When we got home, one of the new pieces had one of the wheels  broken off. We went to baggage claims and they told us they would start a claim but did not think this one could be fixed. She was very nice and offered a replacement bag for us to get our stuff home in one piece and suggested we call when we get home. We did and at first, they told us we accepted a replacement piece so that closed the case. The brand new piece we purchased was almost $400 and they replaced it with a piece you could get on Amazon for $69. I told them this was unacceptable. She said she would have to speak with a supervisor and would get back to us the next day. I never heard back from them. So after a week, I called them back. Was told the person handling my claim was not there but took a message and said she would call back when she was in at work the next day. Again, no return phone call. I waited another week and still no call from them. I finally called them back and spoke to someone else. He also told me that I had accepted a new bag and the case was closed. I explained everything again and said that was unacceptable. He said he would talk with a manager and call me back. No return call. I called him back after a day or two and he said the manager agreed to pay for a replacement bag and he was sending me an email. In the email, it said I needed to send them a copy of the receipt. I did that right after I read their email. A few days later, I got another email saying they were sending me a check for the $389 replacement cost but had to return the bag they gave me to the airport. I drove an hour and forty minutes one way to return the bag they gave me. It took almost an hour to convince the people at the airport to accept the replacement bag back. I then had to call them again to ensure the system showed I returned it. A day later later I called again and they just sent me an email saying they were sending a check. I called again and asked why it was only for the $389 and not for the set they destroyed and what about the tax I paid. He said they do not reimburse for those things and the case was closed. I must say, if this is the way they treat customers who try to be brand loyal, I am just going to fly with whom ever is cheapest from here on out! If my loyalty means nothing to them, then I wont give it to them. I even offered to accept flight credit or even points at the beginning to make it easier on them.

Review_Heading: "hope I don't have the same problem going back"
Name: P Vincent
Review:
✅ Trip Verified | 
1.5 hr delay Chattanooga to Dallas. 11 hr delay Dallas to Amarillo. This is my first and probably last flight with American Airlines. Just hope I don't have the same problem going back. Plane was supposed to leave Dallas at 12.02 am but postponed til 10.53 am. Only compensation was a $12 meal voucher for the 11 hour layover.
route: Chattanooga TN to Amarillo TX via Dallas

Name: Adrian Enriquez
Review: Not Verified |  Clearwater to Mexico City via Miami. This airline is awful. We bought tickets I expect to get on the plane with no issues but we didn't, our tickets were standby. We booked to go to Mexico City at 20th December and were still in the airport looking if there's room on the plane so we can get on.
route: Clearwater to Mexico City via Miami

Name: C Chure
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Zurich. This transatlantic flight was terrible! The interior of the aircraft was old, seats were uncomfortable and barely reclined. There was no in-seat entertainment system, they broadcast 3 'motion pictures' but none of which I could watch because the audio wasn't working at our seats 33A and 33B. Our reading light and attendant button also didn't work either. Nowhere to charge devices, relied on the airline to provide this and expectations were not met, it's 2019 and nearing 2020 and we couldn't find a USB port at our seats, even public buses have these. No entertainment, no comfort for a long-haul flight. Just a terrible  transatlantic flight, we paid so much money for such an awful experience. Disappointed, dissatisfied and will not be recommending this flight to family and friends. Don't want them to experience the same issues.

Name: P Pennant
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Sioux City to Chicago. Everything was going along well until 5 minutes before boarding. They announced a maintenance issue and kept pushing back departures until 8 hours delay. We missed an international flight and needed to book expensive tickets during winter holidays. There was no assistance or apology from AA.

Name: Shanise Callahan
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Atlanta. I arrived at this unorganized airport 2 hours early to my surprise flight # 1866 gate C19 while sitting there I hear one of the staff say I need everyone to go to gate B16. She was very rude and seemed to have an attitude. There were quite a few elderly people which none were offered assistance by wheelchair or any thing else. After walking this long distance. We started sitting down and I hear a gentleman say pardon the inconvenience we need every one to go to gate C24 following announcements on the loud speaker. I stopped an AA staff person to ask for wheelchair assistance for this elderly women and was told I have to find a porter! Now we start heading to the next gate which another announcement was made about the delay plane now being cleaned and will be heading over to the gate. We sat there about 10 to 15 mins enough time to finish my bagel and coffee. The next announcement made flight # 1866 will be departing from gate C29, this walk was not that bad, just an inconvenience especially to the elderly. We are now sitting there when the 2 female employees start calling up stand bys after stand bys Then they finally start calling group #’s up which I noticed stand by customers are boarding before me and allowed to take there rolling bags and carrying on bags. I was confused the entire time but would not express that to the staff. Then the employees now called up groups 7 -9 to check there rolling luggage in before boarding the plane. A women in front of me started to board the plane with her rolling bag and they got very nasty with her and called security. Then the female employee who was checking in bags said didn’t I announce this when I said 7-9 with carry on bags only can board the plane and rolling bags have to be checked in. I was upset due to all the gate changing, booking this unprofessional flight and now have to check my bag in after down sizing my bag in the first place, so my daughter and 1 month old grandson who I am meeting for the first time, would not have such a long wait for me! I question America Airlines unprofessionalism, the lack of empathy for the elderly and the lack of customer service from the check in staff! I will not be flying with AA anymore or booking through cheapoair anymore. These flights and all the fees attached are far too expensive to have this sort of experience. I will say going through security was the only great experience ! The TSA agents were great! But the overall experience earned from me is a 1. I will also be calling American Airlines to put in a verbal complaint and advising them to have more training with there staff.

Name: B Edwards
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Pittsburgh to Orange County via Dallas. This is for the front desk for American Airlines at the Pittsburg Airport. The staff working was extremely rude. We finished our work meeting very early. About three hours early to be exact. I approached the check-in counter and kindly said hello. No response from this older woman. I said, "Hi, I was wondering if there are any earlier flights to Santa Ana Orange County.” She just says, "I have no idea who you are. Give me your idea". No enthusiasm, super rude. The whole conversation was like this. She told me I’m flying out of Pittsburg at 5:22PM (Obviously, I know this as it’s on my boarding pass). I asked again, “Yes, I’m trying to see if there’s an early flight to out. She just says, ”No” and prints my boarding pass. Super rude seems like she hates her job, not friendly at all. Everything else about the trip with American Airlines was great until this unpleasant woman entered the picture.
route: Pittsburgh to Orange County via Dallas

Name: Navika Sood
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Los Angeles to Phoenix. We were forced to check our bags at the gate due to “limited space”. We sat on the plane for 1.5 hours to be told that we need to get off and rebook since the “maintenance issues” really weren’t resolved. This was after a 1.5 hour delay on that same flight. Why put us on a plane you can’t certify???? We did manage to get the last two seats to come home to Phoenix. We’re back packers in Southeast Asia. Small back packs. Since we were forced to check our packs, we waited at baggage claim to find out that my husbands GoPro camera and Apple Watch were stolen from the bag. Do not agree to check your bags. There was more than enough space in the bins. And when we go to file a claim at phoenix sky harbor, we have a new person that was too lazy to help and another useless employee that “assisted” in handing us a paper form and saying “fill this out and good night”. So disappointed.  We can’t get back the memories that are lost. Have fun with our stolen property.

Name: David Rubinoff
Review: Not Verified |  What an awful airline. I will never be using them again. I had my flight delay 5 times due to "airplane maintenance" and then was stuck in Charlotte for the night. I then finally got to Tri cities today just to find out that mine and my girlfriends bags were both ripped and my game console was broken. Clearly American Airlines is just awful everywhere, be it TN or NH. There are much better airlines. Spare yourself a horror story like this.

Name: Victoria Benson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Detroit to Dallas. They suck in every way. Service suck. Policies suck. Prices suck. Never fly American Airlines. I have been sitting here delayed traped on a cramped airplane for 45 minutes. They just keep telling me lies about some bag they need to get. I just went to my grandpa's funeral and I have finals tomorrow. I am unbelievably upset. They can't even tell me the real reason we are going nowhere. I will never fly with American Airlines again. I wish I could give them a big fat 0!

Name: David Wall
Review: Not Verified |  Charlotte to Las Vegas. I fly American frequently because they are so dominant in Charlotte but to be honest they suck. They have old airplanes. Overworked grouchy flight attendants and their frequent flyer program is misleading and a rip off. I took a flight to Thailand using a one world partner carrier in October and they won’t honor the miles I asked about before booking. They are horrible. If you have a choice book with someone else.

Name: Annette Cremo
Review: Not Verified |  Denver to Atlanta. I am elite status and booked a flight with for my daughter and they are charging her for a bag. I tried to talk with them but they refused to listen to my request. Both my daughter and I have the city advantage card which allows us a free bag. I am very frustrated this point and think it’s all a scam. So very disappointed in American Airlines. I can see why they are not one of the preferred carriers

Name: Neil Jeram
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to New York. On numerous trips over the last five years all within the US, I have not really encountered any major issues. If you hold a ticket, not on standby and understand that within the US the service is perfunctory and you have to buy F & B on board then all is fine. The run from Miami to NY was quick. Just a bit over 2 hours and totally uneventful. One time at both ends. Newish aircraft and had come on with some snacks IFE and WiFi were both fine. So really nothing to complain about.

Name: Latonda Rogers
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  My initial flight was scheduled to depart at 1:40pm & arrive in Charlotte by 5:24pm with my connecting flight scheduled to leave at 6:20pm & arrive in GA at 7:40pm. My initial flight was delayed to a 2:15pm departure, then 2:30pm and it didn’t leave until 2:50pm. Due to all of the delays, I missed my 6:20pm connecting flight and booked another flight that was scheduled to depart at 8:20pm. We boarded on time and were set to go when it’s announced that there’s a worn out tire on the plane & we won’t be departing until around 9:15pm. This was the longest & most frustrating travel day ever .. not sure what caused the initial delay but I’ll be thinking twice before traveling with American Airlines again.
route: San Antonio to Atlanta via Charlotte

Name: Kyle Graham
Review: Not Verified |  Los Angeles to Oklahoma City. Me, my wife, and five month old son were flying home For Christmas and our baby (as expected for a newborn) was extra fussy on a late night flight. Our flight attendant Ester went out of her way to move us to a new row with more room, help to take care of him, and just sit and talk to us about our lives. She made us so comfortable, and made a point to remember our names. We are forever grateful for helping make our first family holiday season so wonderful, and would love to thank her again and again personally.

Name: Brandon Lindsey
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Lexington to Washington via Charlotte. This airline managed to misplace my suitcase and placed it on the wrong flight. So I got to my destination and it was nowhere to be found. They found the flight it was placed on and offered to drop it off to my home for free. The next day they drop it off with a broken zipper and tell me I've got 24 hrs to bring it back if I want it fixed or replaced. I'm an hour away from this airport. I would not recommend this airline unless you're on a very tight budget. They're not worth your time.

Name: Paul Lenser
Review: Not Verified |  On my way from Miami to Sacramento I needed to catch a flight to Sacramento. There was little time,25 minutes between arriving in Dallas and leaving. Just prior to boarding the plane I informed the attendant that I had left my MacbookAir on my Miami flight. Instead of having someone call the gate and have them check for Mac she said to go online and report missing. It has now been over a week and my Mac has not showed up. How hard would it have been to take a few minutes to try to help me find prior to being lost?

Review_Heading: "cabin pet policy needs to be looked at"
Name: Kaylin Wilson
Review: Not Verified |  I called the 1800 number to make sure our puppies could go on their flights with their new owners. Everything went well and was approved by them. When we got to the airport that wasn't the case. American Airlines did not let the puppy go home with it's owner. I understand that the pet policy is strict, but for them to deny a puppy that can stand up, turn around, sit down, lay down comfortably is not okay. Dog breeders want their puppies safe, safer than the policies of what airlines approve to be safe. The in cabin pet policy needs to be looked at and fixed. I will make sure no one else books a flight through American Airlines for taking a puppy home from us. This was the biggest waste of time, stressful on the new dog owner, myself, and most of all the puppy.

Review_Heading: "a lack of heart towards families with young children"
Name: H Cooper
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I was on work travel from the US to Spain and brought my husband and 18-month old baby with me. We had bought separate tickets on 2 consecutive days, but mine ended up being economy and my husband + baby, premium economy. Both for basically the same price for the round-trip flights ($1348.83 for economy vs $1366.16 for premium economy). When we boarded, the economy class was packed, not a seat open. However, the premium economy was practically empty, only 5 other passengers. The seat next to my husband (baby was a lap infant) was open, because the woman assigned to it quickly changed to a different seat (nodbody wants to sit next to a baby, right?). So as the seat became open, I went and sat there, and immediately the flight attendant went to get a supervisor to scold me. The two woman ganged up on me and yelled at me, accusing me of having kicked out the other lady from her seat. I thought, what are these lies? They very meanly told me to go sit at my regular seat, 20 rows back. I obeyed, but after reaching 10000 ft of altitude I communicated my situtation to another flight attendant, to see if they could understand that I am a mother who has been separated from her baby and husband. They were very mean. They again yelled at me saying that you have to pay for that class, $500 or $800 (two people told me 2 different things). How ironic that the prices we paid for these two different classes were the same! Also, I bet that, had I been their "friend" or sister, the treatment would have been different. So then my husband called the manager, and very politely conveyed our situation and asked why couldn't I be with them, if there were tons of open seats available. He first said “I hear that you’ve had an encounter with all my staff”. Ok, first off, “an encounter?” Asking questions is “an encounter”?! Second, aren't the staff there to help customers? Doesn’t American Airlines always say that they are there to serve you and make your flight great? Then he said that it was the regulation, but yet, he was willing to break the regulations by letting me take my baby with me to my seat, even though he was *not* the lap infant associated with my ticket. Oh, so we break one rule, the one about swapping seats and tickets for the child, but not the rule about moving "up" on a seating class (barely, still economy)? While this was happening, the seat belt sign was off, so I had left my seat to go see my family. The meal time also began. The two flight attendants who had previously yelled at me in a 2-against-1 scenario, now attacked me again. "Go back to your seat!" "You can't be here!". I was just visiting my family, and all of my stuff was in our shared carry-on which my husband had! They boxed me in between two carts, they made me cry. Other passengers saw all of this and invited me to come over to their seat, so that the carts could move (since the flight attendants weren't being cooperative). People who I had never seen before in my life were very sympathetic. Some later approached me and said "they were really out to get you". It was a clear situation of abuse of power by American Airlines, and a lack of heart towards families with young children.

Review_Heading: "don’t see how this airline stays profitable"
Name: K Nate
Review: Not Verified |  Baton Rouge to Newark via Charlotte. 10 legs over 2 separate days on business trip and only 2 on time. The on time flight included the flight attendant dumping water all over my carry on during service. I don’t see how this airline stays profitable. Just terrible and American Airlines won’t get my business again.
route: Baton Rouge to Newark via Charlotte

Name: Ray Prieksat
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Wichita to Dallas with American Airlines. Minor passenger issue that incompetent airline employees could not handle. Flight delayed well over an hour and connecting flight missed. Typical Airline incompetance!

Review_Heading: "put me in the worst possible situation"
Name: Zachary Herrera
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | American Airlines put me in the worst possible situation and didn't blink an eye. Long story short I was checked in via my email since the day prior to the flight, I was at the airport 2 hours early for my flight hanging out outside so I could smoke, when I went to go through security 45 min prior to my flight. I had missed my check in time is what I was told and can't get a flight until tommorow as a "standby". Between just getting out of the marine corps and starting a new job weeks ago, having 2 kids the holidays and va appointments this was devastating to me and sw customer service treated it as if they were annoyed by me and needed to help the next customer. I will never fly American Airlines again. I managed to work a ticket getting within 2 hours of my destination through SW Airlines landing tonight but now I have to find a way to get home from there with little money. Thanks American Airlines.

Name: Laurie Rowe
Review: Not Verified |  Prior to taking off plane had engine problems. One person to reroute the whole plane. Spent 5 more hours and an extra lay over before reaching my destination. All after plans needed to be cancelled. Customer service contact and show no accountability for ruining our overnight trip to NYC. Refused to give another ticket for our troubles or acknowledge their part. They felt a $100.00 certificate could make up for the it faulty equipment and our time. No compassion from the customer service representative. I will never fly with them or affiliates again.

Name: W Varden
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Hartford. I’ve been flying 3-5 times per year for over 17 yrs and American Airlines is by far the worst airline I’ve flown. If you buy economy tickets with your significant other they can sit you in row 5 and your wife in row 9. If you ask to be sat together because you have never had that issue with any other airline they will charge $56 to sit you together. Is almost like they go out of their way to make your experience as miserable as possible.

Name: Jae Alas
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Madrid to San Francisco via Dallas Ft Worth. On 12/2/19, my 9 yo daughter was traveling from Madrid>DFW>SFO. I get a call at 11pm PST stating that she cannot check in due to the unaccompanied minor fee not being paid. When I booked this flight it was mandatory that both unaccompanied minor fees were paid for both ways. While on the phone with the agent she confirmed both ways were paid. Unfortunately when I was sent my trip confirmation unaccompanied minor doesn’t show up on that. After receiving the phone call I immediately called the airline to fix this problem and was told that somehow the system must have dropped the unaccompanied minor for the trip back. At that time I offered to pay this fee and was told that they could not take my payment over the phone! So here I have my 9yo daughter in Spain and I can’t pay for her to get here. I suggested that this fee be waived since this was American Airlines fault, the agent also mentioned that should could not do this as well.  Thank god a stranger ended up paying for her unaccompanied minor fee at the gate in Spain. If this very generous person didn’t take care of this my child would be stuck alone in a foreign country.  My daughter gets to DFW at 1:35PM. Her next flight is scheduled to leave DFW at 4:49. After 13 delays the new time to depart is 11:05PM. 10 hours she is sitting in the airport and during this time she was not in the unaccompanied minor room, they had her sitting in the gate area alone. I had called the gate multiple times to make sure she was ok and that someone there had fed her. I was told she was fed a cookie, chips and some soda, she was NOT fed a hot meal. I then asked where she was and was told she was asleep in a chair next to the gate! My 9yo was left in the main area and not in the unaccompanied minor room where she should have been. At this point I finally get a hold of a manager who apologized for everything and took my daughter to get a hot meal and back to the UM room. (7 hours too late). In addition my daughter was mingling with people at the gate and even ate with some random family. Coco was the only amazing thing about this trip home for my daughter. No one called me to update me, no one tried to get this 9yo on another flight to another nearby airport. I looked up the other flights and plenty went out before flight 2393 I am beyond livid . Where in American Airlines mind is any of this ok. You put my child in great danger. I will never fly your airline again and will make sure others are aware of the horrible customer service with your airlines. I did receive a voucher for the UM service, however I would like a full refund.
route: Madrid to San Francisco via Dallas Ft Worth

Name: Erica Minella
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Chicago to Cancun. Do not fly American Airlines. Second time in a row my baggage didn’t make it to my destination. They promised me it would be delivered within 24 hrs and here I am 24 hrs later with no bag and no update from them. Tried calling and representative didn’t speak English. Ruined my vacation.

Name: Kelly Stecher
Review: Not Verified |  Newark to Peoria via Chicago. Delayed out of Newark (due to weather, understandable). While boarding we were told the over head bins were full and our carry-ons now HAD to be checked. But could not be answered and confirmed as to what would happen to our suitcases if we missed our connection or switched flights. Once on board we noticed the back half the plane was hardly full and there was plenty of space for our bags. Once arrived in O'Hare we had time to make our connection. We were not allowed to deplane for over 25 mins. We ran across the terminal, once arrived at the gate of our flight home we were told the plane left, we missed it. We were sent down to customer service, there we were told our flight was gone and offered to be placed on a flight to Bloomington (55 mins away from where we live) or we had to wait until the next day to be sent to Peoria. We triple checked with the man that our luggage would be sent with us on our plane. He said he put a note confirming our bags would follow, if not file a claim. While boarding for the Bloomington flight, I received text alerts informing me my original flight home has been delayed and new departure time is at 10 pm. So our flight was still in Chicago and we were being sent to a different city for NO REASON! Top it off, once we arrived in Bloomington only 1 of 3 bags made it and of course NO ONE working can be found anywhere to make a claim. We track down a luggage worker and they search the numbers, our bags were sent to the Peoria flight scheduled for the next day! Not only did we have to schedule a different ride to take us home 1 hr at midnight, when our flight home that we "missed" arrived in Peoria at 11pm. Now we have to take off work the next day to go pick up our luggage from the Peoria airport because they sent it to the wrong flight! Worst part, throughout this process we couldn't find anyone to help us and if we did they didn't/ couldn't give us actual answers! Would not recommend American Airlines!

Name: E Reyes
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Antonio to San Juan via Miami. Date of return flight on American Airlines 11/14/19, our flight was canceled which caused me to miss a court hearing resulting in us having to pay additional to our attorney. Our first night in our hotel we had no water or ac and were told to us the restroom in the restaurant. We will never use Expedia or American Airlines ever again!
route: San Antonio to San Juan via Miami

Name: Charles Shipley
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Philadelphia to Denver. My husband and I were returning from Italy and had a 6 hr layover in Philadelphia. When we boarded the plane at 1900 our flight was delayed for 2 hours. The pilot told us to get off and we would board again about 1/2 hour. I noticed a large line forming in front of customer service and noticed an email informing me our flight had been cancelled. My husband got in line. I got on the phone to try to get us tickets. After 45 min on hold, I reached a representative. She could not find a departing flight available from Philadelphia for days but told me if we could get to Baltimore by 6am there was a flight leaving at 8 am. We agreed and just as she was getting our information the call was interrupted by an automated message asking if I would work with that representative again. I was then thanked and the call was ended without tickets. I called AA again while I was in line and in 45 min I was on the line again with a representative. I explained that my husband had gotten frustrated with what had become over a two-hour wait to get a flight home and had purchased a returning flight through Delta Airlines the next morning. I asked her if she could book us on a different airline and she said that there were no flights available. I asked her if we should cancel the flights that we have booked through Delta so that she could book those flights through Delta for us and she said there was no way that she could guarantee that she could get those tickets if we canceled them and that we should just keep those tickets and get a refund on those Delta tickets from AA. I asked her if she could get us a hotel. She said there was really nothing else she could do. As we were exiting the terminal to get our checked bags visiting with some of the other passengers we were told that they were given hotel vouchers for a nearby hotel. We decided to return to the customer service people and see if we could get a room as well but no one was there. When we returned to Denver I contacted customer service who told me that I needed to reach out to refunds. Refunds told me that since I had booked my flight through Iberia and my husband had booked his flight through British Airways that we would need to contact them. My husband and I contacted above-mentioned airways who emailed us back denying any responsibility and putting the responsibility back on American Airlines. I contacted American Airlines again and they said that we should contact cheap o air where we had originally booked the flights. We contacted cheapo air and they denied any responsibility as it was American Airlines problem. I reached out to refunds again and was told that I needed to contact customer service. I contacted customer service and spoke with a woman who said that she would get this resolved and contact us within two days. She never returned our call and I could not reach her with just her first name when I called back. I was told again that I had contacted the wrong department and that I needed to reach out to refunds. I probably have close to 30 hours into trying to resolve this problem. I am not quite sure where to turn at this point. It is highly unlikely that I will ever choose to fly on American Airlines again.

Review_Heading: "now I am stuck in a hotel"
Name: A Rex
Review: Not Verified |  Buffalo to Cancun via Philadelphia. After being almost a 2hr delay, with absolutely not weather events and the 35mins circling the sky to land in Philadelphia. My wife and I have upgraded seats. Had 5mins to get through customs and heard the flight to Buffalo, NY was about to close the gates. After running with my military service connected knee and back conditions. And after asking for a ride by an attendant, which we were denied, made to the gate on time. However, the airlines sold our seats to someone else, even though we made it on time. The ticket agents need to have a bit of customer service training. They could not have been more ignorant, especially when I attempted to get it straightened out. I was given a the neck jerk and the hand, while she took our tickets and would give me their names. So, now I am stuck in a hotel when I should be home already. Not only that, the Homeland Security act has given these folks the audacity the act like law enforcement officers. I worked for custom and immigrations for many yrs and have never experienced the ignorant folks you have working for you. I will never fly with American Airlines again.

Name: E Garmann
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Los Angeles to Boston via Philadelphia. Extremely disappointed, mainly by the crew. When we were first at the gate, the gate agent made us put our bags in the bag sizer to check if they fit, which was fine. However we had 2 of the same exact suitcase, one of which had a backpack and jacket on top. We briefly explained that it was the same suitcase and it would be too much of a hassle to put it in the bag sizer and began to leave. As we were walking down the jet bridge, she was saying "It won't fit. When we got on the plane, the greeter kept saying 'good morning' to everyone, despite it being 11pm. While passengers were trying to sleep (because it was a redeye) crew were talking about their life and other nonsense. When I confronted them about this, they rudely stated 'We're working'. They did not bring drinks when passengers woke up, which would have been nice on a 5 hr flight. Only tolerable part was the legroom. No adjustable headrest, though.
route: Los Angeles to Boston via Philadelphia

Name: Mike Andrésen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  My 2nd ever worst flight in business class was Miami to Santo Domingo AA987. After a overnight stay in Miami I skipped breakfast at the hotel to get something light in the lounge. I was pointed to the AA lounge by gate D15. But not much there to eat but some fruit and yoghurt. The rest they wanted me to pay for. Well ok I thought I’ll get breakfast on board. (Afterwards I was informed by BA staff I should have gone to the lounge by D30 apparently) To my surprised, all that was served as breakfast on board was yoghurt and fruit or a bagel. Business class - no way!

Name: M Karsen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Santo Domingo to Miami. My worst ever business class flight was the AA1154. Got up and left the hotel at 4:15am. Arrived at the airport and checked in. NO lounge! Had to sit at the gate for over 1 hr. Finally on the plane. About 1 hr after take-off the cabin crew asked if I wanted breakfast. My question was what were the choices. Surprise me! 1 decilitre of yoghurt and 17 grams of granola. With a small power bar. I even had better breakfasts on domestic flights in Sweden. And thank you BA, Qatar Airways and others to serve decent breakfasts, lunches and dinners! And snacks in between. Both in first and businesses class. AA answer "we are sorry for your bad experience". Nothing else! No compensation or anything! Never American Airlines again!

Name: R Carsan
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Boston to Dallas Ft Worth, first I find that they do not give veterans any type of benefits, not even a free checking bag. Than they gave me the wrong gate number, almost missed the flight. The staff were incredibly.  I dont see why a retired veteran can't get any benefits.

Name: L Ming
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | New York to Miami. I had the most ridiculous excuse given to me to justify me not being given a seat on my flight I was on time for. I arrived at 2:30 for a 3:30 flight, after ten minutes in the kiosk and another 10 of an attendant helping me, I was informed that I would not be allowed onto my flight as I was too late. After receiving my standby flight ticket to a later flight and a quick security check, I arrived at my terminal by 3:05 and was still not allowed onto my flight. I spent the next three hours waiting for my new flight for absolutely no reason. They told me if I had checked in beforehand I wouldn’t have lost my seat but the email confirmation had no check in for someone who didn’t pay extra to reserve a seat.

Name: P Deane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Charlotte to Atlanta. Very unimpressed with customer service. I was connecting through Charlotte and saw an earlier flight back to Atlanta available than the one i was on (both american flights). I went to the terminal and they very rudely told me i could not switch flights. I went and checked snd there was 15 seats available on the flight. I went back to discuss with them and offered to pay a transfer fee and they still would not allow it. You would think with how competitive flight industry us that something as simple as switching to an earlier flight where there was plenty of excess seating would be doable. I do not plan to be flying American again.

Name: J Reid
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  They cancelled my flight due to lack of staff and logistical error. We sat on the runway for over 90min. The pilot even voiced his frustration over the PA system. I shared detailed information with the airline about how I lost wages and wanted some form of restitution. They decided to claim it was "weather related" which was a flat out lie. Very unprofessional.  Won't fly with them again.

Name: S Neal
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  This was the worst flying experience I’ve ever had. I understand bad weather happens, but the way this airline handled their problem was unacceptable and offensive to me and likely all the others that AA stuck with the bills that were “complimentary”. I was in NYC getting 2nd opinions on recurrent stage 4 cancer. The weather got bad on my way back home and our plane never left runway. We were all bussed back to the airport and shoves in a small room as they tried to figure out alternate routes. It was disappointing they couldn’t get me home until 11pm the following night due to both NYC airports shutting down so it was a mess. The nice man at the rebooking booth knew it was way too long for someone in my condition to wait it out in an airport as it would be almost 24 hours. He offered me a food credit, 2 shuttle credits, and 2 nights at a hotel he told me was within 2 miles if LaGuardia. Food credit worked great and I got food before I left for the shuttle. I then waited outside in the pouring rain as the shuttle just wasn’t coming even after an hour. Finally I see it and make sure to get on first. It was at that time the driver asked to see the credit and he said okay hop in. Let’s get you to the Bronx! The Bronx I said? It’s true they booked all of use in the hurtle in a Comfort Inn in the Bronx much further than 2 miles. I was just happy to be going to a room as I was beginning to feel weak and tired. I hopped off the bus first and ran in when we got there. This was pure intuition. I walk in and explain and show my vouchers only to be told they don’t take airline vouchers as the rest of the entire shuttle lines up behind me. She called 3 managers on speaker phone and they all said they don’t take them Nor were they notified by American Airlines. So it’s storming and this lobby is full of upset people. They were about to get more upset when the woman tells us all they only have 3 rooms total available for everyone and you must pay for it. I paid for that night and the next day since they refused to take my two vouchers and the next day as my flight was 10pm. It was $175 a night. The next day they end up changing my flight twice so I could longer use my voucher for the shuttle as they didn’t allow me enough time with the last second flight change to sooner take off. Now I had to pay $43 for an uber ride to the airport because they moved the flight back up last second to try and get out before a storm. I did all of this as I had no help and no choice. I explained all of this in detail with proof and there must have been others report this as we had a full large shuttle with people that got no room at all. I provided receipts. They can verify it all. I spent nearly $400 all because of them. They refused to refund anything for months and then send a $143.00 check which I still am unsure where that number came from. I called and they told me to go to the airport as thats the only way to be refunded. I did this and they said no refunds are processed at the airport and to go home and email them. I did that too. Nothing. Very sad for such a large accomplished airline. It’s sad because I fly them often and use an associated credit card. I will never fly them again unless necessary. Regardless, they need to redo their customer service when it comes to the example above. Bad bad! If I wanted to pay I would’ve stayed closer to the airport...

Name: Chris Deplama
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Charlotte to Dallas Ft Worth. Zero accountability and the staff could not care for the inconvenience of scores of passengers and they did as little as possible to accommodate all of us. I knew they were terrible already and should have avoided flying with them. Their mistake cost us a lot of extra time and even more expenses. They simply provide poor services and seem fine with that

Name: E Kaur
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Houston to Cleveland via Dallas. Flight was delayed, wait for technical 1 hour resolve a problem, then could not landed at first time. Just came one minute late at connection gate but was too late - how it possible the same company could not track if another AA flight coming little bit late, passengers losing time and money and have to wait 5 more hours for next flight. Poor customer service.

Name: Kara Eshelman
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Kansas City to Ft Lauderdale via Dallas. I am so disgusted with American Airlines. We booked our tickets in September for a cruise in December. In November, they sent us a notice they changed the times and our 1.5-hour delay was now to be 45 minutes. Then on the way to the airport, they delayed it 40 more minutes making our connection impossible. We waited in line for a long time, because anyone with priority or 1st class gets a special line and goes immediately ahead of all regular passengers. The ticket agent insisted we take another flight leaving in 40 minutes - we barely made it to the gate. Then they announced that this flight was now delayed so we were going to once again miss our connection. They would not allow me to take my carry-on onto the plane - even though other bags were bigger because mine was an actual carry-on. Hint: shopping bags, duffle bags and backpacks all bugger were allowed. Knowing that I was going to be stuck in Dallas because there was no way to make connections. I needed my bags. They gave me a garbage bag for the items I needed which was all but a tiny bit. Bags are allowed. One the plane waiting it was in the mid to high 80's and we sat there for 20 minutes and counting as of right now.
route: Kansas City to Ft Lauderdale via Dallas

Name: Craig Cobbett
Review: Not Verified |  Me and my family book the flight from Boston to Montego Bay in Jamaica for a family vacation. We book through Apple vacations, booked our seats they were reserved so all our receipts were together after we received our confirmation we noticed that the flight to Montego Bay our seats were not together. We called Apple vacations and were informed that it was an error on American Airlines so I called and spoke to the representative at American Airlines and was told there was nothing I could do unless I paid an additional $200 Plus the cost of the seats which was approximately $37 a seat. I asked to speak to a manager  who told me there was nothing he could do because we booked through a third-party and we would have to pay the fees associated with switching seats. When I try to explain the fact that I could not have a six-year-old and 11-year-old sitting by them self multiple rows apart it made no difference. He kept saying you need to pay the money so you can sit with your family even though there was multiple seats available there was nothing he could do. This is poor customer service. Who would put their kids with strangers, when you’re on a plane people want you to take care of your children especially a six-year-old.

Name: Harry Shook
Review: Not Verified |  Indianapolis to Syracuse. This is the worst airline I have ever flown . Completely unreliable and unorganized. I was suppose to arrive in Syracuse By 2 pm by a connecting flight in Washington DC. Then my flight out of Indianapolis was delayed an hour and then they finally told us a piece of the plane had to be replaced and we wouldn’t take off until 12:10. It took them an entire hour and half to tell us this information. Now I’m on 2 connecting flights to Philly, Boston, then finally Syracuse where I land at 8:30 pm. I have 2 three hour layovers at my connecting flights. It’s my birthday and I was suppose to return to campus today to hang out with my friends. Now my day is wasted and my birthday is ruined. If you ever have the option to pay more for another airline do it, American Airlines is not worth your time. Also the seats are the worst.

Name: Andrew Fuller
Review: Not Verified |  We cancelled a "non-refundable" ticket a month and a half before our scheduled departure. We booked and paid for our flights in October 2019; We were on a budget but still wanted to take a vacation out to see a good friend in California. I had been mulling over different flights and came across one with AA which fit within our budget. The flight out had a 10 hour layover in Phoenix, and an hour layover on the way home. This was fine with us since I have another good friend who lives in Phoenix, so staying with him for a few hours seemed logical for a cheap flight (our total all together with upgraded seats was about $780 for both tickets). A month went by and I get a simple email saying that there had been a change to our itinerary, but they didn't charge us any extra money. I go to look at our new flight schedules and AA had the nerve to double our layover time to 20 hours in Phoenix and add another layover on the way home in Charlotte, with 20 minutes between landing and takeoff to change planes in Charlotte. This makes two layovers now on the trip home. All the changes meant we were literally traveling for a total of 30 hours all together (for a flight that is barely 6 hours nonstop). We had previously booked and paid for lodging in Oakland for our flight in, and with the new itinerary change we would have been forced to cancel. I was finally fed up and called AA, who was very pleasant on the phone and they couldn't believe how drastically our schedule was changed and assured a full refund (which I have received). We re-booked with Southwest, nonstop both ways for less than $150 more. Well worth the extra money in my opinion.

Name: T Hayns
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Houston to Dallas. Absolutely awful, most unorganized, rude and disrespectful flight I’ve ever been on. No urgency or customer service whatsoever. Will never fly American Airlines again.

Name: Tanvi Hegde
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Indianapolis. Worst plane ever. They don’t have manners. They don’t provide food or earphones on a 4 hr long flight. They are very rude and unprofessional. Hate American Airlines.

Review_Heading: "had to sit separated from my wife"
Name: Paul Celmer
Review: Not Verified |  London Heathrow to Chicago. When printing boarding pass for me and wife I had a security check, would not permit me to get a seat. When cleared security, a seat was assigned and had to sit separated from my wife for 8 hr flight. American made me feel like a criminal and was not a nice way to end vacation. Also flight attendant constantly ran beverage cart into my shoulder and never apologized or said anything, very rude.

Name: Angela Craw
Review: Not Verified |  New York to London. Totally shocked how non existent of customer service from the security staff checking through your hand luggage to the cabin staff (not all of them) who were so rude, unfriendly, unhelpful, arrogant andjust down right miserable and obviously not enjoying their jobs?. Such a disappointing way to finish your holiday andsuch a incredible difference from British Airways on the way out? Awful food - when I was told one of the options was pasta - I asked ‘what was in with it and the answer was "pasta" - quite bluntly, they need lessons in manners! Will never fly with them ever again nor would I recommend them to anyone.

Name: T Beale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I had to book a last minute flight due to my sister's impending death. I was upset and didn't know how or when to schedule my return trip. I scheduled my return for a week later, for fear if I waited to schedule after my sister died and it being so close to Thanksgiving, that the ticket price would be inflated. I paid $663 for a round trip nonrefundable ticket. I couldn't return on the scheduled date, as my sister was still fighting to stay alive. I called AA and was told by a nice lady that they could help me. I gave her proof by providing the Hospice facility phone number. She said they would only charge me for the difference between my 1st ticket and a new return ticket. My sister passed away the next day. I called AA back and the man I spoke to was not pleasant at all. He didn't show any sympathy whatsoever. My original ticket was $663. He then told me my flight back was only worth $118 and my new ticket would be around $660 (a 1 way ticket!) so the difference left for me to pay would be around $550 to get back home. I didn't have that much money and I don't understand how they could say my first ticket, the return trip home, was worth so little. Needless to say, this was very upsetting, considering the grief I was already going through. Thank God, Spirit Airlines saved me with a much cheaper ticket to get me home. I will never fly with AA again.

Review_Heading: "I had to check my bag in"
Name: Sara Smith
Review: Not Verified |  Seattle to Los Angeles. This is the worst airline ever. I had to check my bag in because there was not enough storage when in fact there is so much storage on this plane. We have been waiting at the gate to take off for an hour now. Everything about this airline sucks. I was supposed to be in LA by 1 but looks like I will be home by 3 pm.

Name: Harold Crowe
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Atlanta to Chicago. I have to write in for American Airlines my flight today was outstanding. This is Thanksgiving week and flight's are busy and over booked and full (no empty seats). I have flown many Airlines and must say I have had extremely good service to exceptional today the flight was smooth flight attendants did a great job today. I am not sure if they hear that enough and want you to know thank you I look forward to flights on American Airlines in the future.

Name: Ray Desimone
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  LaGuardia to Miami via Aruba. After boarding plane were asked to get off stating fuel door issue. After the 2 hour delay we take off and miss our connecting flight in Miami by 15 minutes to Aruba where vacation is planned. We then book the flight for next morning and figure well stay in Miami for the day and overnight. We find out our luggage is getting held for next days flight or we can wait 2 to 8 hours in airport until they find it. Then, they give us a free night at the Miami airport hotel which was for lack of a better term, horrendous (rather than in our paid for hotel in Aruba). They were nice enough to give us food vouchers for $12 per person in total. Considering we had wait 20 hours this was the final slap in the face and didn't even cover breakfast. I understand problems, delays etc but the way they handle this situation is nothing but corporate greed and no regard for customer service.

Name: D Berwin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Francisco to Barcelona via New York. My wife and I were bumped from premium economy to standard economy. The reason was they had over sold premium economy. Because this occurred halfway to our destination I felt trapped by this sudden change and had to accept the smaller seats or lose our prepaid lodging and tours in Barcelona. We originally choose premium economy because my wife has been reluctant to travel if she has to be confined in a small economy seat. It now looks like the airlines actions are going to limit my travel. What other businesses can get away with selling a product or service and then change it at the last minute solely for their benefit?
route: San Francisco to Barcelona via New York

Review_Heading: "charged an extra fee for my bag"
Name: Alrica Evans
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Antonio to Houston. I will never fly this airline again. I was let through to the boarding gate, my carry on was fine until I was boarding. Then I was charged an extra fee for my bag. I was refused my purse with my medication. I was treated with complete disrespect and rudeness. Just because I was at the terminal and I was flying economy. I was treated like a second class citizen.

Name: Glynn Anderson
Review: Not Verified |  American Airlines is by far the worst airline I’ve ever travelled with. I flew with the to Milwaukee in August, through the 3 AA delayed flights, it took just shy of 24 hours! I could have travelled to Australia in this time. The ground staff are exceptionally condescending and hopelessly rude. The cabin crew and hopeless and rude. We missed our connecting flight as a result they put me in two further flights to try and get me there. They lost my luggage and one the way back a week later, more delayed coupled with rude arrogant staff. Even the customer service team are hopeless. After 12 emails they finally offered me $200, I’m yet to receive this and now it’s November. Avoid this airline at all costs

Name: C Gee
Review: Not Verified | Dallas to Lubbock. This is the worst airline I've ever encountered. Flight was delayed 5 times! But there was another flight scheduled later going to the same destination as us and they left with no problems. But our flight was delayed by over 5 hours and they refused to tell us why. They were absolutely no help. I am appalled at the lack of customer service and professionalism. In all of my travelling, I have never had a flight delated that many times without being told anything. They even had us deplane and still refused to tell us what was up. Tried to ask if I needed to rent a car instead and she rolled her eyes at me and scoffed saying to do whatever I wanted then walked away. I was stunned! Fly with any other company. Hell even fly with Delta or whatever is the worst one and it will still be better than this.

Name: Saeid Ebrahim
Review: Not Verified |  Miami to Oslo. American Airlines offer BA ticket on their website. If you purchase a BA ticket through American Airlines they will not honor your system wide upgrade or honor the same day flight change if the flight change is from BA to American Airlines. I have paid with real money and $$$ to earn my Executive platinum reward. I don't care how American Airlines deal with BA. If AA sells ticket to me then they have to honor what I have earned. Shame on you again.

Name: Matthew Webster
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Atlanta to Salisbury via Philadelphia. I will never fly them again and I know I'm not the only one from last night that feels the same way. My son gets motion sickness and while our flight from Atlanta to Philadelphia was extremely bumpy not to mention the aborted takeoff. We were late getting to Philadelphia which made us have to run from gate A to Gate F. Needless to say that did not help his motion sickness and when we sat down in the plane to go home to Salisbury MD he threw up. So rather than letting me clean it up they just decided to kick us off the plane, no explanation, no exceptions whatsoever. Absolute worst airline.

Name: N Karnov
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Diego to Dallas. The worst experience ever. I checked my bag and the bag came back destroyed, ripped with my belongings out in a plastic bag. They offered a new bag which was too small and suggested to put the rest in plastic bags! I refused and I bought a new same size bag at the airport, same size as my old one. They refused to refund for a new bag saying that my bag was improperly packed (not true, never had that issue before and with other airline. and what even that means?).

Name: Morgan Lindskog
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flights are always delayed. They charge high dollar for garbage service. We pay $2200 to fly from Denver to Key West just to have the flight delayed we missed our connecting flight by a few minutes because they were delayed and even though the plane was still sitting in the runway with walk way attached they would not let us on. They don’t offer compensation or upgrades or anything for the hassle and wasted money. We also paid top dollar for a house on the beach that we’re no longer staying at. The flights they tried to give us due to the mess up also is delayed and we are unlikely to make the connection again and won’t be making it to our destination unless we want to fly to Miami and try and drive and pay extra money for a car. An awfully expensive trip to just get screwed over. Huge waste of money and a huge waste of time. If you’re thinking about flying American Airlines don’t. You will absolutely regret it and they will not take care of you! Terrible company, terrible people!

Name: H Bealen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Paris to Chicago. The flight in itself was fine. The flight attendants were fine and usually cooperative. However, they needed cajoling as usual to get what you had wanted. i.e. You either had to flag one down as they just walk right by you or corner them in the galley or aisle.  When you or your company is spending thousands of dollars though, you'd expect a higher service level. On this flight out of Paris, the catering or meals were very good. I had the beef which was very tender with cheddar mashed potatoes. The appetizer of shrimp with a spicier sauce was delicious. The Ben & Jerry's vanilla ice cream sundae with hot fudge, butterscotch, whipped cream, cherries, berries and nuts was great. Plenty of en-route snacks like fresh fruit, packaged cookies, chips and so on to munch on. The arrival meal was a lighter smaller beef ale pie and a chicken mushroom one. Also good. What I don't like is when you get a malfunctioning business class lie flat bed or seat like I did, there is no where to move. This cabin was full. This is very annoying and the airline should ensure these seats work each and every flight with their maintenance programs (if they so care). I have to rate this flight 3 stars because of that.

Name: Nick Korologos
Review: Not Verified | Sydney to Baltimore via Dallas. After flying five hours from Perth to Sydney and then 15 more to Dallas I had an 8-hour layover till my flight to BWI. There was another flight boarding at 234 so asked to get on that so I wouldn’t have wait 8 hours, so I go to customer service and ask and she goes already closed, meanwhile I could see people getting in. I don’t know why Qantas you would partner with such an airline as American. The staff seem to have no idea what they are doing. Their computers say gate closed but people still boarding. Maybe they need retraining.

Name: G Marona
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Sacramento. Terrible and unprofessional flight attendant, who was serving beverages on board. Arrogant and impatient to what I asked for.

Name: A Smith
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Embarrassing how unprepared this flight was. Delayed 3 times once we got on, now I am going to miss my connection in Dallas. I travel for work 90% of the year and I vowed I would never fly American again, but unfortunately my company needed me somewhere and the only option was American. They didn’t fail to disappoint however, flight delayed 3 times and now we are sitting on the runway for another 20 min for “unknown” reason. This one and only chance I have to this horrible airline proved everything I have stood for. I will drive across the country from now on before I have to travel with American Airlines again.

Name: R Palanez
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Albuquerque to Chicago. My second time riding with American and it was great! My sister and I booked basic economy. Due to our tickets, our seats were separated. Fortunately, one of the flight attendants saw us talking prior to boarding. She offered us an empty row, so we both can sit together. Also, Inflight entertainment was great since I can use AA website on my phone for free to watch live tv or movies.

Name: Daisy Schunk
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I was very disappointed with the way I was treated traveling from Memphis to bBuffalo. We arrived to the check in desk in Memphis and the lady was so rude and she told us that American Airlines had changed our flight from fly from Memphis to Washington DC then from there to buffalo to going through Chicago because the Washington DC one was delayed. While you might think at first, this was a good thing and I thought it was to until once we were through security we were told the flight that American had rescheduled us on was delayed from 10 to 12 and then later they delayed it again We did not end up boarding the plane till about 1:30 it ended up being a same three seat 20 row plane which was cramped. Then we missed the connection flight that American Airlines set up for us to get on because our connection flight left at 3:00 and since our other flight was delayed three time we did not even land in Chicago till 3:00 and the next flight to buffalo is at 7:01 you can understand how frustrating this can be. We arrived at the airport at 8:00am expecting to be home around 4:30pm and now we will not be getting home till around 10:30pm that’s a total of about 14 hours I will be spending in these air port.

Name: Marc Martinovic
Review: Not Verified |  If you can avoid flying American Airlines, most likely you will do yourself a favor. They change my itinerary without informing me. They give me a new itinerary that involved 2 days travel plus an overnight at my expense. Baggage needed to be checked twice for the same trip at my expense. They demand payment for my golf bag of $200.00 US. My golf bag weighed 42 lbs. Overall a very bad experience with people in reservation, customer service and the agents and ticketing counters.

Name: Marian Flyer
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to Indianapolis with American Airlines. The worst airline of all! Everyday, every flight, they seem to lower the bar and prove they are the worst. Flights are always delayed, service is bad and unprofessional. If there’s a way they can make passengers miserable, they find it and do it. I’ll take a later flight from a different airline as they still get there sooner. Never again!

Name: G Jones
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Nashville to Philadelphia. I had the most wonderful experience aboard this aircraft. I was greeted with smiles from the young lady scanning my ticket to the kind flight attendant whom I had such fun guessing where his accent was from. If you want to have a lovely flight I would suggest flying from Nashville to Philadelphia if this crew is on board. I fly frequently and American has moved to the top of my list for preferred airlines. Thank you for such a great experience! (As a reminder to the public - share your good experiences as much as you share your bad. The world will be a more beautiful place for it)

Name: Jake Wexler
Review: Not Verified |  Los Angeles to Columbus. This is by far the most poorly trained staff I’ve ever experienced flying. With not much time before my flight I needed help finding the fastest way of getting my boarding pass and going through security. When told I couldn’t check in at the front desk they gave me a late check in slip and told me to go to the security line. When I got to the security line they wouldn’t allow me through without a boarding pass which was not given to me by the American Airlines staff. Due to the back and forth of being pointed in the wrong direction by 3 different American Airlines employees I eventually missed my flight which I needed to make for work. Train our staff for these situations because you clearly don’t understand or seem to care about the impact misinformation and general cluelessness by “professionals” under your company can do to someone.

Name: S Craig
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | My friends and I were supposed to be flying to New Orleans but our flight was cancelled due to weather. The airline promised us over the phone that if they flew us to Mississippi instead that they would reimburse us for any car rental costs to get us to our final destination. We agreed to fly to Mississippi because of this agreement. They said we can just call them and they'll walk us through how to get the refund and it will be an easy process. Once the trip was complete I called the airline and they said they can't do anything over the phone and to contact their customer support email. I did so and they said there's nothing they can do and they don't refund car rentals ever. There was a lot of back and forth, I explained that we were guaranteed a refund and they refused to honour that guarantee and kept repeating that they got us to Mississippi and that was their only responsibility. Horrible customer service. Will never fly with American Airlines again.

Name: K Peale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Las Vegas to Dallas. We boarded on time, things were looking good, and then we sat on the runway for an hour. Then we got off the plane and found out it would be another hour at least(its been 2 now). I missed my connecting flight and had to reschedule but the soonest flight wont get me to my destination until tomorrow mid morning. Wouldn't have been a big deal except I am now paying for a hotel room that I'm not using, missing my husband's graduation from basic training, and paying $300 for a rental car. I would not recommend this airline to anyone.

Name: Debra Jean Harris
Review: Not Verified |  San Antonio to Albuquerque via Dallas. I had the worst experience in my 40 years of flying with this airline. Late flights, which caused me to miss a flight, I did get on a flight that put me in Albuquerque at one o’clock in the morning (it was late, also) and to add insult to injury, my luggage was still in Dallas. They had five and a half hours to get their act together and get the luggage in the right place. I am still waiting for my luggage to be delivered to me. I have been told it is out for delivery, but no sign of it yet. They also kept changing gates for the flight that kept getting delayed. The bus would’ve been faster. Nope, not flying American again.
route: San Antonio to Albuquerque via Dallas

Name: P Huang
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Nashville to Laredo via Dallas. I was supposed to depart at 6:30 AM arriving in Laredo at 11:09 AM for a meeting. Went to bed early for the early to find a text indicated my flight was delayed to 12:00 PM - they rebooked me on the 5:00 AM - arriving 12:39 PM. Every flight I have taken on this airline this year have had at least one leg with problems. When it happens, the indifference their staff showed to passengers was appalling. Their problem started with their people, which explain equipment problems then operational problems

Name: D Meares
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Georgetown. I am so upset with this airline. They have the worst customer service both in person and on the phone. I missed my flight because they gave me the wrong gate code. The gate code that they sent me via text said that it’s departing at gate E31. I checked on the information screen posted all over the airport and the the same gate was written and said gate E31. There was no recent text or update after that and when I went to the gate, there was nobody there and I checked the online status and the gate change to D60. The person I talked to at the rebooking booth literally told me that I should be checking their online app. I thought that the information provided via information screen all over the airport are updated as well. I also opted to get text notification for any changes but there was none sent out. They wanted me to call the number and the wait was an hour long. They can’t do anything for me. They won’t even allow me to book to the next earlier flight that they have because the connecting flight is not American Airlines. They obviously only want to book it through their airlines. They could have book me a flight to Nassau and got a connecting flight from there but they refused to do so. They wanted me to wait the next day for their airline. I even showed the guest services the pictures and text that I received and yet nothing was done for me at all and I am stuck in the airport for two days. This is the worst airline so far.

Name: D Larmen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Honolulu to Los Angeles. When we showed up to check our bags on our return flight nobody was working the baggage counter.  Apparently this airport in Honolulu baggage claim closes for 5 hours in the morning from 7-12 and American Airlines failed to mention it. When I called they said I didn’t call to check the baggage counter hours so I am to blame. This airline is the only airline to close their baggage counter in the airport. They refused to assist in any way. I will never fly American Airlines again.

Name: Jesse Goetsch
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Norfolk to Peoria via Charlotte. This is a customer service review, not a flight review. I had military obligations come up requiring me to be on duty for the date of my flight so I would not be able to make my flight. They said I would not be able to cancel my flight or move it unless it was a change of order and first had to contact the commanding officer. Anyone with military experience knows that is unreasonable considering a CO doesn’t have time to deal with moving someone’s flight. They were not willing to assist any further than that. If you’re military I recommend looking elsewhere.

Review_Heading: "can't bus you directly to connecting gate"
Name: N Dawsen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Hong Kong to Tucson via Los Angeles. Out bound was fine, 4-6 hr layover at each airport, but easy to get from plane to plane. Coming back. Land in LAX at the remote international terminal and have to go through immigration (expected that) easy transport to the connecting flight - no. After immigration have to go through security (pretty stupid since I just got seen by 3 immigration people) then I have to walk myself out the building and over to the next terminal, then go through security again because they can't bus you directly to your connecting gate or at least to the main terminal with out you leaving and reentering, then my flight isn't on the board so have to ask 3 different AA personnel who give three vastly different answers on where my flight will be (each answer has me go to a totally different terminal) before my flight is finally put up on the board and I have to take a bus to another remote terminal (at least I didn't have to go through security again). Yes half of this review is on LAX but in reality when the airline leases the gates at the remote terminals they also contract how to get their passengers to/from those terminals and their connecting flights. Especially when the connecting flight is with a partner airline.
route: Hong Kong to Tucson via Los Angeles

Name: W Geale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Charlotte to Dayton. I rarely fly so I don’t know the ropes. While the staff at the ticket counter were friendly and helpful, the woman at the counter outside the plane and the stewardess were condescending and rude. Such treatment of customers in my business would not be tolerated.

Review_Heading: "never fails to screw up a trip"
Name: J Barten
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Lima via Miami. American Airlines never fails to screw up a trip in every which way, then not properly compensate. I was supposed to be in Lima on this Wednesday evening at the nice hotel I booked, so I could fly to Cusco in the morning Thursday. They were boarding us onto our original flight which was Scheduled for 345 this afternoon From Miami, and as we were boarding they stopped boarding and said something was wrong with the plane so they sent us to another gate. 2.5 hours later they boarded us onto another plane where we flew for 30 minutes before they turned it around for another mechanical failure (one engine literally wasn’t working And we were greeted by a dozen firetrucks all surrounding the plane). We were then directed to the service desk, where I stood in line with 500 other people for 3.5 hours in line so that I could just get a meal voucher and a hotel. I had a flight from Lima to Cusco tomorrow, but they said since I didn’t book the Lima to Cusco through them they can’t help, and they also can’t help that I have to find accommodations in lima tomorrow night because of this. On top of everything, they kept all our bags so there are no clean clothes or toiletries. They made me check my carry on too, so my valuables and medicine are now sitting in the airport for 24 hours. So I lost a day, $600 dollars, sleep. I'm still waiting for the shuttle to take me to the hotel in Miami, and I won’t be there until after midnight tonight The only airline worse than American is Spirit.

Name: Ronald Miller
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  London to St. Louis via Dallas Ft Worth. Flight was leaving from a remote stand, so since I need assistance I was delivered to the plane via a lift. After boarding we were put on a 30 minute hold by the tower which is not abnormal for Heathrow. Arrived late in Dallas to find that I was already re-booked and assisted to the plane. The flight from London was wonderful with attentive flight attendants and very good food. The IFE was up to date and easy to use. I didn't try using the Wi-Fi. The flight to St Louis was on a A319 which I find confining even in first class. Overall a good experience; very well taken care of.
route: London to St. Louis via Dallas Ft Worth

Name: Nicholas Maurillo
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Do not fly this airline! Our trip started out flying from Los Angeles (LAX) to Dallas (DFW), then onto Paris (CDG), then to Munich (MUN) for Oktoberfest. The flight from LAX to DFW was ok which is the only reason I gave a 1 out of 5 rating. Where the trip went sideways was during our layover in DFW. We experienced a 30-minute or so delay to board the plane - no big deal, as intentionally purchased a ticket from CDG to MUN with a longer layover in case anything happened. So once all passengers were on the plane roughly 30 minutes behind schedule, we sat there for another 2-hours before actually taking off. After patiently sitting in our seats for about one hour, I knew I had to speak up about our connecting flight to make the American Airline team aware of the situation. The flight attendant assured me we would be taking off "very shortly" and we would "make up time" while in the air, so I shouldn't worry. I was reluctant to believe the flight attendant so I asked if we could exit the plane to catch another flight to Paris. She would not let us leave the plane. Rather than make a scene, which would have been no good for anyone, I chose to sit back down and wait patiently for our departure. We finally took off after sitting there for 2-hours! Of course, we did not make up any time while in the air and I'm almost certain we saw the Lufthansa connecting flight take off for Munich as we landed. Trying to keep my calm, I told the same flight attendant that we missed our connecting flight due to their delay. She said, "you'll need to call customer service and take it up with them." No apology, no help whatsoever with sorting it out. We got off the plane and I immediately called customer service. They shouldn't even have "service" in their name because they didn't do a damn thing to help, they were terribly rude. No empathy, no apology, nothing. Customer service said, "well, you took the flight, so there is nothing we can do." Of course, we took the flight because they wouldn't let us off the plane even after sitting there for hours! Already late to our Oktoberfest plans, I was then forced to spend another 650 EURO for two tickets from Paris to Munich. Called customer service again and demanded a refund for our flight or at least credit towards another flight. Nothing, but rude attendants on the other line saying, "there is nothing we can do".
route: Los Angeles to Paris via Dallas

Review_Heading: "refused to allow me to take my bicycle"
Name: Michel Del Canina
Review: Not Verified |  Miami to Havana. Terrible experience with American Airlines, supervisor refused to allow me to take my bicycle after I called American Airlines Customer service 3 times before my flight! When she refused me after I had prepared my bike as per the requirements given to me by the customer service at American Airlines. I contacted customer service right there and they told me what they had told me 3 times before and the "supervisor" refused to speak to them. I had been dropped off at the airport at 3:30am! I didn't have anywhere to leave my bike and still the supervisor didn't care. I have never received worse treatment in any airline. I have written a complaint and I hope that someone tries to rectify this situation.

Name: S Ward
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Orlando to La Guardia via Charlotte. American is consistent at one thing: mediocrity. They have a poor understanding of experience, and are seemingly doing nothing about it. Today the delay was poorly communicated (with only 1 announcement and no updates with an over 30min delay), no apologies, zero capability to flight plan, especially with connections. They offered no support to passengers who were delayed and no one took responsibility. Almost every other airline I’ve flown globally have this capability. Customer experience is overtly and embarrassingly low propriety to this profit-focused business. Avoid them!! There are other options, even if it means giving up a lounge access or points, just do it. The stress of this terrible airline isn’t worth it.
route: Orlando to La Guardia via Charlotte

Name: Jessica Peek
Review: Not Verified |  American Airlines will not make any attempt to cover lost baggage.  They also have notorious horrible customer service. Do not fly them if you value your belongings.They lost my bag on a flight from Nashville to Miami in July. After months of time spent filling out questionnaires and sitting on hold they refused to provide any compensation.

Name: K Cruz
Review: Not Verified | London Heathrow to Dallas. I checked in ahead and paid for a premium economy seat. I wanted to be a bit more comfortable on this 10 hour flight. My previous flight landed at London Heathrow late causing me to have to run with my backpack and suitcase to the American Airlines check-in. I check in as my flight to Dallas was boarding! The check-in crew was extremely helpful and directed me to go straight to my gate and not worry about my luggage as they will take care of it. I get to the gate and what do I discover?! Due to my late check in my premium economy seat was given to someone else! I was upset. I paid extra and now I’m stuck with a regular economy seat. I received my new seat an aisle seat just what I like! To my surprise the seat was not bad! It was a 3-row seat and the row behind me was a 2-row seat. I was able to recline my seat all the back knowing that no one was directly behind me. The service by the attendants was amazing! The drink cart constantly moving up and down the aisles. The snacks kept coming. The meal was quite delicious. And the pizza right before landing was spot on. I never felt like we weren’t being cared for. The movie selection was great! A loved seeing newer released movies available to watch. I have no complaints besides my seat being given up. I did, however, receive my money back for the unused seat. I will definitely fly American Airlines again for a long haul flight.

Name: P Sheinis
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Boston to Antigua via Miami. Absolute nightmare. The flight out of Boston delayed due to maintenance issues. This caused us to miss the connector. As a result, we ended up spending the night in Miami, then wasting the whole next day, spending the night in San Juan. The airline really didn’t seem to care, as a matter of fact, one representative said that this was a good experience to learn how to deal with adult disappointment. Being given to $12 meal vouchers over the course of two days in no way made up for missing two days at the all-inclusive luxury resort I had already paid for in Antigua. Not to mention the issues with my traveling companion‘s luggage. She literally only had the clothes on her back for two days. Definitely stay away from American Airlines.
