I tried calling the corporate office when we first started having issues only to get a voice message recording saying the office was closed and to call back during regular business hours. This call was made at 3 PM Eastern standard time, which means it was probably around one in the afternoon in Texas where the corporate office is listed. It’s no wonder they’re doing such a terrible job if they close the office before noon on Fridays. Not only did American Airlines rob me of basically the better part of three days of vacation, but they also made me never want to ever fly again. I will certainly never flying American Airlines again. Please tell everyone you know.

Name: Stephanie Rishell
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Frankfurt to Austin. I had a very humbling experience traveling because I ended up missing my flight and was very disappointed. Your team at American Airlines in Frankfurt were unbelievably helpful! I just wanted to take the time to praise AA customer service! Keep up the hard work, it’s much appreciated!

Name: James Pelton
Review: Not Verified |  San Diego to Omaha. I had a 10:40pm flight out of San Diego. The flight attendant was late, and so the flight had to be cancelled (after we were already on the plane). The next flight wasn't until 3pm the following day. As we were being kicked off the flight, they told us they would pay for our hotel for the night (since there were no more flights). I went to my hotel, and booked a flight with Southwest Airlines at 10am the next morning so I could get back when I needed to. After contacting American Airlines, they said since I did not book my replacement flight with them, they wouldn't cover my hotel room. I expect cancellations and delays with airlines, but when their mistake greatly inconveniences their customers, I would expect them to go above and beyond in taking care of them. I will not be flying American Airlines again.

Name: L Taylor
Review: Not Verified |  Lawton to Oklahoma via Birmingham. This is the first time I have flown American Airlines and it will be my last. Every flight that I have gotten on has been delayed for whatever reason and they have no sympathy for anything. They don't try to fix the issue and I hate their horrible custom service. Spirit and Southwest was so much better. I have learned my lesson. The food was horrible and if I could give 0 stars for the seats, food, and service I would. I'm am not a fat person. I am thick and their was no room to sit comfortably and the seat belts were extremely short. A waste of money.

Name: Alan Parker
Review: Not Verified | Charlotte to Port of Spain. This review has nothing to do with my flight this review has to do with our planned move to Trinidad. My wife has been working for six months to transport our husky with us. She has only called American Airlines Animal Transport and to her dissatisfaction. She was told originally (6 months ago) to measure the dog from paw to ear and add 3 to 4 inches of space in the carrier. We bought our carrier based on what we were told. (34 inches tall) Only to call back today a month before our flight to verify everything and find out that anything over 28 inches tall cannot go through the cargo hole which she has never been told on any of the conversations she has had with them! Now with our flights booked, we find that our dog cannot go with us on American Airlines because she’s too tall they will not allow it! Dogs are like children. We need to get the correct answers when we call about them. It’s hard enough flying in with the dog to a foreign country that requires so much paperwork and tests to now have to deal with a non-pet friendly airline! It’s bad enough that we had to make our flights so they wouldn’t get booked but can’t make hers until 10 days before we leave and if there’s no room then we have to deal with changing our flights. Now, this! What a disappointment!

Name: Michele Ansorge
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I had tickets on an AA flight out of Tampa this morning flight 1369. It was supposed to leave the gate at 7:28 am. I arrived on time more than 2 hours prior to my flight. They start boarding the airplane about 6:45. I hear the crew saying the pilots are not there yet as I board and they don't know what is wrong. Then they announce that the pilots came in late on their flight the night before so they couldn't leave Tampa until 8:45 am. Well many of us on this flight will not make our 1 hour connections. (especially since now I find out I have to go to a different terminal in Dallas). They will not hold our other American flights for us. Now I am going to visit my daughter in Korea. I haven't seen her in awhile. She wants to show me around for 16 days. Well we even have plans with her friends that next night for dinner and on Nov 3rd we have tickets for a formal tea room. Not going to get that money back. $101. Airbnb paid for 2 nights before I get there. Now I pay for that and she didn't need to get there early then. Then AA says they can send me to Dallas on this flight and they will put me up in a hotel overnight. I say why? I live here in Tampa all be it an hour from the airport so I want to go home to my bed. They refused to send me out on any other flight that is leaving today from Tampa from a competitor. And my bags are now going to Dallas and will be stuck there. Plus I had paid ahead of time for a premium seat to have a little more room for the 15 hour flight by a window. Now on the next days flights they can't get me a window seat in premium. They refuse to upgrade me to business or First class for my problems. This is the big blow now. After I deplaned I am at the desk talking to them about getting me on a different flight and the pilots arrive at 8:15. They say it will still be 8:45 before they can take off. One of the pilots tells the crew there that they had come in late the night before from somewhere so FAA regulations say they can't fly until their rest hours are done. Then he rolls his eyes at them and says, " AA knew this last night." So 12 hours before AA could have checked our tickets and tried to reroute us then. There happens to be a 6:00 am flight to Dallas they have. They could have called me to come to the airport early. But nothing done like that. They just play with peoples lives and don't care. Now if will be up to 60 days before they respond to my complaint online. Yah that will help me. In Europe the EU has passed laws that the airlines are fined $700 euros for doing what they did. This is the second time in a year that one of my flights in the US has screwed me. This doesn't happen when I am in Europe. Shame on you AA. Playing with your paying customer. (so now I leave the next day at 6:00 am and hopefully things will be on time. But no window seat in Premium only a middle seat. Wow I paid extra for a better seat but now get the middle one.

Name: Elle Madsen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Cleveland to Denver. American Airlines is the most disgusting and inhumane airlines I have ever dealt with. We had a puppy being shipped on a Tuesday and the airline canceled it. Then it was rescheduled for Thursday. The puppy was picked up from the breeders home at 6am and didn't get put on his flight and the airline could not justify why. Then he got put on a later flight which then got delayed and delayed and eventually canceled at 1am. Throughout this time, the airline continuously lied to me and had people from call centers in India speaking to me about my puppy. They lied to me saying the puppy was then taken to "Pet Hotels and Villas" which never happened. Puppy Hotels and Villas never had any record of my puppy going there. So where is my puppy? American Airlines will lie to you until you stop calling them or give up. They leave puppies to sit in crates for 12 hours. Who is walking them? Feeding them? Giving them water? Where are the pictures and proof that my puppy is okay? I would never recommend American Airlines unless you want to be mistreated, lied to, and taken advantage of. This has been an ongoing, 4 day battle with them, and I have still not received my puppy. Who is taking care of him? The airlines has no clue.

Name: T Patel Patel
Review: Not Verified |  Jacksonville to Charlotte. Worst experience ever. I had a flight that left at around 1:30 pm where I would arrive to my destination around 3:30 pm for a wedding I had at 5:39 pm where I was a bridesmaid. I booked my flight at least 6 months before. The day I was headed to the airport they cancelled the flight with no care of my concern to get to a wedding. I couldn’t believe that they not only didn’t care but didn’t help me get another flight. If I can help it I will never fly American Airlines again.

Name: W James
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Communication is horrible. They told us to board and the plane wasn’t ready. Won’t let us wait by the gates and the gate area is overcrowded. They have 4 delayed planes at the same gate

Review_Heading: "should be ashamed of their poor service"
Name: S Thomas
Review: Not Verified |  Fayetteville to Denver. This was my first attempt at using American Airlines. Though I’d heard bad things I still wanted to give it a fair shake. Upon purchase of tickets I got an email instructing me to be there 45 min early for check in. When I got to the airport I was told that I should have been there an hour early and my seat had been given away. I said my wife and I were expecting to land in Denver to meet family so I needed to get on another flight. They said the next two were full and there is no refund. I called customer service and they said there is nothing they could do. AA should be ashamed of their poor service.

Name: Z Delgado
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Phoenix. I bought a $300 one way to get to Oak at noon. Dallas delayed cause the weather, we made it to Phoenix 6 minutes after start boarding the gate was close, airplane still there!!! We were line 9 people all together, wait until 7.36 PM To San Francisco not Oakland - no meal voucher, nothing because the weather; they knew we were delayed - why not wait 5 minutes?

Name: Sholay Vahabi
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Denver. I booked a flight from Miami to Denver for November 8, 2019. American Airlines changes the flight to a 7am flight. I call and let them know that I can’t make it, so the lady tells me the only other nonstop is 9.30am. So I agreed to that. When I looked up my reservation I realized that she booked me on a 9.30pm flight! I call the customer service line and when I explain the situation I basically get told that because I already made One change (which I had to because of the change the airline made) that I couldn’t make any more changes that I had to buy a whole new plane ticket and get zero credit towards a new one. Then talked down to me because I bought an “economy” ticket and that’s what happens when you buy “economy”. There was zero effort in helping me with this situation when the airline made its changes. Not only does American Airlines nickel and dime you for everything possible to fly in their poor  aircraft, but they like to make you feel like worthless nobodies for booking economy. I will never book through this airline again. We do not deserve to be treated this way. Giving them a 1/10 and that goes to the pilot for getting us economy people to our destination safely.

Name: Daniel Spencer
Review: Not Verified |  I flew as an Unaccompanied Minor from Phoenix to Philadelphia. Although my ticket was bought only 4 days in advance, and the only seats available were Basic Economy Middle Seats (Which is what i got in the end), my boarding group was 9 but Boarding staff were nice and pleasant, and bumped me up to Group 7. The Flight attendants were nice and respectful. The seat was comfortable, food was nice, on-board entertainment above expected. Seemed to have a better experience on American than Southwest.

Name: O Malela
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Managua to Miami. Awful service. I required a wheelchair and requested one to take me from the arrival gate (Miami International Airport) to Baggage Claim. I waited more than 2 hours  to be picked up. It was just awful service. I called customer service (800-433-7300) and was told that somebody would pick me up eventually. To just wait and call back in half an hour. Worst service ever

Name: S Jacobsen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Lima to Salt Lake City via Dallas. Leaving Lima the plane was late 1.5 hrs. We all get that happens. But the airline made no attempt to make up time in the air over this 8 hour flight. The flight attendant lied about letting us deboard first so we could make our next flights. Every single employee along this journey was not only not helpful they were rude and seemed annoyed with us attempting to make connecting flights. They didnt care in the least. Never ever American again.
route: Lima to Salt Lake City via Dallas

Name: J Maleno
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Cancun. The Captain came out into the cabin to  thank us for flying American Airlines. I have not flown American in over a year because I was very disappointed at previous experiences however I have to say that this flight was very pleasant, the ground and in-flight crew were very nice, polite, and friendly. The aircraft looked and felt new, the business class seat was very comfortable and the amenities were good for a 1 hour 40 minute flight. I will fly them again.

Name: Ronald Miller
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | St Louis to London Heathrow via Dallas Fort-Worth with American Airlines. The first flight was almost 2 hours late but I had plenty of time for the connection. The Flagship Lounge at DFW was wonderful with extremely helpful personnel, great food. The flight from DFW to LHR was on-time, the seat was extremely comfortable, the food awful: terrible presentation, overcooked, and tasteless. IFE was great but the remote did not work properly. Wifi was impossible to use.
route: St Louis to London Heathrow via Dallas Fort-Worth

Name: V Calentro
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Milan to New York. Hands down worst business class experience I have ever had. Long wait at priority check in for both legs of the flight, poor onboard service, cranky stewardesses. In business class had to pay extra $20 for WiFi! Last but not least, headphones were collected 1 hour prior to landing!

Name: Sonja Jefferson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Charlotte to Albany. Why does an American Airlines separate people when one purchases tickets for two people at the same time? Doesn't make sense to me - especially when you're  not allowed to pick your own seating and they have some excuse as to why they have to pick your seat. Very very disappointing and planes late with no giving reason, just gets later and later. I'll never fly this airline again.

Name: A Onaissac
Review: Not Verified |  Dallas Fort Worth to Seattle. This airline is Not worth your business. You spend more money with accommodations and car rentals. Better spend your money on a ticket that will get you to your destination without the hassle and rudeness. Customer service agents are rude and look at you like you’re begging them. In less than three months that I’ve travelled with my new job, I’ve been stuck in Seattle because their flights are delayed, leaving me stranded at the airport or having to rent a car to get home. No reimbursement for these additional expenses. So you pay for a round trip flight and you still end up spending more because of their delays. Go spend your money on another airline. American should just give up instead of offering flights that are always running 3-4 hours behind. And, when you show up to the counter, it’s mid night, no one is available to speak with. When my wife traveled with them in July, same thing happened only worse because she had to wait two days before she could get home. Long story short, she ended up paying for her meals, her hotel, used more time off from work, and leaving our pets boarding for more time than originally planned. Horrible, horrible service. Worst airline ever.

Review_Heading: "last time I will fly with American"
Name: M Keane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Honolulu. First and last time I will fly with American! Not only did my plane get delayed over an hour but when we finally did get to fly out we got about 2 hours away and then had to turn around and go all the way back to Dallas. From there our plane got delayed another 2-3 times. Was suppose to land in HI at 12:36P did not land until 9:36!

Name: Michelle Dee
Review: Not Verified |  Worst experience ever with an airline. Flight was delayed 8 hours. 8! We paid to go hang out at their lounge only to find out the flight was cancelled overall. We were trying to fly from Los Angeles to Tokyo for our honeymoon. Our paid time off days were on the line here. Did they try to make us feel less panicked? Nope! Talked to one of the reps (who turned her ID around so we wouldn’t know her name!) who argued with my husband and I about how she was not at fault. We understand that personally, it was not on her but as other airlines do- probably find us an alternate way to get there? She was grabbing the ticket from my husband and pointing out the obvious about how the flight was cancelled. Ok captain obvious we get it. But what can you do to help us? Maybe work with another airline? Find us other seats? Something? We have been in the terminal since 6am and it is not 3pm and we just found out your plane was cancelled. We are not oblivious to the fact that others are also facing these circumstances but the least we expect is some empathy and reassurance. The lounge member was super rude, condescending, yelling at us and was straight mean. She tried to shoo us away to another airline eventually, but with no reassurance. Take note, this was with an airline 2 terminals away at LAX. Would you feel ok walking all that way if you weren’t 100% sure? She would not tell us if we could board or not and we tried to ask if they would guarantee taking care of us if we did not make the cut and she would not answer. It took another co-worker of hers to butt in and tell us they would. Super unprofessional, does not care for their customers, rude and not sympathetic whatsoever. I don’t care if I’m saving 1,000 bucks.. I will never fly American again! They ruined my honeymoon.

Name: G Keare
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Minneapolis to Erie via Chicago. Well I didn’t even get on the flight because it was delayed 4+ hours and I wouldn’t be able to make my connecting flight. The trip wasn’t worth it at that point since it was a weekend trip and there weren’t any other options that made sense. I stood in line for about 30 minutes and was able to figure out what I needed to know by the time I got up there and the assistant didn’t know that much anyways. Very disappointed. Luckily got refunded but I’m never booking with American Airlines again.

Name: S Peetash
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Fayetteville. I never had such a worst experience in my life. To start, when i departed from Fayetteville to Vancouver ; my flight from Fayetteville got delayed by 4-5 hours i had to spent half day sitting at airport and missed to catch up with my friend. From Vancouver to Dallas flight no. 392 was so much congested there was almost no leg space. And the passenger at the front seat was extending their seat to back making it more less spacious. I literally had sore feet because of that and Then to my worst experience when flight from dallas airport got cancelled to Fayetteville. They didnt even provide us any accommodation i hadnt slept for more than 24 hours. They should have at least provide us some place to stay even though it was weather still we paid you and please value our time. I missed one exam already and now have two next day.

Name: K Carter
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Hartford to Philadelphia. Horrible - switched my seat at boarding to the last row of the plane. Told me my carry on was too big as it fit into the measurements. Poor customer service - rude - will not travel with them again.

Name: P Darina
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Tampa to Miami. I fly pretty frequent and I have to say today will be the last time I travel American Airlines. I am boarding flight 2179 to Miami, and my boarding pass says my seat will be assigned at gate. The gentleman who appears to be the captain of flight was very kind and says, don’t worry someone will assist your shortly. The gentleman who’s the counter rep doesn’t acknowledge me while logging into the system, talks to some of the crew members around him, and then asked me what do I want - even a good morning. He noticed I was not pleased and says good morning how are you, this is after he’s ignored me the 10 min I’m standing in front and chatting with crew. Not one person said, take care of the customer standing there being ignored. I’m very much a believer In giving all you do your all, or don’t do it all. And I just think the customer service with American is by far the worse I’ve experienced. Employees are just unhappy and miserable and so I just thought I share my feedback flight #2179 seat 17C.

Name: C Levi
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  London to Houston. The seats were so tightly together one could not take off a sweater, tie a shoe, pick up a bag from under a seat in front of the place of sitting. I am a regular female US size 12. I could feel the legs and hips on either side of me of the people who were sitting beside me who also not overweight. One cannot moves legs or shift at all. It is a physical danger of sitting in limited confined spaces for hours on end with no ability to move in any way. I recommend not using this airline.  It is better for an airline to charge a bit more and treat the customers physical being safely than put their health at risks. I was astonished to see the seating set up as it was. I simply do not know how men could sit in the seats when I was having such a hard time in doing so.

Name: Angela Penichet
Review: Not Verified | LaGuardia to Portland. American airlines is incompetent beyond words. No announcement of a gate change. Horribly rude. Acted like it was our fault that we missed the flight when we were there and checked in 90 minutes before flight time. disgusting disrespect of passenger time and needs.

Name: Julian Skinner
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | London to Los Angeles. Appalling. American Airlines got me in an hour late to LAX so I missed my connecting flight. Now I have a 12-hour overnight wait and they refuse to give even a cup of coffee let alone a room for the night.

Name: Bryce Jefferson
Review: Not Verified | Dallas to Saint Louis. This is the worst airline in the entire world. I will never in my life fly this airline again and furthermore I will tell all friends and family never to fly this airline. I have flown several times and every single time the flight is delayed 4-5-6 hours. It’s stupid and ridiculous. Trash airline that should be shut down.

Review_Heading: "should be using toilets at the back"
Name: C Rearden
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  London to Raleigh Durham. I bought the ticket on Saturday 7/20/19and travelled on Monday 7/22/19. I did not have a chance to book a seat but was given the only one available (I was told) at a high cost because it was booked in an emergency. I am 75 and was a wheelchair passenger. I was reprimanded by a very unpleasant flight attendant for using the toilet in Business. When I boarded I asked a flight attendant if I could use the toilet in Business, which was near to seat 15E Premium Plus, she said “ yes, that is quite acceptable”. I explained to her I have a weak bladder and have to use the toilet more often. Halfway through the flight, on approaching Business toilets, one flight attendant said to me that I should use the toilet at the back. (This was not the flight attendant from whom I had asked permission). I did not reply but I tried the toilets in the center of the aircraft (which were always busy with passengers standing on the aisle waiting) and I tried to use the toilets at the back of the aircraft but it was too much of a distance for me.  When I next approached Business Toilets the same flight attendant (who had told me to use the back toilets) approached me and said in a rude and condescending way that I should be using the toilets at the back. I told her then that I had asked the other flight attendant for permission when I first boarded and was told I could use the toilets in Business. She looked surprised. I reported this to the Department of Transportation, and to AA but the flight attendant denied telling me not to use the toilets in Business. I would like to say that when booking Premium or any upgrade one should find out where the toilets are and if one is allowed to use Business toilets when nearer to Business than the middle or back of aircraft. It is my belief that AA does not consider the toilets locations when selling seats at a higher priced upgrade. I have since found out from the Department of Transportation that elderly and wheelchair passengers can be exempt from the airline rules that a passenger should use the toilets nearest to their seat.

Name: M Geare
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to State College. Use another airline! I purchased my flight and had strict travel needs. American Airlines told me that they overbooked the flight and I was denied boarding. Consequently, I had to rent a car and drive all night to ensure I could meet my obligations. Evidently, they always overbook the flights with the idea they’ll solicit some to give up their seats. How can they sell seats they don’t have? Never use this airline! They don’t deserve your loyalty or respect since they give none to their customers.

Name: A Rawlings
Review: Not Verified |  Charlotte to Denver. This has been by far the worst experience I have had flying to and from my wedding/honeymoon! Every time I asked for help kindly and calmly, for example that the customer service agents (4 of them) when asked to please help as I am physically running to my transfer flight, looked at me like I was dumb. We then proceeded to run through the airport, my wife began to vomit.  Also, due to the delays I don't get to spend the night in my honeymoon suite with my wife but instead on the airport floor and lost my hotel $.

Name: N Voss
Review: Not Verified | Dallas to Columbus. Would not recommend. Pay up and get a reliable trip booked through another airline. Even though open seats are open on other flights they will under no circumstances change your flight without getting another full charge. Also, very well known for delays and better at making excuses for those delays than addressing them. Do yourself a favor and book through a more credible airline.

Name: Alex Krivosheyev
Review: Not Verified | Dallas to Tokyo. On Thursday, October 10, I was scheduled to fly to Tokyo on AA175. When I arrived in Dallas they cancelled the flight 10 min before departure. They claimed it was because of a typhoon in Tokyo, yet Delta, Japan Airlines, and every other airline flew to Tokyo that day. The typhoon was not scheduled to arrive until Sunday the 13. They did not pay for my hotel in Dallas and they left 300 stranded passengers sitting in the airport lobby with only 2 agents rebooking people. Then every agent left and they told people to use the app or call customer service. I will never fly this airline again, and I have zero trust in American. Please avoid this airline as I ended up paying over $200 in hotels out of pocket.

Name: S Carter
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Phoenix to Boston. American's poor maintenance strikes again. 15 minutes before boarding they delay the flight 3 hours. They just realized the plane couldn't fly. Why they only realized it 15 minutes before boarding makes no sense. Then they delayed another 3 hours - 6 in total - because they couldn't find another airplane. To be certain we don't get too hopeful the customer service person said not to get too hopeful that plane will be cleared to fly to Boston. But they did provide 5 sandwiches for over 100 people and keep updating us on the progress of a different flight out of Portland. We are in Phoenix.

Name: B Meares
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New York JFK to Heathrow. Initially we booked on line and did not get our reservation for myself and my son but they were quick to take the payment On getting to the airport we had to go look for the business check in which was away from the gates and the check in counters for all other passengers. On checking in they had lost my sons booking and his seat he booked was given away and they could not allocate a seat we had to go to the lounge. Crazy they then haul the luggage back to the economy check in while we walk back the same way to go through customs. Customs are rude and obnoxious and do nothing the security search backs up and no one will pick up a tray and tell customers to pack trays. In the lounge No surprise they could do nothing and said we should go to the gate. Well the rudest woman was at the gate that snarled and after standing around for some time allocated a seat that was not a window seat as requested. We fly frequently and America airline ground staff must be the laziest and most obnoxious people around. We will never fly American Airlines again.

Name: Terri Hefty
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Houston to Dallas to Lubbock. Our flight with American Airlines was a disaster from the beginning. Charged $60 to book by phone with an agent, flights were late, airplane dirty, and in the Lubbock airport the gate number was never published on the flight boards and we almost missed our flight because we didn’t know which gate. When I mentioned this to the attendant at the desk, she acted as if she couldn’t have cared less - she didn’t ask me to explain she just acted dumb and confused.
route: Houston to Dallas to to Lubbock

Name: N Davies
Review:
✅ Trip Verified | 
Another poor experience with AAL: again, they refused to check my suitcase through to my final destination under the pretext of "safety:" I do not understand how having two separate tickets endangers safety when more than 700 airlines worldwide regularly interline baggage among themselves. It's really a question of "laziness." Why did we buy two separate tickets? It's a well-known travel agent cost saving measure and we save £900 by doing so. (It was colossally inconvenient to pass through immigration, collect our suitcases, take the train to T5, recheck suitcases, go through immigration & security again.) I flew on Alaska last month to Fort Lauderdale and they without question transferred my suitcase to Delta for the continuing trip to South America. Is American Airlines asserting that Alaska and Delta are unsafe carriers? I purchased a Lufthansa ticket last year from Chicago to Münster with a LH compensation voucher and so the connecting flight to it on United had to be issued separately. Are both United and Lufthansa unsafe operations according to American Airlines? But American regularly disservices the flying public. In August I was denied entry into the Admirals' Club at Roissy because their boarding pass reader wouldn't read my boarding pass (somehow that was MY fault). At my connexion city (London) they simply reissued the boarding pass so that their reader would admit me. But since when are human beings the tools of the computers? When their management doesn't allow them to make reasonable common sense decisions! In August I was charge 50€ for a suitcase to check even though I was Platinum elite and am allowed two suitcases complimentary. The pretext? The ticket was issued by Finnair. I am suing them now and have learnt that their defence will be that I used my Alaska FF account. I only changed from my AA account after they charged me the fee: who wants to patronised a company that rips off their best customers? They are dishonest and deceptive and should be sanctioned and regulated fully by the DOT. I must say I was surprised on board: everyone was professional and courteous - quite a surprise from American Air Lines where most stewardess have chips on their shoulders and check their bid sheets in the galley when they should be working.
route: Miami to Bucharest via London Heathrow

Name: P Cheong
Review: Not Verified |  Vancouver to Phoenix. The flight was on-time leaving and arriving. The check in process took too long and was incomplete. Only one service agent was dealing with check ins with a queue that had a family with infants and 3 other service agents dealing with almost no one at the service kiosk. This meant longer wait for the family with infants. After checking in there was no plastic bags offered for the car seats and strollers that had to be checked in. This meant we had to go back to the check in counter after getting told by YVR oversize baggage people that the plastic bags were only available at at the check in counters. By the time we went to the check in counter the counters were not manned by anyone. We however found an American airline service agent at the kiosk area and asked for the plastic bags. There were no plastic bags available as cabinets were locked so the agent had to ask for the bags from Alaskan airlines. The service by flight was very bad. There was no help offered to adults with infants on boarding and during the flight when it was needed most. When flight attendant was asked to assist to put milk in the coffee she was not happy and showed that she was so and warned me condescendingly about scalding the baby with hot coffee - all the rudeness was unnecessary.

Name: S Carter
Review:
✅ Trip Verified |  
Edinburgh to Philadelphia. We decided to Supposedly upgrade our flights on our vacation to Scotland, so we paid several thousand dollars to upgrade our seats for an enjoyable experience. What a huge, enormous mistake! We had one good flight out of six flights back-and-forth to Scotland. The only decent flight was between Phoenix and Edinburgh on a 777–200. Nice business class Seats, good service and average food. After that it all went downhill! I read reviews previous to leaving and was a little nervous about what to expect. I don’t normally listen to negative reviews completely but I should have! These were the worst seats I’ve ever experienced! The planes were old and dirty. The food was barely edible and the seating was extremely bad. I basically paid thousands of dollars to have hard seats that had a little bit more legroom and width. The last flight was over five hours and was the most uncomfortable flight of all! When I got on the third flight of the day and saw how bad the interior of the plane looked and how cramped it was it made me ill. My husband was sick and had to sit straight up sleeping the whole time! He tried to treat me to nice experience and instead we were angry all day about how much money we wasted! We had TV screens in “one” out of six planes. Even the business class had no screens even on the back of the seats. Almost all airlines have screens on the back of the seats even in economy. I had to “pay extra” for Wi-Fi and to download the American Airlines app to attempt to fill in the time when I was unable to sleep. They don’t tell you this until you get on the plane and then you have to rush to download the app and less you’ll have nothing the whole entire flight! Never again will we pay American Airlines for flights to anywhere within the US or around the world. The only positive comment is for the staff on these planes. With people complaining and uncomfortable they maintained their gracious composure. Hugely disappointed! Embarrassed for the people who have to work for that airline!

Name: T Jonas
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Shreveport to Dallas. This flight was delayed because the Maintenance inspector did not do his job the night before the 6:45AM flight as he was scheduled and the flight crew was told he was doing. We completely boarded on time just to be told it would be at least an hour and ended up being 2 hours delayed when maintenance showed up for work routinely and did their inspection that was scheduled to be done the night before. This is the 5th flight of the last 6 in 3 months on AA that has been delayed for maintenance reasons. These excuses are unacceptable, unprofessional, and occur because there are no consequences for poor service. This disservice inconveniences thousands of people harms lives (I am a surgeon that AA has caused multiple people in pain to miss or delay their surgery with plenty of prep time for things to go wrong), has people missing important family events, and potentially loses businesses millions in transactions. The airlines should be held responsible financially for the damage they cause others from poor leadership and management.

Name: D Googe
Review: Not Verified |  Savannah to Las Vegas. Our flight got canceled and we were put on standby. We sat in the first airport for 13 hours then we changed planes two more times total time 28 hours. The workers are so rude and when you ask questions they yell and tell you to have a seat. First experience and American Airlines made it the worst.

Name: Geri Gustafson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Rapid City to Phoenix. On Tuesday night our flight was canceled due to plane problems. Which can be understandable. But the next day all I got is delay delay delay emails when I tried to call and get more information it was like pulling teeth. What I do finally arrive for my flight they say it is now going to be another four hours late even though there was one taken off earlier which no one had contacted me or let me have that option. Very poor communication.

Review_Heading: "all but one of my connecting flights were delayed"
Name: O Andrews
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | As a service member seeing his family for the first time in 8 months and only having the weekend to spend with them along as with my girlfriend I was bringing with me, I was very disappointed. Instead of arriving before 11am I didn’t get to my destination until 5.00pm. Things happen, but all but one of my connecting flights were delayed with one being delayed about 5 hours. Almost no compensation was given to me-only a reschedule to the flight that got me home after my day was spent in an airport and a couple of pretzel bags and canned drinks that they gave us while we had to spend the night in the airport. This was of course during the time that our connection flight was taking off. I will be avoiding this airlines whenever possible in the future.
route: San Jose to Toledo Express Airport

Name: Sarah Ramsey
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I am extremely disappointed by American Airlines. They are normally my airline of choice and I have put many of miles into them. That will no longer be the case. I had a connecting flight canceled due to “weather” even though there was a flight going out an hour later? Since it was due to weather we were offered no accommodations. When asked about this they said it was the pilots choice to delay or cancel ... since a flight went out an hour later I’d say that wasn’t due to weather but to crew.... ok but it gets better. We were put on standby on that late flight when we showed up somehow I was five on the list and my husband was 32? So I got called yet was told nothing could be done to get my husband on as well .. even though after I was called a group of four was called together then two more singles. When I asked the customer service desk about this I was told it was the computer. So I asked how the group of four managed to get out on the list together and they said luck of pushing the enter button .. what a joke... then was told since I also had booked an economy ticket it pretty much didn’t look good for me anyway from the beginning so that’s great to know that’s how this airline feels. Such a shame too because they have some great people we have encountered who work as attendant for this airline that this has now given them such a bad name in my book. Long story short I thought this was a great airline and now I have been completely proven wrong and they could care less.

Name: Charlene Lindsey
Review:
Not Verified |  
Our flight from Quito to Miami on Friday October 4, 2019 (LATAM Airlines flight 6303) was cancelled by American with no reason given. We were offered a flight out on the following Sunday. Both my traveling partner and I had to work on Saturday. The website did not respond nor did anyone answer the 800 # given. We had no choice but to get to the airport in hopes of talking with a real person. We stood in line for LATAM airlines and managed to get a flight on Avianca from Quito to San Salvador to Cancun on American to Philadelphia, landing in Philadelphia about 4 hours later than our originally scheduled arrival. Why we were not offered that with the flight cancellation? How can an airline just leave a passenger stranded like that?

Name: R Kornan
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Bogota via San Francisco. None of the second row seats in the business cabin reclined.  There was a partition right behind the second row so there was no way to recline the seats. AA should inform customers ahead of time if a whole row of seats do not recline. This ticket, business class on an international flight of almost 6 hours, was significantly more expensive. You are paying a bunch of money and you can't even stretch your legs.
route: Dallas to Bogota via San Francisco

Name: Glen Harriman
Review: Not Verified |  Pittsburgh to Phoenix. Terribly dissatisfied about the manner in which they regard services for the handicapped. We indicated when we purchased out tickets to a funeral we were attending that we would need a wheelchair for my wife. Upon arrival to our destination back home to Phoenix there were no attendants with a wheelchair for not just my wife, but for other handicapped passengers. My wife hobbled the best she could as she held onto the sides of the ramp leading from the plane to the gate. I had both of our carry on suitcases to manage with as well as my backpack and my wife's purse. When we got to the gate to inquire about the wheelchair, the attendants at the gate said they did not know why no one showed up with wheelchairs and had been calling down to the area where the AA wheelchairs are stationed to no avail. Some attendant who was walking around upset and furious scanned my wife's boarding pass and the other handicapped passengers, asking us to be patient and someone would be arriving shortly. Well, after we all complained again, 15 minutes later 2 people showed up but we all could tell they were not sure what they were supposed to do or where they were supposed to go (almost like they were new hires and that was their first day). We had no checked luggage so all we needed to do was to be taken straight to the parking garage to the valet area. My wife, who suffers from (peripheral artery disease) was in great discomfort from the whole ordeal and was in tears. I felt helpless, no one knew why the wheelchairs were not showing up, total mismanagement and disregard for handicapped travelers.

Name: Hossein Mohtasebi
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Los Angeles to Miami. By far one of the worse Airlines in the US. The Customer service reps are rude and give you constant attitude. I have the AAdvantage credit card and part of the perks is that my first check in bag as well as the person flying with me in the same flight is free. I booked two tickets from Los Angeles to Miami for me and my cousin. Used miles for one and paid the other one only to find out that my cousin has to pay for his bag because they put him on a different record locator because I am using miles for my flight. Called Customer service and the agent was rude and with attitude not willing to help or do anything to fix this repeating again that you are on two different record locators (we know by now) asked to speak to her manager, even worse!!! Will cancel my credit card with American and never fly with you guys again.

Name: Robert Reightler
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to Providence. Missed our flight by 10 minutes due to car trouble. The airline worked with me to schedule us on the next available flight at no extra charge. They were kind and courteous which I greatly appreciated.

Name: Deanna Porter
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Seattle. I will never fly American again. My husband and I bought our tickets together do you think we are sitting together definitely not because that would only be smart. Several other couples had this same problem and when we voiced this problem they said the only way to sit together was to spend more money. I've flown both delta and Alaska multiple times and never had this problem. This is the second time I have flown American and I have had this problem both times. Also there seats are uncomfortable and no in-flight entertainment. Thanks for being as basic as possible American airline

Name: K Deane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Atlanta to Dallas. Terrible, 4 times they changed my flight time, and twice they changed it back to the original time. They are very inept and unorganized. Please, pick a different airline.

Name: Courtney O'Brien
Review: Not Verified |  Denver to Chicago. I have had the worst experience with American Airlines. My partner and I had flights booked for thanksgiving travel. My partner has recently been relocated for his job and this requires us to move across the country. Therefore we are unable to Travel at thanksgiving. We have had to cancel two other flights so far. Spirit and united have both made exceptions and allowed for us to cancel our flights with a no cancellation fee. This was very generous on their part and we appreciate our experiences with them. American Airlines has refused to help us out in any way. The will not refund or even give flight credit. I found every representative to be very rude and not accommodating. I’m very disappointed with our experience and I do not intend to fly with their airline ever again. As someone who works in customer service, I am aware you are able to pull strings and make exceptions. I do it for our customer everyday, as we value their loyalty to our company. I hope American Airlines can provide better service to other customers in the future.

Name: M Carter
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Springfield to Dallas Ft. Worth via Las Vegas with American Airlines. I would stay away from this airline unless you enjoy sitting around waiting for explanations on why your 1am flight has been delayed 3 hours until 4 am. If you have a connection flight I would find a different airline unless you want to miss that connection. Constantly overbooked, and never fly out on time. Terrible airline. Pretty easy to tell the company does not care about its employees or customers.
route: Springfield to Dallas Ft. Worth via Las Vegas

Name: Jashay Fisher-Fowler
Review: Not Verified |  St. Louis to Jackson. This is a horrible airline and I do not recommend anyone to fly with American Airlines. They cancelled my flight two hours before take off and have not made any accommodations for my inconvenience. Their employees lack empathy, professionalism and has bad customer service when dealing with customers.

Name: William Krebs
Review:
✅ Trip Verified |  
I purchased my ticket weeks before my departure. AA frequently changed the flight times, thus making it difficult to make plans. When I arrived at LAX early to catch the flight to Phoenix, I discovered the departure time had been changed yet again, from 10am to 2pm. It departed after 2pm, although it arrived Phoenix nearly on time. The departure from Phoenix to Austin was late, as was the arrival in Austin. After our arrival in Austin, the ground crew was late in putting in the gate, and so we waited, waited to deplane. I am not happy with this service. LA to Phoenix on Oct. 10, AA Flight 0445 Phoenix to Austin on Oct. 10, AA Flight 0889.
route: Los Angeles to Austin via Phoenix

Review_Heading: "First and last time I'll fly with American Airlines"
Name: Darlene Moya
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Delayed 3 times for morning flight that caused me to miss boarding my connecting flight that was the next gate over, watched my suitcase get put on the plane though. Now after sitting for over 3 hours for next flight, they have delayed that one 5 times! First and last time I'll fly with American Airlines.

Name: B Samuelson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas to Lafayette. Absolute worst customer care of any airline I fly. I fly 3 times a week. They can't control weather so flights get canceled. They have one agent covering 9 gates of canceled flights and he's a trainee . There is no sense of urgency, no concern at all. Another agent arrived with a friend who was flirting with her right in front of a line of 30 people needing prompt help. She casually logged in then called someone to bring her a radio she forgot somewhere. Then starred at the screen like the guy so not to make eye contact. Gate B5 and B6 counter at DFW on October 10 which made the experience go through midnight to Oct 11. Now 1 am Oct 11. Still no help. Horrible

Name: A Hamiren
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Salt Lake City to Dallas. The weakest airline I have ever taken.  No entertainment, no carry-on overhead space forced to check-in the carry-on as baggage "complimentary", no food and drink, uncomfortable seats. Just several announcements from the cabin crew to apply for a credit card with 15000 miles with an annual fee $99.99!

Review_Heading: "never fly with these money grabbers again"
Name: T Aberle
Review: Not Verified |  Lubbock to Charlotte. Going to visit my sister and my usual airline does not fly directly to her home town so grabbed a flight with American Airlines and boy did I learn a lesson. I will never fly with these money grabbers again. I did not realize after flying so long with a better company that buying my ticket did not guarantee that I would be flying with my wife. For 6 flights the closest we sat to each other was two rows apart. You can call me cheap but sorry that I paid for a plane ticket assuming things then refused to pay $50 a ticket extra during check in to try to get seats together.

Name: Lynn Jenkins
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Atlanta to Dallas. American Airlines runs out of overhead baggage space by the boarding of group 4 on any full flight. It increases boarding times and departure time. At this point after instituting baggage fees, they should have enough historical data to implement proactive change to improve onboard baggage policies. Which leads to the 2 on-plane bags policy, which disproportionately impacts women business travelers. As a female traveler, this negatively impacts the needs of female travelers. A male just boarded with a laptop bag, roll-on bag, and shopping bag. A female was stopped and required to “combine down” for a smaller cross-body bag with her laptop, and roll-on bag. Zero-tolerance or full enforcement should apply.

Name: Teresa Uttke
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I was flying to Jacksonville North Carolina. I accidentally purchased tickets to Jacksonville Florida. Notice the different states. Yes I know this is my fault however I am human and it was an accident. The first leg of my journey was with Delta. When we arrived in Atlanta and realized we were headed to Florida accidentally Delta took care of us and sent us to Jacksonville North Carolina as I had originally planned. When I called and attempted to change my American Airlines ticket they refused. They refused to make an exception. Very poor customer service and they did not care. They refused to even entertain switching the ticket. I was willing to pay a fee to change it.

Name: W Beale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Indianapolis to Phoenix. I will never fly on American Airlines again. Their customer service is the absolute worst I have ever encountered and there is no way to talk with anyone on the phone. Despite the fact that there is a "customer service" telephone number listed, I have called it four times and each time I waited over 30 minutes to be connected to discuss my issues only to be told "this is reservations and we are a totally different department, if you want customer service you can send an email, that is the only way to contact them." On one of these occasions (after waiting 40 minutes, I couldn't understand the person when they said their name. I asked him to repeat it, still didn't understand him so I spelled what I though he was saying and he hung up on me! This forced me to call back again and wait ANOTHER 40 minutes. In the end I emailed them and someone finally called me back but when I asked to speak to their supervisor because I was not happy with the resolution or her ability to explain the situation (more about this later) she stated "our supervisors don't speak to customers". The whole issue was a mechanical problem that caused me and the two people I was traveling with to miss our connection and be delayed an entire day (I understand problems happen and that is not the issue) my two traveling companions filed claims for a refund as did I. they both received vouchers for another flight but I did not. When the customer service agent (who I cannot call on the phone) called me she explained that because I have an AAdvantage Account they were giving me 10,000 miles or I could also receive a voucher. So I asked "what is the value of the 10,000 miles versus the $175 voucher my companions received?" She said she couldn't tell me but I could call the AAdvantage program and ask them and I said "but if I do that how will I reach you again to tell you which I want?" She answered that I could submit another email request (which requires phone number, email, flight number and record locator to all be submitted again and wait for them to call me. I told her how ridiculous this was and this is when I asked for the supervisor. In the end I told her to just give me the miles but it didn't really matter because I will never fly American Airlines again.

Name: J Mallen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Worst airline customer service. They simply don’t care! Delayed by 5 hours. Happens, right! But such a lack of communication the entire time. Every single employee seemed annoyed at the questions. Then they boarded us and we sat on the tarmac for another hour! Weak apologies and planning! I will take 2 segments with another airline to avoid American in the future. And I travel for business 3 weeks a month.

Name: Bill Hale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas to Reno. How does a standby ticket get a better seat than a paid ticket and is loaded in group 3 with a carry on bag instead of 9 made to check the carry on like I had to? I had to wait until five minutes before boarding to getting my seat assignment when a standby person got a seat assignment 10 mins before I did. The counter agent told me it is a full flight and had to check my bag. When we were loaded, there were several empty seats, so much for the full flight. Now I have to wait in baggage claim when I get to Reno. I can see why American Airlines has such low reviews. Whether I buy a first-class or economy one I should be treated as a paying seat ticket price customer. I'm very disappointed with the service.

Name: J Mattel
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Tampa to Miami. This was probably the best 36-minute flight ever. The plane felt and looked brand new, legroom was great, the seat was very comfortable, the large entertainment screen was unexpected but very much appreciated, they gave me a drink and a snack. The crew at the counter and the gate were very friendly, I wish I could say the same for the first-class flight attendant that never smiled at all however was efficient in his duties. Maybe he had a rough morning. Over all, Good job AA!

Name: S Gallino
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New York to Chicago. I was worried after booking American for the first time in a decade after reading a lot of poor reviews, but they offered good prices and itineraries for flights from JFK to ORD. However, I felt compelled to leave a review based on my pleasant experience that completely exceeded expectations. There were no bells or whistles to this flight, but the small fee to sit in Main Cabin Extra was well worth it, as I am 5'4 and could stretch my legs out almost completely without hitting the seat ahead. The cabin staff was friendly, pilots upbeat, and the aircraft was actually pretty modern and clean. Bad things I expected based on popular reviews of American Airlines but did not experience: - outdated aircraft interior - delays & cancellations - gate changes - unfriendly crew - tight pitch Things that could be improved: - cheesy smell of the breakfast offered to first-class passengers permeated the cabin and was quite nauseating - had to explicitly ask for the alcohol perks for Main Cabin Extra passengers and wasn't originally offered - rougher takeoffs and landings than any other airline I've flown (felt very rushed on both actually) - no inflight entertainment if you don't have the app on your phone Overall, this was a good flight at a great price point and I would definitely fly American Airlines again for short-hauls.

Name: Mary Moore
Review: Not Verified |  Las Vegas to Dallas. Two hour delay sitting on the plane due to air not working. Staff is rude and not helpful. They keep telling us 15 more minutes and we are clearly nowhere close to departure. There have been 7 delays since I have been sitting here. The air is still not working, all the passengers are sweating, and very uncomfortable. I have never had a more horrible flight experience in my life. I will never fly this airline again.

Name: Samantha Legler
Review: Not Verified |  Tampa to Wilkes Barre with American Airlines. This airline takes no accountability for errors that occur on their end. A death in my family occurred and a change of flight had to be made. I called over 24 hours before the flight was scheduled for and paid $32.00 to reschedule my flight for the next day. I was advised to use the same flight locator/confirmation code and check into my flight and when I attempted to was met with a completely useless ticket representative with no record on the part of American Airlines and was advised my only option was to purchase another $285 ticket! Though I had credit card receipts showing we had paid to change the flight. Worst experience I’ve ever had flying. As a frequent flyer with family across multiple states, myself and family will never fly American Airlines again and recommend anyone considering a trip to do the same!

Review_Heading: "They ruin the end of every great vacation"
Name: Mary Wattle
Review: Not Verified |  Second time flying American Airlines and it's completely screwed up again. Two hour delay due to plane being in hanger and no one to bringing it over. Missed first flight. Also missed second flight out of Charlotte due to delay. Now sitting in airport for another seven hours getting into Erie at 10.20 Monday evening. Keep in mind we left Fresno at 11.30 pm Sunday night. They changed our flights from Dallas to Charlotte and we didn't want to sit in airport for seven hours so we changed flights for a fee and here we are sitting on Charlotte NC for seven hours. Worst airline ever. They gave us free flights for next year because in July they cancelled our flight for no reason and I don't even want to use them because the airlines are such a mess. They ruin the end of every great vacation and we're sick of it. The incompetence of this airline is beyond comprehension.

Name: Logan Horrocks
Review: Not Verified |  Phoenix to Spokane. It is very sad that a company as pathetic as American Airlines can be up and running still with their consistent inability to satisfy even the simplest of needs (including landing within 2 hours of your scheduled time) on an overpriced ticket. I must give props to the staff however because despite the horrible system they still manage to impress with their astonishing amount of rudeness and lack of basic customer service skills.

Name: Leigh Leonard
Review: Not Verified | Washington to Pensacola. We were exhausted after a stay in DC and had to fly back to Pensacola on a 7:30p flight as we have done many times. My husband and I recently married and upon entering the plane jokingly asked, "we're newlyweds can we sit in first class?" The flight attendant was genuinely so kind and congratulated us (along with her fellow flight attendant. That was one of the most fabulous flights we've had in a while. Not just because we were able to fly first class (as we've flown several times), but the flight attendants dispositions and the "on-time", early arrival and smooth flight itself was all first class! In a time where posting negative reviews (myself included) are everywhere, I just wanted to take a minute and thank the flight attendants for her exemplary, genuinely positive and caring attitude she displayed to myself, my husband and others on that flight.

Review_Heading: "the experience left a lot to be desired"
Name: B Jackson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I normally fly Southwest but they don’t fly into Burlington, VT so we bought tickets for a vacation through American Airlines. Overall, the experience left a lot to be desired. We had one layover both ways. Our first layover was in Chicago where we experienced a 4hr delay. The AA employees told the waiting passengers that two crew members were delayed and they were on their way. Every 15-30min, I would receive a text stating the flight had been delayed another 30min but very little communication from the counter and absolutely no apologies. Once aboard the plane, we were told by the pilot that due to another plane delay AA had to get new pilots and that was the reason for the delay. After sitting for several minutes, the pilot came back on to say that due to the delay, the flight pattern had been cancelled. So, there we sat in a stuffy, small airplane for another hour. Do you suppose the powers at be might have known this would happen and allow passengers to wait in the comfort of the airport at least. I am guessing they needed to get the plane off the loading gate. While sitting on the tarmac, I wrote an email to AA Customer Service in the hopes they would extend an olive branch of service recovery on our return flights (a free drink ticket, upgraded seats, maybe earlier boarding). I am in the service industry as well and know how much it means to offer a small gesture as an apology when things go wrong. No one is perfect after all. Someone did email me back, but offered vouchers for my next flight. I responded saying that I was really hoping for something on my return flight since I wasn’t sure I would be flying AA again. The staff member did respond stating that she was sorry I wasn’t happy with what was offered, but AA could not be offering anything else. So AA would rather coerce me into flying with them again with two $50 vouchers instead of providing some service recovery upfront via a couple free drinks or an upgraded boarding status which would have gone a lot further. It is no wonder this airlines falls below Southwest, Delta, JetBlue and others in customer satisfaction. I won’t fly with American again as I do not believe they truly value their customers. I will end by saying the AA counter staff at the Burlington Airport were lovely and very friendly. But the staff at Chicago O’Hare and Philadelphia seem to dislike their jobs or the customers they are there to serve. Or maybe the employees are treated like the customers with little regard to showing care and compassion.

Name: Tony Benton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Abhorrent customer service. Delayed out of Knoxville for no apparent reason. Watched in Charlotte airport for 15 minutes before gangway detached from airplane that was supposed to go to Pittsburgh. Forced to stay in Charlotte but no compensation made for hotel or transportation citing “policy”. Rude, uncaring customer assistance. Manager not empowered to address anything and was uncaring and obstinate. Similar experience same evening for my wife but she was flying Delta - they took care of their customer. Simply put don't fly American Airlines.

Name: Cianan Furlong
Review: Not Verified | I was supposed to fly from Toronto to New York today, and then to Boston. After getting on the plane and sitting on the runway, we were told there was an issue with the plane. These things happen, there is no point in freaking out. As the day progressed I became more and more disappointed with American Airlines staff. They rudely told me I was going to have to go to Chicago to get to Boston. As I boarded my plane to Chicago, I was harassed for having a large carry-on bag and not having a proper ticket yet (because the airline didn't give me one after switching me). I was told to give my carry-on bag over to them. I don't have any issues with the logic of needing space in the cabin, but the rude way the staff demanded it was shameful. I was lied to and told that I could get it back in Chicago When I arrived in Chicago, I asked where I could get my carry-on bag. A different staff member rudely told me I will get it in Boston. When I tried to explain that there was some sort of miscommunication, I was told that I am just a poor listener. Finally, It was time to go to Boston, I was called to the stand to get a seat number, when I went up I was asked in a very aggressive voice "why are you up here right now". I explained that I was called and she said: "I did not call anyone, sit down". The other employee had to intervene and remind the lady that she had called me. I really am never someone to complain or to write negative reviews. I was just so blown away by how poorly American Airlines handled everything today that I felt something needed to be said.

Name: Joseph Bell
Review: Not Verified | Myrtle Beach to Appleton. Flight was suppose to leave at 5:45 am we arrived at the airport at 5:07 which was empty at the moment. Checking in our bags we were told the fight was booked and ready for take off. Said we came too late. So after waiting for the next flight and having a layover of 6 hrs in Chicago. We are told it was our fault for not being there at least 30 min early. Simple math 5:07 to 5:45 is 38 minutes. Flight left with 6 open seats. Never using American Airlines again. Customer service was rude and short. Will be delta from here on out

Name: Forrest Marion
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | On my flight from Dallas to Las Vegas (3 Sep), I accidentally left my small pocket Bible in the seatback pocket. I realized it the next day and when I returned to the airport for my flight home, I checked Lost & Found to no avail. At that point, I figured it was gone. I have had that Bible with me twice in Afghanistan and many other places and was sorry to lose it. But when I got to my office the following week, I had a phone message from an American Airlines employee who had found my Bible in Buffalo, NY, and had managed to track me down. She kindly offered to mail it back to me and I received it a few days later, as good as new. She truly went the extra mile for me which I so greatly appreciated and will long remember.

Review_Heading: "I will never fly with them again"
Name: J Beale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I been flying all my life, I respect and understand that things just happen. Not this case with the most awful and abusive use of the word American. There is nothing American about how this airline purposely abuses the power when selling tickets for flights that obviously can’t provide. Once you are in the air on one of their flights you are definitely going to have your connecting flight canceled. It has happened to me of a family member every month the last four months when one of us have taken a flight. The pattern exists. Only to add injury to insult the will give you a $12 food voucher (airport food prices) as if that will remedy the abuse. There has to be a way to hold them accountable to the point to where they respect and show remorse when it comes the consumer. Nevertheless I will never fly with them again. You can’t put a price on time and disrespect. They don’t have planes, they sell flights they can not honor and the staff has to be well aware.

Name: Roxy Ocleary
Review: Not Verified | St Louis to Chicago. American Airlines is the worst. They made half the flight check their carry-ons when there was plenty of room for more bags. The plane was trashed. When the pilot came on to make announcements it they made loud screeching noises the entire time. Did they stop and try to fix that? You guessed it. No. This airline clearly gives zero cares about their customers. Fly anyone but American. There are always multiple issues with AA!

Name: Myla Konovalova
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Lihue to Los Angeles. Our flight was delayed overnight. We didn't get any reimbursement for stay, food, transportation, etc. American Airlines just ignored us. I would never use this airline again!

Name: J Liston
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I booked in advance a flight with 1 stop from Newark to Tulsa. I needed to change some dates at considerable expense.Through Travelocity, the airline issued a $174 credit (only valid from one year of booking). I wanted to book another flight 12 days later than the expiration date. Even though we did not take our Tulsa flight until April of 2019, the airline said I could not redeem my credit in Feb. 2020 because my booking was in earlier Feb. of 2019. Travelocity tried to advocate for us and I called American Airlines myself. I spoke with Dane, and she stated the airline would not extend my credit. This is the price you pay for booking a flight early! I plan to retire in 2 years and do a lot of traveling, but you can bet I will never book with American Airlines!

Name: Tony Miller
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas to Madison. What a circus! The flight was delayed from 10:30 am until now - still sitting in the airport at 4:45 pm and they are “hoping” our new plane will be authorized to fly by 5:30. These clowns had us on the plane and partially towed to the runway when one bolt stripped on the part that hooks to the tow vehicle. We eventually deplaned and then waited at least two hours for maintenance to look at the stripped bolt. Fast forward to now and apparently, they don’t have any bolts on hand so they are supposedly bringing us a new plane, at a new gate, but we have yet to see it. Oh, and to add insult to injury, they gave us all a $12 meal voucher for our troubles. That works out to around $2 per hour for our wasted time. Thanks, American! I will be sure to never fly with you again. Oh, let me add that in the short time I was actually on the plane, I looked around to see if it was a full flight (which they always are) as I was smashed between two large dudes. I noticed the two female flight attendants sitting in the back row which was completely empty, save for themselves. I caught the eye of one and mouthed “are those seats open” which they obviously were. She looked at me, glanced at the open seats and looked back and shook her head “nope”! Thanks! I wouldn’t want to intrude on your private flight attendant conversation. Please enjoy the six seats the two of you are occupying.

Name: S Marsten
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Seattle to Paris via Dallas. First and last time we ever fly American Airlines. Both flights to and from our destination were delayed. The first flight was delayed “due to weather”, which is ridiculous because the weather was actually fine, the bad weather happened the day before. When we discovered this we told it to the employees and they said they were still catching up, though ALL other airlines were already flying on time. Because of “bad weather,” AA stated they were not responsible for any incurred expenses to us from the delay. We had to stay overnight in Dallas, had to pay for our own hotel, got no reimbursement or even a small upgrade on our next flight. Not even offering us a complimentary drink or anything. Customer service is horrible. On the flight back, there was also a delay and this time NO explanation was offered but they rerouted us which added a 5 hr layover and a longer connecting flight. Overall we lost a whole day on our already short trip to Europe, lost hundreds of dollars from having to pay for a hotel in Dallas and missing a day in our prepaid accommodation in Europe. The trip was exhausting and stressful. Save yourselves and do not fly American Airlines.

Review_Heading: "a day of absolute hell for me"
Name: D Lauder
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Bangor to Albany via Philadelphia. I arrived at Gate 4 at Bangor ME to depart for Philly at 5:10 where I was greeted by 2 people, a female standing at the counter, and a tall gentleman, who had both seen me scurrying toward them after a delay at security in this small airport. When I arrived at the counter the man moved to the open doorway/tunnel to the plane and stated "you need to stay back" . I am 58 years of age, 5'5", 108 pounds. He was very tall and sounded quite aggressive. The female then stated that I would not be permitted to board. I asked her why and she stated "You had to be here at 5:10". I looked at my phone and stated "it is 5:10 (I show her my phone) and I checked in online as well. She then stated "NO, it's 5:11, I have been watching my clock. The gate to the plane was still open, the tunnel in place, and the plane had not left the ground. I explained that I am a caregiver to my ill husband and this is simply not possible as I was checked in online and had arrived within the time limit. She stated, and I quote "no, and my boss was here to see it" (my 5:11 am arrival, she watched her clock!) I was on stand-by and able to leave Bangor at 5:45 a.m. but what ensued, a nightmare. Redirected from Wash/DC to Philly/PA and from Philly to Alb, NY., no flight until 3:30 p.m.I sobbed at the counter, and in panic, searched for an earlier flight from my phone only to find that I could buy a seat from this very same airline on an 11:30 instead of 3:00 p.m. I returned, again went through security, and found someone to help me change the ticket to the 11:30. What happened with American Airlines at Bangor, ME International Airport was despicable. They held me up at the counter waiting for the clock to strike 5:11, which, I surmise, is due to having given my seat away. It created a day of absolute hell for me and my family. Thanks American.

Name: Beth Perkins
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Absolutely horrible service! Many delays and the flight attendants were too busy talking about the airline and how they where they paid and the flight they were scheduled for sucked. This was my second time flying with them as this happened many years ago also. Due to needing a quick flight for a medical emergency and the time that had past since I last flew with them, I figured I’d give them another try - worst mistake I made, and never again!

Name: C Lewis
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to Cleveland. Boarded at 5:10 PM; it is now 6:55pm. Departure time has changed 4 times; we are told the pilots were not scheduled: and now the paperwork is not legal. Still sitting and waiting.

Name: David Calhoun
Review: Not Verified | Greensboro to Wichita. Terrible, absolutely horrible! My brother is a 30-year pilot with this Airlines. That is why I decided to go with it. I have flown with Delta, United even TWA back in the old days and Braniff Airlines. I have never seen an airline change their flight status so many times. Not only did they cancel a flight on me. But they continued to screw around and caused me a great deal of hardship over it was supposed to be just a simple flight from Greensboro to Wichita. They also have cost me over 27 hours due to the canceled flight in Wichita last night. I have been waiting to go back home now 27 hours to Greensboro. I could have taken an Amtrak train and gotten there quicker. My wife it's a first-time flyer. She is totally bombed with flying now! Rightfully so American Airlines really jerking people around. They also owe me two days parking now that I left my car at the airport - that's another $16 plus the $ 40 I spent on food unnecessarily while waiting on my flights. Do yourself a favor - drive or take Amtrak.

Name: Raghu Gadipally
Review: Not Verified | Austin to Charleston via Charlotte. Worst airline I have ever seen. Travel time 40 mins and they took 1 hour to find the gate. After going on to the runway they mentioned 2 checkups no been done and after an hour they said one engine is not working. Overall worst experience. Don’t ever fly with American Airlines

Name: N Taminas
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Charlotte to Dallas. I was boarding the plane and the lady in the front told me I needed to make sure my luggage fit. So I did that. Of course it dint because no luggage fits on that thing. So they told me they had to take my bag I said it fit on the last plane and that was a small plane so I asked the lady is it a small plane? She said it was - that was a lie it was a big plane which I knew so I said well I want to try it. I then continued to argue with the person who said that since they had already printed out a ticket for my luggage that it had to go (that’s not my problem) so then i was made to leave my luggage. My question now is why does American make me have to check my luggage when all the other ones where my same size and they just don’t have enough head bin space at the top to allow more bags so of course instead of telling you that they would rather lie and come up with an excuse as to why I can’t bring my luggage in.

Review_Heading: "by far the worst airline I have ever flown"
Name: Erica Christine
Review: Not Verified |  American is by far the worst airline I have ever flown. First $30 to check 1 bag. Then I paid a total of $66 dollars to upgrade my seats. Then the airplane is here on time at 2.30pm in Tampa but the crew is not. So I will miss my connecting in Dallas because now they won't leave for another 2 hrs. So now leaving for Philly but not for another 4 hrs. So flight doesnt leave Philly until 9pm, should arrive into Phoenix now at 11.30pm. Just a complete poor show and guess what, on both flights I'm in the very back in the middle. They won't refund for money spent already to upgrade seats. This will be the last time this airline screws me.

Name: Renee Veranese
Review: Not Verified |  Tampa to Charlotte via Pittsburgh with American Airlines. Flight has been delayed 9 times (so far). We've had to change our connecting flight twice which has put us back 5 hours. No apology or explanation and the staff is rude. They dont care about customers. We are currently still stuck at the airport. I will never fly American Airlines again.

Name: C Smith
Review: Not Verified | Dallas to Louisville. Worst airline company for wanting to make it anywhere on time. They have delayed both flights, waited 5 mins before flight was to board to let anyone know and then say it’s a 2hr delay. How can you not know something that big of a delay ahead of time? I have none of my luggage because the last flight was full so I had to check it in. Now I’m without

Name: D Harwell
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Charlotte to Birmingham. Delayed, delayed, delayed. Hate this airline. Will never use them ever again. They have no scheduling management and can not keep a simple flight schedule on time.

Name: J Anderson
Review: Not Verified |  Amarillo to Dallas. American is terrible. Two (2) flights delayed 2+ hours each; a short flight on Monday and return flight on Wednesday. Both were delayed due to maintenance issues. Thankfully, I had text alerts on the first flight since no one was at the counter to ask what was going on, just kept being pushed back and back and back via text message.
