Plane was supposed to take off at 6:41pm; plane wasn’t finished boarding until 7:05pm. After sitting for 15 minutes after boarding said plane, we’re notified that the flight is delayed 1 hour and 20 minutes due to mechanical problems. Still not sure if we’re going to be able to use said plane. I’m supposed to be on vacation. Wi-Fi on the plane doesn’t work, this flight can not earn points (for whatever reason), have not been offered even a drink. American sucks, should have read reviews before purchasing. Will not make the same mistake again.

Review_Heading: "try to smile every now and again"
Name: W Anderson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | San Francisco to Los Angeles with American Airlines. The flight attendants on this flight are always the worst kind of people. It’s as if they absolutely hate their job and take out all their anger on the customers. Rather than being helpful, they are short and abrupt. Would not recommend this airline to absolutely anyone. Try Southwest or Delta and you’ll get much nicer service. Remember American Airlines, try to smile every now and again.

Name: James Perano
Review: Not Verified |  Worst service. Had one AA rep tell me he was to busy to speak with us. Delayed flights. Put on other flights that also were delayed so American Airlines wasted one day of our vacation. Then because we were group 9 to board they would not let us take our cary on. So now we have to go to baggage claim adding even more time to what has become a terrible experience. I will never fly American Airlines again.

Name: Rick Blass
Review: Not Verified |  We had the displeasure of flying with AA July 20, 2019 and July 25, 2019. Where do I begin? First, upon checking one bag, we were told, due to our bag exceeding fifty pounds, the cost would be $100. Our credit card was charged $130! No gate number was provided to us! We had to wander aimlessly and ask an AA representative, who was rude! All representatives were rude! We were told we could not board the plane after first class was called. (We had a service dog and a stroller). We were VIP seating! We were unable to access the AA WIFI once aboard the plane. Being in VIP seating, we asked if there was a charge for alcoholic beverages. We were told, yes! (On our return flight from LAS to CLT, we asked the flight attendant if there was a charge for alcoholic beverages. She also said, yes! The passenger sitting next to us, in the aisle seat, told and showed us that alcoholic beverages are free!) We don’t appreciate being lied to! Once we arrived in CLT, we were told there was a 3 hour delay! We had pre-paid tickets for a show in Las Vegas at 9.00pm that cost us $204.88 and were non-refundable! We understand that weather conditions are not in anyone’s control, however, we were not offered any compensation for the money and our valuable waiting time that were out! We encountered the same no WIFI and no alcohol from CLT to LAS! What happened to the good ole days where there were screens to view movies (with provided ear/head-phones), actual meals and a variety of snacks (that were included, not a charge for) as well as friendly and calm flight attendants? We flew with this airline this past Easter and had a positive experience. That is why we chose to fly with AA again. Bad mistake! Wish we flew with Southwest! This truly was the traveling nightmare we had to endure!
route: Daytona Beach to Charlotte via Las Vegas

Name: Derek Northcutt
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Paris to Los Angeles via Dallas. They just cannot get anything right. Flew from Paris to-day but couldn't check-in and spent one hour over the telephone while they figured out how to reissue the ticket (schedule change). When I checked in again this problem and even though I am AA Platinum elite they charge me 50€ for my suitcase even though am supposed to get two complimentary (https://www.oneworld.com/travel-benefits). Because I couldn't check-in of course got the lousiest seats. Why because the computer told them to collect it and they cannot override the computer. It seems that the computer is not their tool, but they are the tool of the computer. Upstairs was treated abrasively by a 22-year old boy in the Admirals' Club - why does American continue to hire people who do not wish to serve the public? In my opinion AA is deceptive & dishonest and now they do not honour their pledges regarding elite benefits. I plan to sue them in Superior Court for the $55 just because someone has to send them a message that they cannot walk all over people. It is astonishing though how they cheat everyone even their best customers.
route: Paris to Los Angeles via Dallas

Name: K Gurlan
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  6:40 New York JFK to Austin flight delayed 80 min. Since it was taken off after 8pm they did not serve dinner! Same thing on the way back to New York happened. 6:30 flight delayed 90 min and announced dinner will not be served but snack meal. Waste of time and waste of money. Last time flying with American Airlines. Not recommended at any time.
route: New York to Austin via Dallas

Name: Loizos Nicolaou
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Ashville to Philadelphia. Worst airline ever. Our flight was randomly cancelled due to air traffic where other flights were flying as scheduled to Philly. No compensation for money lost on fuel and hotel bookings. Avoid this airline! They had it planned and let it happen at the last minute. They could find an alternative solution. Avoid!

Review_Heading: "no flight home, no one to help"
Name: B Lauren
Review: Not Verified |  On our way there, our boarding passes said to go to the kiosk for seat assignments. At the kiosk no one acknowledged us for 30 minutes as they were talking amongst themselves and finally when someone looked up they asked “are you looking for your seat assignments” we stated yes, and the reply we got was “well so is everybody else”. Absolutely terrible. Then on the way home, our flight got delayed. The delay would cause us to miss our connector flight so with everyone else we stood in line to talk to the employees at the kiosk. While in line, a member of American Airlines passed out a number to call. We called the number just to ask about flight changes and if we could get a refund how that would work. The women on the phone informed us that we would have to do that online which we said we would wait to talk to the employees first. After standing in line for 2 hours to talk to the person at the kiosk about our options, they told us we had cancelled our flight by talking to that women on the phone. The man at the kiosk told us “there’s nothing I can do” and “I wish you wouldn’t have called them”. So we walked away with no flight home, no one to help, and lord only knows if we will get our refund. This is so ridiculous. Awful airline and will never fly with American Airlines again.
route: Myrtle Beach, SC to Boston, MA

Name: A Richards
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Received morning email that everything was good to go. Went thru security at 7.30 for a 9.30 flight to Dallas FW. So the nightmare and incompetence begins. The flight was cancelled. Everything was rescheduled. I would now fly to LAX at 5.30 pm, an 8 hour delay - they gave us a $12 food voucher. I went to the American Airlines counter to tell them I would miss my flight in Manila and they just basically said it was my problem and I would have to call the airlines. My flight in Manila was scheduled for 7.5 hours after I was supposed to arrive on my American Airlines booked trip. Now in LA, I am put on Philippine Airlines, which runs about 30 minutes late after another 2.5 hour layover. So, now I am in Manila, at the wrong terminal, as I was supposed to be on an American Airlines flight that arrived at the correct terminal. Its not really a big deal as I don't have my luggage. 3-4 day delay and I have to go back to the airport to get it! Never again American Airlines. 33 hours and now I'm sitting in a bus terminal at the airport waiting to go to the correct terminal hoping Cebu Pacific takes pity on me and gets me to my destination cause American Airlines did absolutely nothing for not only me but their other customers on that flight. Pathetic.

Name: M Pearce
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | The service on board was surprisingly and completely unexpectedly quite good. However, the managing of bags was terrible. I checked two bags in LA at the same time and when arriving in MEX only one was there. At first at the AA baggage loss counter, they seemed very sympathetic and gave the impression I might get it back in 24 hours as they say in most instances it is the case. But after calling each day with the same promise that the baggage was scanned and in LA, they promised it would arrive in MEX the next day to no avail. On the 15 August, I was told by one staff of the lost baggage phone line my luggage was already on the plane and would arrive at my doorstep by 8pm. At 9pm I call just to be informed that my bag was still in LA. That is not incompetence, that is plain lying. I have to wait until 18 August to receive it back and no compensation was granted. It goes without saying that this was the worst customer service I have ever experienced from any airline.

Name: Cody Hodges
Review: Not Verified |  Denver to Philadelphia. Arrived at Denver Airport 1 1/2 hours prior to 5:24 am departure. Stood inline for nearly 55 minutes at self service checkin. AA counter was moving people from the back of the line to the front of the line in order to keep them from missing their 5:00 AM flight (this caused us to have to run to our gate missing any chance of getting food before boarding). We were sitting near the back of the plane, by the time the service cart got to us, they had one sandwich and two fruit trays left. My son and I originally wanted a sandwich each. He pulled out the sandwich and the fruit trays. I said I would take one of both. The flight attendant from the front of the plane came up and asked for the two fruit trays, my flight attendant literally gave her both. His explanation was the “front of the plane” has priority over the back of the plane. This is absolutely unacceptable. I sent a note to AA and have been ignored. Bottom Line, if AA think they are a doing a good job, they are not. I will continue to tell people my experience and steer them away from flying American Airlines!

Name: R Money
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Las Vegas. Pay more and take a different airline. Sat on the plane for four hours and then flight was cancelled. Rescheduled for a flight 24 hours later. One day out of a three day vacation gone. Next day flight had a three hour layover that turned into four because of a delayed flight. People coming off the flying were running each other over trying to get to connecting flights only to be told the flights took off and they needed to go to customer service to reschedule. No organization with the airline staff or traffic control in Philadelphia. Will be waiting for compensation after this. Will never fly with AA again!

Name: Aimee Dearmon
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  My daughter and I were about to go to Miami see a specialist for my daughter’s condition. The ticket agent said we had time to run to the bathroom, but when we returned, that same ticket agent watched us approach, rushed to shut the door to the ramp and almost gleefully told us “sorry, you can’t board.” We inquired as to what to do next, and she said we could go stand-by. After waiting through 3 over-sold flights, we realized that there was no way we would board a flight to Miami going stand-by. We called American and the agent offered us two new flights at almost $400 a piece without any credit for the more than $300 we’d already paid for the original flight. I called United and a great guy got us on another flight the following morning for only $140 total for the two of us. While in Miami, my daughter became very ill and was hospitalized for 4 days. The doctor would not release her from his care in time for our flight. I called American and explained the situation. They offered to “help” us, but they would have to charge a “change’ fee to the tune of $480! After many failed conversations with American Airlines, I gave up. I felt like we were being extorted. We were stranded and nearly broke through no fault of our own and they would not budge an inch to give us a reasonable flight. I called Southwest airlines. They gave us a flight home for little more than $168 a piece, which was much less than American’s “change” fee. When I complained on Twitter, they began to direct message me, (anything to keep my more than 3000 followers from knowing how awful we were being treated.) The last one read, “We’re very sorry for the situation. We feel it was outside the norm and for that reason we hope you’ll allow us another chance in the future.” Still no offer of compensation for the more than $700 they pocketed from us. And, when I read other former customer’s experiences, it seems this is exactly their norm! I will never fly American Airlines again. Their staff, especially their O’Hare staff, are obnoxious and rude. I can’t remember being treated so badly by a company whose service I paid for! Deplorable customer service!

Name: Karen Stahl
Review: Not Verified | Phoenix to Houston IAH. My back still hurts from flying yesterday. These are the most cramped seats and without back support, I've ever flown in. Pay a little more and fly another airline

Name: E Lamena
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Chattanooga. My flight was scheduled for 8:27pm. I get to the gate at 8.20pm to find the gate is closed! I go to customer service and they said "oh, flights leave 10 minutes ahead of time " I go where does it say that? I've never heard of this? " Its common knowledge" Airlines know who is supposed to be on the flight, you know you are missing someone but you leave early anyway? The worst part was their attitude! I asked to speak to a supervisor and he was unprofessional. I said nothing I had says flight leaves 10 minutes early, I looked at departure time on kiosk, 827!  He said the kiosk says it, I went and looked and took pictures, it does not say to be there 10 mins early. I have never seen anything like this.

Name: Aurore Le Roué
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  We bought some tickets from Boston to Washington, for a flight scheduled at 8.00 pm on 08.15. Two months before our trip, we received an email saying our flight will be at 9.00 pm. First bad news. The day of our trip, we received an e-mail at 8.30 pm rescheduling our flight at 10.30 pm. All night long, we received 8 e-mails rescheduling our flight! And no information at all from American Airlines crew at the airport! We didn't know anything : nor why it was delayed, nor why it was rescheduled every half hour. It was freezing in the airport because of the air conditionner, and nobody gave us blankets at any point. We were just waiting and waiting for the next bad news and the next email in our mailbox. At some point, my friends and I went to look for some company member but nobody was at the desk, although it was 11.35 pm and the flight was supposed to leave. We finally managed to find someone who explained us there was no pilot for our flight. How can it be possible? Our flight finally left Boston at 1.30 am with more than 4 delayed hours, and the staff told us there was nothing they could do for us. Even one of the employees was chocked by the situation! This is how American Airlines treats their customers. Because, obviously, customers didn't receive any compensation for all the troubles caused. Just a "we apologize". We lost 7 hours at the airport and we lost a lot of money because our Airbnb in Washington couldn't wait for us all night long.

Name: Kristine Zuluaga
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Hartford to Miami. Brand new airplane. They waited until all were seated. Upon pre-flight inspection, they discover that there’s a flat tire and they had no replacement. They announce that they are trying to borrow from another airline and that flight is delayed 45 minutes. Original departure time was 6am. Ten minutes later, stewards said we have no information so please do not ask us. 5 minutes later we get text message saying departure delayed until 9:30 am. Ten minutes later they say they still have no tire and no info but will need to deplane for repair. They also said “make one line in front of gate counter if transferring in Miami. We will hand you a card with a phone number to call regarding your transfer flight. When you deboard do not speak with other AA staff as they are busy with other flights”. Mind you, they are holding our luggage hostage so that we can’t make other arrangements. As we are deboarding, the sign at the gate changes to departure until 11:30. No one makes announcements from gate. Only announcement made was “If you’re not making a transfer in Miami get out of line! This is the only flight to Miami we have so you just have to wait” This is how they were speaking to us. No apologies, no kind words. Now, I had to get up at 3:00 am to make this flight. I booked an early flight because I was surprising my daughter on her birthday and had a whole day planned for celebration. As it is, I will only have 3 days with her counting today. I haven’t seen her in almost a year. She had a very difficult week which made me decide to bite the bullet and pay this high priced ticket for just a few days which is now turning into a nightmare. It is 7:30 am and still no announcements. I appreciate the safety check and making the necessary repairs, however, a new plane should not be without a spare tire and neither should the airline. This is what is causing the major delay and I do not appreciate the way we are being treated not to mention that I paid almost $500 for disappointment, a day lost, and complete rudeness! Not so much as a food voucher was offered. Next time, it’s Delta for me.

Name: P Andrews
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | New York to Miami. If you want to pay for American Airlines and get Spirit Airlines service thats the only way you should travel with them. Delayed at every single flight no exception between 1 and 3 hours, no water no snacks, no going to the bathroom, just sit strapped in your seat until you get to depart, if you ever find out since the crew does not communicate with the passengers. This is my last trip with American Airlines, will change my miles membership and credit cards too, this is a absolute no no company to travel with. Sadly they have been decreasing quality since past 4 years, but the delays are just too frustrating.

Review_Heading: "punish those are not willing to pay"
Name: Victoria Lohn
Review: Not Verified |  Washington to Kansas City. Does American Airlines now have a policy to punish those who are not willing to pay for an earlier boarding? Sure seems that way. Went to board my plane yesterday, when group 7 was called to board, they suddenly had no more room in the overhead bins. They checked our bags at the gate. When we got onto the plane, there were empty overhead compartments everywhere. There was plenty of space. It seems as though you must pay to board early or you now have to face the fact of going to baggage claim to get your luggage. You certainly cannot risk complaining, what would happen if you did? You will be removed or arrested? I am not poor, but I was poor at one time and did not have the money to pay for 'boarding earlier'. There is something sickening about this unethical behavior.

Name: Justin Yuchnitz
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Worst flight ever. When you use your miles with them they sit you in the back row next to toilets and next Non-parented children. Stewardess was flirting with man in front of us, but what’s worse is that she wasn’t keeping the two non parented 7-9 year old children who were so out of control. Kicking the seat, throwing food, snatching our phones from our hands, and just all over the place. Bad bad bad! Don’t fly this airline.  Not flying this airline again.

Name: T Charter
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Terrible airline. Delay after delay after delay. All accompanied by their ‘we are sorry for the inconvenience’ email. They’re not sorry. They’re laughing all the way to the bank. Never again.

Name: C Magana
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Worst airline my family and I have ever been on. Delays going to our destination and delays on the way back. They have no care for customer convenience, the crew was late and therefore delayed two hours. Then again on our way back home there were other unexplainable issues causing further delays. We had to sleep at the airport overnight and they could not/ did not want to accommodate us at all. Also once at Dallas Forth Worth, they kept changing our gates from one end to another, we kept having to walk up and down like 4 time! Worst flight experience ever. Get more for your money and fly another airline, United is the best.

Name: Patrick Blauser
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miserable experience on AA133 from Dublin to Dallas/Fort Worth on Sunday, June 9, 2019. My fiancé and I sat in front of a2 year old who kicked our seats and screamed for 6 of the 8 hour flight. We were very sympathetic to the mother of the child and asked crew to move to a wide open row toward back of plane but were told it was blocked for them to rest. I understand that particular aircraft has a separate designated crew rest area. Why would they also block an entire row? This is but one cause of my eroding confidence in our future travel with AA. On our way to Europe on the flight from DFW to New Orleans on AA (BA5269) May 23,2019, our AA flight attendant appeared angry and spoke to flyers as little as possible. She was abrupt and outright irritated when I asked for water during normal service times. Contrast this is the cabin service we received on BA and then Aegean in Europe and it provided a strong reason to look elsewhere when flying. Upon return, I sent a message via twitter and AA’s response was outright dismissive. After asking around to frequent business travelers, I was told AA has the reputation of terrible customer service. I’m now actively avoiding AA.

Name: Matthew Lynn
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Boston. American Airlines has the worst customer service I’ve ever experienced. I’ve had issues flying with them before but never anything bad enough to write a review. My flight was delayed and I was reassured that all flights from DFW were also on hold. I arrive at the gate only to find that the plane has actually left early!! Not to mention the gate had changed without notice! I tried to remain calm as this was my first missed flight ever but the gate attendants were unbelievably cruel to me in my panic. They hatefully pointed me toward the customer service area and I waited in line there for a little over an hour and I was simply given another flight  standby with more rudeness from the attendant because I had questions she couldn’t answer. I personally will never fly AA again but good luck!

Name: Alexander Booth
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Miami to Nashville. I have always had a terrible experience with American Airlines. My wife has been asked to give up her seat and be left behind while we were already sitting in 2015. I am currently writing this review while waiting on a flight that has been delayed 5 different times and have been sitting here for 4 hours on a 45 minute layover. They gave us some free crackers to apologize. I have had a pleasant experience a time or two, but unfortunately this seems to be par for the course for those of us that give this airline second chances.

Name: Neil Jeram
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | This was a flight from Dallas to London as part of a Sydney-Dallas-London-Sydney trip on One World. AA have lifted their game (in my opinion) and the flight was smooth, on time and totally uneventful. The IFE is really great so made use of it a lot. The FA's are best described as courteous but not warm. Swift in getting things served up for the overnight leg and then retired not to be seen again. No matter. Had eaten in the lounge so did not eat anything on board which looked pretty much regulation fare. Comfort wise it was OK and decent leg room for an economy cabin. AA get a bad rap but here is a big shout out for them in all regards from check in through to getting off the plane.

Name: Morgan Pettit
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I’ve never been more upset and disappointed in an airline. Ever. I’m a regular flyer but this is my first time flying American. They didn’t have great reviews but I thought, hey, this is a straightforward flight in the middle of the summer. Nope! I was delayed at SLC due to something in Chicago that passed in 15 minutes but delayed us for an hour and a half. I missed my connecting flight by 10 minutes. The girls and the counter had no idea what was going on or how to help me and the flight attendant when I got on the plane was absolutely clueless too and told me to call customer service? In the air or? It was a small flight (less than 20 people), they could have held the plane or at least tried. When I got to Chicago, they told me they couldn’t put me up for the night and to use a hotel discount. The discount was available / didn’t work and I was on hold for 30 minutes before I just got my own hotel! Then, in the morning, I finally board my plane and am headed to my destination. 20 minutes of sitting on the plane later the captain gets on the speaker and says the plane has maintenance issues and we have to get off and wait another hour and a half for a different plane! The front desk and flight attendants didn’t even know what was going on. I go home every 3 years and had an extremely important family event to attend, and missed it completely. I’m so upset at American. This flight was very expensive and I paid readily so I could get home on time. Shame on you for not giving any cares about the actual people who try to support your flights.
route: Salt Lake City to Central Wisconsin via Chicago

Review_Heading: "do not intend to fly them again"
Name: H Marsen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I don't normally leave reviews, but my experience was so awful that I felt compelled to write something. I had a flight leaving from Toronto to Richmond, for which I had no checked luggage. I was unable to check in online and had to do so at the Airport. I got to the Airport with 45 minutes left before check in closed and tried to use my passport on the self serve kiosk, which took forever to process and kept giving me an error. I tried a few more times and kept getting an error before one of the attendants said i should go to the desk for processing. I had to wait in line for what seemed like an eternity and once I got to the desk I was told that final check in time had passed and I could not board. I was shocked, and explained to the staff that I was here before check in time and had tried to use the terminals and was eventually sent into the line, and that normally my passport works at the kiosk, so this was my first time with any such issue. I asked if there is anyway that an exception can be made, I still have 45minutes before the flight boards and I need to make my flight, it was not fair that I cant board when I was here before check in time. The attendant was unsympathetic and very rude and basically said no there is nothing we can do, you're supposed to be here 3 hours before your flight and its too late to board as per her discussion with her manager. They told me I can rebook but it would cost me $800 to leave the next day but that all they can do. I had to rebook myself on another airline, but the only silver lining here was I did request and receive a refund from American Airlines for my missed flight. However, I do not intend to fly with them again anytime soon.

Name: Lovonda McClinton
Review: Not Verified |  I have never been treated so rude in my life. My family flew into Lake Charles Louisiana for a family reunion on August 9th and we were scheduled to fly out of Lake Charles on August 11th at 4:25pm. We were lost and ended up getting to the airport at 4pm. There was no line and no wait being that it was a small airport. There was no attendant at the check in station. I immediately ran to security to get help as they had not started boarding our flight. The security guard came and informed us to go back downstairs to check in and that they would send someone to help us. They deliberately waited until the plane left to come help us. The attendant was very rude and told us we had cheap tickets and we would not be able to rebook them. She showed no sympathy or compassion. The attendants at United were more helpful than she was. I called the customer service line and the supervisor told us that we could not get a refund. My family including my 85 year old grandmother in a wheelchair now have to rent a car and drive all the way to Atlanta because there was no more available flights leaving Lake Charles for 2 days. I feel that the situation was handled poorly and that we were treated unfair.

Name: E Nagaka
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  My flight was cancelled and I was only notified at the airport at self check in. I was rebooked for the following day and got a very insensitive attitude from the American Airlines customer service. Not an airline I will recommend based on customer care.

Name: J Hardester
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Athens to St. Louis via Chicago. American canceled our flight with about 6 hours' notice. The representative put us on another flight, but she failed to secure our tickets and within about 30 minutes, that flight was oversold. Another American rep put us on a different flight through Tel Aviv, JFK, Charlotte and finally St. Louis. However, she also failed to tell us there was absolutely no way the connection at Tel Aviv to JFK would be possible with the timeframe. We ended up (thankfully with about 11 others from the same flight) stuck with Israeli airport security overnight - who were not at all interested in providing any assistance. We finally were able to get on the phone again with yet another American representative who got us on another flight (all economy - when we paid extra for premium economy) to the states. We ended up spending 48 hours in airports - all to come back and find American isn't the least bit interested in providing any sort of customer service to try to make things better. Not good business at all.
route: Athens to St. Louis via Chicago

Name: E Neale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Miami. Truly the worst airline. They don’t care if you have to change a flight (just buy a new ticket duh). There alre always delays. It’s not a friendly atmosphere and the flight attendants always look miserable. I always dread flying with them. I fly SW whenever possible. AA, time to consider your customers. Getting too big for your britches.

Name: S Heane
Review:
✅ Trip Verified |  
Phoenix to Sacramento. On our original flight to our destination our plane was switched gates six times and it was delayed 4+ times and resulted in us missing our connection flight and our cruise. On our flight home our gate was switched another 3 times to completely different terminals across the airport and delayed two hours. It was the worst experience we ever had, will definitely NOT be flying American Airlines again.

Name: I Kasuji
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Honolulu to Los Angeles. We had a flight canceled and they rebooked us on the next mornings flight and gave us a hotel, meal vouchers, and taxi cab to and from the airport. It was a really nice hotel too.

Name: M Paige
Review: Not Verified |  I've never been a big fan of AA, but after my most recent experience I'm absolutely disheartening and disgusted. For those that don't know, the company policy is to shut off the boarding system 30 minutes before take-off. I usually fly out of a small town airport, so it doesn't take me long to get through TSA and boarded... So I got a lovely surprise when I couldn't get on the plane. Apparently, I was just cut off by a couple of minutes. And instead of helping me reschedule my flight (even to another day), the lady had to put me on standby (another company policy for 'missed flights') - so I wasn't even ever guaranteed any flight and had to sit in the airport for hours waiting, continually going back to the desk to get a new standby ticket for a new flight. This policy is not okay. Plane tickets are expensive and people's time is priceless. In addition, when all the hullababo was over, I still could have gotten through TSA in time to get on the flight. That was the most heartbreaking part. In addition, the woman next to me was also late, and the clerk at the desk was absolutely rude to her. He spoke in a very condescending tone of voice. He said things like: "you missed the same flight yesterday," "I guess it just wasn't meant to be then," and "you need to understand that you should be at the airport ready for your flight two hours before!" (Note: usually I agree with this advise-- but not in a rude way like the clerk said it or for a very small airport like Bangor!). I get it, it's not an easy job and people are annoying-- I have worked in service, too! But if you can't handle people without being mean, find another job! It was super uncomfortable being next to her and having to listen to his rudeness - imagine how she feels! Rude service, bad policy, and a generally uncomfortable flying experience. It's with the extra money for Delta. Treat yourself and avoid the hastle!
route: Bangor to Philadelphia via Los Angeles

Name: Kelly Gardner
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Harrisburg to Albuquerque. Extremely rude from check in to flight attendant. I just want to go back to Southwest. I have to take 2 more planes on this airline before I get home and I’m dreading it. A nice word or a smile goes a long way. These people don’t care.

Name: C Larson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  This is the worst experience I have ever had flying, hands down the worst. I arrived at LaGuardia in NY at 7 am and had a connector flight to Richmond, VA. 30 minutes before boarding they came over intercom and said that the flight was completely cancelled, not delayed but completely cancelled. The reason, because the had to much air traffic i.e. they overbooked. They put me on next flight, at 9 pm. I asked for other options and they give no one options. They were very unprofessional throughout the whole process, laughing and joking with each other. When asked for a meal ticket they were reluctant to even give me that even though it was there fault that they were over booked. This happens apparently 4 times a week on this connection alone and yet American continues to screw people over with no remorse. One of the customers had to get his 10 year old son to doctor in Richmond and they still didnt make accommodations for him. Now it is 9 pm and we were supposed to board at 8:45 pm but low and behold it is late and wont be here until 9:36 pm. This airline is pure trash and I dont recommend.  I hope the upper management reads this and strongly looks at how they choose to operate their business and not continue to screw people over. I will never ever never ever use their airline and I hope that jobs are lost over this post.

Name: Ryu Taggart
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  This was the worst airline ever. They change my times eight times at least before we got to get on our flight in one day. When we finally got on our flight the plane was sitting there for at least 30 minutes. They said it was due to weather but the weather was up north and the airport was still clear. I had a connecting flight in Chicago and the Chicago plane was with American Airlines again and they were an hour late so my new time to fly was 9:02 and we arrived at 9:20 and I saw my flight still at the gate but they wouldn’t let me in because they close the gate. They told me that I can reschedule to tomorrow since it was too late at night. They wouldn’t pay for a hotel or they wouldn’t even pay for a little bit for food. They didn’t even apologize or anything they just told me that it wasn’t their fault. It was not a good customer service and i was really disappointed.

Name: Kathy Le
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Seoul to Dallas Fort Worth. I contacted the customer relation and been emailing back and forth with them regarding the situation that my family and I had came across on July 30,2019. All we get back in response was an apologize and a reply kept saying thank you for our feedback and they will use this feedback to improve. I am very disappointed with AA. When we arrived at ICN airport from Vietnam, we were greeted by ICN staff at our gate as we landed. The staff helped all the passenger that is flying to Dallas on the flight AA0280 to get to the gate as soon as possible so we wouldn’t be late for our departure. There was 29-39 of us running across every terminals along with the staff trying to rush. The staff even called AA staff from the gate to let them know we’re on the way. As we arrived at the gate with AA0280, there was about 25 more minutes to departure but AA refused to let anyone from our flight onto AA. Their reasoning was unacceptable! They said we’re late and we have no document from our previous flight stating why we were late. There was other individuals passenger from a different flight was still able to get on board with AA. They allowed those individuals but not anyone from flight KE0686. We were not late for our flight with AA and their gate was still open. We were treated unfairly and their reasoning was unacceptable. My family and I brought our tickets with AA with a reserved seats. They had no reason to refuse to let us on unless they gave up our seating without our permission. AA is known for overbooking passengers on their flight.  The flight we brought is from Korean to Dallas but they exchanged our ticket from Korea to San Francisco to Dallas. We had to recheck all our luggage again at San Francisco. All the trouble they put us through was not right. We did not brought our ticket to go through all this trouble. We were suppose to work that morning that we arrived on 7/31/19 but because we were so overwhelmed and exhausted from all the trouble that AA put us through we were not able to make it to work. AA is not taking responsible for their wrong. They said our flight was late, which it was not late for AA. If we were late, why are other passengers able to get on 10 minutes after us? Something doesn’t sound right. “Under the federal rules, passenger is entitled to cash compensation, not just a voucher, and a seat for a later on flight. According to U.S, we have laws that they are forced to pay those.”  I tried to explained to AA but they refused to take action for their wrongs. I even attached a video clip of almost all the people that kept behind that was on the same flight as my family and I. On behalf of my family and I and also 29-39 other passengers, AA need to be responsible for this. This is their fault for either overbooking or giving up our seats. I will contact the head leader of AA as well. We will not be flying with AA anymore after this situation. It’s unacceptable!

Review_Heading: "I will never fly with them again"
Name: L Cariges
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  While on my connecting flight from Dallas Forth Worth to McAllen my flight was delayed multiple times then completely canceled without an explanation. I went to customer service and was put on a stand by list with 44 other people, which is ridiculous! How can they allow that many people on a stand by list. Long story short I was not allowed to get on that flight either and end up spending the night at the airport trying to figure out a way home. Eventually I was allowed to board on a flight to another city close to home at around midnight, but the situation and customer service was ridiculous. I will never fly with them again.

Name: Carla Martinez
Review: Not Verified |  San Antonio to Phoenix. I am a disabled vet with PTSD. I was willing to pay extra when I checked in to make sure we had our seats together. I have horrible anxiety the person who helped me said it was not necessary that it would be taken care of at the gate. At the gate I was told sorry can't do nothing. Additionally they over booked the flight and we volunteer to be rebooked on another flight and still would not seat us together.

Name: Daniel Pinney
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  LaGuardia to Richmond. Just flew in from Japan, 10 hour layover just to have my flight canceled 1 hour before take off because this sorry excuse of a company knowingly overbooked / oversold tickets and openly admitted it. The most un-professional/unorganized company I’ve ever felt with. Are kids running this place? Is this a joke? I don’t care if I have to pay $500 extra dollars for a ticket with another airline I will never use this company again.

Name: David Frazier
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Ft Lauderdale to Augusta via Charlotte. Booking my flight was so easy. I talk to Jermaine on the phone with customer service and he made booking my flight with my voucher very easily! He made me feel like I was talking to a friend on the phone. He had great customer service skills.
route: Ft Lauderdale to Augusta via Charlotte

Name: C  Mabilwe
Review:
✅ Trip Verified |  
Mexico City to Los Angeles. American Airlines has charged my credit card twice for services that I never received. In early 2018, I was charged $96.12 to upgrade my mother’s seat on a flight. However, on that flight, AA did not upgrade her seat.  Recently in July 2019, the same thing happened. I tried to upgrade my mother’s and my seat on an international trip, a birthday gift to my dear mother. For some reason, they upgraded mine but not my mother’s. It was a huge inconvenience for my 89 year old mother and me to seat separately for the 5 hour flight (on the upside, they let my mother have the upgrade while I sat in economy). A couple weeks later, I happened to check my credit card account and saw that AA had assessed two charges of $200.20 each, even though they only upgraded my ticket and not my mother’s.  When I mentioned my fear of being overcharged based on my previous experience, the airport representative who helped check us in assured me that I would not be charged for the upgrade that was not allowed. Also, I was only given a receipt for one upgrade of $200.20. On both occasions, I only discovered the inappropriate charges weeks later while checking my credit card statements (which I honestly don’t do often but must try to from now on). If I had not discovered the charges, AA would probably not have reimbursed me! Second, AA did not have the courtesy to issue any apology whatsoever on either occasion for the overcharge! AA’s conduct is an unacceptable business practice and should be looked into. I don’t consider my experiences to be isolated incidents. Once my points are used up, I will not fly with AA.

Name: Elle Geare
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Burlington. Terrible. Multiple delays. Bounced us back from different terminals all day. No updates provided to us. The airline representatives are cranky and annoyed. This is the most terrible airline in existence. The only reason I fly is because it is a hub airport for where I live.

Name: MM Madany
Review: Not Verified |  Toronto to Charlotte. I don’t know what is going on with this airline. They have no minimum respect at all to their customers. This was my first and last time to fly with it, my flight was supposed to be at 7:30 am, I received more than 6 flight delay emails and at the end the flight was cancelled.

Name: Tara Tjepkema
Review: Not Verified |  On the way home (July 29, 2019), our ticket said boarding at 6:44pm. We were sitting at the gate next to the boarding gate (no room left for sitting in our gate). There were zero calls about the flight heard over the entire airport (later verified when we did get to go home, the attendants were calling out flight numbers but they were only heard in the gate area). We went to the gate at 6:35pm and were not spoken to until 6:37pm when the attendant informed us we could not board our plane as it was closed 10 minutes prior to departure. I asked when departure was and she said 6:54pm. So, it was 17 minutes prior to departure. Then she said, well it is international so we board 15 minutes early. Ok, well our ticket said 6:44pm which was 10 minutes, she said 15 minutes which would have been 6:39pm. Either way, we were there 'on time' and were not given any explanation as to why and our 'new' flight was not until the next day. First, this is unacceptable. The fact is we were on time. Second, the attendant was extremely rude. Third, it is your fault we were not on board and we had to find our own accommodations because of your mistake. Fourth, we were not able to have our luggage. So no medications, clothes or toiletries and stay another night. For these reasons I would not recommend booking a flight with American Airlines ever. Also, when we were trying to figure out a place to stay, some other folks came and shared similar bad experiences and recommended to never fly AA again. Lastly, we are frequent flyers and know many more.

Name: Steven Weinel
Review: Not Verified |  Charlotte to St. Thomas. I was to board with group nine, yet after boarding group seven, no other groups were called. This flight had been delayed already, so I waited a minute, then went to the counter at the gate to ask when I would be boarding. I was told that the plane was full and given a ticket for the next day. I went to the counter the next day and the rude agent said that I was not in the system and that there was no way what happened to me happened. I was given a standby ticket, despite having a seat before. I will never fly American again.

Name: Patrick Finney
Review: Not Verified |  San Francisco to Oklahoma City. American Airlines doesn't value their customers and I will never fly with them again. We had a 45 minute wait between connecting flights but that was altered due to late departure, late arrival, and a customer who had a medical emergency. We missed our connecting flight due to these circumstances which are out of my control. The airline had the opportunity to hold up our connecting flight which Delta did for customers when we flew earlier in the week, but did not. I waited in line with approximately 30 unhappy customers who shared similar horror stories to mine. I also love the fact that Delta allows military to board early while American does not. I will fly Southwest and Delta from now on.

Name: J Patten
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I was less than thrilled to have spent $300 for an unaccompanied minor ticket for my 14 year old, 6’1, 200 lb son who has a cell phone to call me if he encounters a problem. Instead he was treated like a baby being made to wear a lanyard around his neck and a hospital type plastic wristband. I had to call an agent to purchase the ticket, but at no point during that conversation was it explained to me that he was I had to wait until the flight took off, so I left as soon as he boarded the plane. I was then chased down by the rudest employee who proceeded to yell at me. When I asked what his name was, he would only tell me Frank and said he was the manager, but refused to give me his last name. I am so glad I was forced to pay double the cost of a normal flight, only to not be informed about staying an extra hour and then be treated like a criminal for trying to get back to the rest of my family. American Airlines, I think I am capable of making the decision as to whether or not I think my child needs your services, which were really, my services.

Name: S Cole
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Salt Lake City. In 4 flights with them this week, we waited for the pilots on all of them, each flight we had major waiting. We missed our connection because we sat on the plane for 1+ hour after we left. Will never fly again on them. I have never been treated so poorly by a company.
route: Dallas Ft Worth to Salt Lake City

Name: P Rasena
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Los Angeles to Miami. The ticket agents at gate 50A for flight AA1268 we’re extremely rude and unfair in regards to our carry on luggage. She ask to put our luggage in the luggage size verification to see if it fits and it fit perfectly! Nothing was hanging out but she said because it looks too tight in the cage it’s not the legal size and forced us to check our carry on in. We watched all these other carry on bags bigger than ours go bye without them being stopped, I feel like we were being discriminated because we were the only ones being singled out for our carry on size. We’ve flown with this carry on 1000x and never had issues. This is the last time I will ever fly American Airlines. And the more I recall it, almost all my AA flight experiences have been horrific.

Name: Bruno Garcia
Review: Not Verified |  Every time I fly with American Airlines I have a problem. Especially if I fly through Chicago O’Hare Airport. This time what happened was that the previous flight in my gate (to Atlanta) could not fly their plane. So, American Airlines decided that after nearly 24 hours of traveling from Spain, the flight going to Atlanta would take the plane going to Denver (at around 8-8:30 pm) and I would have to fly at 11:30 pm CDT and get to Denver at 2:30 pm MDT. Let’s just say it was not worth and I am neither going with American Airlines nor through Chicago O’Hare.

Name: M Parton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Richmond to Denver. We got the run around for hours. Never made it to our destination. It took 14 hours to get them to finally get them to get us a return flight home. We got told several things and hand to hassle to get the right answer and help. Never again would I put my family on American.

Name: Troy Snyder
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Philadelphia. Took a chance on this airline even after all the issues families and friends have had. Had no trouble from PHL-MIA. Trying to fly home flight was delayed 3 times and we are still waiting for a plane. Never flying this airline again.

Name: M Cardenas
Review: Not Verified |  San Francisco to Phoenix. First of all, the service here was absolutely horrible. The woman checking my luggage was probably the most disrespectful person we encountered and I wish  I had gotten her name to report her. Absolutely rude, completely out of line, and knows nothing  about good customer service. When we got in line no one informed us of the first line we had to go through first, so after waiting in such a huge line, we were then rudely that we had to go back into the other line. They acted like it was our fault! Not only that but there were about 3 people working so you can imagine for yourself how long the line was for help on a weekend flight in San Francisco. Second, our flight was delayed before we had even gotten to the airport! We found out about it the morning of and we ourselves had to go and find a new flight! They completely expected us to miss our own flight that they were in charge of booking. Not only that it was a 3 hour delay which made us late to picking up our dog at the vet, so we had to pay for an extra night all thanks to the worst  airline our family has ever flown with. 110% do not recommend!

Name: Marywade Brewer
Review: Not Verified |  First of all, I should state I was flying stand by. The whole way over to the airport there were 13 seats open in first class. We got to the airport and (not to mention) we were the first stand by people to check in. I guess it’s understandable we didn’t get first. Anyways, we start boarding the plane. May I add I’ve only flown Delta international never American. So, we board the plane and sit down in main cabin. I notice something weird. Huh there’s no movies screens. I shrugged it off and got my charger out. I was going to charge my phone but there weren’t any! I was kinda getting annoyed by this point cause there was already no inflight entertainment for the main cabin except using the app. But how are you supposed to do that if you don’t have chargers?! I took out the pillows and blankets. The blankets are expected to be the scratchy fabric. But the pillows shouldn’t even be called pillows! They are so flat and tiny, they provide no support. American only knows how to treat first class. We need to get what we paid for! Make our money worth it! I will never fly American internationally again.

Name: Anna Campanella
Review: Not Verified |  New York JFK to Dallas Ft Worth. This was the worst flight I ever took. They say to arrive at the airport 2 hours early which we did. I received an email at 3:59 that it was on time. Then I got an email at 4:59 that the flight was being delayed 5 hours. I was already checked in so that email didn’t help me. We sat in the airport for 7 hours with no explanation as to why this was happening. I will never fly American again.
route: New York JFK to Dallas Ft Worth

Name: Eileen Ramos
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Orlando to Charlotte. I’m in flight AA677 supposed to leave at 5:12pm, now it is 9:20 we’re inside the plane since 7pm, and we still here at the gate. Worst airline ever, this is my second bad - I mean really bad experience with this airline

Name: Carrie Pedrin
Review: Not Verified |  Dukuth to Charlotte via Chicago. This flight was an absolute joke. Flight 583 started off with mechanical issues and 1 hour delay in Duluth. Then got to Chicago, otw to Charlotte when 25 minutes away we hover because of storms. After a 90 minute delay we are diverted to Raleigh. This is a 2.5 hour drive from Charlotte. We arrive on the tarmac and sit there from 8:20 to 9:42. When finally allowed off the plane no one updates us till 1:22am and they had no pilot to fly back to Charlotte. I was flying due to my father having a stroke to start with, this was the flight back home after seeing him. My husband could of picked me up and driven back to Charlotte in the time we never got any updates. Instead he and our children had no idea when I would be home. I am writing this as I am just now getting on the plane to Charlotte, but told my husband to wait until we actually get in the air before heading to Charlotte Airport to pick me up. They have horrible customer service, never let us know anything, and finally over 90 minute wait on the phone to talk to anyone about the flight. I would hope that everyone on this flight gets a refund because it was not worth a penny.

Name: Eileen Ramos
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Orlando. A horrible experience, after waiting so long since 9:15 pm that the flight is supposed to leave on July 28, 2019. After we left late, waiting on the runway and waiting to take off we had to return to the gate because an indication came out that something happened on the right side of the plane. We were in that period of time more than 30 minutes inside the plane mounted waiting for them to say what was going to happened, they offered nothing during the wait inside the plane not even water. They decided that we should get off because they couldn't fix the plane, that they would be providing another plane for that flight. We got off and around 12 midnight they told us that the flight was canceled. They gave us nothing no voucher to eat or hotel, and on the flight that they accommodated us to leave it was the other day July 29 at 11am all those hours around 24 hours my husband and I had to stay at the airport without sleep waiting there until the time for our flight. I do not recommend this airline at all.

Name: Jeffrey Lanahan
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Manaus to Washington  via Miami. What a totally incompetent worthless company. Worse than spirit. Terrible booking system, terrible customer service. Poor  in flight food. We overpaid for a flight to get home to DC from Manaus at the time stated on our ticket. I had some meetings scheduled, had my dog to pick up from the kennel, among other life circumstances to be taken seriously by me, but not by American Airlines. Connecting flight was a mere 10 minutes late. Bags took forever to come out onto the carousel. All this and we still arrived at security to re check our bags with 25-30 minutes left before our next flight. But nope, they told us they cant allow us to go because our bags need to be checked 45 minutes prior to the flight, so they forced us to go on standy  all day long. Excuse me but we are here and the flight hasnt left yet and ive been in this situation before with other airlines and have been allowed to go through, or put on another flight with another airline, or been vouchers for food and other things. That is the LEAST that could be done given i paid money to arrive home at a given time and did everything i was supposed to do and am now effed because of other peoples incompetence. But nope they said all they can do is put me on standby and offered some chips and soda to supposedly make up for ruining my day and costing me literally hundreds of dollars. Thanks for nothing you worthless people.

Name: Roshele Ward
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Las Vegas. Our flight times and gate number changed 11 times. We were to depart at 10:28 pm, we left at 01:45 am. With so many inconveniences, it should have been a free flight. Once on board we waited another 20 minutes for a manual to be delivered, I didn’t think that I would make it home today!

Name: Tusmia Aditi
Review: Not Verified |  On Tuesday, July 30, 2019 around 1 PM my family and I went to the bag check in and immediately the woman working there was being rude because she couldn’t find our names in the system. Eventually it was revealed that they changed our flight without notifying us. At first she says our tickets are non refundable but, eventually (about 30 mins later) her supervisor told her to fix the mistake and we finally moved on to the security check and then went to our gate. After about an hour and a half, our flight was delayed and then 20 minutes later it was CANCELLED. We had to get in line to rebook our flight but, almost immediately the flights leaving that night were all booked. We decided to stay on standby for the last flight that night but, of course that also didn’t work out. We asked to be put on the next flight out which would be @ 8 AM and they said we would be put on standby even though there were enough seats available on that flight. My father started insisting that they have to confirm our seats because we did not want to go through the stress of being standby again. Again, the customer service was absolutely horrible and a supervisor had to come in to make sure we got what we wanted. We left LGA that night at 10:30 PM. Mind you we didn’t get our checked in luggage back because they were all sent to ATL so we didn’t have clothes or anything essential. Our next flight was around 9 AM so we got to the airport around 6 AM. Nothing significant happened until it was time to start boarding. This lady took our tickets and said that everyone got a seat except my dad and he would not be allowed to board the plane. At this point I am so frustrated. We needed to get back home as soon as possible because we were traveling with my 92 year old grandfather. As soon as we asked how this could happen they lady at the desk is like “do not yell at me.” We didn’t yell at her but, she kept telling us to not yell so I eventually started yelling because this customer service was so so bad. I told her she needed to give my dad a seat right now and after a lot of arguing she did. We all got onto the plane and even the flight attendants were rude and acted like they didn’t really care.

Name: Ilya Greenberg
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Washington to Minneapolis St Paul. Delayed buy over an hour, speeded through check in and regular checks. Horrible service and no professional involvement.

Name: Jill Hed
Review: Not Verified |  Austin to Phoenix with American Airlines. Rudest people to deal with. On hold with customer service for 1 hour and put me on hold to check something and I was put on hold for another 45 minutes. Wouldn’t hold delayed flight for my son for 7 minutes. They basically told him to sleep on the concrete floor for 12 hours until he can get connecting flight. Would never fly with them and will tell anyone and everyone how rude they are!

Name: S Ma
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  This airline's ok, other than the food. I flew on the Boeing 787 from Los Angeles to Tokyo. The crew were not the most friendly, with most of them not greeting us. They didn't look neat and clean. I even overheard one of them ask their colleagues, "It's fried rice, right?" Like that's ridiculous. When the fried rice arrived, it didn't even taste like rice. I don't even know how to describe it. It was just disgusting. The entertainment was fantastic though, as American has most of their movies up to date.

Review_Heading: "told that they had no more flights"
Name: M Cooper
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Manchester to Philadelphia with American Airlines. So today I had a flight that was delayed, no biggie. But they kept delaying it and emailing me different updates then on the board at the airport by hours. At the end I would have missed my over 3 hour layover and missing the last flight of the day from Philadelphia to Akron. So they booked me a flight for tomorrow leaving at 9 am they told me. When I finally got back home and looked into my next day flight, it's a 5.09 pm flight tomorrow night not 9 am. I called and asked about it after a 40 wait and was told that they had no more flights for tomorrow and couldn't explain all the mixed up of the day not even one! So sad that a world-class company can even think of operating this way.

Name: Andrew Miller
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to San Francisco. I usually don’t write reviews but I had to on this flight. I am a former Marine, OIF & OIF Vet and I don’t do too well to confine places too long, but the flight crew Tim and Fay were outstanding and they really took care of me and my family. It was the best service I have had on a flight and I’ve had many. So thank you for your outstanding service and hospitality and it really makes a difference.

Name: Kevin Crane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I was supposed to fly out at 5 am on my way to Syracuse. 3.5 hours before the flight is scheduled to leave they cancel the flight because of mechanical issues. Are you kidding me? It's the first flight of the day and you couldn't get the maintenance done overnight? What kind of incompetent airline allows that to happen? I hadn't flown these guys in years because of poor customer service but they were the only ones who could get me to Syracuse at the necessary time. Needless to say I will never fly this airline again.

Name: E Baymer
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  El Paso to Dallas Ft Worth. This airline used to be great but lately it is worse than even the cheapest airline in the market. We flew American and experienced a delay that caused us to miss our connecting flights which in turn made us arrive 5 hours later than expected to our destination. Not only that but our flight just got delayed so much that it made us miss our connecting flight and now we are schedule to depart in 19 hours! As if it weren't enough their customer service was also terrible. You would expect that the least they could do was too book our next flight (19 hours later) with seats that would be next to each other but even that request wasn't granted! Terrible service and pathetic quality for an airline.
route: El Paso to Dallas Ft Worth

Review_Heading: "go on my cruise with no luggage"
Name: Hiywete Mulugeta
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I have flown with AA twice in the last 18 months and both times my luggage has been misplace. The first time I was luckily on my way home from miami so the impact was minimal. However the second time was when I was on my way to a cruise from Ronald Regan Airport to Miami international. I had to go on my cruise with no luggage and to add insult to injury I spent almost 14 hours in total during my vacation just sitting on hold trying to speak to someone so that I could know the whereabouts of my luggage. I was unable to attend multiple events on the cruise due to my lack of attire which absolutely ruined my vacation which I planned year in advance. I am back home and no one has reached out to me regarding my lost luggage. I think the worst part about this airline is there lack of responsiveness. I filed a complaint with customer relations I have also filed a claim for the details of my belongings and I have yet to receive a call or an email from anyone. When I speak to a representative they are quick to pass me along to the next person. They have no empathy nor do they have the proper customer service training that would of made this experience a little more bearable. American Airlines is right up there with Spirit and Frontier. Do not fly with them if you can avoid it, and if you can’t do not check your bag. Make sure you bring it as a carry on.

Name: Cristian Rodriguez
Review: Not Verified |  Paris to Los Angeles. Horrible experience. Took forever to get our luggage. Food was terrible. As an American first time flying with American Airlines and maybe the last. They also took so long to depart for no reason whatsoever.

Name: N Macelle
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Cusco to Grand Cayman via Lima / Miami. Awful. They lost my baggage. It's been 2 days and they have no idea where it is. Had the nerve to lecture me about packing a carry on for important items when I called to check on my claim?? Rude, incompetent and pathetic customer service.
route: Cusco to Grand Cayman via Lima / Miami

Name: Hannah Gilmore
Review: Not Verified |  San Antonio to Phoenix. The worst airline. It used to be something worth using, used to. I've flown American twice now in the last two months. My first flight, departure was only 15 minutes late, but the return flight was over a 4 hour delay due to "maintenance." A total nightmare when you have a child and planned naps. Not only that but they didn't try and offer any compensation for it. The second flight, most recent, the departure was over a 2 hour delay due to "bird strike" whatever the hell that is. And the return flight was over an hour delayed due to "maintenance." They left the plane off for about 30 minutes with everyone boarded! No AC and multiple babies on the plane sweating. It wasn't until several people complained that they did anything about it (turned on the air). I had hoped to give them a second chance but they suck.

Name: Austin Lindley
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Budapest via Philadelphia. After planning a once in a lifetime trip to Europe with my wife, American Airlines turned it into a nightmare from the start. Our first flight to Budapest was canceled and their solution was to send us to Paris 9 hours later (lost day #1) and then the next day to Vienna (lost day 2) Well, then there was. Huge ripple affect. The car we had reserved in Budapest was no longer an option, since we were no longer going there...so we had to rent in Vienna, twice the price since we did not have a reservation and they were out of cars. Oh, did I mention that our luggage still went to Budapest but no one could find it for 3 days. We had to drive to Budapest to get our own luggage (days 3,4,5 lost) we had other flights to Venice and then to Rome from Budapest all missed because of their canceled flight... this crazy story has many more chapters but Sadly the bottom line is. They "do not reimburse for all that we went through" they offered us 3 vouchers 275$ each, as some sort of apology. And after looking at prices that barley covers a one way flight by American! They only sent us one voucher, and now no one will respond to me. Only an automated email!! The word "American" means Much than they could ever measure up too. They need to rethink this patriotic name, or raise their game to represent all the Americans they serve. My wife and I are both teachers so this truly was a once in a lifetime trip and now we have to live with this nasty aftertaste left by a airline who shares our country's name, but can not live up to other major airlines let alone the nation they think they represent. Side note.... if we had the option to give up our seats at any time, I guess we would have gotten 500$ vouchers. Sad, lack of priority's. The whole thing is very sad.

Name: Cheryl Stevens
Review: Not Verified |  Phoenix to Vancouver. Charged 3 baggage charges of $70 which I thought would be covered when using my newly acquired credit card which I cancelled when I returned home. Then one of the bags was lost anyway. The Kiosks at the Phoenix airport were non-functional and the attendant was quite put-out when we asked for help. She had to use another kiosk to print out our baggage tags. Seats were very uncomfortable. In the future, I will fly any other airline available to avoid American!

Name: Cynthia Kiesel
Review: Not Verified |  Evansville to Houston. Awful, flight cancelled. Trying to get to MD Anderson to a family member with lymphoma. Wouldn’t refund or transfer my ticket. Agent was beyond rude and showed no compassion to the situation. Several other friends and family tried to fly American Airlines to stay with the the family member. Same thing. Flight cancellations/delays. We all said we’ll drive to Louisville or St. Louis and take Southwest Airlines.

Name: Bobby Assady
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Orange County via Dallas. American Airlines, worst customer service yet. They proud themselves of being the best airlines in the world yet they do not treat their customers the best. I missed my connecting flight because of weather conditions and the only flight they have back to my hometown is the next morning and they didn’t even offer accommodations for sleeping. Instead the customer service lady who is suppose to assist started fighting with us saying the other person before us have other circumstances that lead to free accommodations and we came from the same flight. Now my family and I stuck in this airport waiting for our flight next morning. We were supposed to be home tonight
route: Miami to Orange County via Dallas

Name: M Hales
Review: Not Verified |  Philadelphia to Orlando. I won't be booking with American again because of disrespectful customer service manager who lied to me several times, was sarcastically belittling my grievance, and offered no solution. I booked my family's vacation to this year on American because I wanted the assurance of picking a seat when my two daughters flew for the very first time. Specifically I passed up the cheaper tickets from several other airlines so that I could pick window seats for my daughters and my family could sit together with assigned seats. I booked 8 months ahead of the trip and paid for the specific fair where we could choose seats. A week before the first flight, I checked the app and to my surprise my family had been moved from 2 window seats for the girls and the 2 middle seats to 4 internal seats in the middle of the plane with no notification on both of our flights. I called to inquire and the initial agent reviewed the trip, acknowledged that no notification had been made, and that the original seats were now an additional $244 - but now came with free drinks for my 4 and 7 year old. The original agent was empathetic, admitted that there were plenty of open window seats, but offered no alternatives (aside from the up-charge) so I requested a manager. The manager offered no empathy (let alone an apology) and sarcastically suggested that the airline moved us because they "had it in for E & F seat passengers" - not humorous given the situation, and then he then repeated lied about the process, available seats, and lack of communication about the change. He even went to his go-to excuse that the original flight was on a 737MAX that was grounded but, the original email clearly shows that the original flights were on an Airbus A321 and he couldn't even admit that he had made that up. Last month when American stranded me cross-country on a business trip and their solution was a flight home two days later, I spoke to empathetic agents that did their best. I had no complaints despite the fact that it cost me time and money where the solution involved me flying back to an airport several hours away from my destination to rent a car to finish the journey. A bad experience but no hard feelings for American. My current experience however shows that the employees do not value their passengers so I'd have to warn others to book with an airline that values your business.

Name: N Hankin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to San Juan. Words fail to convey the impressive level of incompetence that American Airlines bestows upon its “customers” each day. As United global services members, we travel frequently and are accustomed to a certain level of service ... however we have received better treatment from airlines such as Southwest. Their very creative employees revel in anticipation of finding new ways to mistreat passengers. Most other poor airlines are only capable of one or two blatant failures during any given flight. American Airlines, however, can deliver dissatisfaction from booking, through check in, boarding, meal service and disembarking the aircraft. They are a strong team dedicated to screwing up every part of your experience. My experience was so thorough, I didn’t believe I was experiencing reality any longer. It was so perfectly bad that it couldn’t be real. A Matrix-like experience only without Trinity wearing tight pants and flying helicopters.  I can truthfully say that myself, my family, and my entire company will be blacklisting this airline and I will encourage friends, acquaintances, and strangers alike to do the same.

Name: James Swartz
Review: Not Verified |  Harrisburg to Fargo. American Airlines changed my wife and my seat assignments without notifying us. I found this out after checking in and getting our e-boarding passes. I called customer service only to be told that after you are checked in there is nothing they can do. We will have to deal with it at the airport. Will never fly American again. Their customer service is horrible at best. The 844 number that comes up when you google American Airlines isn't even their number. They obviously are all about the money and not customer satisfaction.

Name: T West
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Boise to St. Lucia via Chicago and Miami. Never fly American Airlines! The absolute worst airline I have ever dealt with! I’m now stuck in Miami without my bag because they forced everyone to check carry on bags at the last minute and multiple people guaranteed me I would have it in Miami when I made it very clear I was here until tomorrow - absolutely nobody with American will help.
route: Boise to St. Lucia via Chicago and Miami

Name: Victoria Raynor
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Quito to Manchester via Miami / Philadelphia. Horrendous delays with little help and explanations. Previously reviewed my outgoing journey (all but 2 flights delayed), return journey was even worse. Only the first flight, UIO to MIA was roughly on time. Second flight (MIA to PHL) was 2 hours late (stuck sat on the runway and it took an hour and a half and repeated asking for staff to offer around water). Was worried I might miss my connection but predictably the third flight was also two and a half hours delayed. No in-flight entertainment unless you have the app downloaded on your device then you can watch on that (which they tell you once on board that you needed to download before boarding).
route: Quito to Manchester via Miami / Philadelphia

Name: Marie Thompson
Review: Not Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Orlando. On our last flight, we sat on an exit row, which gave us a bit more room. The fit was a bit tighter than I'd have liked, but that's the drawback of booking economy. What I want to actually review is the fact that they were super accommodating just this week as I tried to change my flight. I planned on heading out the week after but an unexpected death in the family changed my plans. The airline was willing to work with me to move up my travel date without any cancellation or other fees, as I'd originally booked under basic economy. There was a small upgrade fee, but nowhere near as much as we'd feared it would be. I'm just happy I get to go to the funeral and that they were able to work around various schedules to get me there.

Name: Bryan Pardoe
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Flying both in and out of country has been a nightmare that can only be attributed to American Airlines. I had 3 connecting flights with them, and only 1 has gone as it should. My first flight was delayed due to emergency on the runway, that’s fine, what isn’t fine is being pushes aside for a rebooking the day after and getting the worst customer service I have ever received in my life. Then, the flight the next day (they rebooked) they were delayed about 2 hours because their plane wasn’t loaded with oxygen tanks for the pilots and they had to go get them. Threw off all pickup timing and car rentals. To rewind, Dallas has some of the worst reps I’ve ever spoken to and push any question you have away, from hotel stay to rebooking, to make you call their website. Pretty much useless and immediately dismissive. I will call and try and work out something but this was my experience so far and I would hate for others to go through the same ordeal. Will update if anything changes.

Name: Danika Deva
Review: Not Verified |  Lynchburg to Dallas via Charlotte. This was my first time flying American and there were several concern and problems. I brought a medical device and they made me check and pay for my carry-on. When I arrived at baggage claim there was a text saying it was at the baggage service desk. When I got there, one person said it was lost and another said it came early at another terminal. After waiting to see if it came with my flight since there was confusion, I had to go to the other terminal. I asked it they could bring it to me as I have a bad back and they said no. All in all, I was not happy with this airline. And they made me check my medical device at the plane. They labeled it fragile and watched the man bounce it up the stairs to the plane.

Name: Utkal Kandala
Review: Not Verified |  My flight from Baltimore to Charlotte was delayed by 2 Hours and my return flight from CLT to BWI cancelled (Monday morning). I was supposed to go to work on Monday morning but missed because of flight cancellations and reschedule. I opened up a ticket with customer service to get a refund as I had to incur loss of pay. After few days I got a call from AA customer service, lady on the phone started conversation with a lie that my flight was delayed only for half hour when it delayed for more than 2 hours and didn't even mention about cancellation, on top of that she says she is doing me favor by adding 750 miles to my account. I am the one who suffered with the delay and AA customer representative says she is doing me favor. In total my whole journey is better stated as a bad experience, no value to customers, flight delays and frustration.

Name: Hayden A Marr
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Boston to Los Ángeles. This has been the worst airline experience of my life. American Airlines made me miss my National Soccer tournament and the customer service was absolutely horrible. The airline did not help or give any reassurance that I would be able to make my games on time and I did not make them thanks to their lack of support and failure to help me find a new flight.
