Never flying on American Airlines again and recommend other people read this and follow my steps. Thanks for nothing American Airlines you really know how to ruin someone’s day!

Name: Robert Garver
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Columbus to LaGuardia. Completely and utterly disappointed at the complete lack Of customer service interaction with American Airlines. Over the 4th of July my wife and I flew from Columbus, Ohio to LaGuardia like we do every year, non stop. The night before our fight is to leave our flight gets canceled. After spending over 3 hours straight on hold and still not a live person, we hung up after finding out we weren’t able to get on another flight to go home until the day after we were suppose to leave. Even though we booked non stop flights not only did they book us on connecting flights, but they had us flying out of Newark. Needless to say we ended up canceling our flight and renting a car to just drive home. Unfortunately it doesn’t end there. Now my wife is back in New York with our youngest son and stuck at the airport! She was suppose to fly out last night but the flight got canceled. So now after sitting on the runway, literally, cause they were told they’re waiting on pilots, before literally taking off they announce they’re having engine troubles. So now they’re heading back to the gate and she is going to have to try and arrange something for tomorrow now because like 2 weeks ago American booked her on a connecting flight instead of non stop and now she has missed her connecting flight. Who knows when she will be able to catch a single hour flight to come home, because American has treated this flight like she’s flying halfway around the world. Bottom line, there’s not a single person in this world that could GIVE my wife and I a free American Airlines ticket to anywhere in the world! Your customer service is by far the worst we’ve ever experienced!

Name: Kyle Clark
Review: Not Verified |  Tampa to Syracuse via Philadelphia. As I write this I am spending the night in Philadelphia's airport which is supposedly an American Airlines Hub. I flew from Tampa to Philly for a connection to Syracuse Thursday July 18th. My 9:52pm connection to Syracuse was cancelled at 3pm as I was walking into Tampa's airport due to "weather". I knew then I was going to have to drive to arrive in Syracuse for a Friday morning Funeral. What I didn't expect was a rude desk attendant at the gate and at customer service in a Philadelphia airport surrounded by a beautiful sunset - no apparent weather issues in sight. I spent over $250 on a one way car rental (and an hour trying to find a one way car rental) and drove the 5 hours to arrive in Syracuse at 2:30am. American Airlines booked me on the first flight to Syracuse Saturday the 20th at 3:20pm. Fast Forward to today, July 22nd and I am scheduled to leave Syracuse at 6:57pm, delay till 7:20 ... 7:31 take off. Preparing to run to my connecting gate but - no need - when we hit the ground I get notified my flight is delayed until 11:06pm. And then cancelled. I immediately call and am offered the first flight to Tampa 10:30 something am - nope wait can't have that one, its booked. The next I have available is 4:06pm! I asked if there was an any other flight to any Florida airport in the morning - no. Great, I am booked and get to spend the next 18 hours in an airport. I get on American's Website and find a 6am flight to Orlando and purchase - then call to have the associate fix this mess and she scolds me for booking the flight - saying I should have just called them for help. Wait - while I am going thru this mess my Mother is stuck overnight in O'Hare with a similar American Airlines epic-mess and has to go through the same thing. American will not reimburse the car I rented, they will not pay for me to have a hotel room tonight - there are "snacks and cots" available in the airport. Gone are the days of vouchers, this is all "God's will" and "weather related". Going forward I will pay twice as much for a plane ticket from another airline, I will never fly American Airlines again, if it is the only flight available I would rather rely on my good old fashioned feet to get me there faster then an American Airlines Plane.

Name: A Gardner
Review: Not Verified |  Bangor to Washington. Terrible customer service. Flight got cancelled, stayed another night in Maine, come to the airport at 4am for the flight to get delayed so badly that we missed our connecting. Had to get home for family emergency. Last year we flew American to Utah and had a connection in Dallas where our flight got cancelled. It was Christmas Eve. Our group divided and didn’t get home until Christmas Day. They cancel flights often and good customer service does not follow.

Name: Kimberly French
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  This has been my first ever experience with American Airlines and it was not a good one. My first leg of travel from Erie, PA (ERI) to Tampa, FL (TPA) via Charlotte, NC (CLT) was uneventful and smooth. I arrived on time with my baggage and was quite happy with the service of the agents, flight attendants and crew. My journey home was another matter. First let me begin by saying that I understand that the airline industry cannot control the weather. Mother Nature decided to throw a fit and cover TPA in thunderstorms and lightning for several hours causing the airport to close which resulted in my missing the connection in CLT to ERI. No worries. I contacted the gate agent who quickly re-booked me onto the first flight out from CLT to ERI the next morning at 11:30am. As I had arranged hotel accommodations in Charlotte, I inquired as to how I could retrieve my bags upon arrival in CLT. She told me to simply contact the gate agent upon arrival and my bags would be retrieved for me to take to the hotel. This is NOT what happened! Upon arriving at CLT, I did contact the gate agent about my bags and was instructed to go to the baggage claim area and speak to the agent in the baggage office. I did so. There were a few people in line ahead of me inquiring about the location of their missing bags and I could quickly see how one agent was doing everything in her power to locate them, while my agent seemed to feel that the passengers (including myself) were simply a nuisance to her existence. Without effort in actually locating my bags, she informed me that she had no idea where my bags might be and did little to attempt to locate them. A baggage handler in the office was looking over her shoulder at the computer screen, asked me if my flight had landed yet! then shrugged his shoulders like, “Oh well” When I told her that I had hotel accommodations and simply needed my bags retrieved from the plane I just de-boarded so that I had clean clothing and toiletries, she handed me a complimentary American Airlines toiletry bag (which is its own review). The following morning, I arrived at the airport at 9am, passed through TSA screening and arrived at my gate with time to spare. Our plane was boarded and all passengers and crew quickly assessed that the air conditioning wasn’t quite up to par. We were de-planed and told that the air conditioning would be fixed, or another plane would be provided. Our flight was now delayed. Approximately 2 hours later, we were again seated on the plane only to be told that, again, the air conditioning was not functioning correctly and the crew was “timed out”. Our flight was now cancelled. There was one more flight to ERI from CLT that day, but it was full. I was able to arrange for a seat on the next flight to Cleveland. This meant that I had to impose upon a relative to drive 2 hours to Cleveland and another 2 hours home. Upon arrival at the terminal for the flight to Cleveland, I quickly noticed the difference in accommodations for passenger travelling to Cleveland versus those for passengers travelling to Erie. The seats in the waiting area were more comfortable and were equipped with charging stations for personal electronics, while Erie passengers were seated in worn, cramped, and uncomfortable seats with smaller charging stations (with access for 6 devices) in the waiting area.

Name: Paige Evans
Review: Not Verified |  New York to Pittsburgh. Being a nervous flyer already, our Pilot was exceptional at LGA airport flight 4600 on July 21st. He cracked jokes as he prepared us to be sitting on the runway for quite some time, he updated us as status changed and throughout the flight. He was so down to earth and keeping us in the know helped calm my nerves very much !! He was the best pilot I've ever had. The seats were great and comfortable, I was overall very pleased.

Name: Jodi Mincemoyer
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Norfolk to Phoenix via Charlotte. Check in at Norfolk was easy. Staff were helpful. We do not usually expect much. Flights loaded easily and departed on time. Service on board was efficient. We did order a sandwich and it was not very good. Seems like that shouldn't be that hard to do as the prepackaged foods in the airport can be quite good. Overall, everything was very smooth. The worst part was that we actually arrived in Phoenix early (!) but could not get to the gate because it was blocked by equipment.

Name: Megan Styron
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Weather delays, cancellations with no assistance with rebooking, cost more to book new flights, wasted food and beverage coupons, no concern with my safety or well-being by stranding me in the airport over night by myself, then more delays, missed flights, and total inconvenience of 14 hours and hundreds of dollars. Just in case you were wondering what American Airlines response to their terrible customer service on July 18 -19th. Please free the read and share. Be cautious when using them in the future ladies and gentlemen, they don't care about you. You are just another number.

Name: S Morgan
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Los Angeles to Kona. American Airlines has horrible service! My family and I flew to Kona Hawaii (flights 59, and 58). On the way there we were told that the flight had limited food items, and it would not be a sufficient amount to serve everyone. This was proven, as every item on the menu was not available. Also the flight attendants seemed bothered when asked for service/assistance. Once we arrived to Kona, we discovered that all of our new luggage was damaged (deep scrapes and scratches, and a thick black tar substance that would not wipe off). I was told that I would need to file a claim, which I did (including photos). I spoke to a supervisor in the baggage department of customer service. He asked that I reply to his email with photos for a second time. He stated that he would review the information and contact me with a resolution, of which he never did. I called to follow up with him, and was told that he was on another call and he'd call me right back. As of the writing of this review, he still has not followed up with me. On the flight home, it was the same issue, not enough food for everyone. They did not have any of the requested items on their menu. Furthermore, the plane was nasty and it appeared that they did not clean trash left from several previous customers. I would not recommend AA.

Name: B Carmen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New York to Atlanta via Washington. I was flying from NYC with 2 children, one of whom has severe eczema and mild allergies, and whose meds wasn't allowed in the carry on and thrown in to the trash by TSA. Our nightmare had began. So, I was on a deadline to get home in Atlanta. Then, the gate attendant informed us that there is no more space in the overhead bin that we have to check in our carry on. We touched down in DC under sunny skies with 40 minutes to make our connection flight and immediately the pilot announced that all outbound flights are grounded due to incoming inclement weather but no to worry about connections since everything is grounded. Meanwhile I have not any updates from AA trough text, Although we signed up for it. The nightmare got worse when a dozen passengers or so going to Atlanta were prevented from boarding the shuttle (a 2 minute bus ride) to the next concourse, where our flight was still waiting, due to adverse weather conditions. We were directed to customer service desk. What occurred there is a classic example of how AA employees treat customers with disdain and condescension. I was informed that I would be put on a flight for the next morning although my flight still on the ground. When I asked her if she could find alternate route for me to get home the same night, she sighed, rolled her eyes, and told me step aside since I didn't want to be helped. I was also informed that the airlines will not help with hotel or meals and that I and the kids were on our own. This is the 3rd time AA has done this me and one of those times I was in a foreign country. I've come to believe that these aren't isolated incidents but inherent to the way AA does business. As much as it is under my power, I will not fly with American Airlines.
route: New York to Atlanta via Washington

Name: D Gearen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Richmond to Salt Lake City via Chicago. I was to leave RIC at 0740 EST and arrive in ORD at 0853 CDT. Then from ORD at 1030 CDT with an arrival at 1223 MDT in SLC. Because of weather my flight to ORD was delayed. They automatically rebooked me because the delay was until 1228 EST. Which would have caused me to miss my original connection flight in ORD to SLC. They booked me to go to DFW. But, I wasn’t given a seat. I was told to talk to someone in ORD to get my seat. Then from DFW I was connecting there to finish up in SLC at 0032 MDT. Which was 12 hours later than the original final destination arrival time. Well I got to ORD to find out they canceled my flight to DFW. They rebooked me from ORD to SLC at 2045 CDT. With an arrival of 2230 MDT. I was delayed again. I finally left ORD at 2130 CDT and arrived in SLC at 0002 MDT. Just to find out my luggage was missing. Didn’t know where. They said they would call me when it is found. I understand weather is uncontrollable. However, American Airlines didn’t try to make me comfortable. I sat in the airport for over 12 hours not even knowing if I was going to get home. The gates kept changing. The flights kept changing. And, I was so lost. I was scared and upset. There was no communication except through email. Customer service was definitely not around. And, on flights pretzels and soft drinks are not acceptable as the only option. Especially when you know people have been shuffling around with no direction. Also, my seats were bad, the air didn’t flow, and it was extremely tight quarters. Old plane. Not fun!! Let’s just say, I did not enjoy my trip with American Airlines.
route: Richmond to Salt Lake City via Chicago

Name: M Edwards
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | New York to Cincinnati. All the time this airline has delays, today is 2 hours, I swear that this is the last time I use this garbage of airline. And the customer service is the worst - nobody knows anything.

Review_Heading: "not need to be treated this way"
Name: D Stanson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Salt Lake City to Oklahoma City via Dallas. In Dallas / Fort Worth airport: I had to check in my carry on because I was told there was no room in the overhead storage bins (they were all full). As the flight was preparing for take off, I noticed that four storage bins were completely empty. I was not happy. On my return trip, I had another layover at the Dallas/ Fort Worth airport. There was a problem with my ticket as I was trying to make my connecting flight. I told the person at the information booth upon leaving the airplane about my problem. She was impatient with me and told me to go to the boarding gate. I went to the gate as instructed with 36 minutes before boarding. There was no one at the booth. When I went to board with my problem ticket, the person checking tickets was irritated with me telling me I should have talked to someone before boarding. I was tired from the previous flight. I did not need to be treated this way.
route: Salt Lake City to Oklahoma City via Dallas

Name: Ken Johnson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Greenville to San Diego via Dallas. Worst experiences with this airline and i’m done with them if I can ever get off this tarmac. On my flight out here i had a one hour layover that turned into a 4hr layover. I didn’t end up to my hotel until close to 1am and had to get up for work 4hrs later. Now on my way back to San Diego I had a one hour layover again and i’ve been stuck on the plane on the tarmac for 2hrs with no end in sight. They told us at first we didn’t have pilots and then that we had a bad tire. They also oversold every plane I was getting on both ways and EVERY trip was delayed at least 30 mins just trying to get people to sell their seats. They offer a voucher for about $450 and just wait. If people don’t take it after 10-15mins they up they voucher offer. I seen this go on for 45mins. Did I talk about how I got my luggage back minus the handle i gave it to them with?
route: Greenville to San Diego via Dallas

Name: Nathan Creer
Review:
✅ Trip Verified |  
Salt Lake City to Orlando. I fly once a month or more for work. Occasional plans change and I change or cancel my reservation. I’ve never had a problem canceling and receiving a refund if I cancel it within 24 hours of when it was booked. I needed to cancel an American flight within 5 hours of booking they cancelled if just fine but then refused to process my refund. I was stunned I spent 2 hours trying to get ahold of someone but they refused to help me and best they were willing to do was rebook it. I’ve canceled well over 10 flights within the 24 hour window and this is the first time I’ve been given grief. Very frustrating. I would like to say I’ll never fly American again however sometimes it’s my only option. But I will say this they will be the last option for the indefinite future I’d even choose frontier and spirit over them.

Name: A Karelinos
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  On July 15th, flight #1835 C17 from Dallas to Las Vegas has been cancelled after delaying for 2 hours. We got passes for waiting list for gate C29 where all the unprofessional behavior started. The supervisor started yelling to us why we went there and we have to remain quiet without asking questions! Of course we have not been in the second flight and when we asked what is the next step, the supervisor of AA said that she will call the police! She said that she’s working for 12 years at the AA and no one will touch her for her behavior! Finally we left unhelpful from C29 and went back to C17 where an agent gave us new boarding pass for another flight after 3 hours. Total delay 6 hours. But the point is the unprofessional and unacceptable behavior of the supervisor who believes that she owns the company. I have never dealt with a worse customer service and worse employee in my life. What a disgrace for the company keeping people like her dealing with customers. Never again with AA we are family of 4.
route: Puerto Vallarta to Las Vegas via Dallas

Name: P Deane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Pittsburgh to Montego Bay via Charlotte. Cancelled , delayed flights rebooked not till days later return flight worse delays circling airport flew to Raleigh for fuel back to Charlotte to circle more landed sat for 20 minutes till gate disembark no food available, no customer service. We flew out of Jamaica at 12:30 pm arrived at Charlotte 8:00pm ( that’s 7 1/2 hours it’s a 3 1/2 hour flight) left Charlotte 10:00 pm arrived in Pittsburgh at 12:00 am . no customer service no food given to us the entire trip This trip took longer than it should have we traveled with a child. No excuses would not recommend American Airlines
route: Pittsburgh to Montego Bay via Charlotte

Name: Makayla Herdman
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Across 6 flights I had an issue every time! 1st flight: seat didn’t recline and tray table didn’t stay up 2nd flight: was charged for baggage twice and never refunded, was told the matter was closed and I would not be compensated 3rd flight: i booked these flights for someone else and they had to be changed. 36 hours, 4 phone calls and a visit to the help desk at the airport (was told to do that) saw me having to forfeit the total cost of the flights. Not one person wanted to help, they kept pointing me in another direction until it was impossible to change anything due to the time. 4th flight: what was meant to be a 90 minute flight was a delayed flight that had me sitting in the aircraft for 8hours! No food was available due to it being a ‘short haul’ flight. 5th flight: my partner had a direct flight from NY to Miami at 7:30 am, with no notice they changed it to a connecting flight to Atlanta at 2:30pm, this flight kept getting delayed and no one wanted to help him get to his destination without being stuck in Atlanta. He eventually got on a 7:30pm flight! 6th flight: the power point in my seat didn’t work. The response from ‘customer service’ is appalling! I was overcharged and treated badly.
route: Melbourne to Miami via LA /New Orleans

Name: R Marshall
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Washington to Charlotte. The customer service was disappointing. The customer rep from DCA to CLT was more interested in others conversation than to me, who was in front of her, talking to her. In addition, the look she gave me, was like I was bothering her, although I was paying for an upgraded seat.

Name: Karen LeBlanc
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Boston to Cancun via Philadelphia. American Airlines sent me a text at 5:45 pm on Saturday July 6th telling me my flight at 5:15 Boston to Philly was cancelled but the flight Philly to Cancun was not. They put me on hold for hours, missed my friend's wedding reception. We left from Boston and flew 6:30 and we would leave Miami at 3:15. That also got cancelled. We had an 11 hr lay over and not slept so we got a hotel to sleep for a while. We spoke with a pilot who was called in to fly another flight to Cancun and he looked into it and told us it was a crew issue. He said they did not have a crew to fly the plane. We got to the resort at 10:00pm and lost a whole day. American Airlines Customer service are telling me it was weather related and will not compensate us. I will never fly American again.

Name: V Raynor
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Manchester to Quito via Philadelphia / Miami. A 3-leg journey supposed to take 18 hours. First flight (MAN-PHL) ended up delayed by 2 hours as we had to return to gate to rearrange the luggage due to an issue with "centre of gravity". This meant I missed my connection in Philadelphia (and consequently all of my subsequent connections!). Airline staff were pleasant and organised me a hotel for the evening and replacement flights for the following day. PHL to MIA was very successful with the flight fulfilling my very basic requirement of travelling from one place to another relatively on time. Miami to Quito however was not so successful. It was announced 10 minutes prior to departure that there was going to be at least a 2 hour delay due to waiting for a replacement pilot! This time got gradually later and later. Finally arrived in Quito however at this point had missed my ongoing flight. As this had been booked separately from AA they offered no help for me to rearrange. Only positive about this airline is the really helpful flight attendants who I would commend. Nearly every review talks about delayed and cancelled flights - really take this into account, especially if you have transfers! Definitely worth paying a bit more to go with a more reliable airline in future.
route: Manchester to Quito via Philadelphia / Miami

Name: Jeremy Rodriguez
Review: Not Verified |  Atlanta to Dallas via Corpus Christi. The staff refused to help my partner and I with Hotel accommodations that ATL promised us to due to our delayed flight caused by mechanical errors. Told us we could camp out in the terminal until the next day and mentioned we could go online to find hotels without means of transportation. Finally spoke to someone from AA Customer Service who did, in fact, confirm that mechanical errors automatically provide paying customers with hotel accommodations. By the time we reached the phone agent, the staff literally left the premises and did not return to us and left two of her desk agents to help us out. What a sorry excuse of a Supervisor.
route: Atlanta to Dallas via Corpus Christi

Name: Al Stoddard
Review: Not Verified |  We booked flights in January 2019 to Fairbanks for June 23 and a return flight from Vancouver for July 7. In late January or early February 2019 the return flights were cancelled, likely due to the grounding of the 737 MAX planes. We got those flights re-booked and about three days later the departing flights were cancelled and also had to be re-booked. This made us very nervous. The new flight times, the connections and layovers were much worse than the originals but the seats were good. Very few options were offered so we took what we could get. A delay was encountered on June 23 in Chicago. No food was on board and our Seattle flight was delayed for an hour. Thanks to a Seattle layover this did not cause us to miss a flight. When we showed up at the gate in Vancouver on July 7 we were directed to a gate agent who offered another change to Greenville with connections through DFW that they said would be great and save us a connection, a long layover and nine hours. We jumped at the chance to get home early with the understanding that the flight was not overbooked. We were then directed to get seat assignment at the gate. The Vancouver to DFW seating was terrible (last row, 30 A/B). The Greenville seats had me in 30F and my wife in 21 F. Those were great seats. Not. We were deceived at the gate by a the agent and his supervisor. The Vancouver to Dallas AA 979 leg on the return of this flight boarded and was ready to take off when the flight crew again announced that they did not have enough food (best guess soft drinks) on-board. The flight was delayed for over one hour while the crew waited for the caterer. This delay almost made me miss my connection to Greenville SC. The flight attendants handed out soft drinks like candy. The rest room lines were long and disruptive. We have never been so glad to get off of a flight in our lives. After being asked the flight attendants reluctantly asked passengers whose destination was DFW to stay seated so those with tight connections could disembark. Some complied, others did not. WHAT is going on at American? They seem to have cheap flights but not much else. They claim to be the largest carrier in the world. They need to concentrate on customer service and satisfaction.

Name: Brandon Babcock
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Antonio to Dallas via Indianapolis. I don't like American Airlines. I have always found them to be rude and unhelpful. Checked in online before I got to the airport. Went to the rude ticked counter agent who told me I had to check in again. She refused to print a boarding pass. So I asked her what she was there to do. Apparently it was to put my bag on a conveyor belt. So whatever on that. Can't fix rude customer service people. I feel it in my heart that she had something to do with my bag getting lost. She had a spiteful attitude about her - if I pay 30.00 for my luggage I expect it to arrive with me intact. I left from San Antonio to Dallas. The gate where we landed was C11 and I was flying out of C10 to Indianapolis. 30+ minutes in between flights. I get to Indianapolis, no bag. I did receive a text from American saying that the bag was lost. I was not able to talk to a lost bag clerk because I had a shuttle waiting for me. I then go to the link in the text and start to fill out a claim-  link is not working. I call 30 minute wait time. I guess this is how American airlines likes to operate. I only flew them because the company I work for bought the tickets.
route: San Antonio to Dallas via Indianapolis

Name: SaraJane Aufrecht
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | We booked our honeymoon flight to Orlando with American Airlines and we were truly disappointed. The flight itself was not bad. However, seats are not assigned but rather purchased at ridiculous prices at check in. We forgot to check in 24 hours before our flight home and almost every seat was taken by the time we realized we hadn't checked in. Our only option to sit next to each other was in the emergency exit row and pay $81 each! If we didn't want to sit next to each other, we would have to pay $78. Why are we paying for a seat? Isn't that what the ticket was for? Checking in early allows you to pick a seat at $15-$20 but why were we "punished"? We will not be flying AA anytime soon.

Review_Heading: "AA representatives are extremely unhelpful and rude"
Name: R Crisafulli
Review: Not Verified |  Do not fly American Airlines! Our trip to and from Myrtle Beach was a disaster! They cancelled our flight home, we ended up having to spend the night in a hotel ($160 which we had to pay for) and flying to an airport two hours away from home. We then had to rent a car (another $165) and drive home. The AA representatives are extremely unhelpful and rude. I have flown other airlines and have never had an issue.

Name: S Vardel
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Kansas City to Charlotte. The flight was on time and soon as we are supposed to be boarding they pushed the boarding back 15 minutes talking about its a storm so they will let up know something at 5pm then text messages come to my phone saying departure is at 515 and then another came through shortly after with a departure time of 530. Once again shortly after that another message comes through saying that departure at 8pm then someone comes over the speaker stating that know there is maintenance issues and the flight is cancelled and we need to make are way to the outside counter to reschedule the flight because they was closing their counter. Rescheduled my flight for 12hrs later and they did not provide hotel or anything for the inconvenience if it was a maintenance issues as they stated. Definitely will not fly with them if i can help it.

Name: Cale Bryant
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Chicago. Never again will this airline get my business. Delayed 3x and then cancelled with NO help for accommodations from the very airline who caused the problem. NO weather problems. The return flight was delayed, bumped, and finally my seats were given to standby with the call center saying we were checked in and ready, and the counter agent saying another. Absolutely zero help in any way. Their solution? Sleep in the airport. With my kids?! I found another airline with the route we needed standing right there at the American check in counter. Will I see a penny of these cancelled and delayed flights? I doubt it, so as far as I'm concerned, this airline is run by thieves.

Name: H Malani
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Houston to Los Angeles. In Houston airport for 25 hours, they keep changing the depart time and no explanation. Not even once they explained whats going on, not even one of them asked if we need anything, its 10 of us and they keep delaying our flight.

Name: J Morton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  London to Columbus via New York. I landed into JFK on time. While waiting for my connecting flight to CMH, it was delayed twice, then cancelled. I was rebooked the following day and had to pay for my own hotel since it was claimed to be 'weather' despite the fact that other airlines did not cancel the same route. I woke at 3 AM for my rebooked 5:45 AM flight to find that it was cancelled as well and rebooked for 2 days after the original flight. I was forced to rent a car and drive 9 hours to Columbus, OH in order to make a very important appointment on Tuesday, July 9th when my flight was originally scheduled for Saturday, July 6th. I am ashamed that in the future, I will have to fly a foreign airline in order to ensure that I get where I need to go. I will not risk flying with American again. This event overshadowed the fact that the seat was uncomfortable, the cabin staff rude and the food disappointing. This was a truly horrible experience.
route: London to Columbus via New York

Name: E Maroles
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I will never buy a ticket again with AA! I don't care if I pay more but I will book with an airline that really cares for people. My husband (in the navy) made it to the USA for his birthday, but thank you to American Airlines we could not be together, my flight was cancelled. It is not just today! In the last 2 months, my flight was cancelled twice. Last time it was cancelled in Boston. I missed two days at work (but AA seems does not care ).

Review_Heading: "no one to help us reschedule our flights"
Name: Jilleen King
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Left Jackson, MS at 4.30pm and was scheduled to land at DFW with connecting flight to Burbank, CA. We got about 175 miles out of Dallas and were told there was a big thunder storm and we would have to circle. All departing flights were cancelled. After about 30 minutes, we were diverted to San Antonio for refueling. We sat on the tarmac for almost 2 hrs, were not allowed to deplane. The crew provided little or no information about other connections, but they were very clear that American Airlines would not cover overnight stay. We finally reached Dallas at 9.30pm. There was no one to help us reschedule our flights or help with hotel rooms and the ticketing counters were all closed. Passengers who checked their bags in the jetway (for no cost) were able to retrieve them. Those of us dummies who played by the rules and paid $30 to check a bag were told our luggage had to go all the way to the destination. I argued with an AA "Customer Service" agent in baggage that I needed the cpap machine in my bag, but she just quoted airline policy. I made my own hotel reservation, paid $50 for a taxi, repeated that the next morning, and flew back to Jackson, a flight I arranged on my own from my hotel room. No one from American Airlines tried to be helpful or provide any information, even to the poor young woman whose 1yr old baby was crying from hunger. Never again.
route: Jackson, MS to Burbank, CA via Dallas/Ft Worth

Name: Seneshaw Berhanu
Review: ❎ Not Verified | Myrtle Beach to Charlotte, via San Francisco, was delayed due to weather for about an hour and a half. So some genius decided to keep the connecting flight from Charlotte to San Fransisco in regular schedule despite connecting flight from Myrtle Beach to Charlotte was delayed. Instead of delaying the flight from Charlotte to San Fransisco to allow passengers to get to San Fransisco the same night, we were scheduled to catch the flight going out the next day. Now that's flight management.
route: Myrtle Beach to Charlotte, via San Francisco

Name: R Garminotta
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Flight from Charlottesville to New York. Starts with 2hrs delay, at the airport they notified other 2 hrs, 10 minutes before boarding time they canceled the flight! I lost my connection to Europe putting me in a lot of troubles and they didn't care at all. Staff rude and incompetent. They usually cancel flights without any notification. I will never fly with them again!

Name: Larry Block
Review: Not Verified |  On the morning of June 21st, I booked 2 tickets on my computer. I choose the date of June 23rd as our travel date. I clearly saw June 23rd on my screen. I checked my email inbox for ticket confirmation directly following and for the next 10 or 15 minutes. I did not have time to keep checking as I had to leave for a funeral. The tickets were $385.20 total, $192.60 each. We arrived at the airport at 5am for our 6:08am flight on June 23rd only to be told we had no flight scheduled that day and that the flight was scheduled for July 14th! We were in total shock! We explained to the counter woman that there must have been a computer clitch and that we would not just show up for a flight three weeks early. To our additional shock, she did not care whatsoever, told us it was our fault, that our ticket was non refundable, and that it would now be an additional $501.60 each to fly. With the long line and having to be on that flight for a business meeting, we gave her our credit cards. As a flier of AA for 35-40 years we were shocked and upset to be treated this way. We explained to multiple people at the airport and on the phone trying to get help and no one would help us. It's been weeks since we emailed customer relations with no acceptable response. We are now at a point where we believe AA has created a system to intentionally lock out customers from getting timely help and a way to steal money from its customers. AA does not care about us as people or future customers. It's hard to believe AA would be ok with its good customers paying $694.20 each for a ticket that should have been $192.60 each for a computer clitch. If at all possible, do not fly American Airlines!

Name: David Bravo
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Phoenix to Philadelphia. My son and I were scheduled to fly to Philadelphia in May, 2019. The night before, my son came down with severe stomach flu, throwing up a dozen times in just a few hours. Our flight was booked to leave at 6 am the next morning and there was no way my son would be able to make it. I called AA and was told that unless his illness was critical, I would have to make the flight or lose my $800 air fare. I stated that I was uncomfortable subjecting my son and the passengers to this flight. I was then told that I could take my son to the gate and have him evaluated. I couldn't believe it. Their solution was to have me get my sick son up at 4am, go to the airport, go through checkin and TSA, and finally get to the gate and have airline employees evaluate whether my son was too sick to fly. I was shocked. I chose not to subject my son to the flight, and the passengers to the stomach flu and I lost over $800 in airfare. I'm an Advantage member and I sent an email to AA about this situation. I received an automated email stating that I would get a response back from AA within 10 days. At the time of this review, it has been over 3 weeks, and no response.

Name: D Jackson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Chicago to Sacramento. We had 3 delays and once the plane arrived and de-boarded we were told a half hour later there were no pilots. We then had to wait an additional hour and by the time we actually took off we were stuck on the runway for another hour. We had a ride in Sacramento that had to wait until 11 pm to pick us up. No voucher or anything for constant delays. We fly out of Dubuque to Chicago and its constant delays or cancellations, passengers are often bumped for more important John Deere executives. This flight we had to either choose a 1hr layover (which would never happen) or a 5hr layover which turned into an 8 hr layover. Profits over people seem to be the norm. A little pre-planning and routing logistics could solve that problem, it's just you don't care and there is no governing body that cares. Were hoping the possible Amtrack that is in the future will eliminate the use of flights, at least there on time. That or drive to Madison and take Frontier, they are always on time.

Name: Grant Olson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Springfield to Dallas via Phoenix. This airline is consistently behind and what's worse is how little they seem to care about how they drastically affect people's travel plans. There announcements lack clarity or empathy. We waited for 2 hours 10 min. and 1 hour was simply because they did not plan adequately for a pilot. Similar scenarios have happened to my wife and I often. We have flown Delta with far fewer issues. It really seems like AA is a minor league team trying to play in the big leagues. They could learn a few things about customer relations and service from Delta and Southwest.

Name: Roberta Toews
Review:
✅ Trip Verified |  
Dallas to Vancouver. They cancelled my flight 6 hours before departure, rebooked for 4 days later nothing they could do about early flight. We end up going home one day after with another company paid for a last minute one-way ticket way more expensive than our original tickets. So after a month fight with American Airlines they finally approved a partial refund for the service they never realized. The only problem they did a partial refund to a Mastercard. I do not have, never had a MasterCard. Even so, I already told them 9 times I do not have a MasterCard they keep telling me there is nothing they can do because by regulation they must refund the money to the same method of payment. I paid with the only credit card I have, a Visa, but no one in America Airlines can understand they have a problem on their file.

Name: D Mardan
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Changed Flights multiple times then at last minute they send text that we will not have time to make the connecting flight to Tennessee. Rescheduled flight to Tennessee and instead of originally flying right out of Charlotte we had a 4.50 hr layover. Had to change our rental car pickup multiple times and it ended up costing extra due to all the changes. Now flying home they give us 30 min to try and get from terminal 5 to the Commuter terminal at LAX and if you have tried that it’s very unlikely. Will not change flight to something with a reasonable connecting flight unless we pay 50000 air miles each. Worst customer service I have ever had with an airline! Will get rid of the air miles AA Advantage Card and card and stick with our other airline! Called multiple times to try and resolve this issue and like I said before they wanted 50000 more air miles to change flight or a lot of money! I would love to see them consistently make the transfer from terminal 5 to the Commuter terminal and to deal with all the flight change BS and extra costs to the consumer! Unacceptable

Name: Tim Schmidt
Review: ❎ Not Verified | Dallas to Fayetteville via Charlotte. A warning to soldiers and their families transferring to Ft Bragg. Do not rely on American Eagle between Charlotte and Fayetteville. They are consistently inadequate and they lack accountability. I recommend using another airline to travel to Raleigh Durham and driving in.

Name: Dixie McCollum
Review: Not Verified |  Greenville to Phoenix via Dallas. I have flown throughout Europe, the United States, and South America, and they are by far the worst airline ever.  I have never seen such rude, incompetent staff in my life and you cannot trust anything they tell you. I opened a credit card and paid $2000 for a discount credit and bonus miles. But if I'd known I'd be spending the credit on a hotel due to my second canceled flight with American, I never would have opened it. On top of this, they did not give me my bonus miles for spending the $2000 and gave us no compensation for hotel or food when our flight was canceled. They misplaced our luggage on both legs of the trip, and due to maintenance issues on our first plane, we missed our connecting flight. They rerouted us to the smallest airport imaginable in Durango, CO for an extra 3 hours while we tried to make it to Phoenix, although we were promised a direct flight when arriving in DFW. Another AA staff member told us her boss would hang her if she messed up at her job (when trying to book us new tickets for our canceled flight - this also took 40+ minutes). If that is how they treat their own workers, it is no wonder the customers receive such horrible service as well. Every  one of our flights was delayed, and when one of our flights was canceled, they redirected us to an entirely new destination airport 3 hours away from where we live, yet managed to send our luggage to another airport! In addition, their planes are uncomfortable with no entertainment or power cords for phones. There is so much more to tell, but just thinking about the incompetency of this airline makes my brain hurt. I just want others to know how horrible they are so they will not make the same mistake. If you want to spend the majority of your vacation in an airport/on a plane, book American.

Name: W Janus
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Albuquerque to Charlotte via Dallas. On the flight from Albuquerque to Dallas, we got notification from the app the connecting flight from Dallas to Charlotte was canceled for operation reason and only available options were in next day. AA simply cancel people's flight as soon as they want for no reason! And they are not responsible for any accommodation, simply ask you to take care of yourself with your own cost.

Name: Tony Reyes Natalie K
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Ft Myers to Charlotte. Very disappointed with the service I received. I will never fly this airline again and will tell others to avoid this airline.  After upgrading my seats online to ensure my travel companion and I were seated together, only the second half of the connecting flight was assigned but I was still charged a full amount for preferred seating options on both flights. After waiting half an hour on the phone I was told to come in early to address it at check in. After coming to the airport 4 hours early, we were told it would have to be addressed at the gate. An attendant didn't arrive until 1.5 hours before the flight. When I kindly asked for assistance, he informed me the flight was completely full and said "Oh well, you have a window seat, use that as a bargaining chip."

Name: C Tebbit
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Issues on outbound as well as return flights - lesson learned. Unfortunately AA is not the caliber of airline it probably was in years past. I typically fly Delta with great success however on certain flights I’ve used US Air (now AA) but this last experience was such a cluster that I felt it warranted a review. On our outbound flight from DFW to Colorado Springs our flight was continually delayed as well as with each delay the gates seemed to move as well - at one point it got so ridiculous it became comical. Our departure out of DFW had officially past our originally arrival time in COS. Regardless we rolled with it because hey we’re on vacay and not worth letting it impact our mood. (Keep in mind this delay was not impacted by weather - not sure what the issue was here and they didn’t seem to want to explain) On our return flight out of COS to DFW the flight was cancelled around 3pm for a 4:38 departure. But it gets better from here. We just happened to be first in line to check our bag when the cancellation announcement was made...we thought ok at least were in line already. We step up to the counter and tell the young lady we realize she’s not responsible and we appreciate anything she can do to help us. First offer was best they could do was get us out on. Monday flight (it was Saturday) bc all their flights on Sunday we’re booked. After several concerning questions I got her to agree to explore putting us on another carrier - our options United or Delta. We asked for Delta based on their hub locations and our final destination. Then we were told nothing available. We thought we had seats on a United flight out the next day but still exploring same day departure options we stopped at the Delta counter to see what flights they had - they had options out that evening as well as next day. We went back to American counter spoke to supervisor (with flight info from the Delta rep) and he said he could get us on that flight - he assured us all was good and cancelled our “seat” on United. This is where it got ridiculous - we took our voucher to Delta only to find AA rep never fully finished the booking and we in fact weren’t confirmed and now the seats in United were gone as well. We went back and forth between counters - each only to find the AA reps were not completing the process to truly get their client booked on another carrier and the other carrier flights were now selling out. One AA passenger ended up going to Delta and paying a higher rate to hurry and guarantee her a seat in hopes AA would make it right. This went on and on and on with multiple passengers. Hours later now all flights out of COS Saturday and Sunday were gone and we were then told our only option was to shuttle from COS to Denver at $50 per person, rent a hotel room and get to airport Sunday morning (unconfirmed seats on Delta) and pray we make it home. Thankfully the ticket and gate agents with Delta were empathetic and worked hard to make sure they got us on. I was told at the airport they couldn’t compensate us for any of our out of picket expenses we wouldn’t have to call AA - which I did only for the guy on the other end to be completely rude and inform me I should had taken that up with the folks at the airport and if they told me to call them they then lied. Save your money, time and energy and pick another airline.

Name: Jeff Greene
Review: Not Verified |  American Airlines is an absolutely terrible airline. We have had trouble with them on past flights and gave them another chance but nothing like this. In one single day we had both of our flights delayed, one of which was a simple flight from new Philadelphia to Pittsburgh and it was delayed 5 times for a total time of 7 hrs. Every time they delayed it they never updated their monitors. They told us two completely different gates for boarding. The attitude from some of the workers was terrible. And last but certainly not least they lost our luggage (never even put it on the plane) I was told I would be having it delivered to my house first thing in the morning and it is now 3pm and have no call from their driver. We will never fly your airline again nor will I ever recommend your airline to anyone. Thank you for a completely stressful flight home from what should have been the end of a relaxing honeymoon.

Name: R Nazeer
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Phoenix to Denver. American Airlines is the worst airline I’ve ever flown. My boyfriend and I are on the same itinerary, and instead of seating us together have to upgrade to be able to select our seats. Customer service sucks. On the way to Denver, we arrived at least 20 minutes prior to cutoff time for bag drop off. The attendant told us to wait for her. We waited almost over 10 minutes as she was the only attendant and she literally did nothing. At that point when we were tended to, she told us that the bags couldn’t be loaded and she would have to rebook us on July 4, where there were practically no seats on standby. In comparison to other companies like Jetblue and Southwest, American is not very savvy to the customer experience. It almost seems like their planes - outdated and too tired to care. Big doesn’t necessarily mean better. Amenities are meager. No internet (jetblue and southwest offer). Stupid snacks. Please give fresher, more updated and less monopolizing airlines a chance.

Name: Mark Smirnov
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  American Airlines is a total joke. My flight, flight 251, from Miami to New York (JFK) was cancelled on Sunday, July 7th, 2019. Because of their incompetence, I had to spend an extra day in Miami in the hotel at my own expense and then spend $1,500 to purchase a ticket to New York on Delta Airlines on Monday, July 8th. I was put in on standby to La Guardia airport and that is where my bag currently is and I have to waste my time now and go to La Guardia airport in order to pick up my luggage. If I were to stay with what you were offering me in terms of re-booking, I would not get into New York until Tuesday, July 9th and I had to fly through Norfolk. Then one of the customer service agents at Miami offered to fly on Monday, July 8th from Miami to Key West, from Key West to Charlotte and then from Charlotte to La Guardia. I have never seen anything as ridiculous as this and AA customer service employees at Miami are terrible and no help at all. There were about 180 people placed on standby to New York, there was no chance that any of us would make it to New York on Sunday. I will never in my life fly with American Airlines again unless they compensate me back my $1,500 back which I had to spend because of their incompetence and inability to run the airline efficiently.

Name: C Morrison
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas Ft Worth to Detroit. I will do my best to avoid flying them again. We were forced to sit on the plane at the gate for over an hour in the Texas heat. The plane was hot to say the least. The flight attendant started serving drinks in 1st class (alcohol). After she made her round through 1st class, I hit the call button. Flight attendant came over. I asked her for a drink (included in my upgraded seat). She responds, I can't because we would run out. I asked to purchase 1 & was also refused. (I'm 100% sober). Fast forward to us finally in the air. 1st class had snacks, towels, earphones & 2nd round of drinks. Hit the call button & here comes the flight attendant. I asked for a drink & was told I had to wait another 10-15 minutes. At this point it had been almost 2.5 hours on the plane. We ended up over a hour late to our destination. I missed my ride & had to get an uber. Which took forever! Which only made me get checked into my hotel at 3:00am. This is causing me to miss work!

Name: Ben Guzzle
Review: ❎ Not Verified | Miami to Tampa. I was cancelled by these jerks on Sunday and had to drive home from Charlotte (10 hours). I am now stuck in Miami because their plane is not working. This used to be the best airline. Now they are the worst. Two days, one cancel and a possible second cancel. Do not fly American. They are overpriced and their equipment apparently is old and needs to be replaced. One more example of corporate greed and poor management.

Name: Kathy Willey
Review: Not Verified |  Los Angeles to Philadelphia. I have never had a more upsetting experience with an airline. First we were all sent for a gate change to international terminal. Long walk. Then we received text to go back to original gate. Time changed at least 3 times. Agents were rude and no help. Finally text came flight was postponed until next day. Only no agents informed is. Again no help and poor attitudes. We were told we could get our bags if we waited but only some of us got them. I waited 3 hours. Finally told it might be on flight tomorrow which was then also cancelled. They could not find my bag so I went home empty handed. If bag does not come I am faced with a vacation with no clothes or anything. Could I be more upset or disappointed in an airline? No. It has ruined my vacation and left me horribly stressed and upset. I strongly recommend you think twice before you consider flying on this airline. I will not.

Name: G Elkins
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I bought 4 round trip tickets from Greenville to Phoenix two months early. After two overbooked flights left us standing in the airport with hotel accommodations reserved, the desensitized AA employees would not book us on other routes to our destination. The next disappointment was the flight cancelled with no explanation. I refused to be rebooked, requested a refund, then bought Delta tickets out of Atlanta and drove there to start my vacation with three wasted days. I don't understand why selling seats you don't have is not false advertising and the airline is not responsible to reimburse you for lost time and reservation accommodations. I never intend to fly AA again! I would rate them negatively but don't see that on the scoring.

Name: G Burton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Purchase tickets through Expedia 60 days in advance, showed up to American Airlines terminal kiosk, printed two tickets but did not print tickets for the baggage, therefore we were sent to the line and we missed our flight. Was told we could fly standby to Phoenix which we did. The plane left late from LAX therefore we missed our connecting flight in Phoenix, stranded for the night, told later on in the evening that there was no available flights. The following day had to purchase tickets direct from Phoenix to Cabo. We lost a day of our vacation we had to pay for a hotel and food we were all-inclusive in Mexico and now nobody wants to help us with the refund.

Name: Paige Bier
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Washington. This is by far the worst airline that anyone can take. As someone who travels and consistently flies 3-5 times a month, I try to avoid American Airlines at all costs. They are delayed, cancelled, unprepared, unorganized, and extremely disrespectful. The last flight I took, American didn’t even schedule a pilot for their aircraft. Today, we had a 25 minute delay because the flight attendants and crew did not arrive on time. Also as a bystander, I am absolutely disappointed and appalled at the way American Airlines employees talk to their customers. I saw a customer get yelled at and was asked to return when he was “ready to listen”, and then the American Airlines employee stormed off. They are extremely rude, they could care less about their customers, and they do the very bare minimum. I would not recommend this airline to anybody, and it’s unfortunate that they are even still in business. Save your money and spend it on a more informed airline that actually cares about its passengers, it really does not get worse than this.

Name: Corey Meade
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Portland to Dallas with American Airlines. So first they offered vouchers for volunteers to take a different flight which I wish I would’ve taken cause that group ended up leaving before us. We boarded the plane on time then there was a maintenance issue which I understand. However, they kept us on that plane for almost 2 hours, also not really telling us anything that’s going on besides one or two times, by this time the other plane was boarding and I would’ve had a $1000 voucher which I honestly believe I now deserve! After finally getting us a new plane they kick everyone off and I am now 3 hours late to where I’m supposed to be. I’ve never dealt with so much chaos and I’m utterly disappointed with this experience so far. I would really appreciate being compensated for the voucher I missed out on at least, since this was a terrible mistake made by your airline.

Name: Su Nguyen
Review: Not Verified |  San Diego to Dallas. Literally cancelled my flight 1 day ago and now today American Airlines have cancelled again, get another flight booked today when I'm supposed to have been home since Saturday. Rate them no star, luckily I have a friend here who can provide me a stay.

Name: S Barton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Orange County to Dallas via San Antonio. Abusive and endless fees and an insulting even cynical frequent flyer/customer appreciation plan where they try to get you to pay extra (mileage multiplier) to actually earn any meaningful miles or credit, they are supposed to be showing appreciation for your business not insulting you. American stuck us on the tarmac in Dallas for three hours knowing full well there was no chance of departure - when asked they said "maybe they needed the gate" - hot, stuffy and never bothered to ask if we wanted anything to drink. Just another day at American Airlines.
route: Orange County to Dallas via San Antonio

Name: E Carter
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Horrible customer service. Our flight from Amsterdam to Dallas was delayed by 3 hours due to maintenance issues (this seems to be a recurring theme on recent AA flights I’ve flown!). We missed our connection from DFW to Sacramento so they rebooked us on a later flight which got canceled due to weather. I understand it’s impossible to give everyone their most desired flight alternative but the agents were not helpful! They made us beg for a hotel voucher. They claim it’s weather-related issue but we wouldn’t have been booked on the canceled flight had it not been for a maintenance issue on our original flight! Also, other airlines rebook customers to other airlines if need be. AA just flat out said they don’t have any partner airlines. I don’t think that’s true because they have code share flights. From now on AA will be our last option when flying!
route: Amsterdam to Sacramento via Dallas Fort Worth

Name: Katie Blair
Review: Not Verified |  Charlotte, NC to Boston, MA with American Airlines. Terrible customer service. Cancelled flight and then booked me on another flight 46 hours later after I had already completed the first leg of my trip. My husband had the same issue 1 week earlier, so this is a recurring problem for them. Inability to rebook you on a convenient flight. If you call, you are directed to gate agents, which are not at the gate. Gate agents tell you to call the airline. No one else you solve the problem of the flight they cancelled.

Name: Cas Schulz
Review: ❎ Not Verified | Disappointed but not surprised. Flight scheduled at 1 pm gets cancelled 20 mins before take off and our rebook was scheduled for 3, it was then delayed two hours and then eventually also cancelled. Stranded at the airport for 48-hours, they did not compensate for our flight or for our hotel. Never flying American again, will fly Delta.

Name: C Kalsten
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Our initial flight was a short flight from buffalo to Philadelphia, this flight was also delayed while sitting on air craft for hour and a half waiting to leave, finally it takes off, they didn’t offer anyone food or beverage, they said because of possible turbulence. I understand that but while we were sitting in ground, I feel they could have went around asking if anyone needed water or snack, nope they did not. My family and I had 3 delayed flights in 1 day after that with this American airline, the company had us running to all different gates with promises that we would be flying out. We would arrive to the gate hopeful, and in massive line, to find out that flight that will be departing is to Phoenix, then to Charlotte, I would go to desk, no one knew about my flight? How is it they can keep canceling my flight and not have any information when I could get my family home? American kept stringing us along, after sitting in Philadelphia airport from 2:30 till 10:30pm with 2 children, they ended up canceling last flight knowing there was a storm, that I think they knew about for hours, lady at desk said we are gonna board sooner to try and get everyone out before, they knew this flight was constantly delayed, you would think they would have been more organized to try and figure a solution for all of their customers. Others planes were flying out at this point, So then they told us to go by customer service with a huge line? So what I’m supposed to stand in this line for hours with 2 kids? After already traveling at this point since 10 am, Terrible, we couldn’t even get a opportunity to speak to someone about when can we go home. If you called on line it said a 2 hr wait for that. Then we get an email stated we would get another flight Monday evening at 7:30pm - are you kidding me? Mind you, we were at airport Saturday, who has 2 days just to sit in Philadelphia?  Then I wish it could end there - attempting to get my baggage was a joke, again we sat in line for an hour to speak to someone at the baggage claim desk, they were rude and letting everyone know that it’s been a nightmare for them for the last 3 days, and no one could get there luggage that night, maybe tomorrow?? The customer service people behind desk were more interested talking about their 50 th bday that was coming up, and days that she was scheduled but she was switching with another employee so she could be off or he?? As there is a huge line of people waiting, she said a couple of times we all are lucky that she cares to be there so much, because she wants to help, otherwise she normally already would of left for evening, up there yawning, saying how tired she was - are you serious? My family and I attempted to get a hotel /car rental.. on our own dime, could not find anywhere, everywhere was booked up.

Name: Hollie Crist
Review: ❎ Not Verified | Phoenix to Portland. I guess we never learn our lesson. Last 3 times we have flown with them and every time the fight has been delayed or changed. They are never on time. And not accommodating to help you change.

Name: C Horton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Phoenix to Redmond. All those bad reviews, true. Very poor airline, trying to get to a loved one before she passes, they wouldn’t help me get an earlier flight and then the one I did have was delayed.

Name: E Schumer
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Grand Rapids to London via Chicago. American Airlines is the worst airline I have ever flown. Never have I been treated this badly before. It was just terrible customer service from the beginning to the end. I had three flights with AA. The first one from Grand Rapids to Chicago was delayed due to weather issues therefore I just made it to my second one which was also 30 min delayed. While I was trying to get the second plane AA rebooked me without my knowledge to a different flight ( Grand Rapids - Charlotte - Frankfurt). Had I not checked my emails would I not have known that they have done that. First off: as I had already left Grand Rapids and landed in Chicago this connection did not make any sense nor was it possible for me to take these flights. Second: they did not want to let me on my plane to London, which was the flight I had booked. It seemed that they did overbook the flight and therefore had problems getting everybody on the plane. Others who were rebooked on the flight I had booked originally were allowed to go whereas I was not. The crew was very rude to me and would just ignore me. They were unfriendly and just told me it was not their fault. They did not care about my case nor did they want to help. I had to beg them to help me. They ended up allowing me to go on the plane to London. They did not assure me a seat on my third flight the plane to Frankfurt although I had already checked in to this flight. In addition to that since I did make it on the plane to London I would have definitely made it to my last flight too. I also had a valid boarding pass for this flight. When I said I needed to get to Frankfurt they just said it was not their problem and they would get me to London but not any further. To “comfort” me (and I do not want to say this word as they did not show any emotion nor empathy towards me or any of the passengers) they said London was closer to Frankfurt than Chicago. While this might be true this is a sign of a big lack of customer service. Employees at AA do not seem to have been given ANY training on how to behave towards customers. I ended up crying because I just got so upset and they did tell me I might as well stay in Chicago and fly out tomorrow. Well thank you for being so compassionate. Never again will I fly with American Airlines again. To me it seems that they cannot handle the simplest problems or even normal situations related to flight delays and connections. You can definitely not expect anything in return from this airline. Stay away from them.
route: Grand Rapids to London via Chicago

Name: Lily Frisce
Review: Not Verified |  San Francisco to Charlotte. Worst customer service I've experienced with an airline. I get sick and claustrophobic in middle seats, and despite my obvious distress and discomfort, the crew refused to allow me to move to the open aisle or window seats because they are only available by charge, even though they are empty. A terrible policy, and awful management that they would make their crew feel they have no choice to move someone's seat even though they are visibly sick. Awful people, awful airline. This will be the last time I ever fly with American. Now I remember why I usually choose Delta for domestic flights. Unbelievably discourteous. Wish I could rate them at zero stars.

Name: Hugo Lewis
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Denver to Charlotte. Absolutely awful experience. Rude, terrible service from the first class flight attendant. To make this a worse experience, this was followed by zero customer service after multiple emails contacting the customer service department. I would highly recommend another airline if given any other choice.

Name: J Barton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Salt Lake City. I'm not surprised seeing that I'm not the only one who is disappointed with American Airlines. Whoever is in charge of customer service is doing a very poor job. My flight was delayed several times due to weather in Chicago. I get that, it happens. My disappointment begins when American refused to compensate me for my hotel room because I had to stay overnight in Chicago. I missed my connecting flight because they didn't get to Chicago in time, and they didn't have another flight departing for Utah after 9:30pm. The soonest they could do was 1:30pm the following day, so it's not like I could hang out at the airport for 15 hours. Then big surprise, I got another notification that my 1:30pm flight is now delayed enough to miss my other connecting flight! I called them and suggested the solution of putting me on a Delta flight at 7:50am. Why am I the one to figure out the solutions? I forward the complaint to Customer service; I ask them to compensate me for my hotel room ($129) and I may travel with American again. They tell me no. I explained that I travel every month for my job and they won't invest $129 to keep a customer. Obviously the return of investment is there for American airlines, but they couldn't see it. I've let my colleagues know (of whom also travel monthly) that I don't recommend flying with American. I already have another business trip planned for next week to Missouri and I booked Delta! Keep up the poor work American airlines, you'll have empty seats on your flights.

Name: Pedro Matias
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Phoenix to San Jose. At issue is American Airlines decision to reassigning my window seat 30A to a middle seat without my consent or any mention of this, later forcing me to change seat inside the plane. Upon entering the plane, my phone notified me that my seat had changed. I asked two cabin crew members where I should sit. They replied I should sit on my original seat, by the window, because it was less demanding on my foot. After having settled on my window seat and stored my bags in the top compartment, a family of 4 appears claiming they had the entire row assigned to them, seats 30A/B/C. The family appeared to consist of a small child, his parents and his grandmother. Another crew member told me that my seat was 12E and that I should move. I refused to do so since this was the seat I had purchased at least a couple months back and because I was told by the other crew members that I should sit there. A few moments after, the attendant came back and said that the captain had said that I can “either choose to change my seat or not board at all on the plane”. Intimidated by this and considering the fact that the plane was delayed and this family wanted to sit down and that I was extremely tired from the long trip, I moved my bags, changed my seat and apologized for the family since this was not their problem, but American Airlines. I will no longer fly with or recommend American Airlines.

Review_Heading: "They don't seem to care at all"
Name: Brian Myles
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Bags were tagged with correct tags Charlotte to Dublin to Lyon but American Airlines sent one bag to Tampa. Bag found 2 days later but 4 days later still haven't even begun to forward them to me. No communication from American whatsoever. All info from call center in another country where they keep calling me to tell me that they have found my bag and they'll let me know as soon as they arrange to send it to me. Why are they holding the bag? They say they cant tell me. Dont fly American if you want your bags to go where you are going. They don't seem to care at all. Vacation is ruined because I'm spending all my time on phone and internet trying to get my bag. I go on vacation to get away from my computer and phone Thanks American Airlines for not caring!

Name: Deborah Sanchez
Review: Not Verified |  Salt Lake City to Charlotte via Phoenix . Plane was late getting into Salt Lake City so we were late into Phoenix.. Was told that the connecting flight knows were are coming, so run. I’m a 60 year old Uterine cancer survivor of 2 months and I ran like a crazy woman! I ran past younger people that were on my flight (there was 14 of us) when I reached the gate they let a guy that I was on the plane with on but then closed the door! I said please I was on his plane and they said y’all are waiting on us. She said there are no more seats left that the plane was over sold. What? That is a connection flight for me. Not my flight of origin!? I asked at the customer service counter when they were booking my for another flight for 8 hours later how much did people get compensation for giving up their seat on my sold out flight and I was told nothing the 10 seats that weren’t filled by us passengers from my flight were given to people on standby! So I was bold face lied to by the attendant at the gate! Then the plane I was on after all the 8 hour of waiting barely got down the run way and we had to go back for engine issues. So an original flight time of 5 hours for me turned into a 21 hour circus and a missed day of work at $180 for the day. If I could give this airline zero stars I would! And a zero rating I would.
route: Salt Lake City to Charlotte via Phoenix

Name: Elena Mikalsen
Review: Not Verified |  We were scheduled to fly from San Antonio to Chicago to Dublin. As we boarded the aircraft, we were told the plane was broken and we needed to wait for another plane to arrive from Dallas. 2 hours later, we boarded another aircraft. After we boarded it, we were told it was also broken. At this point, we were at risk for missing our connection. I spoke to the pilot and desk clerk who both assured me that the plane will be fixed very quickly and we will not miss our connection from Chicago to Dublin. In fact, they didn't want to rebook us on another flight at that time, as they were certain we would make our connection. 4 hours later, it was announced the plane was permanently grounded and there was no other plane they could put us on. Our connection was missed. We were rebooked on another flight out to Dallas now, with our international connection through now two different cities, getting us to Dublin 3 days after originally planned arrival. The next day, when we arrived at the airport and boarded the aircraft, we were once again told that the plane was broken and they would fix it shortly. At that point, we left the aircraft as everyone was screaming at us, asked a crew member to get our bags (airport crew, who was very helpful) and drove to Dallas where we got British Airways to get us to Europe. American refused to reimburse us in any way for this. They took no responsibility. We lost 3 days in our vacation time and expenses. All gate agents and customer service we spoke to was extremely rude and even yelled at us.
route: San Antonio to Dublin via Chicago

Name: S Heale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia  to Austin. American Airlines changed my departure time from 9AM to 4PM without any notice. They also changed my flight home from 1PM to 11 AM without notice. Im going to a convention so this time limitation creates unneeded stress. I will never be flying American Airlines again.

Name: Ryan Bingham
Review: Not Verified |  Flight was delayed but not announced until passengers were on board. This delay was over 1.5 hours causing us to miss our connection requiring an unplanned overnight stay in Philadelphia with a new flight the next day in the afternoon. LAX gate staff was rude and unhelpful. Customer service staff at LAX told us we could book on another airline, but we were on our own to contact, book and pay. In Philadelphia we were directed to the 50 person line at customer service where we were told our flight for the next day and we would be better off getting our own hotel. We were given a $12 voucher for each of us for food. We were not allowed access to our bags for medication for our 3 year old requiring. Fortunately, Marriott was able to find a 24 hour pharmacy once we checked in and paid on our own for rooms there. As of today, American has offered no assistance nor responded to us online or on the phone. We arrived home 24 hours later than scheduled.
route: Los Angeles to Bradley via Philadelphia

Name: R Cain
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Washington to Quito via Miami. My wife and I took a trip of lifetime to the Galapagos Islands this month and it was wonderful - except for our treatment by American Airlines. We booked first class tickets 9 months in advance and on half our flights, we were downgraded to coach because they oversold the tickets. I have spoken to six customer service representatives (you can never speak to the same one) and have yet to receive a refund for the difference in cost of first class and coach tickets (which amounts to thousands of dollars). And by the way, you cannot speak to anyone in the refund department. So if you still choose to fly American Airlines, don't expect to sit in first or business class even if you buy those tickets and good luck getting any money back once they downgrade you.

Name: R Davies
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | This has got to be the worst experience I ever had. Started out in Memphis our flight was supposed to leave at 7.35am, however there was something wrong with our plane and it took maintenance over 30 minutes to show up to fix the problem. By the time maintenance did show up thunderstorms rolled in (had maintenance been on time we would have left before the storms rolled in). Ended up leaving Memphis at 12pm and by that time had missed my connecting flight in Dallas at 12.35pm so they routed us from Dallas to Chicago. Nightmare gets worse, our gate and time changed 4-5 times sometimes without notification. Finally leaving for our final destination Sioux City IA at 10.26pm. Mind you my mother’s funeral was scheduled for the next day at 11am and there are not many flights in and out of Sioux City. Get to Sioux City, no luggage! Therefore no clothes or toiletries to shower before the funeral. We were told the earliest our luggage would be there is noon the day of the funeral, hence we had to purchase something to wear. Lucky enough we had money to buy clothes and toiletries. My last time flying American! Staff not friendly or empathetic and could have cared less what I was going through.

Name: J Lane
Review: Not Verified |  AA Advantage, not on this planet! After sitting on the runway for over an hour due to incompetent staff at O'Hare Airport (they couldn't get the crew the paperwork they needed to take off), I'm now reduced to sitting on the runway for another hour because of storms in the region. And the best part, American hasn't even updated my app to show the flight as delayed. Can't wait to tear my AA Card to pieces later this evening. And a bit of advice to American (even though they clearly don't seem to be able to either listen or take advice) just be honest and update the app. I know they can't do anything about the weather, but it was totally their fault they couldn't find their paperwork.

Name: R Sanyal
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  London to New York JFK. This was my first experience traveling on a basic economy fare. For the money I paid, it would be churlish for me to find any fault. I was assigned my seat when checking into a self service automatic machine. It was an exit row seat on the left third of the 3x4x3 configuration.
