Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Wichita to Knoxville with American Airlines. This airline is terrible! Flight delayed at midnight due to something with crew. Of course would never make connection. Wife called and was told nothing they could do. I called back irate and finally the got me on a flight. Upon arriving to Dallas they changed gates 3 times! Was supposed to take off now and they say they need to do maintenance will know more later. No one seems to care, just deal with it. Never flying American again! Flight 5848.

Name: Crystal Hammans
Review: Not Verified |  Chicago to Los Angeles. I know that inconveniences happen and I try to be patient. However, the lack of service or genuine care from American Airlines is ridiculous. After being delayed from my first flight (due to a mechanical issue) I arrived in Chicago to try to book a flight to LAX. I discovered that they never have enough people to assist passengers in rebooking (the one lady was too busy talking and laughing with a friend), American Airlines had cancelled yet another flight so all their flights to LAX were full and standby was packed, and when I told the customer service agent my issue she rolled her eyes and repeated what she had just said in a demeaning tone as if I was a child. The icing on the cake was when I asked where to go to receive a travel voucher for the two delayed/cancelled flights and the inconvenience of having to arrive at my destination 12 hours later...they looked at me as if I was crazy. I calmly explained that other airlines at least try to compensate you for the inconvenience. Instead they gave me a number to call (wrong number) and that lady said I would have to request compensation through their website after my trip. Of course the likelihood of receiving anything from the incompetent airline post travel will be next to nothing! And now that I think about it I want to avoid them at all costs in the future! Save yourself the headache and fly Southwest! At least they are kind and compensate you for inconveniences! With Southwest anytime a flight is delayed they pass out travel vouchers like candy, they care about their passengers unlike American Airlines!

Name: D Macy
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | This travel day started fine, but our flight was delayed over 10 times. It resulted in over 24 hours of delayed time. The flight attendants were rude and quoted over the speaker that they had worked a long day too so please don’t be upset. We tried multiple times to refly into Dallas, and eventually ended in Austin. Once there, we were given no guidance to our flight, and the lady at the front desk was stressed and complained to us that they didn’t know what was going on either. Overall, American Airlines has been extremely unprofessional and unreliable, and I will never willingly choose this airline again.
route: Palm Springs CA to Wilmington NC

Name: R Keane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Salt Lake City to Nashville via Dallas. Got up at 0330 to make our 0600 flight. Our first flight was delayed over two hours because some of the flight attendants stayed overnight at a hotel that lost power (um ok). We missed our connecting flight due to this delay. The connection we ended up getting on was cancelled (right after we boarded in the last group) due to some mechanical issue. We somehow managed to get onto a third aircraft that actually got us to our destination. Do you think our checked luggage made it? Nope. Still waiting to have our bags delivered. Fun day all around.
route: Salt Lake City to Nashville via Dallas

Name: P Garlen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Lihui to Los Angeles. The title pretty much says it all. My husband and I went on a honeymoon to Hawaii. Of course, we were so excited but on the way there, our first flight was delayed, and we missed our connecting flight by less than 5 minutes. As in the plane was still there but they couldn’t let us on. Can they not hold the plane for 5 minutes to let their passengers make their connections? Very frustrating. Then we were told that we couldn’t possibly get to Hawaii for 2 additional days. Luckily, one customer service agent pitied us and managed to get us there late that night (the only nice thing I will have to say about American). Fast forward to the return trip. The same thing happened. In fact, we arrived to LAX with plenty of time to make our connecting flight. However, we were stuck in the plane on the tarmac for an additional 30 minutes and then finally arrived at the gate to find that they had just closed the doors to our connecting flight. So here we are, stuck in LAX all day, and I’m sure it will end with us being screwed yet again by them. Pick another airline, especially if it’s a special trip. Because they will ruin it.

Name: Maharsho Dave
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I travelled from Memphis Airport on May 03, 2019. American Airlines prepone my flight from Memphis to Chicago. I missed my flight but staff cooperation was very poor for alloting me new flight tickets. I have noticed that there was no coordination between American Airlines and Qatar Airways with whom I was travelling from Chicago to Delhi. I will never recommend to travel with American Airlines.

Name: Zach Weaber
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Cancun. Horrible experience. The airline had serviced the plane prior to boarding, then had everyone wait on the plane 2 hours before taking off. No food beverage or ability to get up and stretch was offered. With the competitive prices and horrible planning/service I would not recommend this airline to anyone.

Name: Lylies Asakwa
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  . I was originally supposed to fly from the BWI to STX with connecting flights in between. I showed up at the airport super early because I’m a very punctual person. They cancelled my first flight with no explanation whatsoever and my only option was to find someone to drive me 50 minutes from Baltimore MD to Virginia (DCA airport) to catch a flight from there to MIA (Miami) and from Miami to St. Croix Arriving STX, they didn’t have my bag. The American airline people said it was still in DCA but will arrive the next day. At 3:51pm they called it had arrived. I don’t have a car here and had to wait for a ride. We get there at 6, they people left. Nobody to open the door for me to get my bags and they won’t even answer the phone. What stopped these people when they called to say “your bags are here but we leave at this time”. Now I have to wait till next day again. I literally have nothing to wear. I had a backpack with me with there’s nothing in there to wear outside the house.  I cant even go out. I’m basically stuck inside the house. I paid for my ticket way ahead of time and I paid for my bags. I shouldn’t have to drive an additional 50 minutes to a different airport. I shouldn’t have to wait days for my bags. The last time I fly American is when I return to the states.

Name: W Garlam
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Palm Springs to Austin via Phoenix. Every time I fly with any version of this airline there is always a major issue. Sitting on the tarmac for hours and told we have to pay for food and that it’s only free after sitting on the plane for 2 hours. People needed food. It was a 6 hour flight. Right now I’m at the airport and a bunch of us missed our connecting flight by 3 minutes because their first flight was delayed by almost 2 hours. In addition, they wouldn’t take us to the next flight at the other end of the airport. Yet, others were cruising around on the carts in the airport from the same airline. Why? To get them to their flights. I asked. So, when we got to the gate we were told “sorry” and proceeded to watch the plane sit there for another 15 minutes while they booked everyone on another flight. I’m just praying that this next flight which is 4 hours later is on time and not as filthy as the last one. First Class with them is a joke. Greedy, filthy, and lots of untruths.
route: Palm Springs to Austin via Phoenix

Name: Derek Northcutt
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  London to Los Angeles. Unless you overpay for your flight, they assign you the worst seat available such as a middle seat between two vacant aisle & window seats. If you ask for a better seat, they want $55. IFE was out on my May 8th trip and twice before on other flights. At LAX they park their a/c at Terminal 4 and then expect you to walk a mile through a tunnel to the International terminal for customs inspection. In my judgment, if they are going to land at terminal 4 they'd better hire immigration officials to process their planefuls of passengers. Staff are hostile and discourteous. My last three flights on a 777 were less than 1/2-full. They will realise when it's too late that if you do not treat the traveling public with courtesy and respect they will no longer have a public to serve.

Name: G Barton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Tampa to Santiago via Miami. I had been a loyal AA client for decades but rethinking my plans now. Booked a trip of a lifetime to Chile, business class all the way so we wouldn't arrive "broken" for our hiking adventure. The shortest flight (tampa to miami) was delayed 3X the actual length of the flight. Promised a cart to take us to gate in Miami, even though we were already doomed for connection. Wheelchairs showed up! We could run faster. Missed connection and with standby, stuck in middle seats in economy bulkhead for next flight. Luggage lost for 3 days, including hiking clothes. In spite of this, accidents happen, .but was shocked at refund for change in class of service! I cannot get an AA human being to explain rationale for paltry refund. Would prefer future upgrades on a flight but no one will discuss with us - not in customer service, not in support line, not through credit card! frustration level is through the roof. friends flew on same days, bought tickets at same time, flew economy down/business back and spent $3000 less! We got 10% of that back. a planned do-loop to make sure i go away without any answers. so much for spending the big bucks on a great flight. promised calls back and received 0. will look at other airlines in the future that treat customers right.

Name: G Warton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I just experienced a recent American "Trip from Hades" leaving the Rapid City Airport (RAP) to fly back to RDU via ORD. We were scheduled to leave on Monday 05/27 after 11:00 AM - the flight got delayed so many times I quit counting. We did get on the plane in the afternoon and sat on the tarmac for 2 hours (the 1st hour was spent without air conditioning or water) only to have to return to the gate (the excuse was related to weather but we are thinking it had something to do with the flight crew exceeding their time limits). The flight finally got canceled after we spent the entire day at RAP. The funny thing was there was no communication from the American gate during this time while the other airlines were constantly keeping their customers up-to-date via the airport's intercom (this is a regional airport so you could hear all the gate communications). We ended up spending the night at the airport since the flight was rescheduled for early the next morning (no vouchers for hotels offered of course!). When we called American customer service early the next day, there was no confirmation that Flight 3098 was scheduled to leave at 7:00 AM on 05/28 so we decided to get rebooked thru DFW. This was working great until the agent at the gate announced that American was offering $600 vouchers for people to take a later flight (they overbooked the DFW flight, of course!). We got a call on the intercom to come to the gate. The gate attendant basically moved us back to the ORD flight without our agreement (we had assigned seats BTW), lied about the weather at ORD and refused to honor the $600 voucher. After 32 hours, we finally made it back to North Carolina. Lessons learned: 1) Avoid flying American at all costs. 2) Stick to major airports so you have options. 3) Avoid holiday travel on airlines. 4) Consider driving an RV to see all the US parks.
route: Rapid City to Raleigh Durham via Chicago

Name: Lucinda Nicholas-Grisham
Review: Not Verified |  Washington to Dallas Ft Worth. We originally selected Main Cabin Extra seats, as our flights weren't long flights. After our first flight, IAD to DFW, we realized that the extra money we paid for those seats was ridiculous. They were just as tight and uncomfortable as coach/economy. We tried to upgrade to business class only to be told that it would be an additional $645.00 each for a 2:45 minute flight. Even after paying a great amount extra for main cabin extra seats, all you're entitled to is a drink and tiny bag of pretzels. There is no seat back monitor/tv and it made for a boring/uncomfortable flight. Also the attendants were not very friendly and although I go out of my way to be be a polite/friendly person, it seemed to make no difference.

Name: S Neale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Lexington to St Thomas via Atlanta. Stranded in STT airport for 48 hours by American Airlines due to hydraulic leak, and passengers left to their own devices to find a way home. Detailed version: AA flight 1195 on 5/22/19 had a mechanical problem we were told should take an hour to fix. After a couple of hours, we were told to board the plane. The pilot said there was a hydraulic leak, and a patch had been made. I could see the copilot standing in front of the wing watching as the pilot tested out the patch while we were all seated on the plane. Suddenly, the copilot made a frantic gesture moving his hands across his throat ("cut it" signal) to tell the pilot to stop testing. The pilot said the patch had blown, and hydraulic fluid was all over the ground. It seems unsafe that passengers were on board the plane while this hydraulic patch was being tested. The AA staff held us at the airport until 9pm when they finally started distributing vouchers to a musty, dirty hotel. We finished eating our voucher dinner at 11pm. Before leaving the airport, AA staff told us to come back for an 8am flight the next day, 5/23. At dinner we were told our flight had been delayed until 2pm on 5/23. Before we checked out of the hotel, we found out the flight was delayed again until 6pm. I immediately called the AA booking hotline to get another flight. I spoke over an hour with a manager who said there were no seats on any flights from STT that day, even on other airlines. So we were stuck waiting to see if our AA plane had actually been fixed. On 5/23, we sat in the airport all day, watching other AA passengers arrive on a different working plane and fly off to Charlotte, which was our destination. They would not allow us to board the working plane, though we had been waiting 24 hours. We were stranded since we were "assigned to" the broken plane. The gate agents told us they had no info about when the plane would be fixed. They were waiting for information "from above". Many people asked to speak with the AA manager for STT airport. The AA clerks radioed him over and over, but he stayed outside on the tarmac so that no one could speak to him. Some people had run out of medication, and others with special diets like myself (Celiac disease) were feeling faint from a lack of gluten free food. At 7pm they began handing out hotel vouchers again, and released us from the airport with no information about when our flight was rescheduled. We spent another night in the hotel. We called the AA booking phone number for 3 hours talking to various agents, who said they could not transfer us to a Delta flight that showed seats available online since it was overbooked. Finally, we were passed to a manager who said he found two "reserved operations" seats on an AA flight to Philadelphia used for situations like this. I asked why I wasn't offered these seats earlier that morning when I was on the phone with a booking manager since it could have saved me 24 hours of delay! We went to the airport for a 3rd day in a row on 5/24. We finally made it home at midnight on 5/24/19, which is 48 hours after our original scheduled arrival time. Due to the 48 hour delay, our pets were held at the kennel 2 days past when we were supposed to pick them up. We incurred extra fees for the kennel, as well as airport parking, and my husband wasted 2 extra "vacation" days spent all day in an airport. I will never fly with AA again.
route: Lexington to St Thomas via Atlanta

Name: J Langer
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  My husband and I departed from Cincinnati for our honeymoon in Cancun, Mexico and we had a connection in Charlotte. Every flight was delayed - without notice, as per usual. We arrived at CVG before 7AM for our 9:30AM flight... only to be moved from one gate, to the next, back to the original, and THEN find out the flight is going to be delayed for minimum 40 minutes because they oversold it & no one was budging. Next, we arrive in Charlotte, and another delay. Once we finally arrive in Mexico, we are scouring baggage claim for our luggage, only to find out it did not leave Cincinnati. It took them over 12 hours to get the bags to us and they gave us no update about the progress. Each time we called the 1-800 number for an update, we were placed on hold for over an hour, and then were told basically "the bags will get there when they get there." Needless to say, we ended up spending basically our entire honeymoon budget on clothing just so we could enjoy our first day.  Finally, around midnight, the bags show up. Unfortunately, my bag was soaked. Thank goodness our resort credits covered laundry services. The flight out of Cancun was delayed, with no notice. Then, on board the flight someone had a medical emergency - nurses & a doctor on board the plane recommended landing for patient treatment & the pilots kept on.  Finally, we make it to Charlotte, and are delayed. There is no update to when we would possibly take off, there never is. After waiting over 2 hours, and too many gate changes to count, we finally took off. I have already cancelled the credit card we earned points with. Flyer beware, if you want to have a miserable time, by all means book with American Airlines. If you want to actually enjoy your trip, choose any other airline.

Name: Tayfun Ercay
Review: Not Verified |  I started off Kansas City to Stuttgart via Chicago O‘hare and London Heathrow. The plane from Chicago was delayed due to Maintenance work on The plane and i Missed my flight To Stuttgart after Plane landed in London. American Airlines issued me a Ticket from London to Frankfurt than Frankfurt to Stuttgart, I have been awake for over 27 Hours Running from Terminal to Terminal. Never American Airlines again!
route: Kansas city to Stuttgart via London

Name: Son Vo
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  American Airline standard? I've bought first class ticket to flight with American airline from Fort Walton Beach (FL) to Santa Ana (CA) at May 18th, 2019 for me and my wife. American airline downgrade us to economy grad without any warning, nor explanation. When I made complain to American airline Customer service, that don't answer after 3 work days, until Skytrax pubished my case. But when American airline response me, they wrote me that, their downgrades are automated by their system and happen for a number of different reasons. And Customer Relations of American Airlines wrote: "Unfortunately, there is not a specific reason I can provide to you regarding your downgrade". There is no any explanation, nor apologize. Is it the American airline standard? I have a right to know, why American downgrade us. And American airline must apologize to us for their downgrading. In the other side, American airline must also pay back money when they didn't serve us as first class, as they provided us ticket.
route: Fort Walton Beach  to Santa Ana

Name: Iris Colon
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Columbus. It is not the first time I travel this airline and it always has delays, I do not recommend it. This time it was a delay of 7 hours, not even credit for food, they only offer you junk food, during the 7 hours of waiting I changed the gate more than 5 times. On other trips I have lost my suitcase twice. Really lousy service. No es la primera vez que viajo por esta linea y siempre tiene retrasos, no la recomiendo, esta vez fue un retraso de 7 horas, ni siquiera crédito dan para comida, solo te ofrecen comida chatarra, durante las 7 horas de espera me cambiaron el gate mas de 5 veces. En otros viajes me han perdido la maleta dos veces. Realmente pésimo servicio.

Name: Paul Bingham
Review: Not Verified |  Be advised if you have never booked code share, do not ever do it. We booked on AA (million mile + traveler) code share with Iberia. Miserable experience on the behalf of Iberia, which makes it an AA problem. There is no accountability between the airlines. We booked business class tickets and Iberia changed our flight from to go via Delta through Atlanta with no notice and no reason. We got bumped for Iberia frequent fliers not AA status fliers. Return trip, same! Iberia put us on standby for business class from MAD to ORD. We paid for these tix last January! Iberia has no accountability to American and American can enforce nothing with Iberia. Code share = broker. Book your flights direct. I will be moving to Delta and or United, whomever will match my status.
route: Northwest Ark to Madrid via Chicago

Name: C Theale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  The trip out to my destination was an absolute nightmare. My first flight (which I was up at 6 for) was cancelled on short term notice. The flight I booked after that was delayed by 2 hours. Wound up sitting on the plane at the terminal when it landed for another 2 hours because none of the terminals were open. My layover flight was continuously delayed in 30 minute increments (at 1 am mind you). The plane was even there and ready for boarding. Flight was finally cancelled. The staff there wouldn't even keep us notified on why it was delayed or the progress on leaving. There was another 2 hour wait in line to rebook. This was on a Saturday and they said there were no seats available until Monday or Tuesday. I went to check for myself and there were a couple of flights for the following day. Overall, this airline was completely unprofessional and seemed to care little for their customers. I won't be booking with them again if I can help it. I'd give them a zero rating if I could.

Name: Son Vo
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I traveled with American Airline from Fort Walton Beach (FL) to Santa Ana (CA). I’ve bought for me and my wife first class ticket for flight AA 1538 from Fort Walton Beach airport (FL) to Dallas FT Worth (TX), and AA 1524 from Dallas FT Worth (TX) to Santa Ana (CA). When I’ve checked in at Fort Walton Beach airport, the staff arranged me and my wife to economy seats on the flight 1538 without any explanation, neither warning. Weve expected it only when we’ve got in flight. I’ve ask 2 stewardess, why I’ve bought first class, but now I have to sit in economy class. They were vexed, and indicated me to talk to a man, who seemed be a chief of crew. When I told to that man, the man said, that he doesn’t know it, that I can complain to American Airline. That time was very close to flight time, so I had to flight with economy class. I think, what happen with me and my wife on flight AA 1538, shows, that American airline disregards customers. Or American Airline discriminates me and my wife, the foreigners, even we pay for first class ticket. In the other side, American Airline staff are not well educated, neither in customer service, nor in attitude. I think American Airline deserves 1 point in your scoring
route: Fort Walton Beach to Santa Ana

Name: William Harwood
Review: Not Verified |  Tried to do an online check in for myself and my travel companion and my locator was not available and hers was, but we were unable to complete the check in just kept indicating an error. Called reservations and they were able to get my reservation reactivated, but my travel companion they said the only thing we could do was to check in at the gate. Every time I have had to fly American there is always issues with them for reservations and most of the gate agents and flight attendants have a less than helpful attitude. I have never had these issues with Southwest or Delta. I try to avoid American Airlines when possible, they make the travel experience unpleasant and frustrating.

Name: Lawand Deese
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I had a reservation to fly into Yuma from Charlotte with a layover in Phoenix. I arrived on time to [email protected] 9:30. Once we arrived there was a plain stationed in our bay so we were told it would be a delay. The American Airline passengers did not bother to contact the connecting flight to Yuma and tell them we were in phoenix. So once we got off of the flight and were going to B5 to catch the connecting flight it was closed and we were advised to go to customer service. Once we got to customer service the line was so long, it took an hour to get to the counter only to be told that the customer service closed at 11:00 and we needed to go to another customer service Kiosk on the other side of the airport. by this time, I was tired, had been up since 5:00 in the morning east coast time. I called customer service and was asked if I wanted to be reimbursed. I explained to the agent that this wasn't a pleasure trip, I had flown here for a funeral. she then said, well I can send you back to Charlotte and give you a full refund. I just hung up. Once it was my turn in the customer service line. I was told that i had to spend the night at the airport and the next flight was full so I would have to take the next flight at 10:52. I then became loud and explained to her that thus was of no fault of mine and I should not have to be inconvenienced because of a mistake made by the airline. She then offered me a night at the double tree hotel and a food voucher for a 12.00 meal. Needless to say, I am very disappointed in the customer service received on this trip and not only that the huge inconvenience it caused. I plan to contact US airways next week and if they are not willing to offer me a refund. I will never use them again. There is no such thing as customer service anymore.

Name: Westley Owens
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Seoul. The first leg of this trip back to the States was good. The last leg returning to Seoul was horrible. The gate attendant was rude. The seat space was made for a shorter person. I asked to be moved to a different seat prior to the flight and the gate attendant was less than professional. He was more concerned about the revenue of the seat rather than my comfort. Furthermore, my seat was already a preferred seat. It would have been a one for one swap. This airline should treat military members better.

Name: Rafael Ruiz-Ayala
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Miami. When American Airlines says “tickets assigned at check-in” it means “members of the same family unit buying in a single transaction will be randomly assigned seats in plane without regard to being a family unit in order to generate artificial demand at the airport for purchasing seats.” But that they do not disclose when selling you the ticket. Not even in the fine print. In addition, their systems are unable to deal with Latino hyphenated last names and you will not be able to do online check in with one of those but will have to do it at the airport if using your passport as you will be told there is no identity match (there is no culturally competent IT provider to prevent them to get rid of hyphenation) so again you must end at the gate to solve it. As for the rest, same mediocrity as always.

Name: Colleen Cayes
Review: Not Verified |  I will never fly AA again. Staff at Abilene unfairly confiscated my roll-aboard, which I have ramp-checked with them 5 times in the past 30 days. This time, they insisted I check it and charged me $30. Now I'm stuck transiting DFW with a heavy carry-on and no wheels. I am rebooking my next flights on Southwest into Dallas Love and I'll drive 2.5 hours to Abilene and back rather than ever set foot on another American flight again.
route: Abilene to Salt Lake City via Dallas

Name: M Peale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Punta Cana. I just want to say that American Airlines on two separate occasions has earned back my loyalty. The first time was on a trip from Chicago to the Dominican Republic. My husband had his wallet in a backpack stowed under the seat in front of him. During the trip, it must have popped out. We exited the plane, made it through customs with his passport that was in his pocket and only realized upon exiting the airport and meeting our driver that his wallet was missing. We had no idea if it was stolen, lost, where it was, etc. The driver immediately encouraged us to go back to the American Airlines office in the airport which was quite a feat given the language barrier. By the time my husband got upstairs to AA, his wallet had already been turned in and was waiting for him there with nothing missing. You can imagine the heart-pounding anxiety of losing your wallet, which basically contains your life, in a foreign country. A real vacation killer. So thank you for whoever was involved in returning the wallet. You have no idea how grateful I am. Second, my daughter, a med student in the Chicago area, recently flew to Cameroon, Africa on a trip to bring medical supplies to a surgeon and work with him in the small towns and villages. As part of the trip, she was bringing a large duffle bag filled with prescription meds, surgical gear, etc. at her own expense. The baggage person at American at O'Hare grew very quiet and had to enter every item in the bag onto a form. She was very concerned about not being allowed to bring the items, as this was a requirement of the trip. She was amazed and surprised when the $360 baggage fee was waived by American Airlines because they had a heart and recognized the humanitarian mission in the trip.

Name: H Haymes
Review: Not Verified |  Newark to Ontario via Phoenix. Never flying this airline again, not only did it take a ridiculous amount of time to get in the air due to unorganized staff, half the people on my flight missed their connection flights. I almost missed mine due to a last second gate change, ran across the airport thinking I had 5 minutes to get on my plane like the first attendant told me, then get to the new gate to be told we’ll be having another hour wait because they are having a maintenance problem. Horrible!

Review_Heading: "I believe is the best at CS"
Name: Bryan Pearson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Orlando. Thought I’d write a good review. American Airlines I believe is the best at CS and accommodating there passengers. It’s a very challenging business to keep everyone happy. More people should stop and think before they write bad reviews? It still beats driving! Give them a break.

Name: T Beale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Francisco to Charlotte via To Orlando. Plane was delayed due to “uncontrollable circumstances” so we missed our next flight and it couldn’t be rescheduled til the next day 7 hours later. They gave us a new flight “for free” and a “discount coupon” to a hotel for 120$ per night plus we had to pay 25$ taxi fares each trip. About 50+ people or more seemed to have the same problem. They told us and everyone else it wasn’t their fault and that there would be no compensation for our lost time or our troubles nor would they pay for a hotel for us. What terrible customer service.
route: San Francisco to Charlotte via To Orlando

Name: Andrei Rechkov
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I bought 2 tickets 02/02/19 for non stop flight from New York to Las Vegas at 05/04/19 and back 05/09/19. Approx 2 weeks prior depature, I got a notice my flights canceled by email. As a result, I and my wife had 1 stop flights in both directions. It was my Birthday, and I was very upset. Never use American Airlines!
route: New York JFK to Las Vegas

Name: D Reynolds
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Flight 2616 from Oklahoma City to Dallas late on 5/17/19 - can't make connecting flight and no additional connectors available that day. Either rebook for next day or stay the night at DFW at our expense as per AA customer representative. So we rebook for same flight 5/18/19. Flight is subsequently cancelled the eve of flight. At this point I've given up on AA to get a plane in the air. Paid significant money to get a one way flight on Southwest Airlines and made it home only a day late. I would still be in OKC or DFW as of 5/20/19 if I stuck with AA as their 5/19/19 rebook was also too late to make connecting flight. Very poor service - at least between OKC & DFW. Can't recommend AA for getting to and from OKC.

Name: J Heany
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Birmingham to Lubbock via Dallas. I had a flight at 5:40 AM, I was contacted the night before and told my flight had been cancelled. I did not receive a explanation as to why. Weather was beautiful all day! They rescheduled it for 5:40PM, the flight was then delayed because American airlines did not have enough ground men to bring the arriving plane in. The plane sat there well over 45 minutes until finally assisted. Not to mention those passengers had to sit on that plane with no AC. So when we get on the AC is still out so we have to bring a mechanic and it delays it by another 20-30 minutes. I miss my connecting flight and try standing in line to reschedule another flight, we stood there around 30 minutes before anyone ever assisted us. Finally someone assisted the lady in front of me, when it was my turn he walked away. I asked where he was going, which I had about 10 people behind me, and he said I gotta go! No explanation, so I waited about another 30 minutes before I was finally helped, and when I was helped they acted like I was the one causing the problems. It’s just all around an awful experience! Wouldn’t recommend it for anyone! Customer service is the worst of any airline i’ve ever been on!

Name: James Jackson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Barcelona to Washington via Miami. I will avoid flying American Airlines. May 19th, my wife and I arrived at the Miami from Barcelona, Spain in route to our final destination of Washington,DC. In Barcelona, we were asked to check our Carry On baggage due to the expectation that the overhead storage was already full. Upon arrival in Miami, our connecting flight to Washington was delayed from 3:53 pm to 5:20 due to issues with the two bathrooms on the plane. The pilot gave everyone the opportunity to step off the plane until the problem was resolved my maintenance. One of the AA gate attendance began arguing with customers for leaving the plane even though we explained to him that this was something approved by the captain. We arrived in Washington, DC to be told that our carry on bags did not arrive with our plane. Even after over an hour delay, the bags didn’t get placed on the plane. This is unacceptable. On May 20th we were contacted by American Airlines that so far they only have 1 of the missing bags in Washington, DC even though the bag tracker shows they both did in fact arrive in DC. We were also told that it would be as late as 4pm today (the next day) that we would receive the 1 bag. I am currently on hold right now with American Airlines after waiting over an hour to speak with a representative to find out the status of my 2nd bag. This is by far one of the worse flight experiences for my wife and I. I will add that much of this is also due to the overall poor customer service given throughout the entire Miami, FL airport. But, unfortunately American Airlines is a Primary flight provider there. I will go with other options going forward. This is a poorly run organization and it continued all the way to Washington, DC

Name: A Windham
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Nashville to Charlotte. Only fly American if you don’t mind not making it to your final destination on time. I had a flight out it STL that was cancelled, they couldn’t get me on another plan until a day later very late at night. I stood in line to talk with the attendants for over an hour only to be talked two for 2 minutes and basically forced out of line after being told “I was lucky I even got the (rebooked) flight I did get.” The attendant was beyond rude for someone who is just trying to reach their destination after their flight being cancelled due to an unknown delay.

Name: Cynthia Winters
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I purchased an upgraded, more expensive round trip ticket from American Airlines to Yuma, from Phoenix AZ. When I arrived at Phoenix/Mesa I was shocked to find myself at the wrong airport. My flight to Yuma would be leaving from Sky Harbor, 35 min away. Luckily, with the help of an amazing security guard at Mesa, who helped me find the app and get a Lyft ride, I made my connection. However, my return flight schedules would not allow for that 35 min ride between flights. So I went to the desk at Sky Harbor and asked for help. They told me, no problem, I should be able to fly standby on the 6:30 am flight in Yuma so I could make my connection. They said it would cost an extra $75. Not so bad. Three days later I arrived before the Yuma AA agent and asked to fly standby on the 6:30 am flight. The agent and supervisor said, "No" I did not purchase an upgraded ticket and "No", I could not fly standby, I would have to purchase another ticket for $230. They were flat out unconcerned, bordering on rude, and unwilling to find a solution for me. I was absolutely stuck and had to purchase the ticket. The worst part of this is that everyone I spoke to from the security guards to desk agents, said of the airport confusion, "This always happens," and from a relative of an American Airlines family member, "American Airlines is in trouble for the terrible customer service." It does seem that it's all about money. I will never fly American again, and it's unfortunate because they are the only airline in Yuma, I will never fly through Yuma airport either.
route: Phoenix/Mesa to Yuma via Sky Harbor

Name: TN Nguyen
Review: ❎ Not Verified | Toronto to Baton Rouge via Dallas. This airline is so poor. They have cancelled my flight at the last minute which has made me miss my meeting in Baton Rouge, and when I tried to call customer service, the wait was more than 3 hours. What kind of service is this? Definitely would not recommend this to anyone. Avoid this at all cost. Zero stars is all the deserve.
route: Toronto to Baton Rouge via Dallas

Name: Alexis Parodi
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Gulfport to Orlando via Charlotte. The worst experience with this company, I have flown many time with American as well as with Delta and United but I have had the worst experience with American. Customer service reps don't care, they don't sympathize and it seems like they don't want to help. I asked a desk lady why my flight was delayed 3 times and she said that she just got to the job and she didn't know. My best bet was to go to AA.COM and find out. I did so but there is no info about why my flight is delayed. The time was 10:30 pm changed to 11:00, 11:30, now is at 2:30am. No apologies for no info just a yes it's delayed. The flight from Gulfport to Charlotte had wifi but you couldn't even watch a movie because it's very slow. Never again.

Name: E Carson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Phoenix to Santa Rosa. Last time I flew my plane was delayed until 2 in the morning. I didn’t have high hopes for this flight and it has now been delayed twice (2 hours each.) I wouldn’t be surprised if I wait until boarding time and they cancel the flight. This is the worst airline ever! Don’t count on being reassured that you will depart on time or at all with this airline.

Name: K Sumner
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Nashville to Chicago. No customer service at the airport. AA employees are always frustrated and have no intention to help you. They toss you around 3 or 4 different queues. Different ones of kiosk, baggage, service. You have to go to all those queues in mysterious sequence. Staff wont really help neither there are any signs. Missed or delayed flights every single time I boarded American. Best of luck. I am never taking AA ever again.

Name: Dawn Trout
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Montego Bay to Fort Wayne via Charlotte. I have flown with American airlines 4 times and this was the worst. Got notification that our flight from Jamaica to Charlotte was delayed by an hour. Once we got to the airport it was an hour and a half and we miss our connection in Charlotte by 5min. Couldn't just let me stay in Jamaica another day. Need to give more notice for this. I had to spend the night in Charlotte. Not happy at all. Couldn't hold that flight to Fort Wayne being it was their fault or book another one. I know they got enough planes. Had to wait until 1130 the next morning and of course it was over booked they said. But once on the plane there where open seats. I paid in advance for upgrade seating and of course with this flight my husband and i didn't even get to sit together. Don't think I will be flying with them any more.
route: Montego Bay to Fort Wayne via Charlotte

Name: H Grey
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Hong Kong to Portland via Dallas. American Airlines should be embarrassed with their International First Class product. I flew on their longest nonstop flight from Hong Kong to Dallas and the experience was mediocre at best. The few positives were a friendly cabin crew and the actual seat itself, which has a lot of room and adjustments. But these good points are overshadowed by miserable selection of food and drink. Upon boarding, we were brought cold, stale almonds and cheap champagne that cost maybe ten bucks a bottle. After takeoff, we were rushed thru our meal because of "upcoming turbulence." My beef filet was an inedible mass of gristle and the ice cream sundae was completely melted. The promised "Open Snack Bar" was nothing but a bag of chips and disgusting cold sandwiches. The breakfast served before landing was OK. The Purser on the flight actually apologized to the eight passengers in First Class for the sorry food and drink stating that "There have been some unfortunate cutbacks." The wifi did not work and the entertainment system was so slow that I gave up and just used the map. I will be cutting back my business with AA after this terrible experience.
route: Hong Kong to Portland via Dallas

Name: Dawn Garces
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Los Angeles. My original flight from CUN to connect in MIA for LAX was delayed 3+ hours and I was offered several alternate options. Once I arrived in MIA there was confusion amongst the staff with some telling us we missed our flight when it was actually delayed. Not one person empathized with my situation. I was repeatedly told there is nothing I can do because of the ticket type purchased. I was given a boarding pass for the following morning at 9am but was never told it was a standby until I realized at boarding time I had no assigned seat. Well didn’t make that flight either and still no one empathetic. No offers for options of which there were plenty just the same flight 2nd flt on stand by AGAIN was delayed from 1230 to 2pm. And then no on board amenities ie. charging station

Name: P Skogen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Denver to Dallas. Worst experience ever - arrived 55 min before the flight and since we needed seat assignments the agent at the kiosks directed us to get in line for the main ticket counter. There were a couple of people ahead of us and the agent came out from behind the desk and started asking everyone why they were in line. I told her the window was closing for us to check in, but she continued to go person by person to see why they were in line, rudely asking why they were in line and condescendingly telling them to use the kiosk or that she couldn’t help them, instead of just taking customers in the order they were in line. She completely ignored us and the fact that the minimum 45 minutes was ending. She went back behind the counter and after a bit called someone from the priority line (they had a dedicated rep handling their line) she was incredibly rude and intentionally delaying helping us. When we finally were called up, she very coldly told us we were too late and that we should have used the kiosk. We told her that we were told to get in the line- were actually escorted there and she said, well I will have a talk with that agent. She put us on another flight leaving 2 hours later but did not tell us that we were on standby. We found out when we trying to get seat assignments. No go. Talked to a supervisor - no help. Told this is what you get with economy tickets - ridiculous how we were treated. Never experienced this with Delta or United. Finally got on a flight and were told as we were walking on that there was no overhead bin space left and would have to check bags-even made a lady get off the plane to check hers - when we got on the plane there were tons of open bins- some completely empty! Unbelievable- and so rude and the flight attendant said that’s what you get with an economy ticket- which is not true - carry ons are included. Will never get my business again - rather pay triple to another airline that treats all of their passengers like human beings.

Name: W Stone
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New York to Washington. American Airlines used to be one of the better American (USA) companies. Now it is trash. They are absolutely incompetent. I was waiting for the screen to show the flight was boarding. Then a notice came up saying the flight was delayed 15 minutes. I happened to walk over to the counter anyways. If I had not I would have missed my flight! They never showed boarding. And the flight left on time. No explanation; only the typical American Airlines shoulder shrug.  You’re better off flying a budget airline in Europe than you are flying any American airline.

Name: Jamie Eller
Review: Not Verified |  Rochester to Orlando. Worst airline. We had multiple planes “break down” with mechanical issues which resulted in multiple delays. We watched as tons of people missed there connecting flights. The staff was incredibly rude and not helpful. We will never fly with American Airlines again.

Name: Carey Palm
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Albuquerque to Redmond via Phoenix/Los Angeles with Skywest Airlines as American Eagle and Compass Airlines as American Eagle. The absolute worst customer service I have ever experienced. Thank you SW and Alaskan airlines for  incredible and helpful customer service, I will always fly with you, never American Airlines again!
route: Albuquerque to Redmond via Phoenix/Los Angeles

Name: Robert E Gardner
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  LaGuardia to Pittsburgh. The employees of this airline are so bitter and angry. Their customers are a nuisance to them. They can often be overheard complaining about the customers and/or their schedules. On May 15 there was a customer who was made to check a bag when there was clearly space for her to bring it on. The flight attendant in first class referred to this customer as a bitch to her fellow flight attendant. Unacceptable.

Name: W Sawyer
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Rio de Janeiro. If there’s an award for least child friendly airline, American Airlines wins by a landslide. Their website claims they have bassinets on long haul flights which are first come first serve at the gate. Correction; only if you want to pay an extra $120 for it or pay even more to upgrade your seats. When I asked if the bassinet was available, the answer was “oh, people are already sitting in those seats and they aren’t going to want to ask them to move”. Great customer service. I was then lied to at the gate and told the bassinet was already claimed, but when I looked on the kiosk at the gate, those seats were available for a paid upgrade. Really helpful for me on an overnight 8 hour flight with an 8 month old baby. The icing on the cake is that they don’t even have priority boarding for families with small children. Holding my crying infant, they told me I had to “wait for my boarding group”. By the time we got to our seats, the overhead compartment was full above us, where we needed to access bottles, formula, and toys. I can deal with my crying child because your agents clearly have no empathy for an exhausted mother and baby, but who really paid the price is the rest of your passengers who got to listen to it all night. Nice to know you care more about the money for the upgrade of the bassinet over every passenger in economy class. I didn’t choose  to fly your airline, I had to because of sick in-laws and getting to Rio in time. Emirates Airline offers 2  bassinets in every section of 777 economy class, 6 in total, for no extra cost. They will switch adults without kids seats to accommodate families with babies and have priority boarding. A little empathy goes a long way, because traveling with a baby is stressful enough already. All I received from your desk agents and staff was a quick “no” without any effort to try and help. If avoidable I’ll never choose your airline again.

Name: J Neale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Columbus to Phoenix . I understand delays. I especially want the airline to make sure the aircraft is safe. However, when I got to Phoenix they had already delayed the flight to Honolulu from 1130am to 2pm. They said it was maintenance. After sitting for hours they said the plane left Dallas but had to return there for some reason. So at this point they have moved departure time to 3.30pm. This is a special trip for me. I dont have the extra money for this kind of trip. I saved for months so I could fly out and see my son who is serving in the army. I havent seen him in over a year! At this point I have already lost 5 hours with him. I'm pretty sure there will be no compensation.

Name: Jeff DeGolia
Review: Not Verified | San Francisco to Dallas. Yikes, 2091 bad reviews?! Well, here goes 2092. American Airlines is the single worst airline I have ever flown. I bought an itinerary to fly down to DFW from SFO on Friday to Sunday of this past weekend. I then had to be down there on Thursday night, I called American to see if they could help me switch my flight, they told me it would be cheaper to just buy another flight. So I bought the second flight (also through American mind you) on Thursday night. While this was frustrating, I understood that I bought an Economy ticket and they would not roll out the red carpet for me, so I am not mad about that. I took my Thursday night flight, actual flight itself wasn't terrible. $9 cocktails is a bit high but nothing too ridiculous. After I thoroughly enjoyed most of weekend in Dallas, I tried checking into my Sunday flight on Saturday night. It said the system was down and I would have to check-in in the morning, which happened to be the morning of my nephew and Godson's baptism. I tried checking in before the service, same issue. So I called American. They cancelled my itinerary. They cancelled my itinerary because I was a "no-show on my initial flight to Dallas." So I was stranded after I had flown to Dallas via American because American didn't know I was in Dallas - starting to see why I am so angry? Anyway, I was forced to miss the baptism party to make sure I could get back to SFO the same night and had to be on the phone with AA customer service. The AA customer service line had zero empathy for my situation and functionally told me to "we cant help you." So I decided to go to the airport and try to explain myself. I have never been treated like less of a human. It seems as if American has a training to make their customer service people as cold and heartless as physically possible to the economy passengers. I was forced to buy an additional $600 ticket to get home. Then, when my co-rider had the audacity to try to get on my flight as a standby passenger they told her that she would need to buy a new ticket as well. I would rather drive than ever fly American again. Terrible people working at a terrible, unethical company.

Name: Britni Dreher
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Denver to Phoenix. Considering all of these poor reviews, American very clearly does not care about their customers. My experience was awful. I missed a very important meeting because of a delay for who knows what reason and all I was met with was a condescending Supervisor. Save your money and fly a different airline. This one is truly terrible and will only look at you as money, not a person with very real life obligations and schedules. Their schedule is the only one that matters, not yours.

Name: Eric Crall
Review: Not Verified |  Chicago to Tampa. Fly this airline at your own risk of financial loss. I was stranded in Chicago due to random flight cancellation due to the Boeing 737 max planes being grounded. I was not offered a return flight until the following day so I arranged a different airline to get home same day and American would not issue a refund. This is quite unbelievable and unacceptable. I would not fly this airline when you risk financial loss due to circumstances beyond your control

Name: J Davids
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | After boarding, a flight attendant went around with less than ten earphones for the entire plane. Then he told a few seated people that he ran out of headphones before getting on his phone. We were then told by the captain that he was waiting for permission to get cargo tape on a pipe, which he assured us would not heavily impact the safety of the flight. We waited nearly two hours before they got permission to put cargo tape on a pipe (which for some reason, they couldn't resolve before we boarded). After an additional half hour, the airplane pipe was taped and we finally took off. The attendants were on their phone for most of this time. So, no earphones for more than half the plane's passengers for any way to pass the time and take our minds off the fact that most of us were getting dangerously close to miss our connecting flights (we were in Costa Rica, traveling to Miami on our way to our final destination). When we landed, no one from AA helped those with connecting flights get through the lines quickly or showed any concern or support for their customer's schedules. After waiting in long, stressful lines where all my family and I could do was watch precious minutes slip away (and watch other fellow passengers of our flight stress in line after also being abandoned by AA), we ran to our flight and arrived 5 min before departure time only to be told that the plane had left (we could see it from the window) and that we should go to customer service. 10 min later, I watched the plane carrying our checked luggage (and our clothes and toiletries) take flight. At AA's customer service, we were subjected to a 4 hour wait despite the numerous reps behind the counter (only one was receiving customers). Finally, at midnight, we were told that the next available flight wasn't until the next evening. 3 out of 4 of us had to call out an extra day of work because of this. When we bought a travel package through an independent company and saw that they had booked us with AA, I had misgivings. After my experience with them, I am regretful that I didn't listen to my own misgivings, the news, and the hundreds of voices against AA.
route: Liberia, Costa Rica to Miami, Florida via Chicago

Name: Keia L Moore
Review: Not Verified |  Phoenix to Las Vegas. The gate agents are horrible. They asked for volunteers to get on a later flight and I was the second one to volunteer and they chose the others before me. I already had delayed flights and cancelled flights and the gate agent was knew I had volunteered. Why not give the vouchers to those by order of who was there first instead of whether you like the person or not. I’ll never fly with them again.

Name: J Faasavalu
Review:
✅ Trip Verified |  
Phoenix to Salt Lake City. American Airlines sucks. They delayed our flight by four hours and since we were “group 9” we were forced to check our bags. They let so many people go on standby who used our compartment there wasn’t room for our bags. Only fly this airline if you want to feel like a second class citizen, like your money wasn’t good enough for them!

Name: S Heale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Memphis to Philadelphia. I was able to get on an earlier flight because I made it to the airport on time. Except they wouldn't let me switch because I wasn't economy. It's mother's day and now I'll miss the first mother's day with my wife after having our first child. Thanks American Airlines.

Name: Tatyana Korolev
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Phoenix to Sacramento. I do not recommend this airline. If you like unhappy and unhelpful crew,  then this is your airline. If not then please make your life easy and choose another. I felt sick on the flight and the crew member did not allow me to walk up to her to ask for water she just told me to wait. Anyway they are absolutely disrespectful and rude. Our next flight apparently my luggage was to big and she made a whole scene. How in the world?

Name: Josh Randolph
Review: Not Verified |  Our flight was scheduled to depart at 12:15 am. We didn’t board the plan until 12:45 am, but after being on the plane we were told the flight was canceled due to missing pilot. We were given papers with a number to call and told they could help us reschedule our flight and set up hotel commendations. I called the number and they moved my flight to 7am flying into Orlando, but they told me I would have to talk to someone at the gate desk to secure a hotel. I am now waiting in a line of 40 other passengers not happy about this service.
route: Salt Lake City to Daytona beach

Name: Caleb Lowe
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  London to Los Angeles. First time flyer with American Airlines so was unsure what to expect. Aircraft was quite new so was spacious, clean and bright. Booked exit seats which was a really good decision. No one seated in front and as much leg room as required, more than in PE. Crew very professional, helpful and attentive. The only thing that prevents me giving 10/10 was the food which was average at best. Would have no hesitation in booking again.

Name: P Dalhan
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Boston to La Guardia. Worst airline. Bad customer service. La Guardia gate staff is the rudest of all the airports I’ve been too ( I travel weekly). Planes are always late. Plane has not once been on time to La Guardia. Delays to and from there constantly. Planes are old and need more time for maintenance.

Name: S Neal
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Worst around trip I have ever taken. Went from Tallahassee  to Newport News VA for my daughter’s graduation. First flight got delayed for maintenance issues, so they said. Lost my connection and since it was the last flight of the night had to flight the next day. We were given an voucher and taken to hotel( more like a motel) and also given food vouchers to use at the airport that by the way we could not use since it was late and all food places at the airport were close. In the return flight we asked about seat changes since AA wants to charge for that. If you have a reservation you would expect for the seats to be together. But not AA randomly pick your seats to force to pay for that option. Met three couples and every single of them had the same problem. But asked again and there was plenty of unassigned seats but they were not available unless you pay for them, to late give them to standby passengers. Lucky we found people that change seats with us. Not thanks to AA. Return flight was delayed again! Customer service and attendants were rude and not willing to help anyone. But if you show some character here you go out of the plane. AA is there because Is a service needed, not because the good service provided.

Name: T Garmin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Boston to Washington. This is the worst airline ever. Our flight has been canceled all day (today is 5/12/19). A bunch of folks were supposed to board a 9 am flight, every flight has been canceled since this morning, including the 3pm flight we were supposed to board.  A waste of people's time and money.

Name: L Canada
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Lexington. Arrived at the airport 42 minutes before my flight with literally zero people in the security line, but AA refused to allow me to board because I had a checked-sized bag. Despite having plenty of time, the agent first lied to me about why she couldn’t check my bag and said my only option was to go without my bag. I said it was no problem if my bag came late I just needed to make Mother’s Day dinner and wanted to board. She would not check my back on a later flight and said AA won’t do that. I said I would go without my bag and my husband could pick up my bag from security. They said you can’t leave without your bag and threatened to call the police on me if I did so! So, I couldn’t fly with my bag, have my bag come on a later flight, OR have my bag picked up. I had no option but to leave the airport since I was refused boarding for being 3 minutes late with no security line (and I’m precheck.) I missed Mother’s Day dinner with my family and will not ever give AA one single dime in the future. I’ll stick with Southwest even though it’s an hour from my family’s town. AA customer service is absolutely horrendous.

Name: Melissa Gonzalez Lopez
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Denver to Tallahassee via Dallas Fort Worth. It all started when we first got to Denver. They forgot our bag in Tallahassee and had to wait until the next day to get it. When it comes time to flight back to Tallahassee, our first flight gets delayed twice, to the point that it arrived 8 minutes before our connection flight left for Tallahassee. Of course we missed it, it couldn't account for those who had a flight before. When we asked for a compensation, the people that work for American said that since it was due to "weather" they couldn't compensate. But, how are we supposed to know how the weather is going to look like? After that we had to wait at the airport for over 12 hours for the next flight to Tallahassee. We had to sleep on the floor, not even a single blanket was provided. What I don't understand is why did we have to be treated so inhumanely when it wasn't even our mistake. They just blame everything on the "weather" and not even respect people's rights. Will never fly through this airline again.
route: Denver to Tallahassee via Dallas Fort Worth

Name: Alex Montas
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Detroit. American airlines is the worst airline! I always flight Delta, every time I fly American Airlines the flight gets delayed many hours or gets canceled. They say nonsense things about how the airplane was defective but that it wasn't their fault, and because of that they couldn't reimburse us. Do not fly American Airlines.

Name: K Doyle
Review: Not Verified |  These guys just don’t get it! They cancelled my flight approx 10 hours prior to departure with no reason given. When rebooking they were unable to accommodate me at all on the same day of intended travel. My original flight was at 5am yet they could not send me anywhere at all that day. I was forced to spend an entire day and additional night (with hotel cost) before I could get home. After communicating with them, the reason for the cancellation (which the AA rep on the phone was unable to provide at the time) was weather. There were no weather issue at any of my travel points. Seems extremely convenient for them that the reason is also the one they claim to have no control over. So sad we can’t just get the truth from these legacy carriers. They refuse to own their issues.

Name: S Rodriguez
Review:
Not Verified |  
Dallas to Salt Lake City. What a joke of an airline. We bought our tickets in January and payed additional fees to select seats with more leg room. The agent for our first flight was kind enough to give us similar seats but we were told we would have to get our seats figured out with an agent at the following location. We were also told our bags would be forwarded to our final destination so there was no need to pick them up. That was a lie. Luckily, my husband had a feeling he should check and grabbed them. Then we spoke to an agent to get our boarding passes with the seats we payed for, she was rude and acted as if I was entitled for asking for what I payed for. Finally, she said she couldn’t assign us a seat and we would have to speak to an agent at the gate who would be there about an hour before boarding. No one showed up until 15 minutes before boarding was to start. The agent acted as if he was doing us a favor by saying he could get us on the flight. The seats we pre-selected and payed for were already taken. They couldn’t even offer us seats together. To top things off, the flight was delayed due to a no-show pilot. I travel fairly often and have never had a similar experience. We have never been refused seats we have selected online, much less ones we’ve payed extra for. I will never travel American again. I prefer to pay extra to fly with a company that can be trusted.

Name: Melissa Taylor
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Raleigh Durham to Dallas Ft Worth. Flight out of DFW going to Puerto Vallarta cancelled due to “weather” but storms had stopped several hours before our second scheduled flight was supposed to leave. Lost one night’s vacation and had to pay for hotel. Was not going to spend the night in the cold airport. We don’t believe weather was the issue. Not customer oriented. We think only doing what is best for the business. Not satisfied!
route: Raleigh Durham to Dallas Ft Worth

Name: B Garleman
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Raleigh to Las Vegas. I can’t explain the terrible customer service I’ve encountered throughout the day and into the night. Let’s just say, American Airlines will be the very last resort for future travels or not travel at all. The countless very unprofessional encounter with AA agents throughout this unforgettable experience push me to this extreme decision. Additionally, the extremely delayed updates i received to make informed decisions did not help in any way it just made this worst and I mean that in all forms (via email, text, gate agents, etc.) Bottom line is, it will take some convincing for me to change my point of view towards this airline. There are better options.

Name: Sarah Luedtke
Review: Not Verified |  I have had such poor experiences with American Airlines. Left out of Nashville on Monday and was delayed over an hour in Nashville because of plane issues, missed my connecting flight in Chicago and had to rebook, fortunately I could get on the next flight to Denver. Coming home from Denver flight left on time to Chicago now still sitting in Chicago over an hour after we were supposed to take off. Gate change 3 times. Plane has finally arrived but hasn’t gotten to the gate yet. Again plane issues for the delay. Time has changed for departure 4 times in the last hour and a half. Last Christmas was leaving to go home from Christmas holidays in Wisconsin and had 3 planes that had mechanical issues and hadn’t found a plane to replace. Airline rebooked my flight 3 times that day when I finally said put on tomorrow’s flight. Sure was a sign I shouldn’t go that day. Guess my biggest complaint is all these planes had mechanical issues before anyone could board. Yes good they found the problem before it got in the air but they should be inspecting these planes and maintaining them what better than what they do. Charge passengers a ton of money to flight and then all you can do is sit and wait. No compensation or airlines held accountable.

Review_Heading: "Expected to sit in airport for 36 hours"
Name: Michael Chalkey
Review: Not Verified |  There was a small thunderstorm in Charlotte NC so we sat on tarmac for 1.5 hours waiting for lightning to clear, totally understandable. Our connecting flight that leaves at 5.53 delayed till 7.30 then canceled due to weather, also understandable, rebooked and new plane leaves at 10.30. Delayed 6 times, canceled at 2am for no pilot, rebooked for 8 pm next day (not to Detroit to Toledo) on standby for 9.20 am flight. That was canceled for maintenance. 8.15 flight was delayed once and then canceled then booked for 5.22 am on Monday, not to Detroit, to Toledo. Wife in wheelchair whole time, no food voucher or hotel voucher offer. Expected to sit in airport for 36 hours and then don't even fly home to my state! Wont offer any reimbursement because it was weather related although only first flight was weather related. Horrible service!
route: Montego Bay to Charlotte via Detroit

Name: B Merton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  We were scheduled to fly from Miami to Orlando on May 6 2019, the flight was to depart at 3.30. Everything was fine we were just minutes from boarding, the previous flight had just deplaned and then a storm hit. The announcement was made that we were going to be delayed for an hour so we returned to the club. We arrived at the club and then received a text that the flight had been cancelled. We all have smart phones and can look at the radar and know that the storm had passed and the air had cleared up. I believe the flight was cancelled because of a mechanical issue and not weather related but to blame the weather keeps American from having to find hotel rooms for all the passengers effected. I went to the desk at the club to receive some help with getting us rebooked. The American airlines staff that I dealt with were less than professional or helpful. She actually told me to rent a car and drive to Orlando. (Well if I wanted to do that I wouldn't have contracted with American Airlines would I). She did get us on the stand by list for the 5:30pm flight. We arrived at the gate and were number 15 and 16 on the list, the gate agent was very nice and said he would do what he could to get us on the flight. The plane boarded and he called us to the gate and was able to get us on the plane. He said he couldn't get us in first class we were thankful to be on the flight. After a few minutes and first class being empty with the exception of a couple of seats our names were called and we were moved up to first class. American did finally rebook us for the next day on 2 different flights, we are just thankful we went stanby and were able to get home a bit late the same day.

Name: Dave Benton
Review: Not Verified |  I had a flight from Dallas to San Diego and it was cancelled due to no pilots showing up after we sat on the plane for an hour. So I got another flight # 348 to Orange County and again no pilots. Sat in the plane for almost two hours. Flight was cancelled again. No offer from AA to put us up in a hotel. I will never fly American Airlines again.

Name: J Richard
Review: Not Verified | Pittsburgh to Tampa. Every single time I try and fly American Airlines, my flight gets cancelled and rebooked and cancelled again at least 4 times, resulting in my missing extremely important events which were the whole reason I was flying to begin with. I have literally never taken an American Airlines flight that was not cancelled multiple times after 4 plus hours of delays first. I missed my grandmother's funeral in July, and missed half of my vacation and a religious holiday planned with my family last month. American Airlines never offered lodging even though both times our flights were cancelled and not rebooked until the following day. American has also not gotten back to me after multiple official refund requests for tickets and seat upgrades on flights I never took. They really need to their stuff together before they run themselves into the ground. For a major airline to have such horrible logistics issues is embarrassing, and for them to not make any effort to even respond to refund requests is even worse. I have now spent over $3,000 on booking tickets through another airline, rebooking, baggage fees, overnight stays at hotels and rental cards I should not have had to spend if my flights would have just taken off as planned. Oh and missing my grandmothers funeral after paying $3k for those plane tickets alone is not fun either.

Name: G Meares
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Atlanta. You have to love a airline who creates a delay, placing your flight over 2 hours later then planned, then says there is another previously delayed flight that will get you to your destination at the original projected time. But you have to pay $75 for the convenience of changing flights. How does this make sense? American Airlines is a low rent, low-amenity company that is not worth saving $30-50 over Delta for what you lose.

Name: S Klein
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Tampa to Vancouver via Dallas. Our first flight with AA was delayed from Tampa by almost an hour and then our connection flight from Dallas would not wait for our whole party of 6 before closing the doors by 30 seconds. Two of us were already at the gate and told American Airlines that the others in our party are running and they closed the door and yelled at me that they will call the security if I stayed there. The other 4 literally got there late because they were at the back of the plane on the primary flight and had to wait to deplane. This was the last flight out of Dallas for the day and we were told on our primary flight that because there were so many people on the primary flight with connections that the 2nd flight would most likely wait. They refuse to wait the extra 30 seconds for all of us to get there and told us they can’t help us and send us to rebook at 12 midnight. Very poor customer service.

Name: Liza Moore
Review: Not Verified |  So disappointed with American Airlines. We have been loyal customers for 15 years and were recently notified that our card was hacked through their system and 150,000 miles were stolen. Instead of going after the perpetrators, they let us know that we had to file a police report and that they could not help us. We repeatedly asked to have them call us to discuss the matter and they would only email. The one person my husband was able to talk to told him "you should reply to the email so they know you are responsive, and they will take you more serious." We have never had such an ordeal with any company we have done business with. Customers for 15 years and that doesn't make a bit of difference. Such a shame. We have had to take matters into our own hands. I know this is actually a huge problem with American Airlines and having miles stolen as I have heard similar stories. They should think about better security and help support the loyal customers they have. I have been so upset about this, that I had to take time out of my day to write this review, and it is the first time in my life I have ever had to write something negative about a company. Warning to anyone doing business with American Airlines - beware!

Name: Rivka Bennun
Review: Not Verified |  We took off from New York Monday evening with the expectation that we would arrive in London at a specific time to make our connecting flight an hour and a half later to Tel Aviv. However, we got delayed an hour at JFK because of “problems with the engine”. In the past three or four times that I’ve flown with American, they’ve had “problems with the engine”.  We missed our flight to Tel Aviv and had to find a new one, and it caused us to miss Israel’s national Memorial Day, which was one of the primary reasons we wanted to go at this time of year. This is not our first experience with American, but it is certainly our last. I am never flying this airline again. To their credit, the flight itself was comfortable.

Name: A Karabin
Review: Not Verified |  Fresno to Bradley. Flight was canceled twice on return trip, then a connected flight was delayed. Second connection flight from Phoenix to Chicago seated in different row than spouse when they assigned seats and when asked at the counter to be seated together the attitude of agent was “oh well that happens” and could not do anything and uninterested in helping. This along with the attitude of other staff reminded me why I dislike using American Airlines.

Review_Heading: "I am now going to avoid American Airlines"
Name: Brittni Wedel
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Los Angeles to Puerto Vallarta. Went to get on my flight and the flight attendant made me give up my carry on as he said there was no over head space. After I got on the flight it was clear that was not the case. I went back to the gate to get my bag to take back on the flight and would not let me do so since he had already tagged it. I tried to say that did not make sense as it was my bag and if it is with the owner they would not have any issues with me accusing the airline of misplacing my bag. After being extremely rude he then stated okay fine we can put you on the next flight. Uncalled for. Airlines should screen for staff to have better manners. Things like this is why upsetting things happen on planes and people stop flying with those companies. I will say I am now going to avoid American Airlines at all cost.

Name: S Karniska
Review:
✅ Trip Verified |  
Chicago to London. The worst company ever. This was my second flight with them and definitely last one. Never ever again. Lesson learned. My flight had been cancelled and when I took my rebooked a flight for the next day I had been downgraded from premium economy to economy. Very rude staff not willing to explain anything. They gave me $300 voucher for downgrade which you can’t even used online. When I told them I won’t be able to use it they said it was all they can do. Don’t used American Airlines, I would give them 0 as overall score unfortunately the lowest one is 1.

Name: Nicolas Maiquez
Review: Not Verified |  Buenos Aires to Miami. Not so nice staff, from the airport to the plane. Everyone looked indifferent, like they are just there for the money. Food onboard was okay, not a big of a deal. I have been flying with this airline a few times already. Seats are fine, just like any other airline in the market, same as the entertainment.

Name: Rodney Reddell
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Hong Kong. I booked a ticket from DFW to HKG to RMQ for April 22, 2019, The first leg was Business Class and the second was First Class. Flight was 4 hours late leaving Dallas which caused me to miss my connection in Hong Kong. I was scheduled to arrive in Taiwan on the 23rd and had a driver scheduled to pick me up at the airport and my hotel reservations for that night, as well as meetings scheduled for the 24th. When I arrived in Hong Kong I had to spend 16 hours there waiting for the flight out that American scheduled for the next day since their delay caused me to miss my connection. They booked me in economy class. I had to spend about three hours trying to reschedule my driver and hotel reservations in Taiwan and missed my meetings scheduled for the 24th because I did not arrive until 2 PM. I understand flight delays are normal but in this case it caused me an enormous amount of stress rescheduling everything and missing a day of work and meetings, when I spoke to American Airlines they offered me a $200 evoucher which is pocket change and an insult for the amount of time lost here. I would've been happy with someone acting as if my time lost and stress actually meant something instead of the mechanical response you get from the customer service team at American Airlines. I have learned maybe its time to switch back to United Airlines and MileagePlus.

Name: Suzanne Chapman
