Review: Not Verified |  Awful. Do not pay to upgrade to a better seat! I paid $200 to upgrade to better seats. The ‘better’ seats—were both broken. International flight—upgraded seats were worse than original seats. For $200, received less legroom than regular seats. Since our broken seats were locked upright for 9 hours, but the seats in front of us reclined steeply into our laps, knees and feet. Air stewards very sympathetic. Mostly because it was not their problem. AA could not have cared less. No upgraded seats and no refund for upgrading to broken seats courtesy of AA lousy maintenance. Seat in front killed my knees—which one has come to expect. But when one pays for upgraded seats and does not receive them and are not reimbursed for not receiving them, it is fraud. They want me to take a $100 voucher rather than make it right. What is the point of a voucher if one is never going to fly this airline again? Never again. I’ll connect rather than ever deal with this horrible airline ever again. Worst international ever.

Name: J Hannah
Review: Not Verified |  Frankfurt to Charlotte. Given that there were 300+/- passengers on my international flight from Frankfurt to Charlotte, NC, there were only 4 of us on the flight who were unable to have audio on the flight, making it impossible to watch the entertainment provided to all the others during a 9 hour flight. I was told that, if we were American Advantage customers, we would be compensated with points. Just found out that the compensation of points for 9 miserable hours was 5000 points which won't come close to getting even a domestic ticket, much less compensating for the 9 hour flight. I have flown this route 4 times in the last 6 months and each time it strikes me how "old" and not well-maintained the aircraft seem to be. I will be looking for another airline for my next trip due to the poor customer service.

Name: S Kordan
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Diego to Detroit. Worst flight I have ever been on. Worst customer service I have ever dealt with. My original flight was supposed to take me to Chicago, then to Toledo. Those flights got delayed, and there were no other flights to Toledo for the night. They suggested that I take the flight to Chicago and be stranded there for the night, making it very clear they would not pay for a hotel nor meals. I had them switch my flights around so I would go to Phoenix and then Detroit, which would get me an hour further from home but at least I wouldn't need to find somewhere to stay. Again, flights kept getting delayed. I was concerned I would miss my connecting flight from Phoenix to Detroit so I asked the lady working at the gate counter about it and she spoke to me for condescending.  She wasn't good at hiding her facial expressions. She talked to me like I was a child and was wasting her time. There was nobody behind me waiting to be helped, so it is not like she was even busy. She clearly does not need to be working in customer service. After I got to Phoenix, they boarded us on time to leave for Detroit, then had us sitting on the plane delayed for almost two hours with very few updates. Finally we figured out that something needed fixed on one of the planes wings, and it took this long to get someone there to fix it. Why board us all on a plane that may not even be operational in the first place, not sure. On top of all that, they gave us an old plane that we were unable to charge any of our devices on, AND I had a seat that did not move at all. So I got to be uncomfortable the entire flight with no form of entertainment. At one point I got up to get my sweatpants out of my bag because it was very cold, and the flight attendant just glared at me as if I was doing something wrong. I will never be booking with AA again. What was supposed to be a 6 hour trip turned into almost 20. Very poor customer service. I would give it a 0 star rating if I could.

Name: Enrico Sim
Review: Not Verified |  Wow - what a way to tell your customer that you don't care about them. 3 flights within 12 months to the same destination to see our daughter at university in St. Kitts at Ross University and American tells me that they have the "right" to "scheduled changes" which seem to happen within 72 hours of the flight. So we pay top rate for the flight months in advance and then settle for a substitute flight with more stop overs for the same price last minute because we do not have any other choice. Well my daughter will be at Ross for another couple of years and when I cannot get a direct flight with Air Canada, I will book the British Airways flight from Buffalo (which is the solution I have to turn to when American Airlines AA cancels/alters/reschedules my flight last minute... again - remember happened 3 times). Buffalo flight has more connections but less issues than the AA American Airlines reschedule , cancelation , etc. BTW, after 2 hours on the phone with AA customers service I was told AA has 'the right" to treat me the way they do and they do not have to do anything to make it up to me. "So sad too bad". When I asked them what regulating body I could complain to m they said there is non and I could email the AA customer relations. Here is the problem with an unregulated industry. Choice is yours - good luck .

Name: D Sullivan
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Los Angeles to Bradley via Philadelphia. My flight has been delayed because the flight attendants were late leaving the hotel. I wish that was a joke, but just announced on the P.A. Get it together! This is a job, not social hour. The hotels at LAX are right here! I commute for a living and am early every day because of planning. Now I got a call that my connection may be in jeopardy? Come on American! And they no longer have nonstop Bradley to Los Angeles. Very sad. That's why I started flying this airline
route: Los Angeles to Bradley via Philadelphia

Name: Christine Teleshkin
Review: Not Verified |  Philadelphia to Miami. This airline is absolutely awful. Our flight was cancelled last minute and American did absolutely nothing to accommodate us. Do not fly. Our preplanned 3 month trip was ruined. We paid for an extra day at our resort that we never got to use. Thanks American for a great start to our honeymoon.

Name: S Roberts
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Miami to Charleston. This has been the worst experience ever. From the reservation manager, to the slow TSA check-in process, to the boarding agents! The customer service is poor! And thanks to American Airlines for placing me on numerous stand by flights, I had to to stay another unwanted night. The employees were rude and unhelpful. Never again will I fly with American Airlines! Terrible! Terrible! Oh, if you want to catch your flight, arrive 4 hours prior to your boarding time. The staff in the Miami International Airport are terrible.

Name: E Rakane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  American Airlines delayed my flight from Houston and when I got to Dallas, my connection flight gate was closed 12 mins before departure knowing full well I was running late from my other flight. The attendant showed a nonchalant attitude at the gate and simply told me to wait for the next flight in 5 hours and walked away. Very rude and unprofessional.

Name: B Wilson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Although we managed to check in online for this flight we were unable to select seats for our onward connecting flight to Heathrow with BA. So on arrival at the airport we joined the long queue for Customer Services. After several minutes a member of staff who was questioning people in the queue advised that our issue could be resolved by using one of the Self Service machines. So off to join another queue for a machine to become available. Unfortunately we were we unable to select seats or print Boarding Passes for our transatlantic flight. However we successfully managed to print off Boarding Passes for the MIA–YYZ sector. At the same time another piece of paper was output which stated that we could not print off our luggage tags as the connecting time in Toronto was too short. This despite the fact that the flights were booked over 6 months ago on the AA website. So back to the now longer queue for Customer Services. This queue moved very slowly and the number of agents dealing with passenger requests varied from two to five. Given the length of the line this was totally unacceptable. Well over two hours after arriving at the airport we actually managed to speak to someone who could help us. Our bags were eventually taken from us and tagged from MIA to YYZ to LHR. Once on board the flight was fine and departed and arrived on time. More stress at Toronto as it was not only necessary to pass through Immigration, but also pick up our bags, clear customs and then drop off the bags at the BA desk which had closed. Thankfully, a very understanding and helpful member of staff took pity on us. We managed to get to the gate just as the last passengers were boarding. The bottom line is that AA should never have booked these flights given the unacceptably short transit time in Toronto.

Name: P Gealen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Not a first time traveler, however this may have been one of my first times on American Airlines. It was the worst travel experience of my life. We get to national airport and wait for the flight. I look up and notice, there is a delay. No big deal I’ve had delays before. So we wait. Finally they are boarding. We get on the plane and taxi out to the runway. We stop, pilot announces we are delayed again because we can not get air to the engine. As we sit on the runway, there is no air being circulated through the vents. It’s hot and keeps getting hotter. The woman behind me tells the flight attendant we need air, you can’t keep us on the plane like this. After an hour like this, people are sweating and feeling faint. Another woman asks if her and her infant child can get off as it’s not safe for an infant. The flight attendants reply was “sorry, we are all hot. You’ll just have to deal till we get going”. After 2 hours in the incredible heat they allow us to deplane. It was such a relief walking back to the air conditioned terminal. I wouldn’t even leave my dog in the car like that for 2 hours but I suppose American Airlines doesn’t care about leaving a whole plane in the smoldering heat. Shame on them! Another delay followed by another delay. Now I’m getting worried as I do need to be in Orlando by 8:00 that morning. I know our flight choices will be limited if they end up canceling this AA flight. I saw a flight leaving Dulles ( 20 min drive away ) 10:30 pm. I asked the gate agent should I head to Dulles or what is the likelihood this plane is leaving tonight? He said hold tight. I asked if I can get my luggage so I can have a chance at another flight. He literally said to me “if you were Nancy Pelosi or Oprah we could give you your bags”. Hmm? So because I’m not a politician or a celebrity I don’t matter? Nice AA customer service right there! So we wait. Like he said our flight did leave that evening. I think we took off around 11:00. I know we landed in Orlando by 1:30am. After getting rental car, and drive to our hotel we made it to bed by 3:00am only to be up again at 6:00am. I honestly wasn’t going to write a review for this part but what comes next. I will never again fly American... We end up enjoying our stay in Orlando. We are set to fly out Monday April 29 3:00pm. Sunday night we are all packed up and checked in. Only to wake up to a text from American 7:00am stating our flights have been canceled. They can rebook us for a flight the following day. I can’t miss another day at work, the kids have to get to school. What about the rental car and hotel? I have to pay extra for this too? Frustrated I dial AA customer service to be greeted by a machine and prompted to speak to a robot till I can finally get an agent on the line. The agent tells me we can book you Tuesday or nothing at all. She is apologetic, however can’t do a thing to help me. She basically tells me that’s all I can do for you, have a nice day. I ask to speak with a supervisor. After a brief hold the supervisor gets on the line to tell me she can book a flight with another airline. Well at least now we are getting somewhere. She tries to book with Delta but during the booking she says the seats sold out. She says she can get me an AA flight landing in BWI which is an hour from my home, so will AA pay for that Uber ride? She says no, we’ll have to figure that out on our own. Again, maybe if I was Nancy Pelosi or Oprah!

Name: F Halber
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New Orleans to Miami. Very good flight. Departed and left on time. Seats are decent, Wifi is acceptable and so is the complimentary inflight service. Nice crew (smiling, which is the key..). Flight was full and some of us had to leave the luggage in the hold. Even if there was still plenty space in the overhead bin (empty above our seat). Still, check in was smooth and luggage arrived fairly as on the belt. AA has worked just fine for us.

Name: Joey Mensah
Review: Not Verified |  Chicago to New York. Customer service at the airport was terrible. My flight was delayed and in the end got cancelled. No voucher for hotel or a different airline and I spent more than 24 hours at the airport. This is my second time and I'm very disappointed. American Airline is trash!

Name: B Neave
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Phoenix to Los Angeles. Ticket Agent checked me in & her service towards me was only OK, no eye contact, nothing. The customers in front of me that she checked in, concerned me a bit. There was a lady who was obviously overwhelmed trying to condense her suitcase after the agent told her to. In the midst of her condensing her bag, the agent asked the lady what her seat number was without giving the lady proper time to answer her question. The agent questioned her in a rude manner, “You don’t know what your seat number is!?” She asked her as if she was disappointed and frustrated. This staff seemed very disengaged, rushed and unpleasant. I understand that things get busy but it is not your job just to do your job. Customers deserve quality service.

Review_Heading: "never set foot on a AA again"
Name: Luis Eduardo Vieira mendes
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Cancun to Milan via Miami. We were six counting a handicap person and an infant (2 years). Our flight took off delayed of one hour from Cancun, when we finally arrived in MIA we had only about 1 hour to the connection. So then the 1st soap opera began, no one came to take my stepfather (the handicap) at the plane, after 10 min some one came and left him at a place with others, then the lady from AA said we should reschedule our flight home for the other day, after a brief discussion she called someone and he and my mother went one way and my sister, niece and brother in law in another. We used the APC (Automated Passport Control) and went to the line, or should i say lines, i went one way. then security control. We all met after SC and went to the gate, there the second soap opera began. apparently some battery had to be changed and after multiple delays, emails, and texts and about 3 hours waiting later they decided to change the airplane, so we had to change gates too. more one hour waiting. So boarding began and after everyone were cozy (as much as you can be on a old AA aircraft) all kinds of excuses began. 1st was that we were waiting the green light from Dallas; 2nd the hours of the pilots were over so they had to call other, then it was the time of the crew (they cancelled a flight to Rio so they came to our plane) all that took us about 4 hours inside the aircraft and all they offered us was a glass of water. i can say with certainty that i will never set foot on a AA plane again, i don't care how much more i have to pay,

Name: M Keale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Have never had a good experience with American Airlines. Whether it's technical issues, engine problems, or booking issues, there never ceases to be something that goes wrong. On this flight, I was 3 minutes late to check my bag and they would not allow me to proceed without checking it. Therefore, I got a seperate flight in order to check my bag, layover through Chicago, and have been put on standby with every flight to Boston. American Airlines overbooks most their flights, and they claim my only option is to continue on standby. When asked how long they can keep doing that, I got the reply, "that answer is immeasurable." Which brings me to another point, the customer service is awful! I've interacted with at least 10 different people here for help and only 1 has been nice/useful. I'm not surprised they are all in bad moods because I imagine their complaint level is through the roof. Moral of the story, I have learned my lesson to never fly with American Airlines again. Sincerely, A customer still waiting in Chicago

Review_Heading: "There was plenty of space for my bag"
Name: C James
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | The workers were unkind, unhelpful, and deceitful. I had a bag that clearly qualifies as a carry on bag. That wasn’t a problem. The problem, even after the customer service was terrible, was that the supervisors said I had to check my bag because the flight was full, and there was no overhead storage. They said my bag has to go to Akron. I told them clearly that I had bought this ticket through NYC because I knew there was a chance I’d have to stay in NYC for work. As I continued to explain to them the situation they told me that I could see a supervisor in NYC and get my bag back there if I was willing to pay the fare difference (presumably the difference in the flight I just took, not going to Akron a whole flight less!). We went back and forth as to how silly what they were saying was, and here’s the kicker, I get on the plane and there are many empty seats and even a couple rows totally empty! And of course, storage space. There was plenty of space for my bag. Again, not helpful, rude, and at the end of the day deceitful. So, will I get to be in NYC for work with my clothing and toiletries? If they need me in New York, I will not be in anything but my travel clothes and my bag will be lost in Akron and I will have to pay for a flight I don’t take and pay for the bag to be shipped to me. That’s absolutely poor American Airlines. If you’re looking for was of travel, honesty, and transparency, do not fly American Airlines. I will not fly that airline again.
route: Nashville to Akron via New York

Name: Brad Terk
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas to Ontario. Zero stars if possible. Closed out from the restaurant, they took a little longer than they should have. Walking up to the gate, literally shut the door in our face 10 min before our departure time. Ugly attitudes and horrible service. They could have waited 30 seconds and could have walked on. I will stay away from American Airlines as much as possible.

Name: Jose Marrero
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I usually fly on American Airlines, because I live near one of their hubs and am an Admirals Club member. I have been battling cancer for the past 2 1/2 years and American took away my status and did not allow me to put my Admirals Club membership on hold. They have all this publicity during October for Breast cancer awareness but they don't support the people actually battling cancer. I am going to do some research and possibly take my business to Delta.

Name: D Langton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  The past 26 hours have been hell. I was scheduled to arrive at San Diego yesterday at 11.30pm, instead I was rerouted to Waco Texas where I was forced to spend the night at the airport freezing cold since all my clothes were in my luggage. They gave my a flight the next day to san Diego at 7pm, it is currently 9.57pm I have yet to take off. We were delayed because of "mechanical issues " one of the stupid luggage racks wouldn't close properly. They have not offered any kind of compensation for any of the inconveniences this has caused me. At this point I would have already had made it to san Diego if I had rented a car and drove yesterday evening.

Name: V Dana
Review: Not Verified |  Paris to Mexico via Dallas. The online check in didn’t work therefore we had to wait at a customer desk. After we were already queuing for almost 2 hours they took us apart because otherwise we would miss our flight. However, the people after is in the line were checked in before we even had the chance after they gave us “priority”. As we had to check in fast, they didn’t want to check us in together, therefore we had a 12 hour flight where me and my friends were seated on different places, not even a bit close to each other. We asked many times to seat us together but they didn’t listen at all.

Name: H Chan
Review: Not Verified |  San Francisco to San Jose via Dallas. Absolutely terrible customer service. Flight attendants were downright rude, did not take the initiative to help passengers, and did not dress or act professionally. Worst airline I've ever taken.
route: San Francisco to San Jose via Dallas

Name: C Geare
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I was flying out of Atlanta, GA this past Friday on a flight to Miami, connecting to Houston and the trip was cancelled hours before departure. I first called the customer service line, where I was told by an agent, "I shouldn't have booked my ticket the way I did" & there was nothing she could do. I then went to the AA ticket counter and the representatives shut down the line because it was too many people to deal with and they sent us to main gate for further assistance after waiting in line for 1 hour. I was placed on a standby flight for 6:50am the following day (in which that flight was full) & i could not board. The ticket agent then put me on standby for the next departing flight leaving at 9:14am, but told me because my name was so deep in the list, she couldn't be of much assistance. She let every passenger board standby except me. I then had to catch a flight to DC from Atlanta, just to get to Miami. 24 hours spent in an airport with the utmost rude and unprofessional people I've ever encountered.. oh it gets better... my flight (AA1545) from Miami to Atlanta was not only delayed again , but AA then told me that my carry-on bag was now "too big" and forced me to pay the check-in bag fee, only for me to arrive to my gate & AA was checking in bags complimentary.

Name: Stephen Rhee
Review: Not Verified |  Chicago to Phoenix. I am an Exec Platinum on American after recently switching from United (work reasons). I booked my family in first class (paid revenue seats) and fully expected them to enjoy their experience coming home from spring break. It was completely the opposite. My wife had to fly back with two of my three kids while I flew back with my other daughter because of high school sports. My wife and two other kids were flying back in First class. Checked in, and 10 minutes before boarding the gate agent proceeded to tell my wife the kids lost their first class seats and were being moved to coach, and couldnt be seated together. WTF. We paid for first class seats, they allege there was an equipment change, but only 2 people were moved out of first class (my kids). My two kids and separated from their mother on the plane. They are minors. In addition, they did this 10 minutes before boarding! They offered a refund of the difference in fair (130 dollars) and a 300 dollar voucher. This is completely unacceptable. And you know who sat in the two seats that were taken from my kids? two other kids. American could have handled this with some class 1. offered another flight in first class 2. offer a voucher that covers enough for two tickets in first class 3. rebook us on another airline in first class or rebook the other family on one of the above options 4. offer miles deposited to cover a first class ticket I am going back to United. I spend between 20-40k a year on travel and have never had this issue with United. I float between 1k and global services on united and will never spend a dime on American EVER AGAIN. F-them. Whats the point of spending money on a first class ticket to be treated worse than luggage? Absolutely horrible service.

Name: S Thanatos
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  La Guardia to Orlando. Horrible service! Will never fly American again. We usually fly Delta to Europe. We traveled with 4 kids early in the am. The staff was rude, unhelpful. In fact one of the male stewards was extremely rude and instead of offering to help get our family settled, he was rudely trying to rush us. I've never experienced such a rude group on a plane. Even before we entered the aircraft, we were scolded because they wanted us to get our stroller ready sooner. We had 4 sleeping babies with us and it was 5:30am! Never again

Name: N Shoemark
Review: Not Verified |  Raleigh/Durham to London. One off the strangest flights i have been on; one cabin crew member very rude and snappy with passengers. One passenger asked for a blanket because for some reason his seat didn’t have one and her response was ‘well what do you want me to do about it?! We put one on every seat, if its not there its because someone has stolen it so you have your fellow passengers to blame for that!’. Then the couple on front asked to move seats so she said she would go check if there were any free, comes back a few mins later and said ‘There are two seats together at the back, one of those nasty passengers back there tried to move into it but i stopped him for you, thank me later’ genuinely referred to them as ‘nasty passengers’. =. Even her body language and way she moved about the cabin and interacted with people just wasn’t what you would expect from cabin crew at all and if it hasn’t been for the uniform you wouldn’t think she was cabin crew who are usually friendly, approachable and nothing but helpful. Plus there was supposed to be wifi on the flight but it didn’t work.

Name: S Williams
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas to Salt Lake City. Horrible. I had a connecting flight from DFW airport to SLC. We boarded just fine, then after sitting on the plane and waiting 20 minutes after the last person loaded they informed us there would be a 20 minute delay. 20 minutes later they told us it would be a while longer. 1 hour after boarding the plane they tell us the plane has mechanical problems and it could not be flown that night (I understand that, better safe than sorry!). They spent the next 2 hours telling us to sit, move, we have a plane, now we don't. Total chaos! 3 hours after we were supposed to leave they told us we wouldn't have a plane for 6 hours (overnight). They wouldn't help us find hotel rooms, wouldn't give us vouchers for a room or food. Nothing. Oh and when we finally all boarded the aircraft after sleeping on the airport terminal floor all night, we had to wait an additional hour for them to find all the luggage and get it switched over!

Name: Ryan Brooks
Review: Not Verified |  Raleigh Durham to Tuscon. I am blown away by how dumb this airline has gotten. I'm on a plane right now with half of the seats empty. All I wanted to do was move to and empty row so I am not on top of people and the flight attendant tells me I have to pay extra to move from my seat! Are you kidding me? I have to pay extra for a seat that no one is sitting in anyways! How far has this airline fallen? Are we that hard up nowadays that we can't change a seat on an empty  airplane. I am absolutely blown away by the stupidity of this. No more American airlines for me. If they are hurting for money that bad maybe it's time to call it quits. There's no shame in cutting your losses and shutting it down.

Name: M Saunders
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | We will never fly American Airlines again. The customer service was non-existent. I would avoid any layovers in Philadelphia as the airport is understaffed with AA personal and extremely lazy. After our flight was cancelled due to the pilots leaving the plane and no one coming to replace them we were not given any accommodation, reimbursement and they could only put us on a flight 2 days after our original arrival date.
route: Columbus to Fort Lauderdale via Philadelphia

Name: Gregory R Everett
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Omaha to Dallas Fort-Worth via Las Vegas. American Airlines has the rudest, most uninformed workers I've ever seen. Instead of treating the customers poorly they should be apologizing for their delay or apologizing because they don't know where to find them the transportation they need to get through the airport. But no they're rude and act like it's our fault that we don't know how to do their job, if they don't like their job they need to find a new one. Furthermore if they don't know how to do their job they need to tell they're Superior so they can find someone who can.
route: Omaha to Dallas Fort-Worth via Las Vegas

Name: Richard Holland
Review: Not Verified |  Memphis to Colorado Springs. My wife was scheduled to fly out at 6 am on April 20, 2019. She received a text at 7 pm on April 19 stating that her flight had been cancelled. The reason she booked an early flight was so she could be in Colorado Springs shortly after our son gets off work. He’s stationed at Peterson AFB in Colorado Springs. She was booked a flight 6 hours later than originally. Which puts her coming into Colorado Springs about the time he leaves for work. Not a lot of time for him to pick her up, get back on base, get her checked in at a room on base and then get to work. She called to see why her flight was cancelled and the CSR said it was due to maintenance. Not real happy with American Airlines and the short notice of the cancellation.

Name: J Davis
Review: Not Verified | Chicago to Puerto Vallarta. American Airlines has terrible customer service at O’Hare. Came from over-crowded Admirals Club to find flight delayed, no explanation from ground crew, passengers crowded in “cul de sac” at end of concourse, many passengers sitting on the floor. I’m Plat Exec, but am going to switch to another airline.

Name: Valerie Klapproth
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | The stewards on my flight from Charlotte to Ft Lauderdale (flight 0033) were nothing short of amazing! They were pleasant, always smiling and really went out of their way to help me. I dont normally fly American Airlines, but I will again.
route: Allentown to Charlotte via Fort Lauderdale

Name: L Keares
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  As I am writing this I am sitting in LAX. American Airlines has been the low point of my family's trip. My flight to LAX was delayed, and we had to race to get to our connecting flight back to Boston. Even though they had radioed to let the gate know we where on the way they would not let us board or hold the gate for even a minute even though it was thier fault we were late. When we went to customer service we were informed they could get us on another airline, but only if we were advantage status customers. Because we where just regular customers we would not be able to fly out until the morning. The 2 girls at the customer service area ar LAX had the personality of soulless automatons. The experience flying with American has been hot garbage from the lack of just commonly decent politeness to the barrage of ads and flyers handed out by the flight crew to sign up for thier credit card. Needless to say my next flight will not be with this airline, as they are so fond of reminding me during this trip I do have a choice in airlines.

Name: Jacqlyn Shepard
Review: Not Verified |  San Francisco to Phoenix. American Airlines is the worst airline I’ve ever flown with. Every time I fly with this horrible company there is a ridiculous inconvenience. I’ve had cancelled flights, several hours in delays, and to deplane too many times to count. I always tell myself it is the last time I fly American Airlines, but today is most definitely the last straw.  I write this review as I’m deplaning their aircraft, yet again, for some stupid problem they couldn’t figure out ahead of time.

Name: K Braver
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Austin to Miami. We will never fly American Airlines again. I would have loved to write a review on American airlines website to tell them about my experience however American airlines only gives you 7 days from your flight date to write a review. I couldnt have within this time frame since I was still on vacation internationally. This flight I'm referring to was on 4/8 from Austin to Miami. From the very beginning it was the most rocky turbulent flight I have ever been on. All the people around us was commenting on the turbulence.  The plane then drops and then shoots up again.  The pilot came on the intercom and said. "Sorry about that folks, we were a little to close to the plane in front of us. We will have to circle around and try to land again. It will be about 5 minutes". We finally land and we took forever to taxi to get off the plane. We had another flight to catch and we had hoped to still make it. No one on the intercom told us anything about our connecting flight. We had to run from gate 19 to gate 49. We had 8 minutes to spare and the plane was already pulling away. They did not call our names over the intercom or call out for final boarding. They just left even though it wasn't our fault. We ran to the next gate to tell them but they just told us there isnt anything they can do and to go to the rebooking center. Then we had to walk back to gate 37 to the rebooking center. We talked to the agent told them what happened. She has no sympathy, no compassion and a huge attitude.  We rebooked for a few hours later. But, better customer service and compassion and a heartfelt apology would have gone a long way in this situation. We got neither.

Name: Dyanne Looper
Review: Not Verified |  I had a great one way trip with American Airlines beginning with the curbside baggage and boarding pass agent at the Atlanta airport, a very patient and helpful young man. Next the wheelchair assist woman Pam was very kind and helpful, we had a nice conversation on the way to my gate. One flight attendant was outstanding, with a smile while serving my cup of ice. The flight was very nice, quite cloudy with little turbulence.

Name: Phil Radetzky
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Las Vegas. Since most airlines have flyers right where they want them, the front of the plane is the only place left with enough seat to actually sit in for a 5-hour flight. At over $2,300.00 for my Wife and I, not worth it, but still better than the "Cattle Car Crush" in the back. Unfortunately, we only had an hour in our seats, before we were forced out, after we had taxied out, then back in, to change the flight crew. (Due to "Time Out" of flying/ resting hours) I guess American doesn't own any computers, with which to calculate this before they spend an hour jamming 125 captives into a 30-year old flying tour bus. I forgot to mention we only boarded after being chased to 3 different gates, the last being from one end of PHL to the other. I read Americans "Service Promise" the day after our 7 hour delay/ cancellation and wondered where the promised "Over 3-hour delay comforts" food & drinks were? Certainly not given to us, nor was ANY information as to why we were sitting in 3) different gates, watching 200 American planes land and depart, while we sat and stewed. The final kick in the sac was watching the new flight crew board, then stand back in line for another hour, with no info. We were then lied to again, and were told that "Maintenance" decided to sniff around, while we stood and waited to re-board. At 10:20 at night, the flight attendants filed off our 6:35 departure aircraft, and a passenger yelled: "This means the flight is cancelled!!" With no word from any of the arrogant, attitude-laden gate agents. They finally announced to go back to the other end of the terminal, and get our bags, and beat it. No help, no rebooking assists, no nothing. American is the worst possible company to ever give your hard-earned cash to. The little tags say it all: "We don't care, and we let you know it!"

Name: Winston Pickett
Review: Not Verified |  Detroit to San Antonio. After Air Tran went out of business I have flown American Airlines. I am handicap. They always go over and above anything I expect. From the time I book until I return home I am treated exceptionally well. Love to give credit when its due. Thank you American

Name: Holly Drews
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Washington to West Palm Beach. I was planning to take my bag as a carry on and they had no more room up above the seats, so we were told to check our bags at the gate. When I received my bag at baggage claim my bag had a huge cut in the front of it that was not there before. This is only my second time using this suitcase and it already looks so worn. I am extremely disappointed by this and deterred from using this Airline anymore.

Name: Lakeva
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New Orleans to Vancouver via Dallas. My husband and I had an extremely frustrating experience today. We were flying from New Orleans to Vancouver, via Dallas. The flight to Dallas was delayed. We were afraid we’d miss our connection to Vancouver and were thinking of getting on a flight to Dallas with another airline, but we talked to an agent at the gate, and he kept assuring everyone that “all connections are fine.” They were anything but. We departed late and arrived late. We still had a chance of making our original flight, but when we got to the gate, it was occupied. There were many passengers who had connecting flights on the plane, including international ones. One would have thought that knowing this, the airline would try to secure an unoccupied gate (how many gates can be occupied at one time? hard to imagine that the answer is “all”). But one would be wrong. We had to stay on the plane for more than an hour. We missed the original connection (as did many other passengers). Unfortunately, there were no other flights to Vancouver from Dallas tonight. We decided to take a flight to Seattle, rent a car, and drive to Vancouver. There was a flight with American Airlines leaving shortly after we arrived. We asked the agents at the gate for the Seattle flight to put us on it, but apparently, they had no authority to do that. We went to the rebooking counter. There was a long line there. We called customer service while standing in line. They called back shortly before our turn came. We managed to get rebooked on the flight to Seattle, but when we got to the gate, the agent told us that the gates were closed. The plane was sitting there and continued to sit there for another 20 minutes, but we could only watch from outside. We are not going on vacation and have to be in Vancouver for a conference at 9 am tomorrow. If we cannot make it by then, there is no point in going at all. We’ll do our best to avoid traveling with this airline in the future.
route: New Orleans to Vancouver via Dallas

Name: John Petrides
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Very terrible airline. We were getting ready to fly back to Chicago from Las Vegas when our flight was cancelled because of weather in Chicago. American couldn’t get us on a flight the next day or the day after. They said they could get us on a flight 3 days later. No offer to reimburse us or try another airline. I will never fly American.

Name: K Hume
Review: Not Verified | Cancun to London via Miami. Absolutely terrible. Please do yourself a favour and avoid it as a plague. Rude, arrogant staff, no information, totally unhelpful. It’s just a joke. You feel like intruder. There is no urgency to do anything. You just feel hopeless. But if you think airplane staff is horrible, wait to get to Miami International airport. It’s just horrible! Where is the management? Customer service, ground staff, customs - one big joke! No information, you're supposed to just guess it all yourself. Long queues everywhere. Staff doesn’t bother to help. Extremely rude and arrogant. Just horrible. Missed 2 connections flight before got to the front of re-booking desk. Also, if you are issued with express transfer cards it doesn’t mean express at all. You will be welcomed with another long line with one counter open! And even if none of delays where cause by myself they don’t care! We managed to get on BA flight back home after 5 hours struggle at Miami airport. What a relief and such a difference! By the way our 3 suitcase are still missing somewhere at Miami airport. I wish I never used American Airlines. I hated every minute of travelling with them.

Name: H Watson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Flew with American Airlines to San Francisco from Fort Lauderdale. As there were no direct flights we had to transit in Dallas. Having flown with numerous domestic airlines in the USA, I found American to be very good. Flights were on time, cabin crew friendly, and an easy transit in Dallas. One thing I found a bit annoying was that the aircraft from FLL to DFW had a personal entertainment screen, then the flight from DFW to SFO you could watch entertainment, but on your own device only. I had to spend $10 on wifi to download the American Airlines app on my iPad while flying (if it were a 1 hour flight I wouldn't have bothered, but this was a 4 hour flight). I didn't eat the food as I brought my own snacks. Planes seemed new and seats were quite comfy.
route: Fort Lauderdale to San Francisco via Dallas

Name: D Beale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Lexington to Norfolk via Charlotte. I would ride a horse to my destination before I ever fly American Airlines again! Total disaster from the start! Plane sat at gate for over an hour due to “weather.” I was checking on my phone the entire time. Actually made it worse by waiting. Arrived in Charlotte very late. Once again, waited on taxi forever. Finally parked as far away from terminal as possible. No ramp, had to walk in from outside. Ran as fast as I could. Barely missed connector. Wouldn’t pay for hotel or even give me a discount room. Extremely rude and uncaring service. Got to hotel at 1am and was supposed to leave at 8:20 this morning. Woke up at 6 and on way to airport got notification that my flight was delayed for 2 hours once again! American is a joke!

Name: Brameshia Owens
Review: Not Verified |  Miami to Dallas. Very friendly and professional staff but I will probably never fly American again. My fiancé and I didn’t get to sit by each other on 2 of our 3 flights even though we booked back in March. Probably wouldn’t have bothered me as much if we hadn’t been over 7 isles away from each other and if I hadn’t learned that the couple next to me has just booked their flight and were able to be next to each other. If you don’t have tons of money for better tickets I do not recommend this airline because they obviously only care about the dollar.

Name: J Lane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Due to weather conditions my flight was canceled on Sunday evening (4/14/19), I completely understand weather delays, and did not complain in regards to the reschedule. However, when sending confirmation details American Airlines asks the flyer to confirm the new flight. Everytime, I tried to confirm through their website - it would crash. But! Their is the mobile app! Which also was unable to confirm and stated a call was necessary. No problem, I can call customer service. It was a 7hr wait for a call back when their own service stated 2hr call back times over the phone. When I finally got through to a representative - her first question was to ask if I had booked through a third party and to try to tell me the flight was voided. After, begging her to look up the flight via the record conformation number she was able to confirm me on the flight. Onto, Monday(4/15) one of the flight legs on the rescheduled flight has been canceled. They cannot even get me to Chicago without adding an additional day, possibly leaving me stranded in LaGuardia, NY. I am uncertain of the conditions of American Airlines flying to other cities, my case was from Boston to Chicago - two large airports, but unless you are flying to their major hub in Texas. I would avoid American Airlines until Oct 2019 when it seems they might have more planes in circulation. While the front counter staff were kind and tried to help as much as they could, American Airlines simply does not have enough resources to guarantee you a flight. If your flight is cancelled they do not have enough flights for a reschedule, all flights are overbooked and they do not seem to have any relationships with any partner airlines to help you get back on track. As of this American would of gotten me back to Chicago from Boston three days after my scheduled depart date. At this point I chose to book another ticket with Southwest Airlines who will get me into Chicago tonight. I know a lot of good folks work at American, but they simply do not have the most basic functionality down. Get to point A from point B on a plan within a reasonable amt of time. The only thing that seemed to work was at some point in time they will give you a call back to try to deny your flight's existence. I will take my business elsewhere going forward.

Name: Beth Talley
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I purchased a ticket last minute to visit my Dad who is in the hospital due to complications from a surgery. The flight was delayed several times due to bad weather in the connecting city. The gate agent in Madison was kind enough to reroute me on another airline to eventually get to McAllen the same day, just 11pm instead of noon. Since my very short trip was very short now, I called the customer service line to see if I could change my returning flight to the next day, I wanted to see my Dads doctor, since I arrived very late Saturday night they were not in to see him on Sun. The Customer rep was very helpful, they changed my flight, even though most of the delays were weather related, and I had non refundable tickets, I am very thankful to American Airlines, they were compassionate and very understanding. Thank you American Airlines!

Name: Kathleen Hearne
Review: Not Verified | Little Rock to New York. Worst experience ever!! I will never fly with this airline again. My flight going home was first delayed by an hour. Than it was cancelled due to mechanical issues. They automatically booked me on another flight for a later time which meant I'd miss my connecting flight. So I had to choose another flight home. Next thing that flight was cancelled and they automatically rebooked me for the next day. This was due to weather. They refused to pay for hotel stay overnight. They refused to pay for me flying another airline home. I ended up booking with Delta that same day and getting home about the same time I was originally scheduled to get home. I followed the progress of the flight the next day and saw it had been rescheduled yet again! This airline only cares about getting their money and nothing else.

Name: Nicholas Schmidt
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Los Angeles. I've had to fly American Airlines a lot due to corporate policy and not one of those flights has ever been reasonably close to on-time. Whenever I have to travel with this potpourri of incompetents, I assume the flight is leaving two hours later than what the schedule says.  Today, not only was my flight to LA canceled (while Delta and United are somehow, as if by magic, were still able to fly), leaving me up the creek for an important meeting tomorrow, when I called their national line to reschedule and input my information, it hung up 0n me. Just "we're experiencing high call volume, please call again later." So I call again and get put on a waiting list, being told I'll get a call back in 2 hours. It is now going on three hours, no call. While I was waiting, about an hour ago, I get a text message saying that I've been rescheduled for a flight to LAX on Wednesday.  So I call to cancel and reschedule the whole business myself, scratching the LA leg of my trip entirely. I make it through the phone menu and get to the point where it says it'll connect me to a service representative. And then, it hangs up on me again. I am never flying this airline again, even if I have to pay the difference for a United or Delta ticket out of my own pocket.

Name: Fernando Lemos
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Toronto. I will never in my life ever consider flying on American Airlines again. Apart from the extremely smug staff and almost non existent platform for assistance for re booking our experience was horrible. The original flight got delayed “due to the weather” and had the same excuse used several times and after 4h30 they cancelled. The flight was re-booked not even for the Sunday but only for the Tuesday! Not only is that a kick to the customers that want to go home but in gods name who would think someone would want to stay a whole  2 days with no accommodations. Instead what we got was smug pilots and staff holding a pizza box walking away with no vouchers or anything. It’s gotten to the point where you really gotta ask yourself if these people are qualified or they purposefully don’t care for others.

Name: Mehri Savarani
Review: Not Verified |  Los Angeles to Charlotte. Unreliable with a poor customer service. Our flight got cancelled due to technical problem, we were booked to a stop flights which first flight was delayed so you would arrive 30 minutes after your connection had left but they didn't care and have us a boarding pass to fool us. By looking at monitors we realized what was going on, one more time we got to long line of customer services and after a long wait, we were booked to a over night flight to arrive next day. Meanwhile I was checking available flight on Google and there was a United leaving soon but they took so long and by misguiding us it was too late to make to the gate for boarding. There was plenty flights with Delta available but they said they have no access to that which I don't believe it. They just wanted to fill up their own flights. They never offer any voucher for food or drink and I was told to open a claim on line and they would reimburse me for expenses during 10 hours wait, I just got an email telling me they can't do that but they give me some stupid AA points which serve for nothing. Useless company.

Name: Naomi Kyle
Review: Not Verified |  Do not book American Airlines. Even if you are booking to save money.  My flight was scheduled to leave on a Sunday but was cancelled with no reschedule until Tuesday. They have strict internal policies that do not allow them to upgrade / book other airlines if they have an opening. This is primarily driven by American Airlines not wanting to pay the difference in cost. Instead they decide to put the passengers life on hold in a poor hotel for two days. Note the delay was not weather related, but a maintenance problem with their aircraft - they should have a better back up plan. One day delay is acceptable- two days is not! In some cases passengers were delayed 3 days. Also note there are no exceptions made, even if you have a medical issue.  Also the front counter attendant was extremely rude. While trying to work thru the problem the attendant just walked away and shut down her computer left me to figure it out like my own problem. Do not fly American Airlines.

Name: G Daslirez
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Avoid this airline like the plague. Flight from Mexico City to Dallas delayed two hours for technical issues and thus caused the connection time to be shortened in Dallas. No assistance was provided on arrival and I was told that I had been put on another flight to Tokyo. However my initial flying class was Premium Economy but was told I was going to fly coach. After much arguing, I was put back on my initial flight that had not left yet. Because of severe thunderstorms this flight was cancelled and had to be changed to a later flight in Economy. While I understand weather issues are beyond airlines control, the rude and dismissive way American Airlines staff on the ground handled this was not worthy of an airline that prides itself of going for great. Lastly, the service on board the flight was non existent, the flight attendants looked tired and in need of proper grooming and the food barely edible. I will not fly with this airline again.

Name: K Warner
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Houston to Managua via Miami. Very bad services, delayed the flight twice in one day and also they couldn’t have a connection flight to our final destination. They ruined our spring vacation.

Name: M Lanzeva
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Jacksonville to Dallas Ft Worth. One star is high rating. Zero communication. We found out that our flight was cancelled when we arrived at the gate. They couldn’t get us on another flight home  until two days later. If we were informed in advance (an hour and a half would’ve worked, I doubt they decided it the last 30 minuets) we could’ve rebooked our room or stayed at the resort until we figured how to get home but instead we dragged our two-year-old around the airport in zero comfort. Later we found that the airline had severe hail damage the previous day which explains the cancellation but also means they had plenty of time to inform affected passengers.

Name: C Filbert
Review: Not Verified |  Dallas to Norfolk. Word of warning to anyone planning a trip on American Airlines. They do not care about their customers. Yesterday my flight was delayed for hours in Dallas due to weather and because they had no flight attendants. Had to spend the night and they did not help me with a hotel or transportation or a meal. Total out of pocket was $180. Today I am back at the airport and my flight is again delayed because the crew is somewhere else. I’m not even going to my original Airport. There are Delta flights that would get me where I need to go but American won’t rebook me on one. This American trip has been a disaster.

Name: Ta Vang
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Minneapolis to Phoenix. Awful, the back of the plane smelled of fume. It snowed so we were delayed for four hours and the flight did not have any food. All they had were pretzels and cookies. The plane was super hot as well and the ac fan on top of my head barely blew any air out. I was starving by the time I got to Phoenix but could not get anything to eat either because I was rushing to my next flight.

Name: K Steffen
Review: Not Verified |  My flight got delayed because of a reroute due to weather. Then it was delayed 5 more times (and the weather was only in one state which was behind us-the weather ahead is good). The last delay due to the plane needing repairs. Supposed to arrive at 8:50am, now hoping to land at 7:50pm. No accommodations. Have never had this problem with any other airlines.

Name: Aimee Walker
Review: Not Verified |  I will never fly American Airlines again. Every time I book with them my flight is cancelled. Tonight my flight was cancelled and their solution is to book me for a flight on Monday. That's 2 days after I am scheduled to arrive at my destination. I waited in line 2 hours for this solution and their solution is a cot in the airport.

Name: Sharen Aloysius
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I’m from India, travelling to NY via Boston. My first flying experience with American Airlines. My flight has been delayed for 3 hours, but the lady at the counter was kind enough to assist me to see if I can get onto an earlier flight. I walk up to gate B20 of American Airline at Logan Boston Intl airport; and wait for 10 mins for these 2 airline staff to stop chit chatting at the gate. And when the chatter was unending I decided to excuse myself and ask for help. Me: “Excuse me Ma’am” The tall lady : barked back “ I’m not talking to you! Can’t you see we both talking! U better wait! Don’t you got no sense?!” Such poor reception, extremely rude!

Name: Chris Horne
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  After purchasing my ticket and they offered me extra insurance so that I can change my flight or cancel without penalty. After finding out that my business has concluded early I attempted to get on standby status. After finding out that I was plenty of seats available they informed me that because I have economy class ticket I could not change my ticket without a $200 charge. So basically I purchased the extra insurance and wasted my money. I will never fly American again.

Name: H Karshin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Atlanta to Los Angeles. We chose American Airlines because of the comfort and entertainment provided. We paid higher prices than with other airlines for the amenities. However, our flight was changed with no explanation other than it being cancelled. We had to rearrange everything. Then the new flight was a one stop (which we hate) the reason we paid more for non stop. Then there was no entertainment on either flights. 6 hours to the east coast, it sucked! We were so disappointed that we didn't take our return flight back on American. We paid for non stop on another airline since we received nothing we originally wanted with American.

Name: R Maylin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Gulfport to Dallas. The plane was less than 50% booked. The flight attendants allow people to move seats as they like backwards and forewords throughout the plane so the will not have to sit next to another passenger. I was unable to sit in any exit row, all of which were empty. “You have to pay for those seats.” You also have to pay to sit further up in the plane instead of the back where I was. So I cannot move to a paid seat but others can? What is the purpose of this? Yes, normally you would have to pay extra to sit in an exit row. Since absolutely no one paid to sit there because the flight was more than half empty what is the issue with sitting there? If I had paid for a ticket and not picked a seat, if it was the only seat left I would not have to pay more for the flight, they would automatically put me in the exit row. Not like it hasn’t happened several times already. I fly often for work. Thanks for nothing American Airlines. Next time I’ll drive.

Name: Kjerstin Anderson
Review: Not Verified |  American Airlines states they’re “Going for Great” when they are far from it. After my husbands graduation ceremony dates for the Air force changed a few months after purchasing our tickets, they refused to change the tickets to one day prior, even when I offered to pay extra if necessary. They told me all I could do was void my ticket and buy a new one. I asked if they do anything for active duty military and basically came out and said NO.  So now I’m left scrambling trying to make other arrangements so I can be there.

Name: J Li
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Diego to Puerto Vallarta via Phoenix. They had a glitch in their system that made my TSA Pre-check not showed up on my boarding pass. So I got sent back to a very, very long line. After getting through TSA I still had more than 10 mins before departure, and the gate agent literally didn’t want to turn the door handle to let me in and told him this is because of the missing Pre-Check and he told me “it does that sometimes.”   Anyway after discussing some options with him or a few minutes, two other agents came out. Then after departure time, the plane didn’t even budge. I went back out to the check in kiosks and the agent was able to put Pre-check on my new pass. The AA agents I encountered gave me attitude for their mistakes. They lied about the situation and tried to make me think this is my fault. I would board my flight, with time to spare, if it wasn’t for their glitchy ticketing system.
route: San Diego to Puerto Vallarta via Phoenix

Name: D Rivenbark
Review: Not Verified |  Wilmington to Los Angeles. My daughter missed her flight this morning in Wilmington NC because security too 47 minutes to assist 4 Handicapped adults through security. Now she has been in Charlotte for 7 hours waiting standby. She suffers from anxiety, the airports fault she missed her flight!! Now American is saying no availability until tomorrow morning.

Name: Kimberly Wind
Review: Not Verified | It took 10 hours to get me from Santa Rosa to Santa Ana on a 423$ ticket. Alaska Airlines on time. American cancels and delays flights so you are packed in hours later like sardines with zero empathy. This is the psychopath of all air travel! Never ever again!

Name: D Neale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Minneapolis to Dallas. Solid customer service. Food not great, but it's airline food. Good website and check-in process. Flights were on time, and the planes were clean. Good selection of movies on the individual screens

Name: L Mamarno
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  This awful experience is happening too Often with American Airlines. Passengers have to wait for about 3 hours or more for maintenance issues. What’s going on with customer service and great experience? Why is maintenance happening after passengers are already on board? Straight flight to Bogota, Colombia from Dallas was scheduled at 5:50 pm. Its being delayed 5 times already. It’s 8/04 and still waiting. Who is responsible for this poor customer service? The same exact situation occurred on March 10th to my daughter and grandson with the same flight

Name: Cooper Sarbacker
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Palm Springs to Chicago. Worst airline ever, they made us wait on the plane for a extra 30 minutes so we missed our flight. We went to the rebooking place and they said they cant give us anything! No rental car. And no hotel vouchers. Absolutely unbelievable. Now we have to wait at the Chicago airport for 11 hours to catch the next flight. Do not fly with American Airlines.

Name: Brent Lewallen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Customer service isn’t about how bad you mess up it’s about how you fix it - well American Airlines can screw up big and then make it worse. probably the same old story most travelers have gone through at some point but in the end the luggage was in the back literally a wall away from us and they refused to get it. The people they screwed with the delays did not take precedence over people that booked much later. The list could go on. Long story short if you need to fly don’t use them unless you must. If they are cheaper you get what you pay for.

Name: C Beale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Our flight from Oklahoma City to Dallas delayed 2 hrs. Our flight from Dallas delayed multiple times (still here). Now it looks like we are going to miss next flight also. My company purchased our tickets with American Airlines. I have always flown southwest or Delta and never experienced delays more than 5 minutes. Not a weather problem; it’s April and weather is good! Seriously, this is bad business.
route: Oklahoma City to Phoenix via Dallas

Name: B Ansell
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | New York to Chicago. This airline will treat you worse than an animal. After a 2h delay, we are “parked” in the plane and waiting to depart. No information is being communicated, no food/water is being distributed. Below minimum human standards! They also wouldn’t accept volunteers who were ready to give up their seats for other passengers to fly - worst customer support ever. They also claimed that WiFi for entertainment was available on this flight, it is not.

Name: Kurt Baumann
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas Fort Worth to Milwaukee. My gate was changed 4 times in an hour and a half America Airlines team members were rude and dismissive of my family and 8 other travelers. At the gate desk they then told me to go complain at the information desk but it wouldn’t help America Airlines is indifferent to customer service This was reiterated to me by 2 AA captains  and ground staff. The steward took blankets away from my 85 year old mother when I asked for some more she came back and threw them at me after telling me she didn’t appreciate me telling the captain that I gave my mother a 83 year old grandmother my mother’s wheelchair and that she had been in airport 12 hours. I told stewardess I don’t appreciate her customer service and attitude while watching other passengers jaw drop at her aggressive and unprofessional behavior. There was another great steward aboard that tried to my my Birthday flight home better.

Name: N Beale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Savannah to Dallas. We arrived at the airport 2.5 hrs early to get checked in. I travelled with my 80 year old mother who lives in a different state than me, and who does not know how to use the kiosk. There were 3 ladies behind the check in counter huddled up talking and giggling like school girls. We stepped to the counter and asked to be checked in. A rude woman said, did you try the kiosks?! I stated, "No. My mother is 80 years old and does not know how to use them, so we would like to check in here". She gave us a bad attitude while her friends still stood there doing nothing to help other passengers, by maybe calling them over to their empty check in stations. There used to be something we called "customer service". Apparently, American Airlines would rather pay staff to stand around and *watch customers use the kiosk*, rather than offer assistance to elderly passengers, who remember the days of checking in at the counter with a live friendly agent, not an robot?! I was furious my mother was treated this way. To top it off, they also put us in separate seating rows at checkin, yet when I booked our tickets, I had chosen seats together online. I had to have another agent at the gate correct the seating arrangement, where we were then sat in the very back row against the toilet walls where seats did not recline, not the prechosen seats we paid for and were ticketed to sit in on our reservations.

Name: P Jeale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Detroit to Chicago. As I sit on the tarmac for an hour because of a weather delay in Chicago I felt a need to say how kind and compassionate our flight attendants have been. I wish all my flights have been this good. Now let’s hope we make it to Chicago on time for my connection

Name: R Sanyal
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Chicago to New York. Having read the relentless negative reviews on American Airlines on this forum, I was wary of flying with them. However, I found my experience exceptionally satisfying. On this Saturday afternoon flight, I was upgraded to a business class seat which was spacious and comfortable. It did lack personal entertainment system on the back of the seat in front of you; instead you had the drop down from the ceiling screen where the safety video was played and a show screened which I did not bother. Rather outdated system. Fifteen of the 16 seats in the cabin were occupied and serviced by two very attentive attendants. Pre-take off drinks, bowl of warm nuts, a hot towel, a full dinner with a vegetarian option - I had the beef with mashed potatoes — and a good selection of alcoholic drinks made the smooth flight in a clean and bright cabin go very quickly. Pilot provided just the right amount of information in an amiable manner including letting us know that a cat was a passenger on the flight in the cargo hold. To top it all, the flight arrived at the gate several minutes ahead of schedule. One could not ask more. Good job, American!

Name: P Meares
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Charlotte. My flight was delayed because “they didn’t have a plane”. The delay was only explained that way. I missed my connection and have to fly out the next day. I will miss a very important meeting as a result. They offered no accommodations for there screw up. I will try to avoid flying them in the future

Name: C Heller
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Pay close attention to the type of ticket you purchase or you will be penalized. I bought a ticket from a third party online, Cheap-o-Air, to attend my sister's funeral. I thought it was strange that they didn't give me a seat assignment. Then a window popped up, telling me that if I wanted to pick my seats, it would cost an additional $25 per seat for the 4 flights, an extra $100 cost. I called the airlines to find out if my flight was confirmed, since I didn't have a seat assignment. They said yes. Then, a few days later, I needed to make a change, so I called the airlines to see if I could fly stand by on an earlier flight. They told me that my ticket was a Basic Economy ticket, which means no changes, no seat assignment, no carry ons, and I must board last. Wow! Talk about treating me like dirt. I honestly do not recall seeing any of these restrictions listed when I booked the ticket. And they didn't care that I had extenuating circumstances, a close family member's funeral. I had not encountered such punitive measures before. Maybe that's because I usually fly JetBlue. In the future, I will rent a car or take the train before I fly American.

Name: A Conly
Review: Not Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Jacksonville. Trying to join friends for a weekend of golf and fun at Sea Island. So we booked the 10:50 from Dallas to JAX in first class. When we arrive at gate C30, I see the worst possible thing, a Super 80 at our gate. Perhaps the worst passenger airline plane of all times. For some reason, American can not rid itself of these dinosaurs. At 10:45 they tell us there is a problem with the 30+ year old plane. The part will arrive in 10 minutes and it will take 20 minutes to install. Then after numerous departure update texts, they send us down to gate C19 changing to another Super 80. We finally board and while waiting for fuel and catering, the crew times out, seriously! They deplaned all passengers while we wait for the replacement crew. The new crew arrives check out the plane and we board. We finally leave the gate at 2:45. Taxi out to the runway and while waiting to take off the captain announces that we must return to the gate because there is a problem with the navigation system. So here we sit at the gate waiting for maintenance (an interesting name for this airline). They are offering us to leave now because we have been at this so long. Passengers are laughing at this announcement to keep from crying. We will see how this goes now. At least the gate agent brought food and drinks while we were between crews-cudos to him. You really cannot make this stuff up. 3:25 now. Another safety demo too!

Name: G Meares
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Sacramento to Mazatlán via Phoenix. First leg delayed, second automatically rescheduled a day later. This is a 4 day trip, now a 3 day trip. I’m told there is no other way to get me to MZT, that if I go home and try again tomorrow I’m out of pocket for the RT Lyft (c.$50) and if I go to Phoenix, I may have to pay for my own hotel and seek reimbursement! Last business trip, AA stranded me in O’Hare for 8 hours. No food voucher, no lounge access, no upgrade, no nothing. American is awful.

Name: C Lilley
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Charlotte to Orlando. My flight was to leave at 1030am in it got delayed over time I stop counting. I didn't get leave the first airport until 6pm at night my seat was taken that i paid for in was told i would have to buy a upgrade if to get it back. The staff was very rude when talking to them especially on the second part of the flight in North Carolina. I didn't get to my destination until almost 11pm at night was place in middle seat after my aisle was taken from me in was told I would have to pay a extra 50 dollars when there was lots of empty seat on the flight. This was the worst experience I have ever been on. I will never use this airline again they have drop off service

Name: Taylor Harrell
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Las Vegas. I booked a round-trip flight (as I do every year with American) from Chicago -> Las Vegas for the opening weekend of March Madness. My return flight was 8am on Monday March 25th. Right before boarding, the representative mentioned we would have a 15minute delay. Ok, not a big deal, this is typical with large airlines. 15 minutes later the representative then told us "We're sorry, this flight has not been cancelled. Please call AA.com to choose a different flight at no extra charge." As you would expect, all of the other flights out of Las Vegas on American were the next day. They wanted to switch my flight from Monday at 8am to Tuesday at 10am with a layover in Phoenix, arriving in Chicago at 10pm. (36 hours later "free"). I called American Airlines and told them this was unacceptable and needed to be switched to a different airline since I had to work the next day. They said I could book through a separate airline and request a reimbursement. I chose to fly on a Delta flight that got me home around 11pm on Monday (8 hours after my original plans, not a huge issue). I then requested a reimbursement through American and they said "We're sorry, if a flight is cancelled, please use a representative and we'll switch you to a new flight. Since you booked yourself, we cannot reimburse you." I did exactly what they said and am now $600 out-of-pocket for a 1-way flight. I will never  use American airlines again. I was a once Platinum Pro member with them, but this is a new low to me. Avoid at all costs. Delta and Southwest are significantly better. I will pay $50+ more for a flight that is not American moving forward. Hope this helps save someone a future headache.

Name: C Schaefer
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Jose to Chicago via Charlotte. Terribly disorganized. Overbooked several flights and had people panicking. They gave my friend someone else’s ticket with his information on it. They gave myself and another person the same seat, then kicked me out because they said I didn’t have priority. They were rude over the loudspeaker and nagged us the entire flight about seatbelts, turning our phones off and giving their pens back after borrowing them for customs forms. We felt like cattle being herded not like paying customers. Food was also less than average. My animals are fed better. I will be avoiding AA in the future even if it means paying more.
route: San Jose to Chicago via Charlotte

Name: Alain Comeau
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Boston to Tucson. The worst flight. First our scheduled trip from Boston to Dallas to Tucson was changed to Boston to Los Angeles to Tucson. The seating was inexcusable, absolutely no room. Why make people so cramped and uncomfortable. Even the stewardess mentioned that the bathrooms had gotten so small if you go in the wrong way you cant turn around. The newer plane had tiny air vents that produced virtually no air, its was way too hot and there was no way to get fresh air. Mst planes have actual cool air that you can feel. Got to LA and next flight was delayed. Unfortunately have to return on AA but will never fly again using American.

Name: G Kano
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Boston to Chicago. Terrible service. Forced to check in my bags because I was told there was no overhead space. What’s the point of selling carry on tickets to economy group only to be forced to check in bag. On the flight From Philadelphia to Boston had a bad experience with some air hostess harassing me because of putting my suitcase in the overhead bin. If you have a choice don’t choose American Airlines.

Name: Kelley Bjorkland
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Baltimore to Austin. I am again disappointed with American Airlines. While waiting for my plane I heard that the plane before us was having maintenance problems and could not take off for at least three hours. Then they were rerouting customers and changed our gate. I went to my new gate and learned that my flight was delayed as well and I was not able to make my connecting flight. Again it was because of maintenance problems on the plane. Is there no one checking these flights before they’re pulled up to the gate? American Airlines continues to go downhill and has been doing so for years. I am now connecting a flight in Dallas Fort Worth And was just informed that that flight as well is delayed! How can this happen on such an established airline? The planes are in disrepair. People are angry and service people have the attitude of “oh well” American Airlines is fast becoming a joke, it is a wonder that they are still viable. I have been a loyal member but I am fast turning my sites to Southwest who has a superior service reputation all around.

Name: Ramona Ferguson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to Las Vegas. American Airlines is the worlds worst airline company. I had the worst experience of my life. I held in the airport from 5am to 2pm. We got on a flight only to be sitting there for 20 min before taken off for maintenance issues on a plane that was supposedly sitting overnight. Why would you not have your mechanics looking at the plane prior to boarding time? The the flight was suppose to leave at 7:30 am only to be sent to another gate to board another flight only to be told 5 different boarding times and 2 hours later that that plane had mechanical issues as well. We were told it was due to maintenance and unable to fix. We did not board our flight until 1:30pm. How do you sell tickets without proper working planes? I also purchased an upgraded seat for the first flight, which I never sit in. What a waste! I had to miss 2 business meetings. Customer relations is refusing to set me up with their manager telling me they don't have one. American Airline you need to really do better. This is not the way you conduct business, especially when your dealing with my time and money. You really need to get yall act together and give your employees a proper training. The attitude that your staff have is so unprofessional. The sad apart American Airlines you do nothing to make sure your customers are feeling at ease after all the issues that you cause. I am very disappointed in your company.

Name: E Conard
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Again with American it is a continuous fight to keep your luggage as a carry on. After fighting for it on three other flighs the final leg they got me. Only to discover on the plane they had empyt bins all around. I demand for my luggage and they tell me once it’s tag the law states they cannot give me my stuff back. How about american airline stops taking luggage from their customers or start making a checked bag free to eliminate the carry ons. I will be sure to never go on American again. The airline has no customer service care and creates a hostile environment for people with carry on luggage. Two years ago this airline did the same thing trying to grab luggage out of my 8 year olds hands. They have no personal space or care and will take your stuff. Beware.

Name: Graeme Scott
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Phoenix to Los Angeles. Booked ticket 2 months ago. Got to airport 3 hrs early and were told that they could not seat us together unless we paid $25 extra. That is a scam or extortion take your pick.

Name: G Margoni
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Disappointed From Miami to Guatemala. I've never been too satisfied with my flights with American Airlines and also this was not a good flight, even if the airplanes we used was quite new and the pitch was quite resonable. The flight looked as it was carried out by a low cost airlines: food on purchase and with no IFE (it was expected to have a Personal Device Entertainment, but it was no working even if I've got the app downloaded before the take off)

Name: G Margoni
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Jose to Miami. Not so bad From San José de Costa Rica to Miami. I have never been too satisfied with my flights with American Airlines, but that time I was partly surprised. It still to be a no frills flight with food on purchase, but that time the IFE was working.
