It was a Personal Device Entertainment so you can watch free movies and TV shows right from your personal device if you had downloaded on your device before your flight the AA app. I really appreciated this service.

Name: G Margoni
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  A flight to forget. From Milan to Miami. Unfortunately, American Airlines still  using old aircraft on the routes between the US and Milan. My aircraft was not only old and in not good conditions, with an old-fashioned IFE system (overhead TV, no power), but it also had old and ruined seats. My seat was tilted outwards and it was not possible to change seats because the plane was full. The flight staff was quite good, but not always attentive to passenger needs as in others airlines. Poor quality food and beverage compared to those usually offered on transoceanic flights by European or Middle Eastern and Asian airlines. By the end, that 12h flight was an experience to forget, also because the ticket price was definitely overpriced compared to the services that AA was offering

Name: G Bayne
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Antonio to Dallas. 4th time flying with American. Also 4th time they’ve cancelled flights on me. Every time I fly with them there are delays and cancellations. Additionally, there are never enough support people to help and they’re always sorry for the problems. I feel bad for them but someone in management needs to be held accountable. If you fly, use any other airline. American seem to take no pride in making the customer experience a positive one

Name: H Beale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  We recently flew Detroit to Philadelphia return and both flights the airline stated that only 25 passengers would be allowed their carryon bags. All others would be checked. My husband had a heart attack not long ago and had all his medicine. They refused to allow him his bag stating that we had to take his meds out and put them in a bag on our lap. This happened on both flights. When we boarded the plane there were many overhead bins with room for carry on bags. This is misleading as they sell their tickets as you can have a carryon and a bag. Then the attendants were very rude. Very disappointed in this airline.

Name: Clair Meij
Review: Not Verified |  My family traveled to New Zealand recently, and I cannot say enough good things about our experience with American. Long haul with a 5 year old is not something that I look forward to, but the American Airlines crew and ground staff were so warm and kind to our family. I was very impressed with the international flight’s in seat features like entertainment, cell phone charging . Meals were great and the snacks were a welcome reprieve. I travel like Guinness - not well - and i dread the bumpy landings and descent to Denver. I must compliment the pilot of our flight into DIA yesterday for the most gentle landing and descent I’ve had to date. My son was so excited for his first international trip, and the people at American made it so very special for him. Thank you all for all that you do!

Name: Chris Najem
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | American Airlines is the worlds worst airline company. I had the worst experience of my life. My wife and I were held in the airport from 4pm until 1am. We got on a flight only to be taken back to the gate for maintenance issues on a flight that was already delayed. Then the flight was delayed 7 times (it was clear we weren't going anywhere) 6.45 to 7.00, then 7.45 to 9.20, then 10.00 then 10.30 then 1.15, then nowhere. We were told it was due to maintenance and not having a crew. How do you sell tickets without having a crew? We also were told we can't take our bags and that they would be on a flight that we were practically forced to take the next day into Manchester, NH. Sure enough the bags were never on that flight. I had to miss work the following day in order to make sure I got my bags. Customer relations is refusing to set me up with their manager telling me they don't have one. I promise on everything I love I will never fly American Airlines again, I will make sure my family and everyone I talk to doesn't step foot on an American Airlines plane. The planes are gross and outdated and missing upholstery, no TV's just won't make for a good day and possible could delay your plans. I had to miss work and a wedding because of them.

Name: M Galena
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Freeport. A few months back AA upgraded my status to Platinum for 3 months and I was able to get the free upgrade to business on this 45 minute flight. Needless to mention that the only business experience you can get on such flight is the pre takeoff beverage and a snack. The seat was nice and comfortable, the aircraft look and felt brand new and I got to work with no major hassles. Thank you AA, now if you could also fly out of ACY and give Spirit a run for their money that would be awesome!

Name: M Galena
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Miami. This was an early flight to get to work, AA had recently sent me an email that they would upgrade my status to Platinum for 3 months so that I could experience the benefits of it. On this flight I did not make it for the business class upgrade, I believe I was like 10 on the list, however I got a seat with more leg room for no extra cost. I got to Miami from Philadelphia with no issues, the plane was clean and the crew professional. Good job AA!

Name: C DiLullo
Review: Not Verified |  Kansas City to Philadelphia. I honestly wouldn’t fly American if they didn’t go everywhere I have to go. They are over priced for what you get. They are just as bad as Spirit as they charge you for seats. How dare you! What am I suppose to do, stand? If you’re not first class they make you feel like nothing. Thanks. Delta, Southwest, Virgin, JetBlue are so much better! These are my last flights on this airline.

Review_Heading: "it was like no one was there"
Name: E Patrick
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Have not flown American Airlines in the past however, did connect thru Philadelphia Airport on a US Air flight 10 years ago. We left Minneapolis no issues, smaller plane. Landed in Philadelphia with plenty of time for our connection to Rome. Airport incredibly hot but that is not the airlines issue. Plane boarded fine (love with they put up sign queues for those who hang out in front of the gate). Plane was pushed back and proceeded to sit on the tarmac for over 3 hours waiting for our assigned place and then de-icing. Pilot was becoming irritated as apparently he could not turn on the ventilation (why I don't understand) and finally came on the intercom stating that the airport has run out of de-icing fuel. I guess they had to run to the store to buy more. In any case, our connection now in Rome is screwed but I don't blame American for that. I find fault with the initial flight crew who never once in those 3 hours made themselves known. When right before take off they came out with water and proceeded to serve the first 3 rows never to be seen again until food service (hour later). Not sure if they were new or what. When asked if they had milk to help settle my stomach the flight attendant said yes she'd be right back (never saw her again). We were towards the front of the cabin, not sure who was getting service here. I have been on many many international flights, so many lost opportunities to show better service. Not once during the overnight flight did they come around with water. No wake up towels (which are a really nice treat on some flights). Basically it was like no one was there. The only redeeming point was that upon landing a flight crew guy got all of us (7) to our connecting gate in time to board from Rome to Tel Aviv. Of course our bags never made it. Overall very disappointing picture of this airlines, and I guess $1000 is nothing to some service industries.
route: Minneapolis to Tel Aviv via Philadelphia

Name: W Johnson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I’m sitting on this flight now. This is the worst experience I’ve ever had with an airline. They got delayed while on the plane. With no explanation whatsoever. Staff are extremely rude. There is no power supply and my daughter who is two years old is getting restless. I will miss my bus and have to wait additional time because I am still sitting on the ground. This is my first time and last time using American Airlines. Also, I had to pay for my two year old who they wouldn’t let me sit her on my lap. So far while writing this, 1 hour and a half. Terrible.

Name: J Lane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Tampa to Philadelphia. Horrible experience. Flight overbooked, forced everyone with a carry on to become checked bag. Pilot said 15’minutes remain, ended up being 45. Once we got off the plane, checked bags were sent to wrong pickup location.

Name: Camilly Berardi
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Orlando to Miami. Rude completely unhelpful at desk. Almost missed flight. Then disrespectful again when another passenger cut the line for the second time. Bet if I was a man or traveling with one he wouldn’t have snapped at me. Worst flight experience ever. Won’t be returning!

Name: R Beale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  American Airlines squeezes every cent of profit out at expense of customers and employees. My roundtrip has been nothing but delays and cancellations. I was stranded in SFO overnight after flight was bumped 10 hours because AA "ran out of room vouchers". I have to now wait 12 hours in Charlotte to take my final one-hour flight leg. I can drive faster than that by 8 hours! Even the supervisor in charge of the 2 employees at the ticketing desk last night said to complain to the airline because their policies are making it hell on employees too!

Name: A Pesch
Review: Not Verified |  Phoenix to Minneapolis. Worst customer service ever. Was traveling this evening (see picture - no one was allowed into the check in area despite no line). Stood next in line to check in bag for 40 minutes and was 3 minutes late to check my bag and told I couldn’t board my flight. When I asked for an explanation, one was not given. I was put on a standby flight with no guarantees seat for the following day again with no explanation. The lady helping me laughed when I walked away - clearly this was a joke to her. Now I’m stuck without a reservation despite paying for a ticket and waiting NEXT IN LINE for 40 minutes. Will never fly American again. Highly recommend flying southwest. American air lines at Phoenix sky harbor ALWAYS has customer service issues. Do not support this airline.

Name: Kelly Jacobs
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Charlotte to Tampa. I was on flight 1773 and my seat was 18B. We had not taken off yet and I had a seizure. It was the first seizure I had in a year. The staff was great and the people around me were great. The steward in particular that stands out whose name I did not get because we just boarded and it was so crazy. He was so amazing and patient and helpful. He got all my stuff for me and made me feel comfortable during my seizure. I wasn’t rushed off the plane or felt embarrassed. The staff and other customers on the flight were so understanding and great. The flight was already delayed and my situation was making it worse and everyone was really great with me. Thank you and please tell that flight attendant from the bottom of my heart thank you!

Name: H Geare
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Lexington. I would recommend paying a little more money to fly with someone else. I’ve had problems every time I’ve flown with American and this past time has been a nightmare. First they do a surprise landing somewhere else, making all of us miss our other flights. They wouldn’t let me on my next one until I argued with them for a while and after they let me and others on they take us all the way to a 30 min take off spot only to take us back bc they decide to cancel it. Had to stay the night in the airport and was supposed to take off on another flight at 12, but only to have them have us get off bc technical issues. They get us another plane, we board, and they tell us to get off again bc technical. They obviously don’t care about their customers bc they won’t pay attention or do anything for wasting 2 days of our lives.

Name: Matt Canner
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Grand Cayman to Denver via Charlotte. I have not flown with this airline for 15+ years. Now I remember why. The absolute worst service in the industry not to mention targeting passengers. Completely incompetent employees in ticketing with no communication to outbound passengers was the beginning almost causing us to miss our flight. Then there was no food service or even the ability to purchase food on an international lunchtime flight not to mention the trash talking by the flight attendants during the flight. Make sure you do not question them because they will target passengers and force you to check your carry on luggage because of a “size” issue even though other passengers with a later boarding group and LARGER luggage were allowed to board no problem. What a disgusting level of service. Never again. Save yourself the problems and spend more to ensure this doesn’t happen to you.
route: Grand Cayman to Denver via Charlotte

Name: D Patterson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | We booked a round-trip fare for direct flights. When we were leaving Eagle airport we were told we had to stop in Denver to get fuel. How ridiculous to send a plane with not enough fuel. We were not offered a beverage or any food for free and got home over 2.5 hours late. No explanation or apology. The flight attendant, he said either we land in Denver or we have to let a third of the passengers off and he said it happens all the time if the flight is full. Why book a full plane then. We suffered and the airline benefited. Last time I’ll fly American. Four of us in our family. All unhappy!

Name: C Gallin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Pittsburgh to Phoenix. Horrible customer service. Due to business I called in to move a flight back willing to pay as I have always done with Southwest Airlines. American was unable to accommodate me in any matter and advised me to buy another round trip ticket as my entire trip would be a total loss. There was no credit or any type of refund offered and on top of that they were the rudest people I have spoken to.

Name: Lana Smith
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Cancun to Omaha via Miami. Absolutely dreadful experience. A nightmare. Flight delayed 5 times without any explanation, stuck in the airport for 6 hours, spent 80$ on food and internet to let family know. On arrival in Miami they throw us on the street without explanation how to get to shuttle to Holiday Inn hotel in the middle of the night. I was forced to take another flight to Chicago, arrive to Omaha a day later, miss my work. I didn’t pay for this. I paid for 5 hours 52 min flight with one connection. It was cattle treatment at the airport. I truly hope they go out of business.

Name: Sam Leake
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I was traveling with my wife and two sons from Dallas to Phoenix via El Paso. I had a boarding pass in hand as I went through the long (25-30 min) security line at DFW. When we arrived at the security desk, the TSA officer scanned my boarding pass and told me it was "invalid." We then tried to scan it from my wife's smart phone in case it was a printer error. Still invalid. I was told to exit the security line and go to an AA kiosk to print another boarding pass. Well, the reserved seat with my name on it was no longer available, so I was forced to make another seat selection. In addition, I was forced to pay an extra $6-7 for the seat. Since I really wanted to join my family for our spring break vacation, and did not wish to miss my flight, I went ahead and bought the new seat. Fortunately the TSA officer allowed me back to the front of the line and I was able to join my family in the terminal, narrowly making the flight. The whole thing seemed like an outrage, even by AA's deplorable standards. Since this is a long review I will spare additional complaints about the long delay de-boarding the flight, the rude AA gate personnel who pretended not to notice my teenaged son while he waited to ask them a question, the long delay getting gate checked bags, etc.. Just awful.
route: Dallas to Phoenix via El Paso

Name: S Deen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dayton to San Diego. I have never been treated so rudely. I have been a Delta flyer for years and I know why. I was flying to San Diego for an important business meeting I arrived at the airport 47 minutes before the flight by the time they were to weigh and load my bags there was 41 minutes until departure, they stopped mid check in and said oh you’ve missed the 45 minute minimum. I said I fly out of this airport all the time and this is my routine. I’ve never heard of such a thing and never missed a flight. Long story short they were less than helpful and suggested I go to the delta desk which I did. I had to book another round trip fair at $2000 just to get to my meeting. The Delta people were very helpful and said they have a 30 minute cut off and so did the rest of the airlines apparently not American. Horrible horrible customer service and poor manners. Never no matter the cost difference will I fly American.

Name: Reginald Jones
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  St. Louis to Dallas via Tampa. They never let me know my flight changed. The people at the desk were rude and unhelpful. Now i will miss a very important business meeting because I can't get a flight until the morning. I will never catch an American Airlines flight again.
route: St. Louis to Dallas via Tampa

Name: Jenee Patterson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Left Cleveland for Dallas on time, when we arrived to Dallas flight was delayed 2 hours then delayed another 3 hours. American Airlines were really great about trying to make customers happy. They offered rooms for customers who didn’t want to wait and had food and drinks at the gate complimentary. I have flown for years and American is my choice of airline. These things happen and we all know the risk when traveling.

Name: B Keene
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Oklahoma City to Tampa. It is very frustrating that the majority of flyers take on 2 and even 3 carry on items. Most of them are large and need to be checked. We check our bags everytime we fly and are charged 25 bucks per bag. But, the people that don't check their bags and are forced to check them at the plane don't get charged a dime. There was a girl on our flight 3 days ago that carried on a duffle bag that was bigger than her. It didn't fit in the overhead compartment and it didn't fit under her seat. She had her feet on top of it the entire flight and no one said anything to her. All of this "not checking bags" also holds up the entire plane and with short connection times we have made very close calls of almost missing our connecting flights. This is a very frustrating and unfair system that needs to be taken care of immediately.

Name: Jean-Marc Brand
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I flew with American Airlines from Manchester, UK to Philadelphia. I didn’t find the flight crew rude, however my mom sitting next to me said the man serving food was grumpy. While I didn’t find him especially friendly I didn’t think he was rude. The food was below average. The inflight entertainment didn’t have the biggest selection of films although I did find something to watch. This isn’t the worst airline experience I’ve had but far from the best.

Name: Juju Naqib
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Absolutely horrible airline. Flew from Cleveland to philly to Punta Cana, got a 5 hour delay to Punta Cana ended up getting to our resort at 8 at night. On way home we landed at 9 o clock they held us on plane till 10 and missed our flight home which was at 10:15 and wouldn’t even accommodate us to a hotel room for the night told us it wasn’t there fault we got held on the plane for an extra hour after landing had to spend an extra 130$ for a hotel room.

Name: Richard Winger
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New York JFK to Sao Paulo and back in business class was a flawless flight. AA's lounges on both ends have been renovated, while they won't win design awards, they are spacious and comfortable. At JFK, there is actually real champagne (let's hope that won't be cost reduced); at GRU, it's a Brazilian sparkler, surprisingly drinkable. Hot food at both ends looked dubious, the cold stuff was upscale deli quality but varied and tasty enough to make for a pleasant light supper. Boarding both times was smooth, the flight attendants were personable and caring, AA's much reviewed C seat is really spacious and confortable. I slept soundly, both ways practically from wheels up to final descent. Flights arrived a little early both times. What more can you ask for?

Name: D Geare
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Tampa to Charlotte. Absolute worst airline. Had to take emergency military leave to attend my grandfathers funeral. Was told by employee on the phone to buy a later in day ticket to save money and was assured multiple times that my ticket was available to be put on stand by for earlier flights. Arrived at TPA, only to be told by multiple employees that it wasnt eligible to be placed on stand by. So yes I know this is partly on myself for being ignorant enough to buy a later ticket. However, due to the dishonesty on the part of the sales representative and refusal to listen by the airport employees I missed my own grandfathers funeral. Really appreciate that AA. If I could give you a negative 10, I would.

Name: Diamond Brown
Review: Not Verified |  I had a flight leaving out of Washington DC to go to Arizona (layover) then to California. My flight leaving from DC was at 7:01, we board the plane and then after an hour of sitting, the plane tells us to get off due to technical issues. I believe it was either smoking and there was an issue with the hydraulic system. So our flight departure time got pushed back to 9, then to 10, then. 12. And at 12 they said they would let us know if we could board the plane. 12 o’clock came, they said no, then pushed departure back to 2. Once two o’clock came, we no longer had a pilot or a flight crew. So we now have to wait for a flight crew. Pushed out time back to 3:30 then to 3:55. FINALLY we board and take off to Pheonix, AZ. I had to reschedule my layover flight now to arrive in California at 10pm, when originally I should’ve been to California by 12pm. My layover flight at AZ departure time is 8:37pm. We board the plane, and then get a text message (with their updates) that the flight gate has changed. They make an announcement after finish letting us board to say the plane is out of service we will be going to another plane. Now push back time is 9:00pm. I have been dealing with American Airlines literally all day, and I have never experienced anything like this before in my life. I will not be using them again. Did you not know the plane was going to be out of service.

Name: Enesh Yazgeldiyeva
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Raleigh Durham to Dallas Ft Worth. Terrible. It was round-trip both flights was delayed and don’t have space for cabin bag. Seriously this not acceptable everyone have their own time they shouldn’t ruin it. I am so disappointed.
route: Raleigh Durham to Dallas Ft Worth

Name: G Daniel
Review: Not Verified |  Absolute worst airline I’ve ever flown with. I currently travel around twice per month with Delta for work, but had to take American Airlines for my honeymoon. Everyone from the baggage check worker to the gate workers were extremely rude. They overbooked my flight and told me that I had to check my carry-on due to size, even though I currently travel with this bag every other week without every encountering any issues. When I got on the plane, I witnessed them tell the lady in front of me that she was upgraded to first class, only to tell her she had to go back to her original seat when she got up to the front with her bag! This is a joke of an airline and I will never be flying with them again.

Name: Charles Cocores
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Kona to Phoenix. Awful experience on an aging, dirty poorly equipped plane. Seat had almost no room, very narrow. The legroom even though I paid for extra was awful and inadequate. The graphic showed when you select your seat was inaccurate and did not represent the leg room available on the plane. I got no satisfaction when I complained to AA. I'm even an AA Advantage credit card member, have a frequent flyer account as well and that meant nothing to them.

Name: M Eltwal
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to Boston. Was supposed to leave at 10:20 pm, got postponed three times without any information. I was traveling with my kids one is 4 years old and the other 6 months old, we did not start boarding till after midnight and the staff were very rude and evasive when you ask for information. This airline is getting much worse, this is not my first bad experience, I am considering even canceling the credit card I have with American Airlines, not interested in their miles, very disappointed and frustrated. That leg of the trip just ruined all the fun we had on our vacation.

Name: Tim Shivers
Review: Not Verified |  Gulfport to Dallas. I am sitting at the airport with another delayed flight. It has become way more normal for a flight delay than on time. Particularly with AA! Our flight is now 7 hours past due and still isn’t here. Also, they are not giving us updates. It is 10 minutes past the last updated departure time and no news at all. I recommend flying with anyone but AA. The “savings” isn’t worth it when you have to plan a full day early to allow for repeated delays. I’m done with American Airlines.

Name: Darlene Davis
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Ruined my vacation! Flight to Jacksonville delayed, rerouted to DC with a connection flight to Jacksonville. This flight delayed for 2 hours, arriving 15 minutes before my cruise was scheduled to leave, sat on the tarmac for an additional 15 mins while the pilot informed us "short staffed, no one to guide the plane to the airport." Really didn't matter that I arrived just in time to miss my cruise because my luggage arrived 3 hours later on a plane from Dallas. The response from this horrible airline? I received an email saying they were sorry that my travel plans didn't work out, but since I purchased an economy class tickets, there are no refunds. My vacation plans were going just fine until they ruined them. A year planning the ultimate vacation, all that time and money lost due to this heartless joke of an airline!

Name: B Garlenes
Review: Not Verified |  Thanks to American Airlines we were stuck here in South Korea they didn’t give us a "solution" like three hours ago. After they canceled our original flight this morning with just one stop, reasons "maintenance". Very bad experience with this airline. Our original itinerary was from Shanghai to Dallas and then Houston, and the canceled and I called them to fix the issue and the hang up on me after 45 minutes on the phone and the selected the flight for us and the send us via a China airlines from Shanghai to South Korea and then Dallas and all those flights they put us in separated seats with two minors (with is prohibited) and 9 years old and a 2 years old minors and when we ask the flight attended the didn’t want to help us we have to find the way to trade the seats. We ask for a upgrade or refund for our way back home and they never says anything and now we don’t have even our miles for our way back home from Shanghai to Houston. Completely disappointed with the treatment that we received.

Name: Dakoda Thomas
Review: Not Verified |  Alabama to New York. The only reliable thing about this airline is that it consistently fails to get its passengers to the agreed location on time. I’ve flown with American Airlines 3 times over the last year and every time something causes a failure on the airlines part to get me to the destination I payed to travel. Also I bought a family members ticket and today they failed to get them to the local airport and I’m having to drive hours to get them. It’s been blamed on the weather, mechanical issues, even bad luck by the airline but in reality this airline is terrible. I tried calling and asking for some sort of reimbursement but the said I would have to email the airline and provide tons of documentation instead of a representative helping me after the airlines failed on 4 different occasions. This airline is absolutely horrible and I hope people read this and go to another airline because there’s a high probability this airline will fail you!

Name: D Stralza
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Los Angeles to Chicago. There is too many seats in the airplane and no one have any space. Everyone is sitting and touching another person every time you want to move. The tables are dirty so as carpet in many places. I have no idea who have decided about Zoës kitchen food but I have tried turkey wrap which was soggy, wet with wet cheese inside and no taste on the way to LA and on the way back to Chicago I give them a 2nd chance and tried chicken sandwich which had hard ciabatta some kind of sauce that made ciabatta soggy inside.

Name: Lori Duggan
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Oklahoma City to Tampa. The absolute worst airline. Customer service leaves a lot to be desired. I was transferred 4 times. I will never fly American again. The staff in customer service for Dallas airport was very belittling to me. So he cancelled my flight because I told him to go back home.

Name: B Anderson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | New York to Dallas. Every time I've flown through them, my flight has been delayed. We had a 1 pm EST flight from LGA to DFW, which was cancelled eventually after several delays due to mechanical issue. Then we were put on a 7 pm flight that also got delayed several times before departing at 8:15 pm. We arrived at DFW at 11 pm, 7 hours later than we were suppose to! No, we didn't get any voucher or anything for the delay. There were other airlines that were cheaper than American Airlines but I chose AA thinking we will fly in comfort because of the extra cost. I was very wrong! I am never flying on an AA again. Please do yourself a favor and avoid them if you can. They are not worth the extra money. Infact they were a lot worse in my experience compared to other cheaper airlines. I have flown to NYC from DFW and back several times before on other airlines and not once did I experience any kind of delays. I give them 0/10.

Name: Camryn Strickland
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Austin to Durango via Dallas. Well we made our flight to Dallas barely on time. Then our flight was delayed but that was ok we were going to make it, we made it to our gate on time only to find that it was closed and people on standby were put ahead of us, even though we were expected to make our flight and we bought our tickets months in advance. Thank you American legal for the worst flight experience ever. The flight attendants were polite, but they couldn't do anything for us.

Name: G Tara
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  St. Thomas to Detroit via Philadelphia. Honestly, this airline provided me the worst experience as far as flying goes, I fly somewhere usually once or twice a year, and I’ve been traveling via air travel for as long as I can remember. I opted to take AA instead of Spirit because I wanted a middle of the road airline to avoid delays or issues. Every flight and connecting flight I rode on was delayed by hours, the last trip being the longest of the delays. AA provided us “free chips” instead of meal tickets as their apology for such a long delay. Unless you went to the front desk and complained to their staff, nothing else was offered or provided. I found out some customers were given extra miles or credit towards another ticket at the airport, so I decided to call AA customer service to try and get the same credit. Instead of receiving help, I was talking to an extremely rude “customer service” agent who at the end of our phone conversation was literally screaming and yelling at me and reduced me to tears of frustration. I spoke with a supervisor who apologized for her co workers behavior, but I was still offered no other help or credit. This airline is a joke, and you are way better off saving over 150 bucks per tickets and fly spirit or some other airline before you consider this one. At least when spirit delayed my flight they offered us meal tickets and partial credit towards another ticket. I never say this about a company, but I hope AA goes under because they are truly terrible. I feel bad for the cabin staff, because they were the only ones who were kind and supportive and they work for a bad company.
route: St. Thomas to Detroit via Philadelphia

Name: Andrew Guerra
Review: Not Verified |  Knoxville to Charlotte. I was late (my fault) I tried to check in at the kiosk but it wouldn't let me, thinking i missed my flight. I asked the lady at the counter, she nodded her head as if i had missed it, she asked for my ID and started looking for another flight, then she called someone and asked if there were on time. She then turned to me and said start running to security so of course i did as i got to security i turned and she was right behind me, she got me through security and to the gate. (with 1 minute to spare). So as if it couldn't get any better as were both out of breath and i'm thanking her for everything she's done, she turns to go back to work and then she turns back to me, and says oh yeah your going to need this, and gives me the credit card I left at the ticket counter. Know all that being said its been a uphill battle to get her the recognition she deserves so let me help you.

Name: C Reade
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  St Thomas to Huntsville via Charlotte. I arrived at my gate on a 2 hour lay-over. Sat there all this time. They boarded the flight to Huntsville. Right before they closed the doors the agent called my name and just said to me “sorry we can’t get you on this flight.” He didn’t offer any explanation. He told me to stick around and he will see. So after I waited around he said the flight is closed, and that really upset me. First of all I had a paid ticket with an assigned seat. Second of all; there were no explanation as to what happened, and last that male agent was rude, packed his things and left 14 of us standing there like dogs. Yes, I starting telling them how unfair, poor, and ridiculous this is. Then a lady came over and gave us those sorry $260 comfort in hotel vouchers for the night. AA services sucks, they are big liars. I will not fly with AA. Their services have gone to the dogs.
route: St Thomas to Huntsville via Charlotte

Name: C Dawson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Antonio to Wichita via Dallas. I’m traveling with a service animal, not an emotional support animal or a therapeutic animal but a service animal. I’m also traveling with three small kids. We have been trying to leave Dallas since 3:12 pm central standard time. We have been moved around from gate to gate to gate. I have 8 different messages from you guys with different flight times. That is a long time for a service animal. She was starting to show signs she needed to go to the bathroom. They had moved us over to terminal C. I asked where the pet relief station was. I was told there are none in C. They are all located in A and D. They repeatedly failed to mention the one in B. Even then I wouldn’t have enough time to go to B and catch my flight. Before I flew I called and asked about flying with her and pet relief. I was advised in thermal C they would have someone escort me out and back in. The gate agents refused and said there is nothing they can do. I requested a supervisor. A guy name Kip, who did not introduce himself came over. The only reason I know his name is I asked someone else. I repeated what the gate agents said. I asked what am I expected to do when she goes to the bathroom. His reply was as an airlines that is not their responsibility’s i replied back how shitty American Airlines customer service is and how you guys are the worse airlines. He told me I didn’t need to us profanity, which I did not. He just stood there and I told him bye. He wasn’t helpfully so what was the point of having him stand there. He left and went over to a computer and started to type. They finally got ready to preboard. I was waiting in line and while he was typing he would repeatedly stair me down giving me a very dirty look. Finally I asked if I could help him with some thing. He snapped back if he could help me with something. I replied back how he keeps stairing me down. He said I was the one looking at him and he was “scanning” the boarding area doing his job. Every flight we have ever had with this company has been bad. They may have one or two employees that are good. 99% of them are horrible
route: San Antonio to Wichita via Dallas

Name: S Tosh
Review: Not Verified |  I booked a flight to Tampa through budgetair which consisted of a connecting flight. Toronto to Charlotte, NC to Tampa. The aircraft was having maintenance issues which lead to the airline saying they would update us once they recieved information in 45 minutes. These 45 minutes increments went on for five hours leading everyone to miss their connecting flight. Little information was shared and no other flights were available. The A.A representatives were extremely rude to all concerned passengers. Following cancellation, the airline was forced to rebook everyone to the following day. They sent emails with hotel & food voucher but they were for Charlotte), not where I was stuck (in Toronto). Since it was late no one could get a hold of a representative. When I called customer service the first rep was extremely reluctant to help. The supervisor kept me on hold for 45 minutes trying to get in touch with someone at the airport. No one was there so I was stranded with no where to go, having to sit in arrivals all night and morning until the flight the next night. It was a devastating night. The following day when I made my second attempt to get to Tampa. The tickets they issued were a massive downgrade from my previous flight. I was placed in the back of plane with no option for my allowed carry on. The two representatives at the desk were again overly rude with all passengers for no reason. The women would address everyone with abrupt and condescending tones when people inquired about carry-on luggage or connecting flight info. I WOULD NEVER FLY with this company strictly based on the terrible experience with all staff. Delta is the way to go if flying to US destination. I have flown to over 40 countries with at least 12 different airlines, I have experienced delays but nothing compares to this awful experience.

Name: Jennie Theriault
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Hartford to Dallas. My 4 year daughter and myself were flying with our pet, and right from the rip, the customer service/baggage check in woman was super nasty. Before even looking at our pets paperwork she was telling us she couldn't fly. I gave her all the proper documentation and she still wouldn't let our dog fly. On top of that, I asked her if there if we could get a cart ride to our terminal because I am 6 months pregnant, with back issues and a 4 year old. Her response was, "We have wheel chairs." So we walked and low and behold, there is one of those golf carts sitting right in front of terminal, not being used. Fast track, our dog stayed behind and I contacted guest relations, as I was instructed to do. She issued us vouchers, for the incorrect amount, twice, just to find out they can not be used for pet travel. On top of that, the airline wants to charge us an additional $125 for our pet to fly since we won't be on the flight with her, totaling $325 instead of $200. Their responses, "Sorry for the inconvenience but we can not do anything." Needless to say, by far the worst airline customer service we have ever encountered, and we will NEVER fly American Airlines again!

Name: Ya Bing Xu
Review: Not Verified |  Good luck if you flying with American airline, my first time and only time with this company, I have to forced to stay in Toronto for one extra day with paying extra car rental and hotel, missing work because they canceled our flight, but our friends were able to fly with Westjet under the same weather? American  Airlines did not try to offer any compensation!

Name: M Roberts
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Raleigh to Miami. I just want to start by clarifying that the rating is exclusively for the agent to check us in at Durham airport, who had a choice to be or not to be hospitable with my wish for an extra seat for my lap toddler, if available, and he chose to be hospitable and do his best to accommodate us. Despite the fact that the agent next to him was repeatedly telling him that “I get what I pay for” and that I bought “2 seats in economy so that’s what I get” Well to my luck, he was more understanding and empathetic than his coworker (she probably is not a mother.) Although I knew that he could have said no because I “did not pay” for her seat, why deny it if the plane has available seats?! Why even bother to deny a child a seat? Thank you for being an understanding and compassionate being. Cheers to you and I sure hope your kindness takes you far. To the agent next him Bill - you have a lot to learn in this business, you should start by being more respectful to customers in front of you and compassionate towards others.

Name: Kersten Hubbard
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  My recent trip to Jacksonville (JAX) was plagued with problems the minute I became an American Airlines passenger. I want to be clear that the first leg of my journey from Seattle to Dallas (DFW) on Alaska Airlines. I can’t say enough good things about them. I continue to be a very loyal Alaska consumer. My American Airlines 8:35pm flight from DFW to JAX backed out from the gate on time. Before entering the taxiway, the pilot came on saying there were mechanical problems and we had to return to the gate. A bit later we were told to deplane. No one was able to provide any information on whether the flight was going to continue or not. Around 930/10 pm, American announced the flight was canceled. I then headed with the 200 other passengers to the American Airlines Customer Service desk where I waited in line for over an hour. By the time I reached the desk, it was midnight. I was “automatically” put on a 5AM flight from DFW to Charlotte (CLT) then on to JAX. The customer service lady and I agreed that a hotel room would be worthless, since the flight was scheduled for 5AM. She offered me a meal voucher, which I accepted. A whole $12 voucher. $12 to spend in the airport. Unfortunately, the stores were closed and there was nowhere I could spend the $12. I spent the night in DFW waiting for a 5am flight, all due to American Airlines’ mechanical problems. At some point, I called American’s customer service to see if I could get better compensation. I was told no, $12 is it. Nothing else. Have a good night. My early AM flight was also grounded due to mechanical problems on American Airlines. While we waited on the plane, several people deplaned. Some spread out. Finally, over 2 hours after our scheduled departure, the gate agents came on to do a final head count. The count was so far off, that they made us deplane and replane. Again, more passengers abandoned the flight for other options. I was now going to miss my connection in CLT due to American Airlines’ mechanical problems. By this time, my last meal was over 24 hours ago. I was unable to eat in the airport because I either had to stay at the gate, was captive on a broken American Airlines plane, or nothing was open. The snacks American offered I could not eat due to being gluten intolerant. I finally made it to CLT, the plan leaving over 2 hours late. Fortunately, my connection was also late due to weather and not a mechanical problem (what a refreshing change). I arrived in Jacksonville 18 hours after I was supposed to and after a journey that took 36 hours instead of 12. All of this due to multiple mechanical problems on American Airlines. To add insult to injury, American clearly demonstrated that my value as a paying customer is worth all of $12 to them. However, since I was never able to use the voucher, my value to them is actually worth $0. Which is exactly what I will be giving them in the future! Journey took 36 hours and should have been 12.

Name: Brandy Rhines
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Atlanta to Chicago. The flight was smooth. I will definitely be back to purchase flights again. Wish it was more leg room but the flight and snacks we're great. Thank you American airlines for my smooth trip.

Name: M Keanes
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  American Airlines is a hot mess! Do not fly this airline. We flew from Philly to Jax hole  via Chicago, a route we have done 5 other times on other airlines with no problems. On American, our flight from Chicago to Jax hole was cancelled and we got to vacation a day late. On the way home, American delayed our flight by 7 hours and then cancelled. It then booked us a day later to Columbus (we need to go to Philadelphia!). We had to talk to a gate agent to fix this and then got a route with 2 stops one in Chicago, the other in Columbus before finally getting to Philly. I don’t know how such an incompetent airline is going to get us to all of these stops in time and can’t wait to see where we get stuck tomorrow. Further evidence of american’s incompetence is that they put us up at a spring hill suites in Jax hole where the hotel had no rooms. The poor people at the hotel desk had to shuffle all kinds of things to help us. American said mechanical issues caused our first cancellation and then a “multitude of problems” caused the second delay and cancellation. Take care of your planes American and get a handle on your scheduling! If you want to get your flight cancelled and scramble go for American. They do that really well. I am never ever flying American again and will go out of my way to not fly this horrific airline. They just don’t care. A gate agent working for American told me “this happens to everyone” about all of my cancellations. That statement is so indicative of how they feel about its customers. No big deal, we will ruin your vacation, mess up your life on the way home and cost you tons of money. I should add that my previous 2 business trips were also a horrendous experience. In February 2019, I had a meeting in Orlando and American delayed the 8:55pm flight by 2 hours because the overhead bin doors were broken. How does this happen? I got to my destination at 1am. Great when you have an 8am meeting the next day. My other trip was to Indianapolis from Philly. American cancelled that flight because the crew timed out and made no effort to rebook us. I would have missed my important meeting if I relied on American. I ended up flying delta to Cincinnati and then Uber’d To Indy. Unbelievable. The last debacle that I will leave you all with is our vacation to Vail last March (2018). Also a route from Philadelphia to Dallas to vail airport. Our flight should have left at 1pm for Dallas, it was delayed 2 hours and then 2 more hours and then the flight finally took off at 7pm, so we missed our connection in Dallas to vail and as a result had to stay over in Dallas and then go to vail the next day. We got to vacation a day late. I should have learned from this experience! Never again, American. You don’t care about your customers and are a complete cluster. I fly a lot for work as well, and whenever I can, I will not be taking American unless absolutely necessary and it will be begrudgingly!

Name: H Keane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Cancun. American Airlines is the worst airline I have ever witnessed. I had a ticket that they just disregarded and therefore I am pushed back to take a 1:45 flight which ruins my day plans and trip plans. The flight attendants made it completely unclear as to the volunteer and voucher program and therefore now that I did not volunteer but was forced to not board my flight, I am not getting a travel voucher and am not guaranteed to be on the next flight. I am now waiting for 5 hours at DFW on my birthday still unsure as to if I will get in the next flight. The communication in this airline is terrible. Flight attendants are uninformed and are incompetent at giving customers information as to why 60 paid customers who bought their tickets 6 months in advance are now forced to take a later flight that we are not even guaranteed to go on. Overall, a horrible experience that of course I have to deal with on my birthday and am now missing and entire day of my three day trip. I wish that this airline would compensate for all the issues this has brought me for their lack of supplying seats to customers who have had a seat on this flight for over 6 months. No one should ever fly this airline, you will end up missing your vacation and stuck in the airport with no explanation.

Name: Kody Katzenberger
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Denver to St. Louis via Chicago. American Airlines is a complete joke! First they lose my email so it was nearly impossible tracking down my boarding pass. They do not care at all for making that easier on the customer. Then my flight was running behind (not delayed, just behind) so I was late for my layover and my ticket had me boarding at the wrong gate. I finally tracked down customer service and there was a huge line. People from different flights having similar problem. Customer service didn’t even care. The offered me a possible discount at a nearby hotel. They should have refunded me every dime and paid for my hotel in full. I had to spend the night at the Chicago O’hare airport which is not accommodating at all. Do not fly American Airlines! I’ve talked to so many others and I wish I knew before hand. Stay away from American Airlines.
route: Denver to St. Louis via Chicago

Name: J Lanetov
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Los Angeles to Miami. I was refused to be refunded for the airfare of the flight which had to be canceled due to my daughter’s illness. She was only 9-month old baby who was badly vomiting and at high risk to fly. As advised by the AA airline, I provided an explanation and discharge papers from the doctor. However, it did not touch anyone in American Airline’s customer service because three weeks later, I received a cold statement that refund is not allowed. I’m so greatly disappointed that will never consider American Airline again and definitely discourage my relatives and friends from considering their service.

Review_Heading: "seriously gone down hill in recent years"
Name: H Huang
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I have been flying AA for over 20 years, 10 of which I have been Executive Platinum. I travel nearly 200,000 miles/year on AA. It seems AA have seriously gone down hill in recent years. Their on time record due to equipment troubles have been so poor that it's become unreliable for a business traveler. As an example, in just two recent weeks I've missed a connection in London due to a 2 hour delay because we had to switch planes for equipment problems. Then my flight from DFW to SEA was cancelled over 24 hours before the flight, again due to "equipment problems". How can you not get a new plane in place over the course of a day when they already know the plane has problems. This has become more the norm for AA than it should ever be. I am so disappointed with the drop in quality level of the on time performance and random cancellations that I am considering switching airline loyalty.

Review_Heading: "not have time to check a bag"
Name: N Barkam
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Phoenix. The gate agent in Dallas was not checking the size of the Carry-ons. Once he realized space was an issue baggage started being checked for size. I was forced to check my brand new bag, his response was "I should've gotten to the gate earlier" well if my connecting flight was delayed i wouldn't me in this situation. Who speaks to customers like this? When i boarded the plane it was obvious that no one checked to see if there was actually room for carry-ons. 3 empty overhead compartment. The agent showed no compassion in regards to my situation. i was flying for business and did not have the time to check a bag. i also had very expense components within my suitcase for work in which i was told "the airline insures it". long behold when i received my luggage from the carousel one wheels were broken off.

Name: J Meares
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  This wasn't my first time flying with American airlines but it will definitely be my last. For starters, I have had more than one bad experience with them. This time, I was flying from Lafayette to a connecting flight in Dallas and then to Toronto. I always check my flight status ahead of time and there were no reported delays or changes. But for some reason, the agent at the boarding gate in Lafayette was not letting us board at our scheduled time. They gave us no information as to why we were waiting and told us we would be boarding shortly. Well, 'shortly' became at least 40 minutes. After landing in Dallas, my party and I found out the gate and terminal had changed from what was on our boarding passes and switched to the other side of the airport. After running through the crowded hallways and shouting apologies we made it to our gate which was already closed and unstaffed, about 10 minutes before our scheduled flight. At the next American airlines customer assistance counter, we were told the next available flight would be the next day. Myself and at least 10 other customers were trying to figure out how this happened as we all arrived to our first flight well ahead of the scheduled time. The agents at the service counter were saying it was coded in the system as 'delayed due to weather' ... but why then were the other similar flights, one of which departing just 10 minutes before ours, not also delayed due to weather...? How was this one flight in particular the only one delayed due to weather? Why was the online flight tracker not updated? And why was it listing our first plane as 'landed on time' in Lafayette... ? We took a step aside, and called the customer assistance number and agents over the phone were saying there was no reason listed for the delay. I took my phone back to the counter and had both agents speak to each other, who could not agree on the information they each had available. After they decided to agree-to-disagree, they informed us that their policy does not offer any accommodations for room, food or necessities. We were told the reason being that it was coded as a weather delay... Now, I was never rude or took a tone with the service agents, but they were still not helpful or empathetic to the situation, I guess they are just too used to delivering bad news. They also never offered any information about the area such as what hotels are nearby, even after we asked. At this point, I asked for a supervisor who could offer more assistance in this area, yet we were told that a supervisor would tell us the same thing, and we would be 'wasting our breath'. The only alternative we were offered was the website to American airlines, where we could send an email. This whole experience has left me quite skeptical about the information being given from American Airline and its service agents, who may use these 'codes' to protect themselves from obligations and policies they advertise to its customers. Please consider my experience as a warning for anyone looking to book any flights with AA online, and please exercise caution especially when booking connecting flights with them as they allow a minimum window of 30 minutes between connecting flights and will not accommodate you if your next flight is missed, even if they are solely responsible and the situation is out of your control.

Name: Steven Williams
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Cancellations and delays are part of air travel. However customer service reps with attitudes are ridiculous. It wasn’t just one, but each individual we encountered and observed in both airports seem to not have a concern in the world if we enjoyed the flight.

Name: B Nordenes
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  The worst airline. On my trip from Nashville to Dallas they made us wait more than an hour inside the plane for maintenance problems, which caused me to lose my connection to Mexico City. They offered me the next available flight. To make this experience more terrible, this second flight, ALSO had technical problems. 40 minutes of delay have passed and we are still not taking off. I missed a great date for your poor service. I always use United, but for wanting to arrive 30 minutes earlier I decided to use american. What cost me until now more than 3 hours more! ES:   La peor linea aerea. En mi viaje de Nashville a Dallas nos hicieron esperar mas de una hora dentro del avion por problemas de mantenimiento, lo que hizo que perdiera mi conexion hacia Mexico city. Me ofrecieron el siguiente vuelo disponible. Para hacer esta experiencia mas terrible, este segundo vuelo, TAMBIEN tuvo problemas tecnicos. Han pasado 40 minutos de retrazo y seguimos sin despegar. Perdí una gran cita por su mal servicio. Simpre uso United, pero por querer llegar 30 minutos antes decidí usar american. Lo que me costó hasta ahorita mas de 3 horas MAS!

Name: S Warburton
Review: Not Verified |  Washington to Charlotte. I had three flights, and they wouldn’t give me a seat on the first one. Finally managed to get on, then the flight got seriously delayed so I missed both my layovers because of it. Don’t buy from them because you’re not guaranteed the seat you paid hundreds of dollars for.

Name: B Laird
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I was flying from Lubbock to Dallas Ft Worth via Houston. My flight landed on tarmac at 605am. I was at the tarmac for 30 min flying American Eagle flight. As soon as it reached the jetbridge, i was out of there making my connection to the other terminal so I wouldn't miss my flight to Houston. After running hard and fast, I managed to reach my gate. I was stopped and asked for my id and boarding pass. I showed it to them. The lady remarked she was too busy at the starbucks to come sooner, looking at my starbucks bag. I was so shocked at the way she looked and assumed it was my fault somehow. I don't need terrible customer service at the gate as well as in flight to start my day bad. Please be courteous to your customers and try flying your flights on time rather than assuming your customers are late.
route: Lubbock to Dallas Ft Worth via Houston

Name: David Gay
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Denver to Garden City via Dallas. 4 flights on American Airlines, and late 4 times. That's a 0% on-time rate. This is a terrible airline. Average time late: 1hr. Don't fly American! Any airline is better than this.
route: Denver to  Garden City via Dallas

Name: T Han
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Reno to Long beach via Phoenix . We booked a flight departing Reno airport at 9.29am which was to land at LAX 11.09am (AA 6018). AA 6018 got cancelled due to weather conditions (other airlines like Southwest didn't cancel their flights) and were booked on a new route which had a layover at Phoenix. The flights were AA 546 departing Reno at 12.45pm and landing in Phoenix at 3.28pm and AA5896 departing Phoenix at 3.56pm and landing in Long Beach at 4.15pm. You can already see how tight this layover is. The first flight was late in Phoenix by just minutes but we arrived at gate A7 and were supposed to depart at gate B16, running took 10 minutes. My sister and I caught the plane before the gate closed and were checked in but the employee who checked us in held on to my ticket in her hand while she assisted other travellers, answering their questions and letting them through. The other passengers on our first flight (AA 546) who were running towards this connecting flight (AA5896) arrived at gate B16 and the employee realised there were so many other passengers who had to board and decided to close the gate. She and the subsequent managers and other AA staff insisted that it was standard procedure to close the gates 10 mins before the flight and there was no communication from the first flight to hold this connecting flight. They even called security when one of the passengers who arrived later than us (but before the gate closed) started crying. The AA staff had us booked on the next flight from Phoenix to Long Beach (AA5899) which was delayed by 1.5hrs. The flight duration between PHX and LGB is also 1.5hrs. We realised on hindsight that even if we had got on AA5896, our checked bags wouldn't have anyway. American Airlines never should have offered such a connecting flight to passengers. Half an hour layover is clearly insufficient if passengers have to change planes and if AA flights were going to land late (it happens so frequently that it should be included in the flight time). If they told passengers that the connecting flight would be held (they told the passenger who cried), then the flight should have been held. Who lies about stuff like that? The AA employee couldn't maintain order. She prioritised passengers who were behind me while holding on to my processed ticket because they were more aggressive. My sister had already been processed and was waiting for me on the inside of the gate. She saw the employee tear my processed ticket after she closed the gate (literally in my face).
route: Reno to Long beach via Phoenix

Name: Neal Hermanowicz
Review: Not Verified |  Los Angeles to Washington DCA. American entices customer loyalty by allowing preferred seat selection but then changes the plane (and the seat) without notification. As a consequence I ended up on a 5.5 hour flight in standard coach. I am 6'2". This amounts to fraudulent business practices. American's customer relations response is to say no seats are guaranteed. They bank on frequent fliers like me (I have platinum status with American) selecting preferred seats and then filling their seats by switching aircraft. After 30 years and 1.3 million miles with American I am changing airlines. Their deception and poor service are intolerable. The planes themselves are often old, the seats are unusually cramped, and amenities that are now standard (accessible plugs, screens at each seat) on other airlines are often missing.

Name: Ashley Cass
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Rapid City. I will not choose American Airlines again. We were suppose to depart at 8:40am and we still have not moved and it’s 10:20am. They first told us it would be a 20 minute wait and we would be on our way. I did appreciate the flight attendants, but other than that this time delay is ridiculous.

Name: S Kernow
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Fort Lauderdale to Chicago. American Airlines is flat out horrible. We had a nightmare of a time getting to Fort Lauderdale from Madison. Initially the our flight was delayed 30 minutes for bad weather. We were not upset about that. However, once all the passengers were boarded, we were asked to unload because of a mechanical sensor issue which took another 2 hours to fix. We ended up having to stand in long lines and rebook our connection 3 different time. All in all an 8 hour delay! When we finally got back on that flight, the pilot says they have to fuel up!! They couldn't have done that when they were fixing the sensor?!?! If that whole situation wasn't unfortunate enough, we got bumped from our original return flight and are now getting home over 5 hours later than we wanted to. When we asked about getting on an earlier flight, we were told no and each customer service person we spoke to was unaccomodating and rude.
route: Fort Lauderdale to Chicago via Madison

Name: J Reade
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Denver to Los Angeles. Out of all the planes at Denver Airport American Airlines fails again. They had us wait 2.5 hours on the plane while they de-ice. We are 3 houra late to LEX and no one talked to any of us about compensation or refunds. We pay a lot to fly and i expect American Airlines to get me to my destination in a reasonable time. Today they failed.

Name: D Gold
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to New York JFK. Reasonably short internal domestic flight to connect to LHR via JFK. All one can say about this airline is "grin and bear it". It is truly grim beyond grim. Flying American Airlines for internal US domestic travel is done under total sufferance. They will charge you for everything, including seat selection and baggage. This is precisely what happens when the likes of American Airlines have a virtual monopoly for US air travel. The ONLY reason to fly this airline, is that their frequent flier program is probably the easiest to use compared to Delta or United. Don't look nor expect any kind of reasonable service from this airline, from check-in to baggage collection, and the in-flight experience is terrible in economy class. What a shame!

Name: D Gold
Review: Colorado Springs to Orange County via Dallas. One flies with American Airlines with trepidation and a heavy heart. The decline of this once great airline is quite sad, but airline choices in the USA generally are limited. I used a combination of reward miles and revenue ticket, and requested a simple upgrade to domestic US First Class, using AAdvantage miles. They finally granted an upgrade, but only on the short COS-SNA sector, not the longer DFW-SNA sector. However, predictably American billed for the entire sector, and also had the temerity to bill a further $150.00 for same day flight change, and the upgrade. I couldn't believe it! Not only is the service on this airline non-existent, but they bill additional charges for almost everything. It is a wonder they don't bill for breathing on the airplane, or using the bathroom. Anymore, flying in the USA on American Airlines is mere transport. They are low class at best, certainly not First Class.
route: Colorado Springs to Orange County via Dallas

Name: M Martin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | San Juan to Salt Lake City with American Airlines. The worst flying experience ever! Flights overbooked, one was delayed 4hrs so we missed our connecting flight, our luggage was put on the wrong plane. Very unprofessional and unorganized.
route: San Juan to Salt Lake City

Name: Mona Swain
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  While the airlines cannot control the weather, they can certainly control the customer service (or lack of) that their paying customers receive. I missed my connecting flight to Greensboro from Charlotte on 2/19/2019 due to rainy, cold weather. I entered Charlotte airport at concourse A and had to depart from concourse E which is about a 12-15 minute walk. Once I was informed that plane's door was closed and could not be opened, I asked what my options were, I was told everything from "rent a car, it's only an hour away" to "go stand in line". An agent pointed at the Customer Service area which had approximately 100 people surrounding it. I was told I could either go stand in line or give the airline a call. It would have been helpful if the agents could have provided information regarding when the next flight out was scheduled, a list of hotels available in the area, or who to contact for questions. None of this was offered to me. Instead, I had to listen to a ground crew staff complain that the flight attendant let passengers disembark the plane before the ground crew were ready and watch an agent put chapstick on while he was trying to deal with upset passengers. There was a glaring lack of professionalism from almost every employee I encountered with American Airlines. It was clear that passengers missing their flight were not American Airline's problem, and agents were quick to let me know that they were under no obligations if the delay was weather-related. After the chaos had subsided, I was able to speak calmly with an agent and get a boarding pass out for the next morning. I was also able to book a room with no assistance from American Airlines. I was lucky to find a room at all and got one of the last rooms at a Best Western 15 minutes away. Once I got to the airport the next morning, the screen listed my gate as Arkansas instead of Greensboro; when I asked the agent if I was at the correct gate, she said "hold on, I need to log out", then proceeded to finish her conversation with her co-worker. The agent finally responded with a "yes" and no apologies for the screen not indicating Greensboro were offered. Greensboro was never put up on the board which caused confusion for several passengers. It was announced later that this flight was going to Greensboro, NC but Arkansas still showed as the point of destination for Gate 33 passengers as we boarded. Would it be too much to have passengers that are connecting to another flight, to disembark the plane prior to other passengers? If I had gotten to the gate 2 minutes earlier, I would have made the connection. I have flown with American many times previously and have encountered rude agents; however, the agents in Charlotte are by far the rudest. This is the last time I will look the other way and chalk up bad attitudes from agents as having a bad day. I would highly encourage American Airlines to provide customer service training to your staff. I will not recommend this airline to my co-workers nor my family, as I would not want anyone to experience such a disregard for simple human kindness and courtesy.

Name: Peter Northcutt
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Frankfurt to Dallas via Los Angeles. It's all about the money for AA - no interest in performing a quality service. If you book their lowest fare, you are guaranteed not to sit with your partner but instead always in a center section seat. In fact, they go out of their way to ensure this: We were both assigned center section seats between a vacant aisle and window seat. I look at the seat map and there were 76 vacant seats with 32 possible adjacent seating combinations. I have never heard of a company that brings out a product and then makes sure you hate it. We asked to sit together at the airport and were told : 100€ and that we should have paid the $12 at home or the $240 to have an "upgraded" fare. British also assigns you a middle seat but their airport staff cheerfully reseat you when you ask - without any "I told you so" attitude. Ground staff is good, but the inflight crew all have chips on their shoulders. It makes you miss Eastern Air Lines.
route: Frankfurt to Dallas via Los Angeles

Name: Olga Perkins
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Orlando to Phoenix. I think this is the worst airline. Every time we fly with them there is an issue. Booked seats 3 months and advance and got split up with 4 little children! Waiting on the plane for 3 hours to exit the plane and was late for the next international flight. No one was even helpful about it. Lost luggage which took 2 weeks to be found. Constantly delayed flights. We just hope we will never need to use this airlines again .

Name: Christina Stewart
Review: Not Verified |  I did not fly with American however the ground team accidentally took my luggage to Phoenix from Houston and it now sits at Tucson airport. The team won’t deliver to UA agents so that it can be returned to me. I travel with AA however recently reduce how often due to poor quality service. I continue to encounter this. When I called, the call center agent was unforgivably rude. When I pointed that out the response was met with more rudeness. When asked for supervisor they placed me on hold with no sign getting my call redirected. I am still waiting on my luggage to be returned. Please make some minor effort to help resolve this issue and return luggage. This would take communication and teamwork. Why is that a challenge?

Name: Brett Moore
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Was a little apprehensive flying with American Airlines after reading previous reviews but was pleasantly surprised by the overall experience. The aircraft itself was clean, spacious and the seats comfortable. The food - has to be some of the best I have ever had flying, and I have traveled on a lot of airlines! I especially loved the sesame chicken with tabbouleh salad and sesame soy dressing - so delicious! It was also a nice touch before departing Sydney a menu was handed out detailing the food to come and at what time during the flight it would be served. The inflight entertainment system was fantastic with so much to choose from, including films that had just been released in cinemas. And finally the cabin crew - were professional and friendly. There was one guy recommended sites to see in the states. All in all an incredible experience and I could not highly recommend American Airlines.

Name: Amela Glavatovic
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | On February 16, 8:45 am we took a flight from JFK to Cancun, flight number 1327, it was me, my husband and my kids, my youngest being my three year old daughter, who was flying for the first time. Once we landed and we were waiting to get out of the plane, my daughter, obviously being in a new environment began crying, I was trying to make her feel better and stop crying when one of the air hostess came up to me and told me this is unacceptable you are the mother you need to make her stop crying. I was so appalled by your employees attitude and customer service to a family who trusted your airline for our travel. I have never been treated this way in my life and I was so disappointed and upset with the way my children and myself were treated. Your employees lack of customer service and respect towards paying customers was appalling, and put a very big damper on our family vacation. I did not expect this from American Airlines and I expected your airline to treat your customers better. I will not be flying American Airlines again and I am very dissatisfied with the way your crew member have treated me and my family. As a business owner myself I know the importance of customer service and putting a customer first, I did not see that kind of service when I flew your airline.

Name: M Pollock
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  La Guardia to Dallas Ft Worth. Well, flying is already not pleasant, and I am not that frequent of a flyer, about 750k miles toward the million miler, usually about 25-30kk miles a year, just under their gold tier. Here is my beef. The new basic fares where you only get half a leg credit. My company has a policy they says all of the employees must purchase the lowest published fare. Well, for American, that means basic economy. Flying on American Airlines went from bad to worse. I live in Dallas and it is tough to fly any other airline that doesn’t have a connecting flight. So I am stuck... a gold member they can’t select a seat, gets half credit for every flight, and just flies in misery. American should change the policy on basic fares and allow gold members or higher to at least be able to select seats. At this point, I truly hate living in Dallas because I have to fly American and they completely suck with these new policies.
route: La Guardia to Dallas Ft Worth

Name: Kathi Harvey
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  We were delayed by the airport shuttle and arrived 55 minutes prior to our flight departure and were not allowed to check in. We explained the delay was out of our hands. Because we missed the flight out they would not reserve the return flight even though it was paid in full. We had to throw the tickets away. We walked over to Delta and the agent just put a person on a flight to Costa Rica 35 minutes before his flight took off and they did have to check bags. Our flight was delayed on Delta which meant we were going to miss our connecting flight to Nassau. We were so disappointed. But Delta held the plane in Atlanta and moved it to the gate next to our arrival so they could collect us and get our bags.

Name: Michael Rojek
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Honolulu to Los Angeles. I attempted to check in online 18 hours prior to my flight. For whatever reason, the system processed mine but not my wife's. Since in the inbound flight we weren't seated together, I wanted to rectify this. I called AA and the first agent who answered immediately suggested it was my fault because I "didn't check a box or something". I suggested he first listen to me and run my record locator. All I wanted to do was ensure me. And my wife sat together this time. When he did, he said this is an issue with British Airways since they issued the ticket. I said that's impossible, because BA doesn't handle check in for flights on AA. I asked to speak to a supervisor, and was told to call BA or they could put me in touch with their website tech support (why?). Both the initial agent as well as the supervisor were incredibly rude and appeared to be doing whatever possible to get me off the line. I called BA. The agent, Dev, went above and beyond what could possibly be expected, and stayed with me for an hour to help. I explained what happened and he told me they're "giving you the run around" because, of course, BA doesn't handle check in for domestic AA flights. He offered to call AA for me and we were on a conference call. The supervisor he spoke to informed him that there was an issue with the passport info. He asked them to change the info and complete checkin and was told that was impossible. He said he knows for a fact it isn't, and it happens all the time. Since checkin wasn't my issue, but seating, he suggested my wife simply be given a seat next to me and she would complete checkin at the airport. The AA supervisor said that, too, was impossible. Until she's checked in, they can't assign a seat. Once again, the BA agent explained that this is impossible and he has lists of policies and regulations, not to mention previous experience. The AA supervisor hung up on him mid sentence. He apologized profusely and said he never experienced anything like this. We called again, and the agent we got this time was just as unhelpful and refused to do anything, but was at least pleasant. She suggested I pay to select my wife's seat, because next to me there is an empty one. The BA agent again asked why they can't assign it to her, it's within 24 hours of the flight. No. They won't assign it, they won't fix her checkin, but they're happy to SELL the seat. At this point in my frustration I said fine, I'll buy it. $50 additional fee if the agent takes my payment. Both me and the BA agent were at a loss for words. I ended up going online to buy the seat next to me for my wife, with Dev and the AA supervisor on hand to confirm it went through. AA succeeded in ruining my last day in Honolulu and wasting 2 hours of my time in order to squeeze even more money out of me. I would have thought that would be it, but upon arrival at Heathrow, I learned my bags didn't make the flight (2hr layover at LAX). This airline is an absolute joke, with complete disregard for passengers. Even the discount carriers treat you better. BA offered a black and white comparison between how an airline should behave and how it shouldn't. Dev was apologizing for things that weren't his fault, stayed with me until the end, whereas AA staff were aggressive and condescending, and even hung up on their British colleague. Absolutely shameful. The plane was also terrible, but west coast/Hawaii flights typically are. Shameful behavior.

Name: Nathan Godfrey
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  We had our wedding in Jamaica and had a group of 20 plus people. From the start to finish was awful. In Grand Rapids we were delayed and lied to.
