The entertainment offering was average with a reasonable selection of modern release movies and the screen and sound were fine. With the exception of leg room, which exceeded my expectations, this flight lived up to what I would expect for a long haul international economy flight. I'd fly AA international again.

Name: P Allen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Departed El Paso Friday morning for Paris with a two hour layover in Dallas Tx. Monday night my luggage is still sitting in Dallas. Putting a piece of luggage on an airplane is beyond their brain capacity.  Does anyone at American Airlines actually care? Are you listening to customers or just collecting flight benefits as you ramsack luggage building your wardrobe? Carry on luggage only.
route: El Paso to Paris via Dallas Ft Worth

Review_Heading: "do not take care of the customer"
Name: Joe Catalano
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Hartford to Chicago. I accidentally booked a flight for 7.30pm not 7.30am. I paid 200.00 to change the flight and an additional 300.00 because the rate changed. I arrived to the airport to leave at 7.30am and the plane broke down. The repair took all day and we ended up leaving at 730pm after all and they will not refund the additional amount paid to take the early flight that I was not able to get on. They nickle and dime you for everything but do not take care of the customer when they are at fault. I have flown 13 times since May and this is how they treat me.

Name: R Keach
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Las Vegas to Philadelphia. When I purchased my tickets, I forgot to secure my seats. By the time I remembered, my seat on my outbound flight was an isle and on the return flight a middle. Although I am slightly claustrophobic, I felt I could manage the return if I kept my mind busy. Well, I was wrong. I will remember my return flight today forever. While waiting for my boarding group number to load, the airline informed us they were looking for 10 people to give up their seats as they were overbooked. They offered a $1,000 voucher. Wanting to get home sooner, I boarded the flight and sat down in my middle seat after the isle passenger moved aside. Once I sat down and with the other passenger next to me, my claustrophobia kicked in and my heart started to accelerate. I felt a cold sweat and a feeling of being trapped. I tried hard to read a book but knew after 1 minute that it wasn't working. I asked the passenger to get up and quickly exited the seat. I rushed up to the stewardess and told her I had a problem. I explained I was having a panic attack due to the middle seat position and my claustrophobia. She immediately looked me in the eye and told me everything would be fine. She told me her father also had the same fear. She helped me out of the plane past the line of entering passengers and told me to take deep breaths. She then went back inside the plane and asked the passenger in the isle seat if they minded moving to the middle. Unfortunately they said no, so she took my carry on bag and escorted me back to the check-in area to be placed in an isle seat on another plane. Now the story does not end there. Because the plane was overbooked, a passenger seated on the isle in the emergency row decided to deplane. Rather than placing another passenger in that seat they brought me back in the plane. The flight was wonderful and I had no further anxiety problems. I even got home on time to see my family. I feel American Airlines and the stewardess went above and beyond. I will remember the kindness they showed me today for the rest of my life.

Name: C Rasmussen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New York to Freeport via Miami. Absolute poor experience from end to end. When we checked in, the boarding passes didn’t work when we entered security. Our re-check-in was done with an attitude of me not understanding how things work - which isn’t very customer service minded. After we arrived at our destination, 2 of 3 checked in luggage’s missed our flight (we had 2.5h layover) and was not found until the day after. Neither of these experiences were managed well, and no one (!!) from the additional assistance during check-in (and re-check-in) to the baggage service representative (via phone) had any empathy or a customer service mentality. Please note, we were traveling with an infant. On the way back to our home, we experienced an unpleasant situation while boarding the first airplane. We were kindly asked to check in a carry on at the counter, and we explained that our carry on had baby equipment required for a long layover (blankets, harness etc.). A classical superviser-type (by attitude) employee from AA interrupted the conversation, without any respect of existing explanation (or emphathy for that matter), and ordered us to check in our carry on. If we did not, she told us we wouldn’t be allowed to board the airplane. “Next flight you’re taking is at 6PM” was her exact words. This was said without even trying to solve our issue! It contributed to the unpleasant situation we experienced at the gate. Worth mentioning we were flying with carry on allowed as part of our ticket. We unwillingly gave up our carry on (incl. important baby stuff) only to discover that half of the overhead bins were empty when boarding was complete. I am frequently using AA for business trips - it’s though no longer my first choice when other options are available. Participated in the post flight questionnaires provided by AA. I honestly gave up after answering questions for 10 minutes - also realized I was only through 1/3 of the steps.
route: New York to Freeport via Miami

Name: E Barton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Orange County to Gainesville via Miami. The airline had no control over the weather delays, but my flight landed late which made me late to my connecting flight home. I had to stay overnight in Miami; I was frustrated, irritated and just wanted to get on my flight. I talked to the gate agent and they gave me a voucher for a hotel ($200 a night kind of hotel). The room I received was a King sized bed with a golf course view of water and palm trees. The company also gave me a $12 voucher in order for me to eat that following day. I was mad about not going home but this company exceeded my expectations! I had a similar situation happen with Delta Airlines and it was a joke. They gave me a $50 voucher as compensation, that was it!
route: Orange County to Gainesville via Miami

Name: Ruth Jacob
Review: Not Verified | Topeka to Meridian via Chicago. This flight was outstanding. Seating was comfortable and service outstanding! I highly recommend American Airlines! Will not hesitate to fly with American again.

Name: Brandon January
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Oklahoma City to Dallas. American Airlines is a disaster! Let’s review: 1) Plane delayed 30 minutes from OKC to Dallas. 2) Plane delayed 20 minutes after landing in Dallas. 3) Arrive 2 minutes late to catch our 2nd AA flight with 10 other people from our first AA flight! 4) AA didn’t wait for us 10 to catch 2nd flight and even left the gate ~7 minutes before scheduled. We know because we watched the plane back out. 5) Lost $600 in travel costs and 30 hours of my life. 6) This airline is by far the worst, from an organizational standpoint. It’s apparent from every aspect of the way their organization is run.

Name: Anthony Staubs
Review: Not Verified | Pittsburgh to Charlotte. Delayed on the runway for over an hour and they wouldn’t provide me with a drink of water while on the ground with no actual reason. I had a very dry sore throat and this made it very uncomfortable. They didn’t even seem to show any sort of empathy for me or my request. Never had good experiences with this airline and this will only add to my list.

Name: ML Simonetto
Review: Not Verified | I had a horrible experience flying back from Boston to Miami with American Airlines. The flight that was supposed to leave at 6pm got first delayed to 7.15pm: I literally saw the plane that was supposed to be the one that would have taken us to Miami, be given to the people in the 4.50pm flight from Boston to Miami. After that, we were told we were waiting for a flight from Philadelphia to get to Boston and they would have boarded us there. Well, the plane got to Boston at 7.45pm but we couldn’t board for “weather-related problems” when the reality was that the crew wasn’t there. Well some crew members got to the airport and boarded the 4.50pm flight that was waiting in the parking since 6pm. We were told that another crew was on their way and our flight would have taken off at 10pm. At 10.30pm we were told we wouldn’t be able to go to Miami and our flight was cancelled. No refund, no hotel provided because it was “weather related” when really it was because American Airlines couldn’t get the crew to the airport. At that point it wasn’t even raining in Boston. If this wasn’t enough, the personnel at the desk was incredibly rude. They lied to us multiple times regarding the status of the flight, they told us the problem was the weather when all the other flights were taking off from Boston, just not to provide us with reimbursement. When I asked them to be put on a flight for Miami ASAP since my pet was at home alone they told me “well, pray this flight is leaving because we don’t have any tool for tomorrow”. And when I told them I would have complained they yelled at me. I will never fly American Airlines again.

Name: P Bantichi
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  My flight was from Jackson to Phoenix, with a connecting flight in Dallas. Our flight to Dallas was 5932. There was a weather delay and we were told we would miss our connecting flight in Dallas and that we would “have to figure it out.” When we arrived in Dallas we were notified that our connecting flight was also delayed, so we were overjoyed that we would make the flight. After running to the terminal, we learned that there was an electronic issue aboard flight 556 to Phoenix that they working to resolve. This announcement was repeated over the next two hours. The next announcement said that the plane was out of order and they were looking for another flight. Then another announcement saying that was incorrect and that they were still working to fix the original electronic issue. After another hour goes by we were all given hotel vouchers and were booked on the same flight for the next morning at 9:00. We arrived at the terminal on time for the flight. After a thirty min delay, an announcement arrived that the pilots had not arrived. Then another 30 min: “there is an electronic issue.” After another two hours they said that the plane was out of service. We were told that all remaining flights to Phoenix were full and we were routed to customer service. I was told that there were 4 seats left on a flight to Phoenix about 5 terminals down and were given new boarding passes. After me and my wife get there as fast as we could, we were told that the flight was already gone. At this point my wife collapses sobbing. You see, she only gets two days this year for personal reasons and one has already been wasted in an airport. Not to mention what our plans for this trip were, which I will get to in a min. Anyway we go back to customer service and they get us on a flight to El Paso to Phoenix flight 2399. When we boarded the plane in El Paso, we sat on the tarmac for 45 min with no air conditioning. Babies were crying, the flight attendant even made the comment that passengers should not be treated this way. Some staff during this process were rude, some were very gracious and helpful, like Sally from customer service at the Dallas airport. Now let’s talk about expenses. I have invested in a continuing eduction course in Scottsdale for Nov 8 and 9 for a total of $3,000. I missed one of those training days. I took off of work for the remainder of the week. I realize you don’t care about these things, but these inconveniences resulted from your poor systems and protocols and lack of communication.

Name: J Quinlan
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Los Angeles to Kona. American Airlines is the worst! I arrived to check in my bag 40 minutes before my flight. They have a strict policy that you have to check a bag within 45 minutes of your flight. If you don't they force you to buy another buy and get on anther flight! They provided zero alternative options for getting my bag there on time. They didn't let me get on my flight and take the chance my bag would be delivered on another flight. Plus, they have retarded bag fees and their customer service phone line had a 45 minute wait!

Name: S Leath
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Las Vegas to Atlanta. The worst experience ever that I received. For someone whose scared to fly I believe they need to be better at their service. If something going wrong with the flight I believe that there should be communication being given to passengers. If a passenger explained that their flight leaves at a certain time, like 20 min from now what you don't do is tell the person whose seated way in the back to hurry up and make it to they flight in order to make it. When their difficulty happening on the plane. There was no type of order. To be paying for a flight I do wish to get treated right and not being disrespected to and treated as if I'm nothing.

Name: L Jansen
Review: Not Verified |  Newark to Phoenix. I fly almost every week for work and never had a positive experience with American Airlines. I paid for preferred seating for a window seat and there’s no window in my aisle, and they also made me check my carry on bag, which they do every single time regardless of size. I have also had more delays with American Airlines than any other airline. I am an American Airlines member and cardholder and still am treated poorly. On top of all of that, it is completely impossible to get in touch with customer service. Would not recommend.

Name: Benjamin Aldous
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Lihue to Phoenix. I booked and paid for a first class seat. When I get to the airport they downgraded me without my approval to a coach seat. I was told it was because they overbooked first class. When I paid for first class there was only two seats booked at the time. I was informed my downgrade was because the other travels had a higher status with American then I do. Seriously? This is how American treats people. Never again

Name: P Warner
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Pensacola to Boston via Charlotte. I recently flew American and the flight resulted in a change to a further airport, a delay in the new flight due to airport maintenance that was known about but not conveyed until after the flight was supposed to take off and finally an hour wait while they retrieved our gate checked bags and found us a hotel. Each individual I spoke to was very polite but ultimately the company policy made this a difficult,exhausting, and ultimately very costly trip with lost days of work.

Name: D Muller
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Denver to Charlotte. Waited at gate for paperwork (as per captain) Made us almost miss connection. After standing at the luggage carousel for 30 min, we realized our luggage was not there. Walked all over the airport trying to find a AA employee. Found a security girl that directed us back to luggage pick up. Found AA baggage office, they say they will deliver my baggage some time at night. Tired from getting up early and flying all day, I am now expected to wait up for this.

Name: Rachelle Camara
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | The flight from St Louis to Chicago via Providence was, by far, the best domestic flight I have ever been on. The staff were absolutely brilliant - the most accomodating, friendly, and humorous flight attendants. They were extremely attentive and made the flight seem even shorter than it was. They even brought some gifts over for the kids sitting behind me which was very sweet. The pilot kept us updated during the flight and provided a safe and smooth take-off and landing. He even saw us off the plane after we landed. I never had a favorite airline before but I will absolutely be flying American from now on!
route: St Louis to Chicago via Providence

Name: Bill Keene
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Baltimore to Dallas with American Airlines. Paid for inflight internet and it barely works. Waste of $12. Not the first time either. Airline has turned into something like Spirit Airlines, nickel and diming you throughout the process. I’m already looking at other options for travel. My retirement certainly won’t be this brand. I’ll use my 157000 miles (hopefully they won’t ruin that too) and get out.

Name: B Meares
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  West Palm Beach to Las Vegas via Charlotte. The ladies at the desk at Charlotte airport American Airlines were nothing but rude! It was late but I get that, it happens- but the ladies made an announcement if your looking to switch seats come to the desk, so with a seat 29B I was delighted! I go up and the lady looked at my ticket then smirked and was like your in basic economy “if you have the money is the only way I can switch your seat” -  ok lady, I am the customer what happened to the customer is always right or at least don’t be rude is all I ask. Then the other woman at the desk announced there is no food on this flight, so I go up and ask if there’s at least gonna be water. After speaking with her coworker, she was rude after a simple question based off of a bad comment she announced. American Airlines, hire more polite people or train your people better. Very displeased.
route: West Palm Beach to Las Vegas via Charlotte

Name: M Laconicz
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Orlando to Orange County via Dallas. My flight from Orlando to Dallas was delayed, but I was able to obtain a seat on another American flight and make my Dallas connection. However, a computer program determined I would not be able to make the connection, cancelled my seat on the flight to Orange County, and assigned me to a flight the following morning. I received an automated email asking that I accept the next day flight or request another, which I did not respond to since I was able to get on another flight. I did discuss this with the gate agent in Orlando who apparently cannot override the computer's erroneous conclusion. American Airlines Customer Relations responded in writing to my complaint, but stands steadfast by the computer rather than the customer. American Airlines has attempted to reorganize from bankruptcy with a new logo and some new planes (although they remain among the older fleets). The Admirals Club staff are clearly trained to smile and great and offer assistance to customers. Unfortunately the Customer Relations staff appear stuck in the bankruptcy period, little imagination or motivation to attract and maintain customers.
route: Orlando to Orange County via Dallas

Name: Jeanne Bostwick
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Salt Lake City to Lubbock via Dallas Ft Worth. In short, multiple occasions of poor communication at the airport, cancelled flights with hit an miss support, delayed bags after confirming they were on the flight, & rude employees during and after trip. My problem isn't as much that bad things happened, but how many and how the airline handled the situations. I even filled out the the survey that American Airlines sent me. Due to my responses, I expected that I would have been contacted by now (3 weeks later) with al least an email apologizing for the problems I had and appreciation for flying with them. As a result I feel it is important to share with others my experience. The problems started with a series of gate changes that had me bouncing around the airport at DFW. At one point there were people from 4 different flights at a gate trying to figure out if it was the gate they were supposed to be at. The monitors at the most of the gates did not show any information about the flight that was upcoming. This added to the confusion for my flight and others. Eventually my flight was cancelled. The next flight wasn't available till late morning the next day. The person at the gate was able to re-route my flight so I could meet up with the group I was going to road trip with. I received a hotel voucher for my overnight stay. When I called the hotel shuttle to pick me up, they informed me that they wouldn't send a shuttle. I told them I had a voucher from the airline for my stay. The hotel said that it didn't matter and I would need to talk to the airline for different arrangements. Many American Airlines employees & 4 hours later, I was finally on my way to a hotel I would have to pay for myself and submit a refund from the airline. Another person on the shuttle had many difficulties as he didn't have a cell phone to get messages about gates changing and flights cancelling. The lack of announcements and information at the gates was a serious concern. Once at my hotel, I called to confirm that my baggage would be rerouted with me to my new destination. The employee submitted a request, but said I would want to arrive early at the airport and talk to the baggage people in person. I arrived several hours prior to my flight and approached the baggage assistance counter. I stood at the counter being ignored by the employee for several minutes before she acknowledged my presence. She then asked me to wait a few minutes. When she was ready for me, I explained my situation, she seemed pretty annoyed, but she did pulled up my information and said that my bags are marked to be with me. I expressed concern because the lack of confidence from the employee the night before. She snipped at me and said they will be on my flight. (They didn't make it on my flight.) I proceeded to my gate. While waiting, I observed similar flight and gate confusion as the night before. Gate changes & people not being sure where they were really supposed to be. One particular flight only had one passenger on board and they were within a few minutes of needing to shut the gates for take off. I was only set to a few gates that morning. On the plane, the passenger next to me and I realized she had received texts from the airline directing her to gates that were different then the ones I received. We confirmed by looking at each others messages. Upon arrival I was informed that my bag was going to a different airport. I ended up having to replace the contents of my bag and submit reimbursement. Still hoping for refund.
route: Salt Lake City to Lubbock via Dallas

Name: K Beale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Baltimore to Dallas Ft Worth. American has become the most unpleasant travel experience I’ve ever had. They just collect my money and treat me like a number; a meaningless number at that. It’s pointless to go into a great amount of detail because it won’t matter. Let’s just say I got some bad news from home and I was told to prove it. It was cold and callous. They didn’t get that I couldn’t get them the information until it was too late. They even told me they had available seats. Forget that I have flown them for 35 years and have accumulated hundreds of thousands of miles. They just don’t care.

Review_Heading: "staff is mostly in a bad mood"
Name: G Keinzer
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Zurich via Philadelphia. Second time the plane for the connecting flight suddenly had technical issues and we had to wait more than 3 hours for them to find a new plane. And of course every flight is overbooked and delayed because they have to find people who are willing to take a different flight. Also, better don’t think it will get any better once you are on the plane. The cabin staff is mostly in a bad mood and ignore you. Definitely not worth saving a couple of dollars flying with this airline!

Name: S Gomula
Review:
✅ Trip Verified |  
Medford to Los Angeles. Got here 2 hours early. Needed a wheelchair, waited 45 minutes before anyone came to help me. Still waiting for help. Requested wheel chair while making my reservation. Called to see if the airlines got my request. Got to Medford airport which is tiny. Still no wheelchair. No one was willing to help. Very scary feeling, when you're handicapped. If it wasn't one of two airlines that fly direct, I would never fly with them.

Name: Vlad G
Review: Not Verified |  Flight was delayed because of technical difficulties which caused me to miss my connection to DC in Dallas and have to sleep there overnight. No American Airlines customer service rep or any of the ground personnel was concerned. I wasn't offered anything for the inconvenience which was entirely their fault. When I filed a complaint online I was offered a measly $100 voucher and was told that it was perfectly sufficient and they weren't going to do anything else. They have the worst customer service and I honestly believe that AA is one of the worst airlines in the United States currently.

Name: Jesse Poole
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Not good service at all, no one was willing to help. Website says one thing, customer service says another thing — about changing flight to an earlier one, same destination and layover in Charlotte. This was a business trip and I will not choose to fly American Airlines again. Really rude on the phone while I was being nice. Folks at the airline counter were nice, but just told me to call. I just don’t understand why they wouldn’t even try to help a customer if they could.

Name: S Bayne
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Washington to Milwaukee. My husband and I purchased airline tickets together months before, but when we checked in and received our seat assignment our seats were nowhere near each other! In all the years we have traveled together we have never been split up until this flight. I think this is terrible and a poor business practice. I will never fly this airline ever again. Airlines are a dime a dozen—there are more options out there than just you, American Airlines. Avoid unless you are traveling solo. This is not a family friendly airline.

Name: L Tran
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New York to Buenos Aires. The Flagship Lounge at JFK terminal 8 was very nice, with good selection of foods and wines. Check-in and boarding went smoothly. The seat was very comfortable. Cabin service, though was not at the level of premium Asian carriers, was pretty good. Cabin crew always showed up with a smile, and one can clearly saw that they were trying to provide upscale service. The big letdown was the food. I had better meals in economy with other carriers, and that was the first time I left my meal mostly untouched. Dessert was, however, pretty good, so that became my dinner. I had the exact same experience on my return flight from Buenos Aires, so this seemed consistent. What puzzled me was how AA let this minor thing ruined all other improvements they made. If AA simply improves in-flight catering the way they did with their lounges, I think they can be a 4-star (or even 5-star) airline.

Name: F Kolman
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New York to Miami. The plane is old, the luggage compartments are small and there is  barely any leg room. There are no screens or TV and the service is horrendous. We are waiting over 25 minutes to get a gate in Miami and they dont let my children go to the bathroom. The flight up to New York from Miami was a disaster, they kept us on the plane for an hour with ac. Truly a horrific flight and airline.

Name: Sterling Gee
Review: Not Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Honolulu. American Airlines points are useless. I purchased a 1st class ticket (full fare) for my honeymoon. I used my miles for another ticket for my wife. I was also sold the upgrade to platinum level for about $800. Now we are on our way home and American lied to us and told us one of us was getting bumped to coach due to the flight being oversold, Come to find out my wife's seat was bumped because an AA pilot wanted to deadhead home in 1st class. No more American Airlines for me. I just cut up my card and also cut up my Citi aa card. Done with AA.

Name: R Robinson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New York to Dallas Ft Worth. This was my first time flying American, as I am usually a Delta flyer, and this trip left much to be desired. The staff at the gates are very snippy, impatient, and borderline rude. I actually got angry at the treatment I felt myself and other passengers were receiving. The flights either left 45 minutes late or pulled away from the gate 15 minutes early. The seats feel like church pews. They kept it freezing in the cabin and when i asked for a blanket (which is standard with Delta) the stewardess informed me that I would need a business or first class ticket to get one. I  paid regular price) and strongly considered just purchasing a one way ticket back to California with Delta to avoid the extra grief of flying with American. Very poor experience.
route: New York to Dallas Ft Worth

Name: Joshua Fernandez
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Las Vegas. Airline is trash and disrespectful. They took our crew and put on another plane. I am never flying this airline, I prefer Frontier. We were given a $12.00 food voucher. They lied to us twice about a crew and we had no choice but to spend the night. They will not reimburse for a hotel but will give vouchers. Everybody had bad stories of this airline.

Name: Alexa Felix
Review: Not Verified |  Flew American Airlines from Boston to Savannah. This is one of the worst airlines I’ve flown, cancelled my flight 3 times and due to an emergency in Boston that was the airlines fault they made me reschedule my flight 2 times. This airline literally sucks and the people that work here don’t help either, never recommending them to anyone.

Name: D Porter
Review: Not Verified |  Two thumbs down for American Airlines. I flew American round trip from San Francisco to Costa Rica recently and though there were a few redeeming moments with them on the whole I would never recommend or choose American. Of the 4 flights (connecting included) there were stressful delays on each one and re-routing and departure time changes which added considerable travel time and made me miss appointments. My main complaint is that American seems to use scented air freshener in their cabin air system which every hour or so would come blasting through into the cabin. I happen to be physically very sensitive to chemical air fresheners and I know for certain that there are many people who are sensitive. We are trapped in the capsule at the mercy of someones decision to use this toxic scent (whatever it is). I got off the plane feeling ill and with lung irritation. My partner could smell it on me when giving me a ride home. He too is sensitive and it gave him a headache just from my clothing. It seems we are living in a new culture of air scenting from laundry detergent to garbage bags and everything in between. Hopefully they will realize that this is a bad move. Also because of their delay in one of my days of travel I did not have time to eat in my connection airport as I had to run to the gate. I was prepared to purchase food on board the 2nd flight of my journey only to find out they didn't have food to purchase (between Dallas and San Jose) which was the longest leg of my flight. Instead they had a wimpy and junk food like snack offering. What was with that? Also the headphone jack was broken on one of my flights so I couldn't use the onboard entertainment for a 6 hour flight. Overall I think American is the worst airline I've used and I travel fairly frequently.
route: San José to San Francisco via Miami

Name: B Dean
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Boston to Miami. American Airlines never fails to disappoint. It has gotten to the point where I book a flight a night before I would like to arrive because the chances of them getting me in on time is less than 10%. Every time it is due to a “maintenance problem” so I do not even get compensation for the time they have wasted. The only reason I am still buying flights from them is because they are the only airline that has a direct flight from Boston to Miami. This is the last time I make this mistake. It would actually be faster for me to have a connecting flight than to take this direct flight. This particular time the flight was delayed 2.5 hours. They made us get off the plane so that we could reboard in 20 min. I am still waiting for AA to give me a voucher or some sort of compensation for the last time I flew with them when my flight was delayed for 3 hours and as a result I lost my AA connecting flight (with an original 1hr layover) - they rebooked me to take another AA flight after an 8 hour layover. I ended up getting a new ticket on a different airline where my layover wouldn’t be half a day long.

Name: K Hollenquest
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Denver to Dallas. I felt like I was targeted during boarding from Denver to Dallas on 11/2/2018. They require you to check your bag at their notice without the consideration of my needs and the reasoning why I didn't pay to have my baggage checked. I was boarding the airplane when the ladies checking my boarding pass took my carry-on baggage. Their intention was just to check any bag without asking the traveler if there's a need. I asked for valet check in service and I was told no, but at the same time another traveler was granted such. AA assumes all responsibilities in the event somethings happens to me. After departing the airplane, I noticed several baggage were the same size or even bigger than my baggage but I was the first to pull to the side. There were even travelers with more than 2 items boarding the airplane but they were not asked to consolidate or to check one.

Name: Peter Kempa
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Vancouver to Lima via Dallas Ft Worth. I was very pleased with all aspects of both legs of the flight to Lima.The departures were punctual, the seats and seat pitch were surprisingly comfortable and the meals were above average.The crew were are all friendly, courteous and efficient.The only shortcoming, which did not, which did not happen to bother me, was that in flight entertainment was extremely limited.
route: Vancouver to Lima via Dallas Ft Worth

Name: Michael Gatewood
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Philadelphia to Northwest Arkansas via Chicago. Airline departs Philadelphia on time. Lands in Chicago at 0855hrs. The plane sits on the tarmac for 30min causing me to miss my connecting flight. I ran to my connecting gate to be told the gate was closed. I could see people inside the door. I knocked on the door to let them know I was outside. No response. I found a 'supervisor' and complained. She said she could put me on the next flight but said the problem was mine. I informed the supervisor that the airlines set the times. American Airlines is never on time. Never! American Airlines has got to be the worst domestic airline ever.
route: Philadelphia to Northwest Arkansas via Chicago

Name: Nick Dechene
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Los Angeles to Charlotte. Why does it seem that every time I fly on an American Airlines operated flight the planes are broken. I'm always delayed due to something not working on the plane. Today, I was booked on a 0830 trip to CLT, but that didn't happen because it was broken. So after 3 and a half hours we got on the next flight out and surprise, surprise, that ones not working either. Thanks American Airlines for holding me up hours on my trips constantly.

Name: L Whitty
Review: Not Verified |  Dublin to Orlando via Philadelphia. I have an extremely bad fear of flying. The cabin crew could not have been more accommodating from the first minute. Re-seated us at no charge to a more comfortable section at the middle of the plane, and checked in regularly, explaining every noise and bump. Fantastic service and left me feeling incredibly grateful. No complaints about the comfort or level of service, all top quality for a bargain price.

Name: Christina Felix
Review: Not Verified |  Honolulu to St. Louis. Horrible customer service. Employee at the gate held up the line and made me “consolidate” my purse into my husbands laptop bag. 2 people get a total 2 carry ons and 2 personal items. We had 4 as we were allowed. No need to be rude and bossy. It’s not necessary. Flying is already stressful and uncomfortable. I don’t need rude employees making it worse. Flight was out of food. Dr Pepper. Both my original and return flights offered WiFi for a fee. Wasn’t able to use it. It was disconnected one way and cut out the other route. But they sure did take my money. Never American. Never again

Name: D Peterson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | London to Chicago. I’ve arrived to Chicago and I realized that the stroller I was bringing to my grand daughter was broken. I contact American Airlines 2 days after my arrival to Chicago. They finally got back to me after 3 weeks! To make a long story short they refused to compensate me for something because I didn’t have the receipt from the stroller. In other works, according to AA, we have to keep all the receipts for purchases above $150 until the time we die just in case we will travel with them and they broke or destroy our personal items. This is unfortunately the customer service companies like American Airlines offer to their customers. Now, I have to buy a new stroller and apologize to my 3 year old grand daughter why she never received her favorite stroller. Shame on you AA.

Name: Vanessa Fabbri
Review: Not Verified |  Tucson to Tokyo via Los Angeles. I recently took an AA round trip ticket to Japan. On all segments of the flight my husband and I never were seated together although we were booked together. You had to pay minimum an extra $40 for assigned seating. Those weren't cheap tickets to start with. Throughout the trip we had the chance to witness and talk to a number of couples who were experiencing the same thing. One case was so obvious. Where there were 3 seats, an American couple was split by a Japanese girl who was sitting in the middle. They asked her if she wanted to sit by the window and managed to travel side by side. In the automated check in stalls at the airport it was rather irritating how AA kept requesting whether we wanted to upgrade class, seating, meals etc. That is so low class behavior. I personally am not looking forward to travelling AA again.
route: Tucson to Tokyo via Los Angeles

Name: R Winmill
Review: Not Verified |  I will never fly American Again, this was the worst customer service ever. Six hours on the tarmac - after3 hours it was back to the gate by federal law, however not long enough to get something to eat, then back on the tarmac for 2 more hours. Ten finally we are ready for take off, the plane starts to throttle up on the runway but then suddenly throttles back and exits the runway, to be told the crew had been on duty too long to fly and it is only about a 40 minute flight. So then it was supposed to be back to the gate but there are no available gates. 1 more hour on the tarmac, no ac, the plane was way to hot. I could see from my window seat at least 3 empty gates probably not American. We were told many times the reason for so many delays, was Little Rock is a small airport, all the more reason to be adaptable. How companies respond to a problem is everything.

Name: Deanine Johnson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Raleigh Durham. This airline nickel & dimes passengers for everything and penalizes us for purchasing an economy ticket by putting you in a middle seat in the back of the plane when you can finally check in online. My flight to Chicago I got stuck in the middle next to a non-stop burping passenger; my flight on my way back, I'm in the middle & praying i don't sit next to her or someone worse tomorrow. I can see their tactic which has only encouraged me to never fly American again. Why not put ticket prices that includes everything (overhead storage, seat selection, etc) as base price instead of separating everything? I can't believe any other airline (besides Southwest) could make United look good, I was wrong and greatly disappointed. If your gonna spend $$$ on a plane ticket, save some & don't go American. My experience was so bad I'm actually considering Delta for my next trip.

Name: Dixie Delello
Review: Not Verified |  Flew Fort Lauderdale to Charlotte via Tennessee. I was so disappointed with American Airlines, no TV unless you pay extra for the service. No wifi unless you pay extra. I paid $1000 for the flight so we should have recieved at least free wifi. My husband and I were traveling together and they put us in different seats and different rows. I had to ask other people on the flight if they would switch seats because I have a fear of flying and I need my husband there to be comfortable, I won't fly with American again.
route: Fort Lauderdale to Charlotte via Tennessee

Name: H Lorraine
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to New York. The worst customer service I have ever experienced. This is the 3rd time I have tried this airline within the last year and for sure will be my last! Every flight was delayed which caused me to lose out on a $4,000 training. I am beyond upset I also called just to see if I can postpone my outbound ticket so I could make up the lost time no one returned my call. Then at the gate I asked for at least a simple seat upgrade and was denied this company does not care about their customers at all. Never fly American Airlines!

Name: Curtisha Maharaj
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Washington to Miami. American Airlines is consistent with bad customer service, from the phone representatives to the the ticketing agents. You need to train your employees on proper communication etiquette and how to carry out good service. Each AA representative I have dealt with has been extremely unprofessional and just have an overall sense of not caring about the service they provide.

Name: T Kehija
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Flew from Dallas to Oakland via Phoenix. First flight delayed one hour but arrived only 3 min before connector flight but when I went to gate it was gone. They referred me to customer service counter and lady was rude when I told her I had to get home cuz my wife was having a baby at home and she didn’t even care. She said why don’t I Check with other airlines and I asked if I had to pay and she said yes. You would think since I paid for a ticket already and they made me miss connector that they would bend over backwards for everyone that missed.

Name: Alwaleed Althani
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Washington to Houston via Dallas Ft Worth. Evening departure on an older 737-800 with no entertainment system and average service nothing to mention about it, connected with a much newer 737-800 with an entertainment system. I must mention the super friendly flight attendant who was super pleasant and helpful.
route: Washington to Houston via Dallas Ft Worth

Name: Erin Raley
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New York JFK to Nashville. The most miserable flying experience I have ever had. The flight home was incredibly uncomfortable. It was so hot on the plane that the chocolates that we had bought in the airport melted. I will never fly again. Staff was less than friendly and would be better off working for TSA. Complete waste of money.

Name: Rebecca Williamson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Atlanta. Dont Ever fly with them. They lied to us on the phone when we called prior to our flight saying we would be able to keep our return flight if we chose to purchase a flight earlier than the original one. The day we went to check in they said they had cancelled our flight, wouldn't give refund, said we lied about ever calling. We have proof that we called. Said they wouldnt help us that the basic economy doesn't work like that. We followed their rules to a T and called prior to make sure and then told the day it was cancelled that we cant miss the first flight, although again it was approved ahead of time. They didn't even act caring, had to wait extreme times on the phone to talk to anyone. No one was helpful or even admitted they cancelled it, kept blaming someone else. If you want help dont fly with them! So were stuck on miami with no way home to my kids, unless we wanna pay another $360 just to fly home cheapest possible with them.

Name: Rob Zent
Review: Not Verified | AA policy. I had a 9:30pm flight from Miami to Dallas. I arrived at the airport in time from a previous flight to catch a 6:30pm same flight. Despite being empty seats. They don't allow you to exchange the flight. They said there's usually $75 fee you can pay to change. I was not allowed to do this for unknown reasons. AA leading the way in not helping customers out.

Name: P Reynolds
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Jacksonville to Boston via Charlotte. If American Airlines didn't have such good credit card offers for mileage accrual, I would reconsider flying with them. I am a regular user of American because of convenience of routes and schedules, but I find myself turned off by their oddly convoluted (and long) boarding times, less than helpful ground staff, and overwhelmingly apparent cost-cutting. I purchased a premium seat online for one segment of my trip, and was charged accordingly. However, upon check-in, I was told the payment was not received and that I'd have to repay the $41.60 fee, and no effort was made to rectify the problem on the check-in staff's part. Dispute is still ongoing with my bank. Let's move onto the actual product though. The two aircraft I flew were definitely showing their age, but the new leather seating and adjustable headrests (737-800 models) were greatly appreciated and of good quality. Arrival and departure times were more than punctual and flight attendants were friendly enough, but the borderline harassment that ensues when 6 minutes of intercom time is devoted to credit card advertisement is definitely a turn-off. I didn't use the wifi, but I did use the stream-to-device entertainment, which worked well. There was also traditional overhead monitors available on the 737-800, playing standard sitcom fare. Overall it's an average experience, but a few factors such as aging planes and odd advertisements, along with cheap biscotti snacks and pricey buy-on-board options leave just the slightest bad taste in my mouth.

Name: Stephen Smerbeck
Review: Not Verified | Philadelphia to Rome. On October 10, 2018, I had one of the most unpleasant experiences, in a long career in flying. When I checked in for AA 718, over two hours before the departure, I noticed that our seats were not assigned on the boarding passes. I thought this odd since I had selected our seats and paid extra for those seat selections. I checked the AA website and saw that a note that the flight was delayed 30 minutes, but I did not receive an email alert. We went to the assigned gate and 20 minutes before scheduled take off, it was announced that our flight was delayed, the gate was changed, and the plane was changed. Our seats, which I selected and paid $282 for extra leg room (it was a 7.5 hour flight), were not honored and we were assigned seats in the rear of the plane where we could enjoy the roar of the engines and a hint of jet fuel for the duration of the flight. AA's code sharing partner, British Airways, also foisted the "change of plane" and doomed us to horrible seats. I have a suspicion there was some consolidation of flights going on here. I checked the flight the day before and many seats were still available. The upshot of this is that I believe that AA changed to a plane with fewer seats and that our "guaranteed" seats were not honored. I am left wondering who sat in our seats, and why we were selected for inferior seats. If I am unable to feel confident that the seats I select and pay for will be available, why would I ever utilize American Airlines again? Please persuade me as to why I should fly American Airlines again, after this dismal performance.

Name: Christophe Vacher
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Los Angeles. I had enough with American Airlines. It's now #2 on the list of worst airlines I ever used (#1 is Wamos, a Spanish airline). Their personnel on the ground (and in the air) is actually pretty helpful and their machines fairly simple to use, at least from my experience. But it's once you're onboard that you realize your mistake. I paid $1030 for a flight from LA to Reading and back, the same price I would pay for a trip to Europe, which is twice the distance. You'd think for that price you can get a minimum quality, even on economy. Wrong. For a start, you pay $30 for your first check-in luggage, and it grows exponentially! Totally outrageous. What this does, it makes everybody bringing carry-ons, overcharging the cabin with carry-on luggage, making it hard to find space above your seat for your luggage, so you have to put it in a totally different area (what a hassle to get it when you exit the plane!). No food for the whole flight (Yes, AA, I don't call food a couple of pretzels and a soda). If you want food, you have to pay for it. And what kind of food! Then, there is the entertainment: just as it seems to become a trend on the worst airlines, American Airlines forces you to use your own devices to be able to watch their programs. In their penny pinching minds, they automatically assume that everyone has a smart phone, or a tablet, or a computer. If you don't have any device on you, or your device is not compatible with their system (more on that later), you're out of luck. But the incredible part is, they don't even provide any electric plug or USB for you to plug in your devices! So, if all you have to watch movies onboard is your smartphone (which is already pitiful), and you need your phone battery fully charged for when you arrive at your final destination and need to call your friends, taxis, hotels, etc., again, you're out of luck. Now, let's talk about device compatibility with their onboard movie/TV system, which uses Flash Player. I did have a fully updated version of Flash Player on my computer, but their system kept saying it was not updated. After several attempts, since they were offering to download their own updated version of Flash Player, I decided to uninstall my version and replace it with theirs. Guess what? It still would not work. Their system would not recognize its own version of Flash Player on my machine! Unbelievable. I uninstalled and re-installed the app again, tried everything to get it to connect. Nothing worked. I spent the whole trip with no entertainment. Also, the cabin remained pitch black the whole time (you could barely see where you walked) which was very hard on your eyes when people constantly turned on their individual light or their computer screen. When we got to the luggage claim area at the airport, no indication anywhere of which carousel it was. When we finally found it, the previous plane had not even started their download, which made us wait for an extra hour. To top it off, I was carrying fragile items in a separate box. American Airlines made me pay an extra $200 (one way) because it was oversize. But the best part: they didn't put it with the oversize luggage (that are usually handled with a bit more care), they put it with the regular ones. Nothing was broken, but the whole experience really made me furious. The irony in all this is: AA is one of the only airline companies to wear the name: American. Aren't you ashamed, guys? You should be.

Name: W Eldridge
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Terrible customer service rebooking and flight cancellation policy’s are a joke. Was cheaper to rebook than to change a flight with more than two weeks notice. Customer service representatives have all been very unprofessional to talk to and will not be booking with American Airlines again.

Name: Laura Frias
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Miami to San Francisco. Absolutely awful! How is this airline still in business? I can't even believe how awful they are and expensive too. My flight was delayed 11 hours and there was no apology!! Just a deal with it attitude! No vouchers, no excuses, no apologies!! On top of that, a 5 hour flight offering a cold Turkey croissant for almost 10 dollars! Only choice!  Plus a bad movie, their choice. Hated it! Never again!

Name: A Neale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Milan to Miami. I flew the dreaded Basic Economy, and it was okay! I knew what I was getting into - no checked bag, no seat selection, boarding last - so there were no surprises. My expectations were low, and AA exceeded them generally. AA will not give you a boarding pass for flight segments until you arrive at that airport which is moderately annoying, but that was the only issue for me. There was plenty of overhead bin space on the international segments for my bag. I had a middle seat CLT-FCO but had an aisle seat MPX-MIA. Food was decent as was the on-board service. IFE gets low marks because there was no AVOD at all on the nearly 10 hour flight MXP-MIA. Apparently the 767-300 refurbs have not gone that far per a flight attendant. Also, in Economy there are no power ports; so your devices will quickly run out of juice. Bring an old-school paper book! In general the Basic Economy experience was not that bad, and I would do it again anytime I do not need to check a bag.

Name: W Davis
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas to Grand Island. Every flight on my vacation was delayed. Customer service was completely disrespectful. How am I supposed to be a satisfied customer when nothing goes the right way, this is not the first time this has happened, but it is now the last time it will ever happen. Delay after delay. They have no excuses. All staff are lazy and works at there own pace. People have lives and families outside the chaos of airports, we have made commitments to get from 1 place to the next, and this airline wants nothing more but to take our money. This is so pitiful. I am so angry and have had 2 anxiety attacks because I had no where to go when things canceled. I am a patriotic American. And it pushes me off that the company American Airlines cannot uphold what we are as a country.

Name: Daniel Hardone
Review: Not Verified | American just keeps getting worse and worse. I've flown American for the past 2 years on business. They used to have 2 classes of tickets, now they have 3. If you buy the old economy ticket you could upgrade to say and Emergency Exit row 1 hour before the flight. Now, with basic economy you can not. So, if the plane is half empty and you prefer to move, you can not, unless you pay an additional $60! Are you kidding? This after becoming a platinum member! Rude gate agents, horrible service, delayed flights, and horrible seats has driven me to fly another airline. Southwest is first on the list. Bye-Bye American! Don't waste your time with this un-American airline!

Name: T Dawes
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew American Airlines from Miami to New York City. Boarded the plane knowing full well we were delayed 2 hours. The pilot waited until everyone was seated to announce it. And to put salt in the wound, no service of any kind. Didn't see an attendant anywhere. Shameful and last time any of my family flies on this trap.

Name: B Lamiraz
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Santa Ana. Warning - do not travel economy in this airline. This means you will overpay, I ended up paying $ 500.00 for a flight I have made in JetBlue numerous times at a price of $97-$140. It guaranties that you will be seated in the last row and in the middle. Even when the plane is empty and they give others better seats free you will not be moved unless you pay extra. If you dare to request to be given another seat they reply “you are group 9 economy.” When I requested an explanation they just said you don’t get to change your seat. Someone booked this flight for me. Do not make this mistake.

Name: W Mearson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Had a 4 hour layover in Charlotte trying to get to Chattanooga. There was a flight leaving to Chattanooga in 30 minutes and the attendant verified there were 3 unsold seats on board. I was initially informed I could pay $75 to switch to the sooner flight no problem, but when my boarding pass was actually scanned the attendant flatly said I could not get on the earlier flight for any amount of extra cost. This was baffling and stressful, I am mainly upset because no explanation was given as to why I could not board the sooner flight. Sitting here for 4 hours when I know there are empty seats on the sooner flight. Thx AA

Name: kathleen beuttler
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New Orleans to Los Angeles. My flight was delayed 3 hours due to the unavailability of a flight crew. While waiting at the gate to board, the pilot announced that we did not have a flight crew available in New Orleans and that we would have to wait 3 hours for a crew to be flown in from Dallas. American offered no compensation for this major inconvenience. I wrote several letters but American just sent a form letter saying how sorry they were!! I am frequent flyer with AA and was offered no additional compensation - not even some extra miles.

Name: Maryna Kravchenko
Review: Not Verified |  We flew from Puerto Vallarta to Sacramento, with connected flight in Phoenix. We booked 2.5 hours available in Phoenix because we have to go through customs immigration (since flying from mexico). Our Flight from MX was scheduled 5:50pm and 1 hour delayed, we now have to fly at 6:57pm, meanwhile it's 7:25 pm we all seated on the plane and it still didn't move. Because of that we will have maximum 40 min between connected flights. My husband asked staff if possible to let us and others who are in same situation as us deplane earlier, all he got was a rude remark from her. Also after she made sarcastic comment without realizing that I was walking behind him. I'm pregnant, we travel with child and parents, at least I would expect some understanding and respect from crew, instead we got smacked in the face. I will continue review when we arrive to Phoenix.

Name: P Klein
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Tampa to Barcelona via Philadelphia. Our flight attendants were more concerned about their off time than our comfort. They asked us to move seats - then we realized they wanted to claim the two rows all the way across in the back for their own lounge. They even made us go down to the middle of the plane to use the bathroom so they could have the one in the back. One was great the other four were awful.

Name: K Goodall
Review: Not Verified |  What kind of airline makes someone pay $200 to change a flight? Life happens and no one should have to pay more than their ticket originally cost to change a flight even to the next day. My boyfriend and I are flying to see his family and we need to stay an extra day due to something, my original ticket cost more than the day that I needed to change to but in the end other than the $200 per ticket I also have to pay $50 per ticket because It was booked through a third party. Let me tell you something about an airline that puts their customers first, it’s not American Airlines. And honestly I’m not sure how great they do everything else but if I have to pay that much to switch I am never going to book with them again. I booked another ticket with southwest for the day because even though I won’t get my money back for the American airline flight I found a cheaper one overall with Southwest, who isn’t an airline I fly a lot but they have free flight changes so they just got themselves a new and very happy customer.

Name: M Wilton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Minneapolis to Charlotte. After experiencing a steady trend over the past several years in upward ticket prices and frequency of delay, I thought it was time to leave a review of American Airlines. I have recently experienced so many delays, resulting in missed connections, that I now find it preferable to fly to an airport 3 hours from my destination and drive the remainder. That is how unreliable airlines have become. Today, my flight has been delayed for two hours (so far), with a series of 3 increasing delay emails that began with a shorter predicted delay. After finding no information online about the reason for this delay (when airlines are usually eager to blame weather so everyone knows it's not their fault) I contacted customer service to inquire as to the nature of the delay. I was told "maintenance issues" after being on hold for over 10 minutes. I am writing this review in part to suggest a number of changes that AA could make to their service to dissuade negative reviews such as this: 1. If a delay is due to something that is the fault of the airline, and not the weather, state this honestly on flight status pages. 2. Maybe offer a voucher or other compensation when delays that are YOUR FAULT exceed two hours. Even something minor—like a seat upgrade or free wifi—would be better than nothing, and deter disgruntled passengers from boycotting your airline (which I am seriously considering at this point in time). 3. Change the "on hold" music to something with slightly better sound quality. Also, we do not need to be reminded of AA advertisements and "Please continue waiting" every 30 seconds. This is incredibly distracting and irritating when people are already irritated. 4. On your website's "Your Trip" section, clearly display the arriving aircraft's departure status, so that customers can click on the delayed flight and see where it's coming from and whether it's departed. This is an incredibly obvious thing that helps patrons gauge how long a delay is likely to last, or whether a cancellation is imminent. Other airlines already do this, but AA forces people to use better flight tracker services to check the status of the arriving aircraft. Unless some of these things change, I will not be using American Airlines any longer, and will recommend all of my friends, family and colleagues do the same.

Name: S Barton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Boston to Dallas Fort Worth. Ground employees extremely rude including check in and gate staff. American needs to work on service excellence. Will fly Jet Blue next time. They are known for great customer service. American has lost my business.

Name: Ashley Metzger
Review: Not Verified |  Flight was 8 hours late. No vouchers given or even a simple we are sorry for the inconvenience. Terrible service both at the airport and in flight. After waiting 8 hours to take a flight and already missing my brothers wedding, I was treated extremely poorly and was told that I should pay more attention to putting my bag under my feet than looking at my phone. My phone that I was texting my family on to tell them that I will not make it to the wedding. I will never fly AMERICAN again.

Name: Parker Buchanan
Review: Not Verified |  Austin to Montego Bay via DFW. Boarded the flight with no initial delay, 10 minutes after flight was scheduled to depart, the captain informed the flight via intercom that someone spotted a dent on the plane - maintenance allegedly told him that it would take about 15 minutes, then he would update us. After 30 minutes, it became indefinite. At this point, we had no chance of making the connection to MoBay. I called AA Customer Service, which was a joke; the rep kept telling me about overnight layovers and deplaning, which is not the airline’s fault, because they need to keep us safe. “So whose fault is this and who compensated me for my nights loss, transportation, etc?” “We have no control over that...” She said. The point is that this airline is not proactively maintaining the aircraft. No my vacation time and hard earned money are lost and they don’t have the decency to offer any type of reimbursement, not even a drink of water. The toilet facility on the aircraft is filthy and the attendants are sitting down with their feet kicked up. We’re on the plane as I write, wasting our lives away while they get paid. Never again! I rather take Southwest, and I hate Southwest.
route: Austin to Montego Bay via DFW

Name: Joseph Barnett
Review: Not Verified |  On March 24 of this year I flew on AA 1839 from Washington to Dallas Fort Worth. Since this flight was a short hop there were no meals served, just American's biscoff. The flight attendants seemed very nice and helpful, check in at DCA was very simple in painless, there were kiosks with staff roaming the check in area collecting baggage and helping out with any issues, from parking to being at the ate took me about 45 minutes. Once we reached DFW the staff at the gate were very helpful in finding where my connection was. I would fly with American again.

Name: Marissa DeCapua
Review: Not Verified |  LaGuardia to Dallas. Worst airline ever! I always fly Delta but had no choice but to fly American Airlines to Dallas and it’s the worst. They always have huge delays and issues and wont provide you with any information or approx time of departure. The staff are rude even when the airline has inconvenienced me. I’d rather fly Spirit.

Name: G Meakin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Philadelphia. Terrible support and accommodations on-flight. No room was provided for my carry on. It should not have to be a concern of the flyer to ensure that personnel use proper storage room. Flight attendants or crew members should ensure flyers use proper storage. Instead all flyers group 6 and back were asked to check their baggage.  I have important documents, work laptop and information to keep on me and was not allowed due to running out of room. I will request I never fly American aAirlines through military again. Completely let down, I have flown with this airline numerous times and have always been allowed to keep my bag even when "no room" was available. The lady at the desk was extremely rude and not willing to listen at all. Just got told to please handle it when you arrive at Philadelphia. So much for your customer service. This was terrible and can not any longer recommend your airlines for flying to others.

Name: John Murdock
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Honolulu to Salt Lake City via Los Angeles. Worst customer service I have experienced. My wife and baby went to the counter and checked in and the woman at the counter in Honolulu airport told my wife that I had five minutes to get there or I wouldn’t be able to board the plane. So my wife called me right then and I was there two minutes earlier than the five minutes because I sprinted from my car rental drop off after she told me that. When I arrived at the counter (three minutes earlier than the five minute cut off she gave my wife) she said in the most demeaning tone “you’re not going to be able to board the plane” and it felt as if she loved telling me that. I said “why?” And she said “because you didn’t make the cut off“. I looked at my watch and I said “yes I did, look at the time” and I showed her the time on her computer screen which was one minute earlier than the cut off time. She said in a sarcastic voice “I’m sorry there’s nothing I can do“. I said “can I speak to your manager“? And she laughed and said “she’s not going to help you“. She came back after like 15 seconds and said “told you, you’re not getting on the plane“. I asked her why she seemed to not be interested in helping us and told her it seems like she didn’t care.  She just kept saying “it’s under the terms and conditions” and “you shouldn’t have agreed.” I will never fly American Airlines again. Because of some cut off that I wasn’t even actually late for.
route: Honolulu to Salt Lake City via Los Angeles

Name: Santhosh Shanbhag
Review: Not Verified |  One of the worst flights ever.  We flew from San Francisco to Rome via Chicago. First they didn’t allow us to checkin online unless we selected seats for which we needed to pay like 30-40 Dollars per seat per leg of the flight. That means it costs like 150-160 dollars for just selecting a regular economy seat. Then when we reached the airport, we tried checking in the kiosk. It said assistance required and there was no one around. Then we went to a counter and checked by bag which cost 60$ for a single bag(wow). Then first flight from San Francisco to Chicago was delayed by 1 hour. That was after boarding. We barely made it 10 minutes before our boarding started for our next flight from Chicago. Then after sitting in the flight for 30 minutes they started saying that some maintenance was required for the flight and now it has been already more than 2 hours and we are still waiting. They are not even letting us off the plane.
route: San Francisco to Rome via Chicago

Name: Dustin Hendrickson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Wichita, 1hr 32 mins late arriving. Worst airline in the business, delays and other issues, aircraft are cramped and uncomfortable. I would not be flying them, but my company booked the flight. Truly a disgrace to airlines, I'm not  sure how an airline can screw up so badly and so often.

Name: Monet Young
Review: Not Verified |  Buffalo to Charlotte. Worst airline to fly with! This is now our second time this year for our flight to be delayed causing us to miss our connecting flight thus missing very important events that we paid a lot of money to be at. To “accommodate us” they gave us a 10% hotel discount for a hotel that was over $150 a night and sent us on our way. Absolutely unacceptable. And now that I’m reading the reviews I see that it’s a very common thing with this company. Will never be flying through this Airline again and suggest you not to if you want to make it on time wherever you are going.

Name: Marija Cvijetic
Review: Not Verified |  Phoenix to Monterey for a wedding. We were in a 10am flight. Got on a plane and they told us to get out because of technical issues. I was asking what is going on because no one was giving us information and they told me to go sit down in a very rude way. We waited and then they cancelled the flight. I went to costumer service to ask to fly somewhere else and I got yelled there as well saying it is not their fault. They put in on 1:45pm flight. Flight was delayed because they could not find the pilot. Nobody was taking responsibility for this. We missed the wedding. We had a hotel there and could not be given our money back. Worst experience ever.

Name: Todd E Duggan
Review: Not Verified |  Will not fly American again. Flew Friday 10/12 from Bradley International Airport, Hartford CT to Richmond VA via Charlotte NC. Flight delayed 30-45min from Bradley to Charlotte. We had a 1:45 min layover so no big deal. Flight from Charlotte to Richmond delayed 30 min. Trying right now to get home. Was supposed fly from Richmond to Hartford via Philadelphia. Flight from Philly to Hartford canceled. Rebooked from Richmond to Hartford via Chicago. Flight from Richmond to Chicago delayed 30min. In Chicago right now. Flight from Chicago to Hartford thus far delayed 1:15 min and changed gates in O'Hare from one end of Terminal 3 to the other end. Funny aside, the original flight we were booked on from Richmond to Philly was supposed to leave at 1500. Over loud speaker, "Last call for such and such flight to Philly" at 1530! So that flight was delayed too. I have flown Delta for years and very few issues. Unfortunately, there was not a convenient flight on Delta for this quick trip so decided to try American. Will never do that again. They are truly a comedy of errors and pathetic-ness.

Name: A Aljunaibi
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | The worst airline I have dealt with. My flight was delayed for 10 hours, they didn't send an email or call to let us know that there was a delay. I came with a group of 5 to the airport and when you tried to check in the system showed us that there was a delay and all the American Airlines offices were closed. We have been waiting for the assistance for 3 hours to try to find at least a place to stay in because it was 3 am and we arrived at the airport at 12 am but they were disrespectful and they didn't even gave us a place to stay and it wasn't our fault. They didn't care about their customers.

Name: Rhyder Ferguson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Norfolk to Philadelphia. Charlotte with American Airlines at Norfolk was the most helpful associate I have ever had. She was able to do things at the gate that the customer service counter said they couldn’t and was able to get me in my wife’s flight. Thank you.

Name: Marc Bloom
Review:
Not Verified |  
I will try not to ever fly American Airlines again. I say try, because sometimes it can't be helped and that's the only business they deserve. There was only 1 gate agent in San Antonio that was wonderful. We arrived Phoenix thinking we were going to be running, flight crew did not announce the gate the plane parked at. We run off to find out that we were at the correct gate. Could have stayed on the plane. Asked the gate agent at gate 2 at 4.30pm MST in Phoenix if there were any upgrades since I have long legs. She immediately said no and didn't look. I was not asking for 1st class, just a row with more legroom. If I can post the pictures I took of how many open seats including the ones on the front row by the wall with about 6 more inches. She didn't even take the time to look, instead stood there talking to an airport employee in red shirt. We heard the conversation and it wasn't about anything work related. The flight crew on the flight from San Antonio to Pheonix were rude, like we were their last flight. Guess what, we were, imagine that, horrible service! Do not fly American Airlines!
route: San Antonio to San Jose via Phoenix

Name: C Mallen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Los Angeles to New York JFK. Lovely service and lots of space even for a little snooze and had fun watching the first 5 episodes of the (US version) of The Office (why not more?!). Only complaint concerns the pre-booked meal - I'd chosen shrimp avocado toast - it consisted of 2 slices of toast, 2 shrimp and about 1 tbsp of avocado - more of an appetizer than a main dish! Fortunately I'd had a gorgeous fruit plate at Flagship Dining in LAX, or I would have been forced to eat the entire basket of onboard snacks otherwise. Really excellent flight with friendly and efficient service
route: Los Angeles to New York JFK

Name: Daniel Dodd
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Washington to Atlanta. I am going to stop being completely loyal to American for flying. I only have gold status but am flying a lot next year so would probably get higher. I don’t see the reason to stay with American. My last two flights in a row with American have been canceled. The first after sitting on the tarmac for three hours and the second after sitting on the tarmac for 5.5 hours. Although it was weather related, it shows very bad planning and a disregard for people’s time. They could have canceled earlier on when you knew the situation was so poor. The flight I’m on now has six open seats in first class and I wasn’t upgraded. Which just confirms my belief that they don’t value my business. In fact when my last flight was canceled I rebooked with Delta for the following morning and was impressed with the new plane even though I was sitting in a middle row in the back. I don’t remember the last time I was in a new plane with AA. They may be the largest airline (as I hear you often boast) but this can change when you take your business for granted.

Name: Mark Swartz
Review: Not Verified | Phoenix to Bradley via Charlotte. The worse experience we ever had on an airline. Terrible service from check in to departure. The majority of employees of American Air Lines were rude, uncaring and very disinterested in the needs or wants of the fliers. The only exception was a Supervisor. We booked our flight and expected to be seated together, we weren't, I paid an extra $40 dollars to sit near my wife and the machined malfunctioned and seated us in different rows. After being told I had to pay another $40 dollars to change seats, the supervisor kindly corrected the situation. American Air lines is an airline we will avoid .

Name: Jonathan Walker
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Phoenix to Newark. They changed the take off time twice, pushing it back. Then they decided to change the time and make it sooner. I went to the gate several times and it was empty of people. Each time they said take-off will be 10am. They ended up shutting the doors at 9:20 and we almost missed the flight. The staff at the door was extremely rude, argumentative and was fixated on blaming us for her faults. She threatened to not let us on the plane, because I confronted her about her rude behavior. I’m very unlikely to fly American Airlines now unless absolutely necessary, I will chose another airline.

Name: Mariam Ismail
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | London Heathrow to Washington DC via Philadelphia. I can’t believe the negative reviews on here! Please don’t listen! Before I booked my flight with American Airlines, I came on this website and I was about to cancel my flight, thank god I never did! Inhad an amazing flight with American Airlines. Flight was on time, the crew were absolutely lovely, the food was delicious. The crew kept on coming to give us snacks and even ice cream. The wine was lovely and they kept topping my glass. Before we landed to Philadelphia they served us pizza. I always fly out with Virgin Atlantic when flying to America however, from now on it will be only be American Airlines! I just want to thank the lovely crew on flight AA729! Please don’t listen to the bad reviews.
route: London Heathrow to Washington DC via Philadelphia

Name: P French
Review: Not Verified |  Purchased 2 First Class tickets for Washington Dulles to LAX to Puerto Vallarta. Dulles flight had mechanical issues, but was canceled 3 hours later, gate agent immediately rebooked us on a Washington National Airport to Dallas w/connection to PVR. Upon arrival in Dallas, airline partner refused to honor tickets & told us to talk with American airlines. American airlines customer service desk said "Yes, we're having a very difficult time getting them to honor the tickets, we've told corporate., I guess they're trying to work on it." We were booked on a flight on for Mexico City with a connection to PVR. That flight too had mechanical problems, but took off 1 hour late. After going through Immigration in Mexico City, we had only 30 minutes to get to the connection; when we arrived at the gate, they refused to honor the tickets & sent us to the AeroMexico ticketing desk. AeroMexico refused to do anything but simply referred us back to international terminal & American airlines desk. At the desk, the agent was able to see all of the issues which had occurred, told us there were no flights until the next day at 7am & provided a voucher for a meal (at 10:30pm) and a night at a Mexican hotel adjacent to the airport. The next morning we were at the airport by 5 am for the 7am flight to Puerto Villarta. It took American Airlines, and their partners, 29 hours and 5 airports to complete a 6 hr flight. Upon my return, I was informed by American airlines they were crediting 10,000 miles and were sorry for our troubles. They did not reimburse us for the difference between the First Class tickets we paid for (but never received First Class, sold out) on our journey to Mexico. Really terrible customer service, obviously they don't care!
route: Washington to Puerto Vallarta via Los Angeles

Name: M Barlen
Review: Providence to Los Angeles via Philadelphia. This was the worst travel experience I've ever had. I missed my connection in Philadelphia due to a maintenance issue on the plane. I landed at 8:52pm and was told by customer service in Philadelphia the next flight out was not until the next morning at almost 9:00am. I was looking at a 12 hour layover so obviously I wanted to stay in a hotel. I was told I would have to pay out of pocket by customer service.
