Horrible service at Mazatlan international airport, they try to charge you for carry on luggage including threatening you that you are not going on the flight and you are going to miss your flight if you do not give them what they ask. This airline should go out of business for the tactic they use to force you to pay for carry on, never again I would use American Airlines.

Name: Deborah P Conroy
Review: Not Verified |  Buffalo to Philadelphia was fine. Not comfortable, but adequate. However, the connecting flight from Philadelphia to BWI was first delayed multiple times, and finally (an hour and a half later) cancelled altogether. According to the boarding desk personal, flights were being cancelled due to "congestion." Connecting flight was supposed to depart at 8:05 am, but due to all flights to BWI by American out of Philadelphia that day, the first available flight out was at 5:55 pm, which meant my afternoon meeting in Washington was impossible. Apparently Philadelphia to Baltimore was not the only flight cancelled out of Philadelphia that day; there were hundreds of people stranded by American that morning. I did manage to get a rental car and DROVE the rest of the way. Submitting for a refund was also fraught with difficulty and in the end, my $190 aborted flight wound up costing me $327 ($190 + $215 car rental + $18 unknown fee charged to my account by American Airlines two days after the flight date - $96 refund) (I have no idea what the $18 is for. It came out of my account without my approval. I'll be following up on that.) Recounting my difficulties with this airline has elicited many, many horror stories from other travelers. They apparently frequently cancel flights, stranding people, with little recompense and no apology. Do not book with American.
route: Buffalo to Baltimore Washington via Philadelphia

Name: D Berton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Tokyo Narita to Los Angeles. First time experience with this airline on an international route. Both flights on time. Aircraft and restrooms clean. Staff was very professional and proactive on both trips. Tons of entertainment. The food won't be giving Emirates a run for its money anytime soon, but sometimes just a hot, simple meal is nice. Wifi goes from good to slow to good - maybe not worth the money. Would certainly choose them again. Is this really the same airline that seems to be getting all of these negative reviews?

Name: L Ginnane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Laguardia to Chicago Ohare. Horrible experience! I will never fly with American Airlines again. They are so strict with the carry-on luggage it’s ridiculous! I travel all the time and use the same carry-on luggage I travel all the time and use the same carry-on luggage for all different airlines -  my carry on fit into their luggage sizer snugly and they still made me check it. I saw them do this with several other passengers also. I know my bag fits in the overhead bin with no problem because I travel with the same back all the time! No more American Airlines for me.

Name: Marty Doyle
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Shanghai to West Palm Beach via Dallas Ft Worth. As configured and operated by AA, the Boeing 787 is a flying torture chamber. The seats are hard and narrow. The aisles are so tight as to be impassable and potentially unsafe. Service is perfunctory at best. Avoid at all costs! Take a connecting flight, older plane, train, bus, but avoid this aircraft, at least on this airline. The Boeing 787 is a potentially great plane, but by squeezing in seats to squeeze out every nickle of profit, AA has ruined it. For background, I am a former pilot, average size, over 1.5 million miles on AA and I have never hated a flight so much. Oh, and there were only 3 functioning lavs for probably 100 pax, if you could leapfrog over the legs and even heads in the aisle, and this flight was 80% Asian folks so we are not talking the Chicago Bears in terms of pax size!
route: Shanghai to West Palm Beach via Dallas Ft Worth

Name: D Meares
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Wichita to Lexington via Chicago. First flight delayed 1 hour 20 min causing me to miss my connection. My second flight had not left yet but they closed boarding as I got to the gate. Leaving me stuck at the airport for 7 hours until next the available flight. The second flight was delayed over 30 min. The first delay caused me to have incur unplanned and unnecessary rental car fees as I missed my ride at my final destination. After seeing all the other flights that were delayed today with American Airlines I will be choosing a different airline from now on, even if costs a little more.

Name: S Allen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New York JFK to Baltimore Washington. We booked two flights with them, round trip and both connecting, and both times in separate months, the flights were cancelled due to maintenance. Same airline, same issue, and has interfered with connecting flights. We were supposed to return home in the late morning, it was delayed by an hour, then cancelled when we were supposed to start boarding. What's our comp? $24 in meal vouchers, a taxi to a different airport, and not much else. I will never fly this airline again, and since I have no preference for airlines, that's saying something. What's wrong with your planes that they're always down for maintenance?
route: New York JFK to Baltimore Washington

Name: Mike Sands
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | 1st flight delayed while awaiting flight attendants, 6 other attendants already on plane kicking 6 paying customers off. Arrive 10 min before our connection is to leave. Won’t let us on because door is closed, watched plane sit at gate 20+ min more before leaving. Now stuck overnight in Phoenix at a hotel since 2.30 pm with only $60 to feed 5 people including 2 teenage boys and no transportation. Customer service only held our spots on the “new” flight and never actually booked the tickets - had to spend another hour and 3 more phone calls to get that taken care of. Family that booked months ago to ensure seating together because of some flight anxieties is now spread throughout an entire plane for a 6 hr flight. Out thousands of dollars for prepaid items in our destination, not to mention the $5k we paid AA for this terrible experience, and all we get from anyone at AA is we understand, we’re sorry, it happens, but nothing of substance When it comes to making it right. All so they can manipulate an ontime departure rating by closing a door instead of being compassionate towards their consumers and opening a door on a plane that was still sitting there and having baggage still loaded. Amazing how the doors on our original flight weren’t closed on the missing flight attendant.

Name: J Daleros
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  My flight was cancelled and we were just told to either get a refund or rebook another flight. All flights to George Bush airport were fully booked that day. So much of an inconvenience since in the first place i booked the very first trip to have adequate time for possible delays. Able to book going to Hobby airport. I just need to be in houston that day. Unfortunately my checked in baggage was delivered to George bush. Not an urgent need but an inconvenience. Toll free number takes 45 min to call you back. Inquired with AA ground crew at the gate who just shrugged their shoulders. They were all in a rush to go coz their gate was about to close. Finally boarded to fly to hobby airport. I could not understand a thing the flight attendant was paging overhead, her words were garbled and carelessly pronounced.

Name: S Merson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  To make a long story short, our American Airlines 9:45 flight schedule turned into a 30+ hour nightmare. The cherry on top was our lost luggage which American Airlines did not even take responsibility for, albeit our bags finally arrived at our hotel with AA's baggage sticker. The customer service was non-existent every step along the way, and when we did reach a customer service rep they could care less despite the cause of the various circumstances were of their making. Even their online complaint site is a joke. Avoid this airline if at all possible.

Name: Brittnee Bates
Review: Not Verified |  When checking in, the website wouldn’t let me continue knowing I have a seat already reserved. The only thing I could do to continue was pay for a preferred seating. After doing that I figured I should have called before but I didn’t. So I called afterwards and they told me they wouldn’t refund it because “it’s policy that it’s non refundable”. The representative was very professional but the supervisors she said she spoke with were awful. I wish I couldn’t talked to them myself. Yes it’s only $14, but they’re always charging for extras and it’s stupid! I told them there was something wrong with the website since it wouldn’t let me continue. They didn’t care. I have flown with American before and hated it. Hopefully my actual flight goes a lot better than the experience I had today.

Name: Jim N Nieman
Review: Not Verified |  Worst customer service ever. They kept delaying the flight, and after four hours of waiting, cancelled the flight and could not offer any other flights. We were flying from Newark to Charlotte. Long lines of waiting to try to get another flight. We were treated like cattle. One recommendation was to drive to Baltimore and take a flight from there. Management was rude and ignored us. Then an hour on hold when I called to get my refund. Never again.

Name: B Lane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  My flight was late leaving causing me to miss my connecting flight that was suppose to land at noon in Kansas City and I’m suppose to arrive back at fort riley by tonight at midnight. The earliest flight they could give me was 8pm leaving philli and arriving in Kansas City at 1045. It’s a two hour drive back to fort riley causing me to be late to signing back onto post. This was already a sad time for me as I flew back home for emergency leave for a funeral and now going back to work I will be late signing back onto post. Which is a very big deal. When I went to customer service in Philadelphia the agent was extremely rude and unprofessional. Telling me there’s absolutely nothing he would do for me unless I magically appeared with orders. I tried to show him my leave paperwork and he said orders or nothing at all.

Name: C Steene
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New York to Columbia via Chicago. This is the worst experience I've ever had flying. American airlines is a nightmare. Cancelled their flight leaving me stranded at the airport and playing redirection games while I sought for assistance. No customer empathy. Even in the dream or nightmare would never fly American airlines again.
route: New york to Columbia via Chicago

Name: Marc L Coleman
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Orlando to New York. After reading reviews, I was very surprised how good the flight was. Left on time, good food and good service. Seats were good, only 4 rows of 2. Plane left on time and arrived on time. No issues whatsoever.

Name: Susan Myers
Review: Not Verified |  Chicago to Dayton. Flight took off on time. After 30 minutes of odd flying, pilot announces cabin pressure was not being maintained. Flight was diverted to Chicago. After landing it was announced that the cargo door was not properly closed. They closed the cargo door and maintenance performed pressure check and we boarded the flight again, three hours later. I’ve contacted American Airlines several times to find our how they can miss a cargo door not being sealed prior to take off. The flight crew was blaming the Chicago ground crew. This concerns me regarding safety for future flights. American Airlines has been dismissive and has responded that they simply don’t have that information and there is no one that they can direct me to for answers. Pathetic. Flight attendants were very pleasant, otherwise.

Name: H Darvez
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I had a flight booked with AA on July 23 at 7PM, they kept sending emails with delay notifications till 11 PM to finally cancel the flight. There started the nightmare - per their representatives AA does not have to provide anything because the cancellation reason was weather (something not out of discussion since there was another flight at 9PM and it was not cancelled). Parents traveling with kids, elderly persons on wheelchairs, etc and AA said that they could not provide any food, hotel,taxi. Everybody was re-scheduled on AA flights from July 25 till 29 (6 days after the booked flight) after any questions their representative kept saying his is not us, this is the company and how they want to address this issue.. I ended up buying a ticket on another airline to flight next day. I never could imagine that behavior from AA.

Name: Ellena Rawlings
Review: Not Verified |  Pretty appalling experience. Have never encountered such poor customer service before. Staff were unhelpful, unfriendly and insensitive to those of us onboard that had very tight connect flight times. Completely unorganised disembarking which resulted in myself and my sister missing our connecting flight, despite telling staff our concerns and seeing that we were visible stressed and upset and about potentially not being able to get home, they did not seem to care or want to help us leave the flight a bit before those who had a little bit longer for connecting flights/remaining in Charlotte. I have never experienced this in many years of travelling with various airlines, worst experiment and left myself and my sister more stressed and upset. Will never fly American airline again.

Name: G Leventis
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  An early flight from Orlando to MIA. Check in went smoothly. As we had fairly heavy baggage, the check in staff was really helpful to advise us as to what to do to save money and at the same time adhere to airline policies. All worked ok. After a fairly strenuous TSA check went to departures hall and took the shuttle to the gate. Boarding procedure went ok, even though despite of our seat numbers were called last again. Staff were very helpful and courteous at the gate and on board. The cabin was clean. Just a bottle of non-spring water was offered, which we did decline. A fine flight, departing and arriving on time with staff being efficient. Only downturn is the airline's policy on luggage and staff uniforms that look aged.

Name: P Merton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  It all started when Ticketing agent in San Jose could not complete a family checkin for over an hour. Caused us to miss our 8am plane to DFW even though we were at airport 2 hours before departure. Waited for the next plane scheduled to leave at 1:37pm. But they hadn’t handled our ticket change correctly and we weren’t even booked on the flight. Another agent got us on as the last 3 passengers on board. American had previously announced the crew for the next flight was missing and another crew was busing in from San Francisco. Departed 45 mins late with a tight 1 hour connection in DFW. American assured us that all of the connections would be made. Upon arrival, hurried to change terminals and arrived at gate with 5 mins to spare. No one there even though American agents said they would call ahead and tell them we were coming. Put on next flight scheduled for 10:25 departure to Northwest Arkansas. American announces they don’t have a plane for this flight. They announce that a plane is due at 10:36. Now due to depart at 11:00. We’ll see! Incompetent ticketing agent! Missing crew! Missing plane! I think I’ll stick to Southwest and just drive to Tulsa! No thanks American!
route: San Jose to Northwest Arkansas via DFW

Name: F Bailey
Review: Not Verified |  Boarded plane in Detroit Mi on July 23! Pilot said we had to make a stop in Greensboro due to bad weather, so we flew into Greensboro and were there for 2 hours. Pilot said we would refuel and head to Charlotte at 6:57. We were left Greensboro until 7:45, so I missed my connection to Tri Cities airport! The plane wasn't refueled until after 7. When I got to Charlotte, the second flight going to Tri Cities was cancelled. I was given a phone number to call to make another reservation and was told it was tomorrow July 24 at 2:40. I'm sitting here with several other people whose flights were screwed up! I will never fly American airlines again.
route: Detroit to Tri Cities via Charlotte

Name: C Cox
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Diego to Phoenix. Flight from PHX was two hours late. Then the return flight was also two hours late. The app said “on time” until the very last minute so there was no way to salvage any of the time. On the day of the flight I got a seating change via the app. Changed us to seats in different rows. Tried to call about it, but the automated system said 1.5 hour wait. Turns out the original seat assignments I got were in a non existent row. These people are a bunch of screw ups. It used to be a good airline, but it sure isn’t anymore.

Name: Silvia Fannin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Melbourne Fl to Dayton via Charlotte. Our flight was scheduled at 8:45 and I received an email this morning at 6:00 that it was delayed and we will miss our connection flight. We knew at the airport that this flight has been delayed for the last 5 consecutive days. If I would have known this in advanced I will schedule my flight for a day early. I considered this an abuse of power by the airline.
route: Melbourne Fl to Dayton via Charlotte

Name: E Salifo
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Los Angeles. The worst customer service ever given! The staff isn’t very polite they’re very curt with you, you ask for a manager or person in charge they won’t get you one they say they’re not available. From a delayed 4hr flight that started in France not allowing enough time for the 4hr layover we originally had in Chicago they rescheduled us on united giving us 90 minute layover which we missed because they made us go get our bags go through TSA and then recheck our bags etc.. they ended up putting us on another flight that was canceled long story short after 36 hrs at Chicago O’Hare trying to get home American Airlines did nothing to help us we called customer service we asked for a person in charge (non available), not until we had to get loud with them that they finally got us on stand by again for like the 7th time that we were able to get on a flight! We spend $300 on a hotel stay that wasn’t planned and to top it off American Airlines sent our luggage with United we had no clothes and our luggage was at LAX!

Name: Atef Mikhael
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Syracuse to Cancun via Charlotte. Vacation ruined, 2nd time last year vacation to Jamaica ruined (lost 1 day flight cancelled), this year lost the bag came after 1 day. On our way back flight delayed, 1 more day in transit! Wife flew from JFK to Syracuse last year lost the bag, will never fly AA any more. I do not care about the entertainment, staff kindness, food, wifi, I am talking about basic stuff. Flights for the most part delayed, cancelled etc, bags expectedly messed up, delayed,lost. I cannot remember a trip without issues.

Name: M Tarconi
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Minneapolis to Philadelphia. Do not fly this airline! When booking it may seem cheaper but they nickel and dime you for every little thing which cost you more in the long run.  My son had a bicycle that could only fit in an oversized bag. When we went to check in they charged us $150 extra because there was a bike inside the bag. Not reading word for word the baggage policy, as most passengers don't, we were unaware bikes were not allowed unless in a box. The manager and the baggage check in person accused us of Fraud and stealing from the airline. We explained it was not stealing No fraud because we were unaware of of the policy. Nonetheless they both continued harassing us and would not make any accommodations even though my wife is a frequent business flyer on their airline. They charged us $150 extra. Never flying this Airline again.

Review_Heading: "not getting what I am paying for"
Name: L Tanner
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Delayed in Roanoke 2 hours trying to get to Charlotte. Last month I missed my connecting flight as a result of a delayed flight. I will be seeing another airline next time even if I have to get on four planes to get where I am going. I am not getting what I am paying for.

Name: H Steade
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Tampa. bWorst experience of my life flying ever! I fly a ton for work and I have never ever been treated so poorly. My husband and I have the American Airlines card and have access to their lounge which we pay $400 for annually. The treatment from the staff of the Miami airport tonight is outrageous. We will be canceling and never flying with them again. I understand delays are out of their control but we sat on and unconditioned plane for an hour just to then sit at the airport with literally no update on our constantly delayed flight for hours. To say I’m outraged and disappointed is a major understatement. This has ruined our entire vacation. I can’t believe I’m even paying for this flight they call service. Please, never fly American. I know we won’t be ever again.

Name: J Heane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I’ve had the most horrid experiences with American. I’ve been delayed both flights to North Carolina from Washington and back by at least an hour. I was supposed to get in tonight at 845 and catch my bus to Bellingham from Seattle but they delayed the fight at the last minute didn’t bother to say anything and I had to pay for another full bus ticket to get home.  Coming up I was delayed an hour as well. I think mainly their boarding protocols and strict baggage guidelines and I don’t read the times points to there bad satisfaction for me. Planes are nice though but that’s about it. Of all the airlines I’ve flown American has the most delays beyond anything I’ve seen and do not want to travel with them again.

Name: S Murphy
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Laguardia. My flight was scheduled for 8:32pm. When we get on the plane, we were told shortly after that there was going to be a delay, which was understandable due to the weather in NY. Soon later, they made everyone get off of the plane because it was too hot on the plane and the air conditioner wasn’t effective, and they ran out of drinking water. We get off of the plane and wait for an update. No accurate update was given. We were simply told that the weather was bad and that now our Captain can’t fky because he’s over his time. They called several more captains and it was too late for them all to fly. They finally found a captain that Can fly. We get back in the plane, which was crammed. We waited almost an hour. I asked the flight attendant what was going on and what time we were taking off. She said she did not know. I asked for water because it was very hot and was told they ran out still. So we were going to be on a 3 hour flight with no water. Soon later, we all get texts that our flight was cancelled. We asked the flight attendant and they had no information. Finally we were told by the captian that it was cancelled. It was past 12am at this point. It took forever for them to re-in-board the plane. We finally get off and get directed to the reservation area by an AA employee by the name of Ana.Short Spanish looking lady.With no patience, she very rudely screams at us while swinging her finger in our face, to get in a single file line and “don’t even think about cutting”.It’s not like she made that comment before and people ignored her. She has an attitude right away.I was very annoyed because we have been on and off that plane several times for hours and have also waited a very long time, just for the flight to be cancelled at 12 in the morning.Then take a shuttle to an airport at 2 in the morning with a rescheduled flight at 8am. Lost out on an entire day of pay because of this airline. I would have been less upset if the staff wasn’t so rude and if they acted like they cared that we were bounced around for hours. Everything was unorganized and unprofessional.

Name: Tara Martin
Review: Not Verified |  Flew from Albuquerque to Miami with a layover in Dallas. Attendants refused to assist with check in demanding the Kiosk be used. Refueling delays in Dallas. Luggage arrived slightly damaged, but filthy. Clean your luggage compartments!

Name: Juan Carlos Gomez
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Las Vegas to Miami. Today they  made passengers from the Vegas red eye into Miami, wait 1.5 hours for bags at 5am. When I complain at the counter the clerk told me that nothing could be done and the supervisor was in a call and would not pay attention to this service to the passengers. There was no storm. Clerks at the bag counters were beyond careless. Shame on you American Airlines for treating passengers like this.

Name: Jason Usry
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Charlotte. Traveling with an infant and family. Called and paid an additional 25.00 per head to ensure we got seating assignments together since we had an infant. Agent assured us seats were together. Got to airport, no seat assignment, and was informed there was nothing they could do. Gate agent was rude and a great representation of the Company and how they treat their customers.

Name: N Garanoulis
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Flying with my wife from MIA to Orlando International, after spending the night in Miami arriving from Madrid. Check in - bag drop went ok. Staff at check in was polite enough. TSA also went smoothly. Flight was quite short - about 55 minutes, so on economy there was a choice between orange juice and water. Got water but was not spring water so I did not consume it. Cabin staff was polite, seats were comfortable and appearance of the cabin was tidy. Nevertheless, cannot award full marks because of the airline's baggage policy, boarding procudure (zones - appears that whatever seat we are seating and zone assigned we board last!), uniforms of some members of staff - some look rather worn for many many years. Overall a good flight.

Name: L Deane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Norfolk to St Louis. I had the most unpleasant experience on your airline July 4th weekend. I arrived at Norfolk International Airport shortly after 10am for a flight that was going to St Louis, Missouri. The flight was delayed due to weather conditions in Charlotte; which I completely understood. However, after waiting at the airport for about 5 hours, we finally boarded the plane. We sat on the plane for 3 hours before we left to head to Charlotte. By the time we made it to Charlotte I had missed my flight and was put on a different one. Minutes before getting ready to board the plane they tell us the flight is cancelled. There was one more plane going to St Louis, and they only had a few seats available on it and it was first come first serve. I was put on a waitlist because the seats were full. Luckily, I was able to get on. After waiting around for about 10 hours with a million delays and a cancelled flight, it was beyond stressful. Worst experience ever. It didn’t help that the people at the airports weren’t very friendly at all. I was highly disappointed with the experience. I was supposed to arrive in St. Louis at 3pm and didn’t arrive until midnight.

Name: E Decoito
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Athens to Miami. I am just writing this review to praise an  individual American Airline worker at the ATL airport.  I was very late for my flight and even though the desk had already been closed for 45 minutes and the luggage belt had turned off he helped me out a ton and printed the documents I needed faster than I could have done. He also took care of my luggage and was at my gate to assure me of that before I boarded the plane. I do a lot of travelling and I haven’t had such great help!

Name: Cody Rodrigo
Review: Not Verified |  Philadelphia to Atlanta. Absolutely horrible. Not only was my flight delayed by 4 hrs than its original departure time of 5:30, but they also left the lights on the airplane the entire ride from 9:30 to 11:30 while most passengers wanted to sleep, this prohibited a lot of passengers including myself from sleeping. The only snack your offered are pretzels. I also didn't get my bag about 12 to 12:30. The constant delays were unreal. I didn't get settled at home until 1:30 in the morning, which caused problems for me the next day. Then when I opened my luggage the next day it was clear that my luggage was handled extremely poorly. I wrapped a glass picture frame in clothes so it wouldn't get damaged in flight as I've done before with delta without a fragile sticker being placed on it and with delta it would always be fine, when I opened my bag the frame was shattered and the broken glass had ruined my picture. There was also a 10min delay getting off of the plane. Then when I went to the train to go to baggage claim, the train was very slow, not just arriving to pick us up at the gate, but moving to baggage claim. I'd sooner fly on any other airline before ever flying American airlines ever again! Not to mention the train and airport was cold as hell, colder than normal.

Name: Fabrice Barbier
Review: Not Verified |  American Airlines seems to be uncapable to keep flight on time. I booked via British Airways and have a cancelled flight in NYC JFK. Rebooked next day via EWR with an initial proposal to have me in an hotel in LA Guardia after fighting for 1 hours with customer service I got an hotel in Newark and was able to enjoy 2,5 hours of sleep before my next flight going to Dallas before reaching my destination to Vegas. So I started my conference late and completely exhausted. Then on my way home, I discovered an unknown policy (was told is documented but could not find it despite search AA website) that you cannot register your luggage before 4 hours before the flight (funnily enough TSA ask to come 3 hours before minimum for international so be between 3 and 4 hours before otherwise like myself you will not be able to register your luggage and be stuck in an airport that has no business lounge facility. As a first class passenger I would expect a much better service so I will endeavour to never fly American again. I appreciated the service desk in JFK that thanked me for remaining so calm while she was getting annoyed for me. Is someone in AA listening to staff on the ground they seem to be facing and understanding issues much better than the management that creates policies. I will avoid this airline!

Name: Jenn Hall
Review: Not Verified |  Portland to Charleston via Charlotte.  We had a horrible experience. Our connecting flight was cancelled, when I went to the counter I was told my flight would be the next day. I'm three hours from my destination but because of the computer glitch they had days prior there were no rental cars. Anywhere. I asked to be put on a sooner flight and was given the flight at noon. 5 delays and 4 gate changes later we took off at 4 pm. I had to ask for a meal voucher for my child since we were at the airport for 12hrs. We were finally given one for lunch for 24.00 with the airport food costs that wawas enough for him to get a burger meal and me a drink. I will never fly American again. Those poor people working there have no power to give customer service for c.

Name: Michelle Pegg
Review: Not Verified |  Flew from Grand Rapids to VPS Florida and no problems on flight there. It departed around 730 am. I will say the staff seems to be rude and uncaring all the way around. It seems like they all hate their job. I left on a Thurs and returned on a Thurs late after noon to my final destination. That's not good since my arrival should have been Tuesday at 7 PM in Grand Rapids. Left Florida to Michigan via Washington Regan at 130 PM and didn't leave airport till 1030 am the next day. They were trying to put me on Thurs at 5 PM until I informed them I needed medication and couldnt wait that long. Also Nowhere to sleep. All chairs with arm bars. We we never offered a blanket or pillow. It sounded like constant construction the entire night and I was so cold from air blowing on us. I would have considered sleeping the floor but I had nothing but what I was wearing and back pack with limited meds and some personal hygiene. They wont offer you reimbursement because it a reason not covered. There is one customer service line which I and about 100 other people were in to find out about our flight. I spent about 100 on food which included snacks and water. I was so cold I bought 2 sweatshirt because 40 each or 2 for 50. Got kicked out of one side after last flight out and put into mid area until early flights came in and went back through security again. It was complete nightmare. I was only grateful I was alone and didn't have kids with me. I will never fly with American Airlines again. I making sure I bring my carry on luggage in case this ever happens again I am prepared. I'm am completely floored they call this customer service and treat their customers this way. There was a couple who had their flight cancelled 3 times and sat over night behind me. They were told the captain had too many hours so no one to fly the plane, also short on flight attendant.

Name: Philip Kopatz
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Prague to Akron via Philadelphia.I flew on American Airlines twice. Once on the way to Europe in early June 2018, and once on the way back to the United States in mid-July 2018. On the way to Europe, my flights were delayed several times and I was 12 hours past my arrival time. On the way back, my flights were delayed and rebooked a total of six times. I eventually made it to Philadelphia at midnight (14 hours later than expected) and they gave me a hotel voucher where I could stay until 1pm the next day when my flight left for home. After waiting 40 minutes for the shuttle that never came, I ubered to the hotel. The hotel said American Airlines had met their quota and that they had actually sold all their rooms. I tried calling the corporate number and they said there was nothing they could do from there. I tried to call the airport and they redirected back to corporate. So I found the shuttle back to the airport where I was told that they didn’t have any more vouchers but if I keep my receipts they should reimburse me. Instead, I called reservations and demanded an earlier flight, which they somehow found. They dropped the ball on almost every aspect of this trip and I will never fly with them again.

Name: Ken Hayashima
Review: Not Verified |  This was by far the most disgusting experience. Originally, I had been supposed to take a 8:19pm connecting flight at Boston to go to Philadelphia from Tokyo. As soon as the flight from Tokyo landed at Boston Logan Airport, I received two texts notifying the delay without being provided any reasons. At that moment, the flight was still supposed to fly at 10 pm, so I decided to stick to it and I checked my suitcase in. After that, they keep sending the delay notifications, which ended up saying "the flight was cancelled and your new flight is 5:25 am one" As expected, they never provided any reasons at all and I was kicked out of the security area around 12am, which forced me to spend some 4 hours outside and come back to line up for the security again around 4 am. When I asked about my suitcase I checked in at the gate after this reschedule, the crew said "that is a separated system and we have no information." The new flight departed without any trouble and I got my suitcase at Philly airport, which was the only good news. After I came back home, I posted a complaint through their system, which is not responded at all for more than 2 days. I would not blame any individual employee for this, but I should conclude that American Airlines' overall attitude towards passengers is nothing but disrespect. I will never ever ever fly with American Airlines again.

Name: J Wallace
Review: Not Verified |  American Airlines flight from Dallas to Charlotte was good. Then my flight from Charlotte to Fayetteville was cancelled. It finally did rebook only to be cancelled again. Now I have to spend the night, unexpectedly and catch a flight at 8am to a different city after waiting for hours to find out it was cancelled. Then I wasn't offered a voucher for a motel and I had to pay for that. Then I had to get a family member to drive 2 hrs to get me and 2 hrs back to try and get ready for my grandpa's funeral, the whole reason for the trip. Now for my trip home. 3 flights cancelled before I was given a flight on a different airline and 2 days later. I missed 2 days of work, I have 2 small children at home with out me. It was a horrible experience and all they offer me was miles to use. I don't even fly. This was an unexpected situation. There should have been some reimbursement from the 600.00 ticket. Not very good business.

Name: Pasi Mänttäri
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Boston to New Orleans via Charlotte. Our first flight was delayed by 8hours 26minutes since they had to do maintenance on the plane for 3-4 hours. After the maintenance, they noticed that they are missing one flight attendant, and we had to wait for him to arrive for over 4 hours. We were told that we would get a hotel at Charlotte, where our connecting flight would leave and were we would have to wait for several hours (original change time was 2 hours, now 6.5 hours). When we arrived, we were met by very rude loud American Airlines staff that were willing to do nothing about the matter or help us in anyway. Hotels were booked, but nonetheless they did not offer food or anything in compensation. Or even an apology (like it was our fault). To sumarize: if you want very bad unhelpful and rude service, delayed flights with sleeping on airports and lies atop of lies how "they will handle it". Fly with American Airlines. I certainly will never again.
route: Boston to New Orleans via Charlotte

Name: Matthew Decker
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Roswell to Louisville via Dallas. Excuse after excuse with delayed flights. Started off with delayed aircraft then told it was a maintenance issue and now with the flight leaving supposedly leaving two hours after it’s original departure time we’re being told we are waiting on a crew! Where was the crew that was supposed to be on the original flight? There’s no excuse for this, send someone from management to explain the issue not hide behind your desk and let your poor gate agents catch the brunt of people’s frustrations. Only using American because I booked through employer website, won’t use personal funds to fly this airline. Delayed my flight last week for an hour waiting on a wheel chair to be brought to remove a patient from the arriving aircraft. Poor service!

Name: Ananta Upreti
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Highly disappointed I suppose to travel July 16 from Sioux Falls to Cincinnati but 3 times delays and finally got 1 flight but to get another connection flight is to wait overnight in the airport. It takes me 2days to reach my destination which is 3 hrs total flying lengths. It’s seems like they care their business more not for customers time.
route: Sioux Falls to Cincinnati via Chicago

Name: C Barter
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I fly twice a month and every other trip is delayed by four to five hours due to maintenance problems. There has never been an attempt to say sorry for the inconvenience or an attempt to make up for the problems in any way. It’s basically deal with it and go away. I have flown on this airline for six months now and it’s always the same never gets better. This will be my last trip on this airline and I advise everyone one else to stay away.

Name: Karla Madrid
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I was traveling from Miami to Washington DC on 14 July 2018 on Flight #AA2363. I usually prefer to travel with American Airlines as I have enjoyed their customer services until today when in two occasions was treated very rudely by two of their associates. People like that shouldn't work in customer service as it ruins the good reputation of a business. It was a very unpleasant experience that I hope not to encounter again.

Name: Raghav Nookala
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I flew American Airlines on business trips domestic and international numerous times but never with family on an intentional trip. Unfortunately I did travel this time and I swear not to do the same mistake again. I wanted to request a vegetarian meal for my family and I could not figure how to do it from the website that I visit almost every week. I end up calling customer service and they had to update the meal preference. However they miss updating one of the family members and guess what, 2 Asian vegetarian meals for 3 of us.  I was traveling with an infant, so requested a bassinet almost 2 months in advance. Even called the customer service and I get a standard response that I need to request at the airport. I am a platinum pro traveler and I still could not block any bulkhead rows because I had a lap child in the reservation. I go to the airport 3.5 hours before the departure time and request bassinet. I was told that I need to contact the gate agent. I go ask the gate agent and she tells me that no bulk head seats are available as all of those seats were sold at a premium to other passengers. When I checked out those seats, there were no infants in them. This was a shocker. My next 2 legs were with Etihad and they had the bulk head rows assigned to us even before requesting them. The air hostesses were arrogant and would not like to entertain simple questions like “hey do have some fruits for the kids?” I specifically asked for the name to complain and she would not divulge her name. A simple yes or know would have sufficed but all I get is "Why are you bothering me" look. This kind of behavior deters families traveling with American and could cost in the long run. No point in whining about Middle East airlines capturing the international travel market. Not because of their price but because of their service. Companies that ignore customer service have perished. Better learn the lesson and improve. Business travelers travel alone (1 ticket) but families (3-4 tickets on average). Wake up before it is too late.

Name: Alexandra Nelson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Ft Walton to Dallas Ft Worth. American Airlines is by far one of the worst airlines I have flown with. I have been traveling a lot for work lately and have been on over 4 flights in the past week with them. Each flight has been delayed, their employees do nothing to inform their guest of the delay or what is going on. American Airlines used to be very organized and customer friendly, however, after my past few experience I will never book a flight through them again.
route: Ft Walton to Dallas Ft Worth

Name: Yankor Ramos
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I can understand a delay due to the weather but the unprofessionalism and rude attitude from the representatives at DFW airport was not necessary. The customer service in Vancouver was not much better and when my girlfriend’s baggage failed to arrive not much was done to assure it would arrive in one of the next two flights the same day and left us staying at the hotel since my girlfriend didn’t have any clothes. Too much failure on American Airlines end when it comes to customer service and inspiring information for delayed baggage. Overall this is the 2nd terrible experience with this airline. Inflight food beverage quality is down. Customer service is non-existent. Poor baggage handling. I can safely say that my family, my girlfriend and of course myself will never fly American Airlines again.

Name: Frederick Langan-Clemens
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Honolulu to Phoenix. Trying to return home after honeymoon plane was delayed on runway for 3 hours and then finally at 1.30am deboarded plane just to wait another 2-3 hours for hotel voucher which serves no purpose since our flight which we had to change ourselves to Delta was leaving at 11am. My wife and I have been up for over 24 hours and still have another 25 before returning home. The only kind person was the morning ticketing agent who at least gave us a food voucher. Customer service was non-existent and my family and myself will never fly American Airlines again! Thank you for making my honeymoon unforgettable!

Name: I Childs
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to Dallas. Worst airline! I fly weekly for work and I have to unfortunately use American Airlines because of my projects budget. Every time I Fly with American, my flight is always delayed! How inconvenient and annoying can this airline be? Then when you call for customer service they are so rude and inconsiderate! I’ve had flights that were connecting and I’ve had to run for my life to catch it because my flight was delayed for 2 hours. This airline always makes it a point to disappoint me. The best airline thus far is Southwest and Delta.

Name: K Kemp
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I am really disappointed with American Airlines. I got one cancellation and two delays for my flights. It was not delayed because of the weather problems, but because of maintenance problems. Moreover, my flight was supposed to be at 10.30 am and they just arbitrarily changed our flight to 10.00 pm without explanation. I wanted to get a refund and change my flight to another airline because I have an important schedule. However, they just say they are not sure whether I can get a refund or not. I will never use this airline again.

Name: Sanil Subhash Bose
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | This flight from Dallas to Philadelphia is notorious for its delay and not respecting the time of people. I think they are understaffed and have arguments and change it in time with different arguments. The most annoying thing is their announcement of delays. They keep changing the time every hour with different arguments. It shows clearly their inability to say the truth. I flew with them five times and four times I had delays of over 4 to 5 hours. They disrespect the time of people because they have no competition in some major cities. I would never recommend American Airlines. I would never book them anymore, I would rather book a connecting flight to avoid them.

Name: Caroleena Corrie
Review: Not Verified |  Tampa to Maui via Phoenix. Over the past three years I’ve noticed a massive downgrade in American airline aircraft. As a result of me working in Maui my days of travel always involve long flights. Since of lately American Airlines has repeatedly shown poor customer service as well outdated aircrafts taking away from the customer experience. This is my sixth flight in a row either coming into or departing from Maui that my 7+ hour flight lacks charging stations or entertaining screens. Due it’s lack of amenities, customer care and high prices, has caused me to reconsider my loyalty to this airline. For such expensive and long flights to Hawaii you would think that American would offer its newest aircrafts not oldest.

Name: K Gillon
Review: Not Verified |  Amarillo to Destin. Seriously the worst airline ever. This is one of many awful experiences with them and it keeps getting worse. After making me more that 6 hours late (which i can understand for weather), they fail to get my luggage on the airplane. Between all of the delays they had plenty of time to switch my luggage so I do not understand why my stuff is missing. Minus a select few, most of the service is terrible.

Name: Ashley Johnson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Port au Prince to San Francisco via Miami. Due to civil unrest in Haiti we cannot enter the country from Santo Domingo without purchasing a $500 ticket to the states. American Airlines wants us to enter Haiti during the chaos to catch our flight back home anyway or charge us $200 each to change our origin city. We've explained several times we can't even get there. No buses nor planes are leaving Santo Domingo straight to Haiti. They didn't care. Even in such a dangerous situation they want to earn as much as they can. Forfeit our safety I guess. It seems extremely cold hearted seeing they've raised the travel warning to level 4 just 2 days ago.
route: Port au Prince to San Francisco via Miami

Name: Jaz King
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Washington to Miami . The gate attendant at Washington was extremely rude and unprofessional. After we waited 30 minutes on the late plane, the gate attendant rushed us all on the plane and stopped me to insist that I must check my bags on an empty flight. I had 1 suitcase, 1 duffel bag, 1 small fannie pack on my waist and a black plastic food bag that I purchased at the airport. The attendant’s 1st option with handling me was to call security, no compassion or customer service or people skills. She wouldn’t explain to me the policy or other alternatives. My flight experience was ruined. I felt alone and depleted. The other gate attendant that came minutes later in full uniform couldn’t believe the way the 1st gate attendant was treating me.  special shout-out to Miami American Airlines baggage claim staff. They were the total opposite as they listened to my situation and handled the issue effortlessly with great customer service! They turned my day all the way around. They should train the DCA staff!

Name: Valerie Wolfe
Review: Not Verified |  This should actually be a zero star review. We (a family of four) was suppose to leave Newport News, VA on a Tuesday going to Honolulu, HI. Our flight got delayed until Wednesday due to computer issues at the Charlotte airport. I was okay with that since we heard there were issues there for the previous days. What happened next is beyond irritating. On Wednesday we boarded the plane in Newport News and was later deplaned due to a brake issue. They rescheduled our flights for the next day and changed our location to an airport 45 minutes away (Norfolk, VA). On Thursday, they canceled our flight again stating that there was no crew to fly the plane out of Norfolk. So in the end we got to Hawaii on Friday, three days later, a shortened vacation and the worst part, we missed my niece’s wedding! What do you think they did to compensate us? Keep in mind between my husband and myself we sent American five emails regarding this situation. Their solution, give us 15,000 miles! Really, who would want to fly with them after this. Who cares about the miles at this point! We missed the wedding and days of our vacation!

Name: R Cawlie
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to new York JFK. Boarded the plane and pulled away from gate only to find out twenty minutes in that we needed air pressure and a boost and we waited 3 hours with no air in 100 degree weather in Miami just for mechanics to come fix the problem that they said was no big deal. Then we had to wait about an extra hour for a push car to come push the plane and only the crew shows up without the starter car! Had to wait another half hour for them to find the car . And all this we were only told 2.5 hours in that we may leave the plane but the kicker is they were not giving back luggage and were putting whoever wanted to leave on standby to wait whenever they decide to give you another flight. They said it could be tonight tomorrow or next week. How convenient. Who is going to go anywhere without their luggage? Basically didn’t make sense for anyone to leave so we had no choice. On top of all that the flight attendants were the laziest I ever met. I am 6 months pregnant with an 8 month old baby. We were both sweating and overheated. My baby couldn’t even eat it was so hot for her and I asked one for water about an hour in and she pointed to her metal cabinet draws where the water is. Was I supposed to get it myself ? Who knows. I had to start crying to finally get water. Then they said that maybe they should start giving out some water. Maybe? Is that a joke. People are dehydrating. When my husband asked one for iced water she just stared at him with a blank face she only got it once he yelled and then she got mad he yelled ! They only started giving out water about two hours in and had to ration it because they ran out. People had connecting flights in JFK that they missed and you would think they gate manager would help them reschedule or provide them with a compensation but no. Our only compensation was a movie and 1 pack of cookies. I could go on and on. So unprofessional so lazy so incompetent. They should be out of business and should be ashamed of themselves

Name: A Garrett
Review: Not Verified |  Denver to Dallas Ft Worth. The worst experience of my life. The staff is rude , there is no desire to ensure that you get home quickly, and they nickel and dime you more than Spirit. I was on a standby flight which I still paid 100 bucks for and because I was D3, literally anyone who is D1 or D2 can cut in front of you at any time. I got to the airport for a 5am flight at 2:30am, and was bumped off the next 7 flights. I had to take a vacation day from work because I couldn’t get back in time. There was no communication and they couldn’t ensure that I get back because “that’s just the standby game.” Well, if I am still a paying customer, and if I’ve been sitting here for 14 hours then I should be treated as such. After the 5th missed flight, I finally folded and bought a ticket myself ($65) so I could get home. Since I bought this ticket the morning of, I was on boarding group 9. This means that you’re only allowed one personal item which was never conveyed to me. Even though my bag was carry-on size, I had to pay $50 for them to check my bag as I was boarding because I was in group 9 and that’s not allowed apparently, and they were out of room in the overhead storage bins since THEY oversold the flight. None of which, by the way was my fault.  Use another airline.

Name: Hina Patel
Review: Not Verified |  Mexico to Boston via Phoenix. The worst flight ever. They separated all of us on the flight including my kids. On our return flight we had a connection in Phoenix to go to Boston but we had to go through customs and collect our bags because we came from Mexico. The baggage belt broke and delayed us getting our bags. My husband stayed behind to get the bags and ran to the gate. I told the flight attendants and they shut the door in his face. The flight was for 3:30 and they shut the door at 3:25. 6 people missed their flights that day. Awful service and bad attitudes.

Name: R Fernandes
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Flew American Airlines from San Jose to Phoenix. Flight was delayed 7 hours and all I got was a $12 dinner voucher, enough for a snack, not a dinner. On the other flight the pilots were over 30 mins late.

Name: D Hamour
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Hong Kong. Seated in Main Cabin Extra. Plenty of leg room to endure the 15 hour + journey in both directions. Only 2 options for dinner (cod and pork). Former was surprisingly flavorful and tasty. Mid flight snack was stromboli and salted caramel gelato. Breakfast eggs/hash browns. Typical airline food. Nothing out of the extra-ordinary. Service was nothing more than necessary. Flight attendants appear to be more concerned about getting service over with. Entertainment choices were plentiful. I have flown long haul with Emirates and American Airlines' service pales compared to the former.

Name: D Baker
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | The ticket was issued by American Airlines and one leg was flown by Alaska Airlines. American does not provide a boarding pass to the Alaska Airlines flight. Moreover, when I called them and also when checking in, American Airlines indicated that I will get the boarding pass at the gate. Wrong! I discovered that after I missed my connecting flight because I had to go to the ticketing area of Alaska Airlines to get the boarding pass and not at the gate as I was told by 3 American Airlines representatives! American Airlines will issue a ticket flying with Alaska Airlines but they fail to inform you that they are completely separate flights and for checking in luggage I also had to pay Alaska Airlines. American Airlines promised to refund the $25 but they denied my claim, stating that I should read the small print on their website and not believe the words of the American airlines representative and supervisor!

Name: G Lander
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Burlington to Omaha via Philadelphia. Multiple mechanical delays are way too frequent! Delayed now by 2 hours. No plan announced as yet. Ridiculous. We boarded and sat on tarmac for an hour. Then back to gate. Now in terminal again. Get your act together! I don’t believe we are getting our money’s worth at all.

Name: J Little
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Diego to Dallas. So disappointed with this airline. There was a 5 hour delay, with no announcement no email no nothing. They just have us sitting out here blinking. Flight was supposed to be super early morning and yet we are still here hours and hours later. We had to Google the flight ourselves to find out why we were not leaving as scheduled. No one said anything. Customer service phone number was not helpful either. Very frustrated and disappointed with the lack of communication, not to mention how those screws up my work plans for tomorrow!!

Name: Maria Riveron
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Miami. In the last 2 years more and more frequently the service is getting worse. Today we are waiting on board more than hours for catering. Wait more than a 1 day and American airlines canceled the trip. We almost lost the trip to Aruba. Preview I traveled to Cuba and they offered a Voucher for 2000 whoever is canceling the trip The service is getting worse and worse No respectful at all.

Name: Erika Mendez
Review: Not Verified |  Flew American Airlines from Dallas to San Diego. Got a 2hr delay and on top of that had us in the heat. They turned the AC on for about 15 min then turned it down. They were fixing a brake on a wing, shouldn’t they be checking this prior to departure. Horrible service.

Name: Vino Devendra
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I had a connecting flight from Los Angeles to Portland  after arriving from Fiji. My plane time was changed from 2:35pm to 9:30pm. When I asked at the counter, I was told that the travel agent should have informed me. I know it was a lie because this is the second time they used the same excuse. Travel agent was not aware of it at all. Am making sure that I am never traveling with American Airlines again.

Name: Thomas Mele
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | La Guardia to Miami. July 3 last flight out to Miami, boarded 20 minutes late due to late incoming aircraft. C6 gates have completely insufficient area to board even a 737, passengers blocking the egress of passengers even after reminded several times by the gate agent to clear a path for them. Things got better from there. The new 737MAX has great overhead bins and lighting, the First Class seat was honestly not as comfortable as the previous 737-8's were, particularly in full recline. You feel like you need a big pillow in the small of your back to give some lumbar support. Pitch was fine. The FA were gracious and smiling, and always checking on the customers. They were really great. PDB was offered to all 16 F passengers. Meal service was excellent, served polite and efficiently. I got beef with quinoa and asparagus, the beef was tender and red in the middle. Salad and choice of roll and warm cookie too! My travel partner opted for the pre-ordered the Asian vegetarian which was Indian inspired and truly delicious, spicy but not overly so. Service on American is excellent, FA's made sure our drinks were filled. Arrived 20 minutes early despite the delayed boarding. I wish AA would do something about those new seats in First

Review_Heading: "put my 11 yr old between two strangers"
Name: Connie Knight
Review: Not Verified |  Will never fly American Airlines again. After our vacation was cut short for two days because American Airlines cancelled our trip to Hawaii two hours before our flight was to take off. Which was 2am. Was told when I called to reschedule that most people cancel. Not when you have kids who have been waiting for year to go you don't. Then when getting a flight out the next day we were not assigned seats had to go to the counter at every stop to make sure we had seats. One flight they put my 11 yr old between two strangers. There was no food available when flying from Philadelphia to LA. Had a 7hr lay over in LA. No food available from LA to HI either. They will only compensate us with 200.00 vouchers that expires in a year. Oh also out 800.00 for hotel expenses due to arriving two days late. Will never fly American Airlines again.

Name: Chelsea Garcia
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  The worst airline I’ve ever been on. My flight was delayed three times on the way there, and twice on the way back. When we finally got onto the plane, we sat there for an entire hour until we started flying. On top of all of that, they lost my luggage. Complete trash.

Name: M Calder
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Denver to Gatwick via Orlando. Worst experience, will not do it again. I was flying unaccompanied with a toddler on this trip. I intentionally booked flights that had a couple layovers thinking it would give the baby the opportunity to get out and about to do something else on a long journey. These layovers is where all the trouble started. Flew from Denver to North Carolina and made the connection without a hitch. Then from North Carolina to Orlando before heading to London. My flight coming into Orlando arrived late. By the time I was able to de-board the plane my connection was boarding in another terminal, completely on the other side of the airport where I had to leave and re-enter security to get there. Since I was carrying a 30+ lb. Toddler and a 15+ lb carseat I tried to ask for help to get where I needed to go quickly. The gate agents response (at every stop) was it's faster just to do it yourself.  So nowI sprint across all of the Orlando airport get to security only to find the boarding passes they sent me for my British Airways connection don't work. Security tells me I have to go to the ticket counter to get new passes .my flight is boarding as we speak. I run to the ticket counter, loaded down with baby & her stuff to find no one at the counter. Talk to the American Airlines representative (flight is booked as american airlines, operated as british airways) to be informed they can't do anything they will have to see if there is someone around for British Airways. Find someone, get my boarding pass, make it through security get on the plane with 3 minutes to spare. Coming back was worse. Flight out of Florida was delayed 2 hours causing me to miss my connection. After flying 9 hours with a toddler, going through customs in and out of security and hauling around all the baby gear they wanted to put me on a connecting flight to get home the following moring! Finally found 1 gate agent who sympathized and managed to get me the last 2 seats on the last flight that night. However; when arriving for my connection in Dallas they changed the arrival gate to another terminal completely across the airport. Once again the connection was boarding, asked gate agents for help to get across the airport quickly and was told it was faster to do it myself. RAN with toddler and accessories across all of DFW. As a mother of 3, two who are now grown I remember gate agents and airport staff being much more helpful with families flying with young children. Apparently preboarding for parents flying with young children doesn't exist to this airline anymore. When I asked the rep almost laughed at me. It only makes sense so that parents can get kids settled and out of the way of other boarding passengers. Instead I got to stand in the isle, hold up traffic flow and apologize repeatedly to everyone around me while I tried to get the baby in. On the flight back from London to Florida (9 hours) the movies on my daughter TV didn't work and they couldn't do anything to fix it. I  could not get wifi to entertain her. The whole travel part of the trip was a complicated mess. On the other side my husband and older daughter where flying on another airline at the same time and arrived everywhere they where going early.

Name: Loay Osman
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Chicago to New York. After all the hassle with another airline flights being cancelled I managed to book myself on AA an flight from ORD to NWR. It was a ripoff but had no other alternative and paid 487 USD for a one way ticket. As if the drama of this particular night didn’t want to end, AA has added to the spice by delaying the 9.50pm until 11:50pm then till 12:30am. After we boarded the plane and ready to take off I saw the crew running around and suddenly they announced that this aircraft can’t fly tonight because it is scheduled for maintenance in the morning. Then we had to leave the plane and wait for a new aircraft. Finally there was a new plane came and we took off at 2:30am instead of 9:50pm the previous night. Finally landed in NYC at 5:30am totally exhausted and had to run for my important meeting at 8:30am. This was just a disaster. The plane was very old and dirty.

Name: Paul Spano
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew Bristol to Charlotte. As usual American Airlines did not disappoint, departed almost 2 1/2 hours late and got to sit on the tarmac for 45 minutes once we arrived in Charlotte. Congratulations American on being the world’s worst airline. I realize maintenance issues happen but if I pull my last four American flights I have had at least one leg disrupted with some sort of maintenance issue. Fix your planes.

Name: B Meares
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Cancun to Montreal via Philadelphia. Extremely bad experience. First, the flight from Philadelphia got delayed 15 minutes, to only get delayed another 30 later on. The flight attendants were extremely rude, actually only one of them, he was shouting commands at us while boarding the plane. The company does not provide inflight meals even though the number of hours ant time of the day would require so. This is by far the worst flight experience I had so far. Avoid this company!

Name: W Nelson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Rome to Detroit via Philadelphia. I’ve had my share of bad travel experiences and it’s often I compelled me to write nasty reviews, so it’s only fair that when I have a really great experience I write a fitting review as well. Classic situation- our flight from Rome to Philadelphia (AA 719) was delayed for about two hours, which caused us to miss our connecting flight (with Dreaded Delta) from Philadelphia to our home in Detroit . Very rarely does this pan out in the travelers favor. Great customer service isn’t born by perfection; not every flight is on time, and mistakes are made. Great customer service is all about making it right. Like all travelers in this situation, I just wanted to get home and that’s exactly what happened. American ended up booking us on a full flight about an hour after our original flight into Detroit, causing minimal inconvenience. Free of charge. Technically speaking I think AA had no obligation to do this and that Delta, if anyone, would have issued us new tickets (and no, we did not have insurance). Beyond that, I have to say that the staff of flight AA 719 was the most professional, pleasant and fun crew I have been around over probably a hundred flights. Both the staff on the flight and the representatives I spoke to on the phone (especially supervisor Leslie) were extremely helpful and understanding of our situation. They had rules and protocol and they broke them to help us — they treated us like individuals and not like numbers. That is the hallmark of a class organization. Generally speaking, when I select flights I’m looking more for price and timing. In the future I’m going to lean towards American Airlines. We could very easily have missed our flight, bought new tickets, hotel accommodations, a last second extra day off work, etc — that happens to people every day. I am genuinely appreciative of American Airlines effort to spare us.

Name: D Garela
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to San Francisco. Ridiculous! It’s 1 am and still at the airport in Miami! My flight to San Francisco was supposed to depart at 7:50 pm and the crew had us waiting for 2 hours in the plane while fixing Documents. The problem is that they didn’t keep us informed as to what was happening. Then we got sent to another aircraft because apparently the one we were originally didn’t pass the test when it should’ve been tested beforehand. While we are waiting on the second flight after 4 hours of waiting then the crew disappears and we have not pilot. I completely understand that incidents happen if it’s a weather condition, or even if there is something wrong with the aircraft. But, the fact that they staff kept lying to all passengers is not professional! My time is very valuable. Again very unprofessional from the company staff to not be transparent with the passengers.

Name: Maya Hoch
Review: Not Verified | Chicago to Jamaica via Charlotte. This airline is a joke. I'm not sure when they last took off on time. We flew from Chicago heading to Charlotte and after half an hour in the air the captain had to land back to Chicago due to a smell coming out of the AC. This caused connecting flights to be missed and took us more than 6 hours to catch a flight to Jamaica. On the way back, we had a 2 hour delay at Charlotte pushing the take off time to 1am without notifying customers that check points at CLT closes at 9:45pm. Yes, if your flight is late at night you have to check in before 9:45pm or otherwise you can't make it to the gate. We had to spend the night at a nearby hotel to catch the earliest flight which was also delayed after boarding due to maintenance. Worst experience ever.

Name: Christina Emseis
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Newark. Over 5 hour delay, poor communication, rude staff with apparently lack of information. Puppets we call them. Better equip and train your staff to communication and provide credible information to paying customers.

Name: Angie Uribe
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Houston. I find it extremely unprofessional for an airline company to not be able to explain why a flight was delayed three different times. When asked at the front desk to speak to a representative or manager, the employees of American airlines gave extremely rude, non-hospital answers. If a passenger books a flight for hundreds of dollars to a destination, they should have the right to know exactly why a flight was delayed without attitude from American Airlines crew. It is the responsibility of the airline to provide factual answers to the customer who is spending several hundreds of dollars. If I could give this airline a -10 I would.

Name: G Bensen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Palm Springs to New York via Dallas, and was traveling first class with an emotional support 16 lb Cairn Terrier. I was asked to renew the AA form signed by my doctor 48 hours before the flight. I had been doing this for the last 4 years. I sent the completed form 3 days before the flight I got an email back saying they needed the date the therapist was licensed not the date it expired and the name of her business. I emailed back that she was in private practice and gave the date she was licensed. The day of my flight, I checked in for my flight and was asked for a copy of the service animal form, which I presented and was issued boarding passes, with a stopover in Dallas. When I got to Dallas and boarding the flight to NY with my dog, I was pulled aside and told I couldn't board the flight. Now I had my boarding pass, my suit cases were on the plane, and my little dog was in tow. I said "What, you've got to be kidding?". This very rude employee brusque told me he wanted to my paperwork, which I gave to him. He told me I couldn't board the flight because I needed a letter from my doctor with her letterhead and I didn't have it. I told him I was never asked for that, just the AA form. He said the only way I could board the flight was to pay $250. I said I would if this would help expedite and we could sort it out later. Then he told me then I would need a dog carrier to board the plane, which I didn't have as this wasn't required for emotional support animals. I told him this was not right, I had followed the online requirements and showed him my AA form and my emails with the SAC (Special Assistance Coordinator). I asked him to call his supervisor, which he did. All of this took about 30 minutes. Now the plane was fully boarded and he was not going to let me on this flight. Seconds before the flight left, finally his supervisor agreed I could get on the plane. The doors were now locked to the hallway and he couldn't open them, he was having a meltdown, until another employee who had the gate opener helped him out. I was literally overwhelmed and terrorized (create and maintain a state of extreme fear and distress in (someone); fill with terror.) The so called first class flight was horrendous, with a loud stewardess gossiping for 3hrs, we all heard every word and she couldn't even bring water. I had order a breakfast, got some crumby granola!
route: Palm Springs to New York via Dallas

Name: Beth Taylor
Review: Not Verified |  Dallas to Maui. The service in first class going over to Maui Hawaii was very good on June 15, 2018. However, the service coming back to DFW on June 23,2018 was very bad. I would say the people sitting coach had better service. I had a staff member that must hate her job because they acted as if it was a bother to answer any questions. The meal was very under par, I was served a vegetable dish that consisted of a plate of rice and 2 peas and 2 cubes of sweet potatoes. I will be rethinking my next flight with this airline again

Name: Iheb Namsi
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  On my way back home from Lima, the service was very bad. From Lima to Miami, their on board meal only included an omelet or a ham and cheese sandwich. We all ordered the omelet (a family of 5 people) since no one of us eats pork meat; however after the second bite I discovered that it has bacon in it. The flight attendants never mentioned that. I asked if they have any other options they denied with an attitude (I felt like they are doing me a favor even though I paid over $3000 for the trip). From Miami to Norfolk, I ordered a beer. The flight attendant served everybody but me. When I asked her again she pointed to my wife who she gave 2 beers and she said “there she got yours..” even though my wife ordered just for her. Later, I asked for another beer. The flight attendant claimed that they are out even though she listed many beer brands options to a guy was sitting right in front of me and she never served anymore after him (I knew this because the airplane was super small and the kitchen was right behind me). So technically the flight attendant never served me a thing for the whole time I was on board… (Very rude and unprofessional). Next time, I will make sure to fly with a different airline than this American Airlines. I believe that deserve some service with the money I pay.

Name: T Pearson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Worst staff ever! First off flying to a funeral, first flight landed 40 minutes late. Had to get 33 gates in 20 minutes, made it in 8 minutes just time to see our planes door closing. Total useless employee named made no attempt to get me on the plane. Informed me doors close 10 minutes prior to flight even when their airline was responsible. Instead made a disabled veteran go back 25 gates to customer service, who then booked my new flight 2 hours later 15 gates away. They could care less that I was disabled, going to a funeral, actually on time for the flight, anything. Everyone I dealt with was lazy and incompetent, that the best way I can describe them. First time and last time flying this pathetic excuse.

Name: Branden Fessler
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Santa Ana to Phoenix. Poor communication. Changed the gate without an announcement. Then the flight was delayed to wait for a flight attendant to get to work. At least keep us informed, up to date, and not sitting in a plane for too long. We were clearly seen with dollar signs above our heads, and taken for granted. Just poor communication all around. As the very base level of customer service is communication. If you can’t handle that properly, the rest is diminished and meaningless.

Name: Steven Miller
Review: Not Verified | Hands down this is the worst airline I have delt with. The staff was the rudest and most unprofessional. Our flight was from Phoenix to Fresno was cancelled, when we asked about our options the staff was rude and said we be put on stand by for the next flight which was later that night. We had children at home and our sitter was leaving the next day so we had to get home, so being put on stand by with 100 other people was not an option for us. So we rented a car and drove for 9 hours. When we emailed the airline (there is no phone number to call according to the staff) they said we "elected" to take a car and they would not reimburse us. The refund for the ticket didn't even cover the cost of the car (because it was from a different state). We tried calling the reservation hot line and the women we talked to stay we wasted their time by calling. She actually said we wasted her time. Please do not fly with them. They are rude and unprofessional and you might not even get where you need to.

Name: Kelli Duchesne
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I have flown with American Airlines many times before and have never received such horrible customer service. My flight from Chicago O'Hare Airport to Wilmington, NC was delayed four times (which is not the problem). The flight was eventually cancelled, I have never had to deal with a cancelled flight before but I know it happens, so the staff should know how to handle these situations. I couldn't be more wrong. After standing in the customer service line for 40 minutes, I was handed a piece of paper with an 800 number on it, to then sit on hold for another hour, only to be told I would be issued a refund, or I could wait until the next day for a flight to my destination. I was traveling alone with my 7 Month old baby, and had only her diaper bag of limited supplies. The staff was absolutely useless, and very rude. One staff member rolled her eyes at me, and another man said to me, "I can't control the airline, it's really not my problem." I have never received such horrible customer service and this is absolutely unacceptable. I had to come up with different options for the staff to work with me, essentially doing their job. I ended up having to go through United Airlines to get to my destination, and their staff was very helpful. My family travels often, my husband is in the USMC, he and sometimes our whole family have to travel all over the US.

Name: Brooke Lowry
Review: Not Verified |  Arrived at curbside check in at 5:30 am for a 6:43 departure (Tampa to Greensboro, via Charlotte. Then later that afternoon I was scheduled to leave Greensboro on a direct flight to Philadelphia and returning to Tampa the following day). Stand at curbside for ten minutes or so waiting for “computer problems” to be resolved so I can check my one bag. Finally gave up and went inside. Stood in that line for I guess another fifteen minutes or so because by the time it was my turn I was one minute ... yes, one minute inside the 45 minute cutoff to check a bag.
