Boy was that about the biggest mistake ever. So the actual flying experience wasn’t bad at all. The problem came when my arriving flight into Charlotte, NC to catch a connection was delayed to the gate due to weather. Which was fine, we can’t control the weather. The delay also delayed my connecting flight to Fort Walton Beach. So I was still able to catch my connection. That’s fantastic.  Absolutely it was. So I ask the boarding agent if there was a chance that my checked bag wouldn’t get transferred in time to the connecting flight. She said that it’s very possible that it won’t make it in time. So I said that’s ok I’ll work around picking up my bag the next day. And the next day (today) is where the problem started. I show up at 6am and there’s no one at the baggage claim office, no customer service representative to be found. I talked to the ladies at the ticket counter twice and they told me someone be down to help. So I’m there 3 hours before someone opens the door and it takes 2 minutes to get my bag. Why did it take 3 hours? The monitors show when they have flights departing and arriving. There was plenty of time between to accommodate the 2 minutes it took me to get my bag. My biggest complaint is with customer service. Everything else was as good as it could be.

Name: Kyla Kendrick
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Newark to New Orleans via Charlotte / Chicago. American Airlines is the worst airline I've ever flown. My 5:00 a.m. flight to Charlotte was delayed a little over an hour, because the AC was broken, after we were told it would take 10-15 min to fix. We then missed our connecting flight from Charlotte to New Orleans and the next one was almost 4 hours later. We had paid extra to have seats next to each other and in preferred seating and when we got off the plane and had to get new boarding passes we were basically told too bad nothing they can do about it. When we arrived to New Orleans everything in my bag was damp and all my clothes had to be put in the dryer. But i had nothing in my bag that could've leaked. On the way back, we had a layover in Chicago of an hour until our connecting flight to Newark. 40 minutes before our flight we found out we're delayed an hour and a half. Im sure 500 other things will go wrong before we even get back to Jersey. First and last time I fly American Airlines.
route: Newark to New Orleans via Charlotte / Chicago

Name: Jenny Marie
Review: ❌ Not Verified |  New York to Wichita. After flying once before with American and not having the best experience I decided to give them another shot. On the way here the service was great, 0 delays. Granted that was Memorial Day. Flying home this morning was a pain in the ass. It started arriving to LaGuardia airport this morning with staff who seemed to not be knowledgeable of what they were doing and told me all other flights were booked (not true). My flight was supposed to leave at 1030am from LaGuardia, which turned into 1130am then to 12.50pm mind you I had been sitting st the airport since 8.30am. The only flights left to my final destination was a 10.30pm flight out of DFW meaning I would sit in DFW for 6-7 hours or more depending on delays. Turning a 6 hour travel day into a 17 hour flight day. Additionally I would have missed that flight if I would have not gotten up to go to the restroom and so happen to look at the monitor to see that the gate had changed. No communication what so ever about the gate change. We did not depart to almost 1:15pm - mind you they gave us 0 information about the whereabouts or why our flight was delayed for nearly 2 hours. Finally we made it to Dallas 3.5 hours later. At this point I was tired and irritable. Thank you to the kind woman at DFW working for AA, who got me on a flight sooner than 1030pm, she was patient, kind and emphatic. She made sure I still had my first class seat and all. She turned a very long day into a better one. But after having a experience like this in the past, AA will no longer receive my service nor would I recommend them to anyone.

Name: Calley Wipf
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Sioux Falls to Chicago. Our flight was suppose to leave at 6 this morning and we won’t be heading out till 5pm tonight. This is very irritating because we spend a lot of money on our tickets to leave at a certain and were not even leaving anywhere in range to the original time. We received a $24 vouchers for two people for an 11 hour delay. I think that, that is pretty pathetic. We have places to see and things to do and this is a huge waste of my time. I will make sure to tell everyone not to use this airline.

Name: Cynthia Eubank
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Cleveland. Gate got changed three times at the airport and the staff were very rude to everyone. Then once we board are already delayed flight, we sit on the plane for 30 minutes and still counting for a pilot. No one said anything to us until now. So, we still don’t know when we are going to start off. The smaller seats on this very crowded flight makes it all more fun to sit on a plane forever. Here’s hoping we actually get to move soon. Horrible airline! Not flying them again!

Name: L Savanni
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Denver to Chicago, connecting to Helsinki with Finnair from Chicago. If you can, I would recommend not flying with them. There was a delay to our flight and 30 people were supposed to go on a connecting flight to Finland and they didn't hold the flight, then they promised to rebook everyones flights, and now they're saying all flights are booked until another 24+ hours and are not offering paid hotel vouchers or anything. Horrible customer service. very dissapointed.

Name: Jenny Urbanski
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Worst experience ever! Going to see my son who is in the Air Force. Flight was delayed overnight. I had the worst help with assistance on changing my flight plans. I was not put up in a hotel, therefore had to pay for two separate hotel rooms as they are non-refundable. Had to change my car rental plans and pay a premium. I was not assisted by a single employee during this situation! I will never fly American Airlines again.
route: Detroit to Dallas Ft Worth via Wichita Falls Texas

Name: Dennis Talley
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Phoenix to Roanoke via Charlotte. Avoid the AA local flights out of Charlotte at all costs. Employees are rude and lazy. I will avoid American airlines in the future and cut up the AA credit card. Our money spends the same anywhere and don't need to be treated like these self entitled individuals are actually owed something. If you don't like your job then go somewhere else.

Name: D Hochstetter
Review: ❌ Not Verified |  Chicago to Seattle. Our flight was scheduled for 8:10 pm on Wednesday night 5/30, originally but then was delayed 4 different times, 9:00, 10:00, 10:30, and finally was scheduled to depart 11:35 pm. Which I can live with and understand except that my girlfriend and I were sitting in the airport over 5 hours watching other planes takeoff. So we sat patiently for 5 hours and finally began boarding at 11:00 pm. American boarded the entire plane and was ready for take off, but then decided to cancel the flight at 11:47 which was after the rescheduled departure time. Then the earliest flight they could get me was in 24 hrs basically causing me to cancel my entire 3 day trip. Plus they didn't even give out hotel vouchers but instead offered cots to sleep on in the airport! I'm just really disappointed in the deception and lack of customer service/ courtesy. Airlines are allowed to do whatever they want and nothing is ever done about it, that's wrong. Treat customers better that's all we ask!

Name: JR Goodrich
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | The Walmart of airlines. Incredibly unremarkable. The International Premium Economy seats are rather nice. The staff seem to care, but it is the details that are desperately lacking, the food which borderlines on institutional, the staff that are nice, but lack passion and enthusiasm, and the paltry amenities that are likes of standard coach of its European rivals. The domestic leg of the journey was reminiscent of Aeroflot of the Soviet days: crammed seating, cabin staff that could not care and food for purchase that is very sub-standard. Come on American, you can do better!
route: Paris CDG to Palm Springs via Dallas Fort Worth

Name: Jessica Moyer
Review: ❌ Not Verified |  Extremely disappointed with my experience with American Airlines. In a two week span, I had over 6 flights through American Airlines and every single flight was delayed at least a half hour, one being delayed over an hour and a half due to the pilot being stuck in traffic. Two of my flights were cancelled as well. My flight from Charlotte to Minneapolis was delayed an hour and then boarded for an hour and a half before finally being cancelled. I was put on a flight for 8pm the next day, 24 hours later than my original flight. I was not offered a hotel and was only given a voucher for $12 for a 24 hour delay. Staff in a Chicago was rude and not helpful during my standby flights in my attempt to get to Minneapolis earlier.

Name: M Winston
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Punta Cana to Seattle via Miami. Overall the customer service is pretty good with American Airlines. Everyone was friendly to us. My frustration lies with a delay on the ground. It was only announced that the flight would be delayed once we landed because we didn't have a gate, and customs was backed up. We sat waiting for over an hour, returning from an international flight, we still had customs, and another round of security to go through before reaching our connecting flight. We ended up missing our connection, we were rerouted back to the entrance without being told where we were going, when we still had 15min to catch our plane, had they called and had it wait for us, we could have caught it. Instead we were forced to rebook another flight. Communication wasn't great at this point. We thought we were getting rebooked for another route that would get us home only an hour after our original flight, and one flight, as we had originally booked. But we were handed two tickets (rather than the one) on a flight that didn't depart till the next day. They claimed that they don't comp hotels if it's due to weather, the reason for the delay, but no one ever said that we were delayed due to weather. She said I couldn't talk to a manager and wouldn't make eye contact with me after I complained. I would now arrive home a day later, and have to pay $150 more than I originally planned to pay for a cab and hotel. The lady who helped us the next morning was really friendly and didn't charge us to check our bags even though we didn't have receipts for the original payment. She also adjusted our seats so we could sit together. Overall service on the plane was good. Maybe when booking connecting international flights the airlines should require a minimum time in between to eliminate the stress of connecting flights in between. This is not the first time I've had to run from the plane, through customs, and security to catch my connecting flight.
route: Punta Cana to Seattle via Miami

Name: S Morton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  St. George to Atlanta via Phoenix. Booked a first class fare and paid a lot of money to get it. The online system would not allow me to choose a seat assignment. When I arrived, I spoke with the gate agent they gave me a coach seat. There were first class seats available and I had paid for a first class seat!  Once boarded there were first class seats available. The crew gave them to American Airlines staff. They made the announcement once everyone was boarded - it was unbelievable! I raised my concern many times. Nobody seemed to care. Hopefully they’ll refund the fare.
route: St. George to Atlanta via Phoenix

Name: Katelin Stafford
Review: ❌ Not Verified |  Flight 5749 from Amarillo to Dallas would have been nice, except for the horrible service from a flight attendant. When we boarded there was an entire row of seats open and my significant other and I asked if we could move and sit together. The flight attendant said that we could not because the door had already been closed. Then less than a minute later she allowed a couple that had already been seated together to move to the row. There was still an entire row available. Extremely disappointed with the lack of professionalism and lack of consistency shown by the flight attendant and this staff. Will be choosing other airlines in the future if this is the type of service that American Airlines considers acceptable!

Name: H Christie
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to Chicago. I'm writing this in hopes someone that gets paid too much at American Airlines finally makes some changes to improve how they operate. I was the typical customer making a connection that was predetermined by the airline. Using decades of history and algorithms to maximize efficiency for the company and yet getting customer where they need to be you would think this would not be an issue anymore. We got off one plane and literally ran across the airport getting to our terminal 10 minutes before it was scheduled to leave at which they told us "we knew you were checked in and coming but we can't let you in 10 minutes before flight". At that time we gave them a confused look as it was 10 minutes before the flight. So you see where I am going with this and why I will never fly with them again but the story gets better from there. We go down to customer service as instructed by the gate attendant to see if we can get on the next flight that is 3 hours delay which sounds good at first but not when you have family waiting for you that drove over 4 hours to pick you up. We had asked if they could do anything from free tickets to a cup of coffee of which they denied saying this happens all the time and it is not our fault. And now for the icing on the cake, they were not sure where our luggage was and after 5 minutes they said it made it on to our original flight. Crazy how that works out right? Now after if spins around the turn style for 45 minutes and hopefully nobody takes it they said it will be picked up and then placed in an office for us to pick up. Long story short, we fly often enough that I am 100% confident saying that American Airlines has some major room to improve so please use another even if you pay a few $ more.

Name: C Murrell
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Rochester to Boston. This is the third time in a row I have flown with American Airlines and they delayed the departure time by more than 2 hours, not because of the weather but because of “mechanical issues”. Last time it was delayed a total of 5 hours. It is extremely frustrating to be stranded in an airport for such an excessive amount of time because the airline repeatedly has issues with their planes. I realize there are situations that cannot avoided, but for such a lucrative airline I would expect they could afford to have modern planes that don’t require maintenance an hour before departure time. I kept thinking these were random situations that don’t happen too often, but it seems to be American Airlines norm.

Name: P Barchas
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Washington to Miami. The plane was very old considering its daily usage (18 years) and not very comfortable. The space for legs was below average and I was quite happy we flew for only 2 hours or so. The flight was delayed because of the weather (which is acceptable) but the provided information was poor and misleading. We had to sit for over 1,5 hour onboard waiting for departure and the only information provided was false, then no further info came along. The flight was bumpy and while landing we had to go-around for a second attempt. The staff was OK, no IFE was present and the service contained standard free non-alcoholic beverage and pretzels only.

Name: P Barchas
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to San Francisco. The plane was quite a new one, looked okay to me. The seat size in economy was quite alright for this type of plane. I suppose it is quite a failure if the only free service onboard was non-alcoholic beverages and a mini-bag of pretzels. No meal is provided for a 6-hour flight and the purchase options are very poor and not clear (it differs based on time and route). The in-flight entertainment on the contrary was a surprise - it worked well and the movie selection was quite wide. What I really don't understand is the seating allocation policy of the airline - we used it twice, always used the recommended kiosk self-check in option and in both cases we got a boarding pass with no assigned seats along with a note "please see agent at the gate", which we did and we got the boarding pass from him. I don't see the point of this weird policy and I don't like it.

Name: Jackeline Voigt
Review: ❌ Not Verified |  I was very dissatisfied with American Airlines during my last trip. My flight from Colorado Springs to Shreveport was weather delayed in Colorado Springs. I understand that these things happen. But when arriving in Dallas to switch connections to go to Shreveport, I rushed to my gate and found that my plane was still at the gate. But they would not allow me to board. The flight departed earlier than scheduled with me watching it leave the gate without me. I was very disappointed that American did not notify the gate that a passenger was a few minutes late due to their late arrival of a connecting flight. It is not like it was an hour or more, it was 10 minutes at most. Other airlines that I have flown have notified other gates of this happening, especially if it is weather related. I am a frequent flier on many airlines, and it has been done for me before. Due to this, I was under a lot of stress. My main reason for going to Shreveport was to meet my daughter and get her back home to Florida. I went to flight services in Dallas, and they were not any help at all. No monetary help or voucher for a hotel overnight either. They attempted to help me with getting my checked bag that arrived with me in Dallas, but the employee from my arriving gate had already gone home because it was after 9. Because of this, my bag left the next morning to go to Shreveport, even though I was going to be leaving from Dallas later in the day to go back to Florida with my daughter, who was arriving from Shreveport. To make things worse, I had to wait 6 days to get my suitcase returned to me in Florida. After checking with American baggage services, I found out that it stayed in Shreveport for 5 days sitting there. My bag had important business materials inside. Needless to say, unless it is a last resort, I will not be flying American Airlines again. They would not even offer me restitution or a baggage refund for my inconvenience unless I showed receipts of $150.00 or more.
route: Colorado Springs to Shreveport via Dallas

Name: L Stanton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Charleston to Bradley via Philadelphia. Absolute worst experience - flights delayed, missed connection, re-routed, flight delayed 3 more times due to a late crew, then boarded and told after that the pilot was then too tired for the 40 minute flight. We were promised hotel vouchers, food vouchers, etc as we were left in a airport at 10 pm with no where to go and no access to transportation or food given the time of night. The AA reps said to save all food and hotel receipts for reimbursement, in which AA is refusing to cover now. Instead, they offered a $200 voucher to fly in the next year which I refuse to do given my experience, and $120 towards the $340 hotel that was the only option left. They also refused to reimburse for meals and are refusing to escalate the matter as their Executives do not take part of these matters. Way to treat your customers American Airlines! Should have read all the negative reviews before I paid $600 for this flight that left me stranded for an extra 2 days in Philadelphia.

Name: R Tasima
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Washington to Los Angeles via Dallas. The staff at the boarding time was very rude and unfriendly. The lady at the gate was very rude to me and my family, we were in Group 9,the lady kept on telling us that don’t you know what Group 9 means and acted not at all polite with me and my family. I understand that there are rules but there is better way of talking to customers and informing them the rules. This was my first time with American Airlines and my start of the trip was very disappointing. A staff cannot be so rude to my family just because we had more than one bag, and the extra bag was a purse and not a bag.
route: Washington to Los Angeles via Dallas

Name: Alex Molina
Review: ❌ Not Verified |  Puerto Vallarta to Tucson. We flew to Puerto Vallarta for our 15th anniversary. The flight there was great. We were saddened to return home from such a beautiful place filled with very nice people. We arrived at the airport early, at 10:00am. When we were trying to process our boarding passes, the woman working at the counter was extremely rude for some reason. Her and her colleague were rolling their eyes and seemed to be annoyed that I was speaking English with my American wife. They made derogatory comments towards my wife being American. She became irate when I was explaining to her that I was a Permanent U.S Resident. I speak fluent Spanish and she ignored me and said she had to call immigration in Phoenix? She left and returned to process my wife's pass. I asked her if I could explain to whomever she was trying to contact my status. I told her that I obviously boarded a plane to get here, and that I needed to get home. I was polite the entire time and she was rude to my wife for no reason. She then said. I can't let you board. No explanation what so ever. My heart sank. I maintain composure and asked her to let me talk to her imaginary friend who she supposedly called at Customs. She just smiled and said Sorry. I asked her to have my Wife board and then I would need a flight rearranged to my native Sonora so I could contact someone at the Consulate. She faked smiled again and said sorry, we can't do anything. She then said I would have to purchase another ticket. I promptly bought a ticket on AeroMexico and had no issues getting to Hermosillo, except for the fact that my Wife flew alone, She had to explain to my two kids that I was in Mexico because some AA rep at the desk was discriminating me because I am Mexican and live in the US, Not to mention I had to fly to Mexico City, get delayed to thunderstorms there 2 hours, finally flew to Sonora at Midnight. I arrived in Hermosillo at 2 in the morning. Somehow I got to the Nogales border, thanks to a friend. Crossed the U.S Border at 7am with no issues. I had to be at work. I was exhausted and very frustrated. Honestly a terrible way to end our 15 year anniversary. Never flying AA ever again.

Name: Ray Sorin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New York to London. After reading many recent poor  reviews of American Airlines, we were concerned that we too might have a flight of horrors. However, our experience was the opposite of most of the recent reviews. The Flagship Lounge at JFK, while very busy, provided a good opportunity for a pre-flight meal. The flight, AA 100, to LHR left a few minutes behind schedule, but landed on time. The flight attendants offered reasonably friendly in-flight service throughout. There was more food and drink on offer during the flight than anyone could have wanted (dinner, snacks, more snacks, breakfast). The lie flat seat, with Casper bedding, while a tad firm for some most likely, provided the opportunity to get a short nights sleep. Fortunately, we never experienced even one of the horrors that so many reviewers have written about. We will fly back to JFK on Monday, in the Premium Economy cabin, and if the experience is any different, based of course on what is reasonably expected in that cabin, we will add a review.

Name: Marian Mekhail
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Manchester. The worst experience - flight delayed for more than 2 hours in May 2018, no snow, no natural conditions, and no compensation for the delay. This flight is not for you if u are planing to return back to work on time. International flights delay first - they try to delay 1:45 hours so as not to cross 2 hours then after they delay additional. No respect for customers timing

Name: B Parker
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Austin to Lisbon via Philadelphia. Avoid this airline unless you are a masochist. On the Philadelphia - Lisbon leg we experienced a 4 hr delay and two equipment changes. On the return, the DFW - AUS leg, a 90minute delay and a gate and equipment change. Not surprising really with the very very old planes being flown. Thet certainly show their age, rattling like a tin can at take off and landing. And how about a transatlantic flight these days with no inflight entertainment? Yep still the norm on AA flying the 767. And anyone who thought that the MD-80 was strictly a museum piece, well no, it's part of the AA fleet. No surprise the constant maintenance issues and consequent delays..

Name: T Pearce
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew American Airlines from Miami to London. Cabin was reasonable but service was very poor. One visit for both bar and meal. No response to in-seat steward request to collect tray meaning a walk to the end of the plane to get someone. Ground service was a bit harsh.

Name: Alyssa Kriner
Review: ❌ Not Verified |  Terrible. Absolutely terrible, both to and from Philadelphia and Phoenix. Boarded and got off the plane both times because of an issue, you think they would have resolved that before letting everyone get on. They let us sit forever blaming it on catering and other various issues. Don’t get me wrong I’m glad they didn’t fly with any detrimental issues to the aircraft but come on. Also both times, there was an error with calculating carry one baggage leaving no room for the last passengers to board and they did not complimentary check any. Will never fly with American Airlines again.

Review_Heading: "met with one rude person after the other"
Name: P Walker
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | First I'd like to start out saying that 20 years ago, I had the exact same result as I did this past weekend and swore I would never fly American Airlines again. I was returning to Houston from Salt Lake City, I had to go thru Dallas for a connecting flight. My flight in Salt Lake City was delayed due to weather issues originally. I knew I was going to miss my connecting flight in Dallas, once I heard of the delay and got up in line (a long one at that) to be told to call the 1-800 number to get done faster. When I spoke with customer service, they told me "I'll be fine as the plane is supposed to board at 4.08 pm" and I was like "Oh great, ok, I don't need anything else then". Not realizing the time when I hung up the phone, it was 4.12 pm and there was no plane at the gate. So, we (as in other passengers and myself) were getting updates saying we were boarding every 10 minutes. Come to find out, because of the weather, the plane that was trying to land was re-routed to Pocatello, ID because they needed to re-fuel. The plane finally landed around 6.15 pm, only to learn that our flight was now cancelled due to the fact that the flight crew had met their hours for the day and couldn't fly anymore. So, at that point we were all stranded, most other flights were full and I for sure was going to miss my connecting flight. Supposedly, because this was a weather issue, American Airlines would not put any of the passengers up in hotels, etc. However, it was no longer a weather issue as other planes were flying in and taking off just fine in Salt Lake City. This was clearly, American Airlines crew that couldn't fly anymore. So our flight was delayed until 7.00 am the next morning. So we return to the airport, did not receive any updates on our flight and hoping for the best I spoke with the gentleman at the gate and asked him to help me find a connecting flight to Houston. He told me, they were all full and to try once I get to Dallas to get on stand by. I finally make it to Dallas, I get off the plane and go directly to the ticket counter at the gate that I just walked out of. I explained that I needed a connecting flight to Houston. At first, the lady couldn't find me in the system (even though I just walked off the plane) and then once she did find me in the system, she said she had record of me landing the night before in Dallas. At this point, I was boiling mad, because clearly she just saw me walk off the plane. Then she said, there was a flight later in the evening that she could get me on. I explained it was my daughter's graduation party that evening and I needed to be home before 8.00 pm that night. So, she handed me a boarding pass and told me to go try and get on Stand by on another flight. Went to that gate only to find out there was a lot of other people standing by and probably would not make that flight and at that point I went and got a rental car so I can be home in time for my daughter's graduation party, that I was hosting. My biggest disappoint in the airline is that not one American Airlines employee even said "I'm sorry!" When you work in customer service and have an upset customer, you should always acknowledge that you understand the frustration and you are working hard to get us home or to resolve the issue. This never happened with American Airlines. I was met with one rude person after the other. It wasn't just me. There were other passengers that were just as upset and had to drive home too.
route: Salt Lake City to Houston via Dallas

Review_Heading: "didn't care what I had to ask"
Name: J Irving
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | The lady at the counter before entering the plane was rude and didn't care what I had to ask. I got my ticket printed by a lady and asked if I had to check my bag and she said no I would be fine and the plane would have room for a carry on. Well I go to get on the plane and they won't let me on without paying 50 dollars. Why didn't the lady who printed my ticket tell me? Why didn't they announce it for all of section 9 until right before the flight was boarding, when I would have had time to go back to the baggage claim and only have to pay 25 dollars instead of 50 now for a carry on size. No military discount for luggage either which is ridiculous. I will never fly American Airlines again with how rude they were.

Name: Joe Hardy
Review: ❌ Not Verified |  I need to praise the crew of Flight AA743 Barcelona to Philadelphia. The crew on this flight was great. they made each passenger feel really welcomed. The crew was nice, friendly, helpful, and kind. I can't say enough good thing about this crew. Wanted to say a great big thanks to this crew. Thank you so much.

Name: Tyler Church
Review: ❌ Not Verified |  I had a trip planned to Puerto Rico for my birthday. I Arrived at 5am to DCA To a weather delay (understandable) Couple hours passed and when we went to board the plane a new maintenance issue caused a 20 minute delay. For the next 5 hours they kept extending the maintenance delay every 30 minutes. There was almost no communication with each attendant telling different answers. The app was also extremely unhelpful. After waiting in airport for 12 hours, they finally cancelled the flight as never going to leave the terminal. I called customer service for a refund and they said that they might be able to reschedule. Another attendant the said that I should still cancel and get refund since the airline was backed up and going to be prone to more weather delays and maintenance issues. (Every person had different answers) I asked if I could just get a voucher to help make up for lost hotel, stress, etc. Two reps said yes but another said that they couldn’t. Long story short they cancelled my flight then left me out to dry with just the refund of my ticket and no additional vouchers. I am still out a large sum for the trip not including lost vacation days and stress. This was the worst customer experience of my life. I was a loyalty program member with an AA credit card and was Still treated this way by staff and the company even after filing a complaint. “...They told me (paraphrase) that it was not their obligation and that I should give them a second chance...” I was lied to and lost an entire vacation to their terrible maintenance and business practices and would urge no person to use AA as their preferred loyalty program. My friend who flew Spirit Airlines that same day made it to Puerto Rico for my birthday but I never did.
route: Washington to Puerto Rico via Philadelphia

Name: R Rayden
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Cancun. Horrible Airline! I always use Southwest because they’re great but this one was booked by my company. American will nickle and dime you for everything possible. I spent over 50 USD just to fly with 1 checked bag round trip. Next was the seat charge, any seat with a few extra inches of leg room will cost you a minimum of 34 extra each way! Once onboard is their in flight snacks, they start at 9 and increase significantly. On this particular trip they switched the gate and terminal 4 times within the span of 2 hours before the flight which made for some long walks. Surprisingly our flight arrived 30 min early but we had to wait the entire 30 minutes on the plane at the gate before we could deboard because they couldn’t find an employee to move the sky bridge into place! Then there is the fact that the WIFI didn’t work and the mid plane bathroom was inoperative. I would avoid this airline if possible. These are the very reasons I prefer Southwest and I fly monthly.

Name: B Lachlan
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I did not fly. They cancelled the flight just as I was going through security. The ticket agent could not book me on anything that would remotely get me to destination in time for obligations (they were offering 24 hours later). I asked if I could get my fare back if I drove the 450 miles. The agent said yes. My travelling companion heard this too. I asked twice. And now they refuse to refund my fare. They also lost my luggage for 36 hours, a suitcase that was never loaded onto a flight that never got to the gate. It was cracked and contents damaged when delivered and they said nothing until I reported it. Still waiting for reimbursement for ruined suitcase and contents. I'm giving them a 1 instead of 0 because some of the employees were trying to help.

Name: S Laban
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Jose to Boston. Horrible customer service! They keep delaying the flight every 30 minutes and do not provide a real picture! Stranded since 3 hours and still no clarity. I would recommend you take Spirit and save some money rather than taking this airline!

Name: M Morton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | My direct flight to Boston was cancelled this weekend, no explanation, no weather issues (all other airlines were flying out). The soonest they could get me on a flight was the next day with 2 (two) stops. I would miss my wedding so did not take it. My complaint is, when they cancelled the flight, only one employee was at the gate trying to reschedule everyone's flights. The American gate next to it, had 5 employees, talking, laughing, not doing anything. I went over to them and asked if they could help me. I had been in my line for 30 minutes and the employee had only gotten through 2 people! So you can imagine the anger of everyone in line! The 5 employees at the adjacent gate said they couldn't help and really didn't seem to care enough to walk over to our gate to help that 1 lone employee. I found that to be so incompetent for this or any airlines. Worst part for me was, my daughter was gong to the same wedding, also flew out from the same airport, same time, with JetBlue. And her ticket cost half as much as mine! So my daughter, poor thing, landed in Boston and spent the weekend by herself. No excuses. Never again American if I have another choice.

Name: M Corwell
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I fly a decent amount. This is my first time flying American Airlines and will probably be my last. I flew from SLC to Dallas and it was delayed many hours and caused me to miss my other connecting flight. I got over it. Now I’m flying back to Salt lake and it’s 2 weeks ago and of course, another delay! Kind of pathetic that literally both of my flights have been delayed. Not just one. Safe to say I will never be flying with American Airlines because they’re 2 for 2 for long delays. This has caused extreme problems and anxiety due to work meetings. What a joke. American Airlines is well known for their delays and I gave them a chance. They failed miserably. Fly any other airline than American.

Name: B Seares
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Phoenix to Charlotte. The worst customer service ever! When I checked in there was no line however I was acknowledged by, “where are you going?” No, good morning even after I said it. Then she proceeded to check me in smacking her lips and hugging as if I was being bothersome by checking in. Instead of asking, “May I see your ID.” She says do you even have an ID. A women she was not checking in with she began to argue with saying, “lady we can’t do anything, if you want something you’re just gonna have to wait until 3 am that all I have for you.” Not polite. Ruining the brand name.

Name: S Kolas
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Denver to Los Angeles. Good flight overall. Friendly staff. Soft landing. Tired of hearing about the credit card offer. Yes, we're a captive audience, please stop exploiting this.

Name: Semih Karlav
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I was booked to fly from Pittsburgh to Amsterdam via Philadelphia. Once landed in Philadelphia, the flight to Amsterdam was cancelled. The employees were totally not helpful and not giving any direction. Finally one of them said that we had to go to the customer service. Once there, we had to wait like 2 hours in a huge queue. Disaster. The customer service agent booked a ticket for us via Dublin. We had to wait 6 hours longer. Once we asked the customer service agent the reason of cancellation the given answer was: I dont know, i just get 8 dollars per hour. They don’t share this kind of information with me. Very unprofessional.

Name: Austin Foshee
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  . Little Rock to Washington DC. Horrible customer service, waited an hour and a half to check my bag in. Missed my flight and they told me to go the back of the line to get my flight rescheduled. There were 5 people working to check people in and 2 of them left never to be seen again. I was told to wait on their manager and waited another 30 minutes and the manager never came. This will be the last time that I fly American Airlines.

Name: M Keane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  We wanted to change our seats and check in online but it wouldn’t let us. Got to the airport and still wasn’t able to change our seats due to technical issues after waiting for them to try to figure it out for an hour and a half we told them we have to go through security and left. When we got on board the flight my screen didn’t work and I told the flight attendant she was very rude and just nodded. Told her a few more times she rest a few times and still didn’t work. We asked another attendant and she rest it a couple more times and still didn’t work. They didn’t do anything else about it. So I got WiFi and that didn’t work well either after paying $19 couldn’t listen to music or watch anything. All the employees were rude. The last time we fly on American Airlines.

Name: Jose Cruz
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  This will be the last time I fly with American Airlines. Arrived to Charlotte for my connecting flight to Hartford and was told there's no aircraft available so my 7 a.m. departure was delayed till 2:30 p.m. Thanks to American Airlines mistakes I will now miss my daughter's college graduation. They're making me jump through hoops and Loops to get a refund my wife and I am extremely disappointed with this Airline and will not fly American Airlines again

Name: D Mealen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Reno to Los Angeles. We recently had to fly out for a death of a family member. American Airlines staff were so helpful with my elderly mother and our flight mix up from Expedia (who were not helpful at all). I will recommend American Airlines to everyone, they went above and beyond in our eyes, they were wonderful and thoughtful of our situation. Thank you

Name: E Mealen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Raleigh to Miami. I came to the airport at 10:30 flight scheduled to leave at 12:03 which was delayed until 12:20. The supervisor was very rude. She wasn’t trying to help us at all. The lady in charge stated that our seats was given to someone else which is ridiculous when my flight has been booked for months. It’s very unfair to people that have waited for 2 hours and still don’t get to get on your correct flight. I was put on standby then that may not even help because this flight is full also.  Which only leave a flight for early in the morning and I have already paid for my Room and everything ! I will never recommend anyone to fly American Airlines because they do not know how to treat people. They are rude and very disrespectful. The supervisor never apologized or even ask If we were okay. I am very upset. I have been sitting at the airport for 7 hours and I don’t even know if I will be able to board at 7:30.

Name: Cortney Zeiler
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to Pittsburgh. My first flight was freezing with no blankets. Then my final flight was delayed 4 hours! After I had gotten up at 2AM. Ironically, I had actually tried to change this flight a week earlier and they told me it would cost me $200 + a $50 service fee. Then they change the flight at the very last minute and I get zero compensation. How is this fair? I've flown around 20 trips, this is the first and last time I will use AA. Never had these issues with other airlines.

Name: Rainer Zinngrebe
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Washington DCA to Miami. Got to the airport 45 min before flight, which is never an issue at this airport, was unable to check in, told the lady and asking they could assist! She said no, too late! Stand in line and see what they say! Line was too long so had to rebook and missed my flight and my meeting in Miami!

Review_Heading: "told that I was late to board"
Name: Astha Shahi
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Washington. Worst experience ever. I am never flying American airlines ever again. I got 40 minutes before the flight and was told that I was late to board and was even dropped off. I was treated like I had never been in a flight ever in my life. And  I even had my boarding pass with me. And when I said I didn’t want my baggage if I was late for the baggage checkin the lady in the counter said the plane is ready to leave. The flight was for 7:10 and I was there at 6:30. She said the only way I could fly the same day was if I was on a standby and paid the fair difference and all other  extra charges that would make up to $470 or more. I doubt if they are there to make money out of nothing and making fool out of people like me. I strongly don’t recommend this airline.

Name: J Neale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Milwaukee. When we arrived at the gate, we were told that we had to check our bag. In fact, they did not let anyone in basic economy bring on their bag. Then when we boarded we found that there was plenty of overhead room. 2 minutes after boarding, I went to fetch my bag, with my bag tag in hand, and they refused to give me my bag; it was right in front of me! I am outraged at their obstinance. I pack so that I never have to check my luggage because I loathe waiting to pick it up. I am a very dissatisfied customer.

Name: S Carynski
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Lihue to Orlando via Los Angeles, My first flight was delayed due to filling up fuel and landed at 7:55am. Our connecting flight left at 7:58am. Our bags therefore did not make it on the connecting flight but lucking I made it. My flight landed at 3:30pm and I received our bags at 12:45am! The delivery company called and woke me up several times (I had work the next morning) confused about directions on how to get to my address. After expressing my frustrations through several phone calls while waiting for my bag, I was then informed that I could have scheduled the bag to be delivered the following day but now it was too late because it was already on its way out.
route: Lihue to Orlando via Los Angeles

Name: H Lane
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Indianapolis to Tucson via Dallas Ft Worth. This flight was canceled and a text was sent to confirm a rescheduled flight for the following day. Due to work conflict, I asked to be re-routed; ended up in Chicago, delayed several hrs til that was canceled too. American Airlines said they would not pay for lodging or food costs incurred for this extra night, nor would they provide any refund for the significant inconvenience and work hours lost. They could not even provide me with an email address to file a complaint - I was told to go to their website & find the email address myself, if I really needed it. Worst experience ever and American Airlines does not care. Photo here was compliments of United, nothing was provided from American Airlines

Name: Eelco van den Heuvel
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Frankfurt to Nashville via Charlotte/Philadelphia. Though American Airlines doesn't get much credit on this site, our trip worked out fine. We had 4 flights with them and all were bang on time. I like the fact that AA flies in Frankfurt from the much quieter terminal 2. We were recevied by very friendly groundstaff and had our bag dropped within 15 mins. AA holds firmly to the boarding-by-group system which I like very much. The flight from Frankfurt to Charlotte was good: a rather tasty meal and plenty of drinks and snacks. We only had 1,5 hour connection time to Nashville, so we were a bit weary about that, because you have tot go through immigration and collect your bag again and go through security again, but is was okay. Airport staff is ready tot take your bag immediately from you after immigration so you can rush through security. By the time we got tot the gate boarding began and again we had a very punctual departure for Nashville. Small snack and a drink on this one-hour flight was enough. Checking in in Nashville for our inbound flight again was a breeze. Again very friendly ground staff (we've experienced different before!) and within 10 mins we were at the gate. Flight from Nashville to Philadelphia took only 1,5 hours in stead of the advertised 2 hours and 10 mins and that was good since we had only 50 mins connecting time in Philadelphia. Still quite a run because we arrived at B10 and our plane to Frankfurt was at the furthest gate (A26). By the time we arrived we were almost the last ones to board. Our son wasn't assigned a seat in Nashville but his boarding pass with seat was ready in Philadelphia. Four the fourth time a very punctual departure. Again a meal, rather bland but okay and plenty of drinks and snacks. Breakfast -well, sort of- an hour for landing. 280 films and games to choose from. Crew over all not very friendly but never unfriendly. In less than seven hours to Frankfurt, landed almost an hour earlier. All in all a very good experience. Would definitely fly again.

Name: Mary Ann G Jenkins
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Charlotte to London Heathrow. I was so disappointed in my experience with American Airlines. I just returned from a flight on Delta and it was a far and away better experience than with AA. The difference was night and day. On both my flights to and from London, the crew never cracked a smile, never had a welcoming word, never answered a request for service with an agreeable attitude. They obviously didn't want to be dealing with the customers and were, at times, even sarcastic to their passengers. My touch screen didn't work but I didn't dare ask the attendants for assistance and get a snarky answer. The food was marginal, at best, but it was the attitude of the crew that spoiled the travel. The gate crew on Charlotte even mocked the passengers from the preceding flight within hearing of the waiting passengers. No wonder my flights were not full. Unless I have to choose American Airlines in the future, I will be flying anyone else. They got us there safely, but that was the extent of the service.

Name: E Forzen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Burlington to Tampa via Charlotte. The pilots and crew left the gate 20 minutes late and then stopped a few hundred feet from the gate and made the passengers sit on the runway for nearly an hour and lied to us about “its weather related" - but it was clear skies and both airports. American is such a disorganized and poorly run airline as every leg of my two days of flights had problems. I strongly recommend not flying with them!!

Name: S Garmin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Colorado Springs to Nashville via DFW. As usual, my American Airlines flight was delayed. My flight out to Colorado Springs was delayed by and hour. Then my return flight was delayed! I was supposed to take off from Colorado Springs at 8:30am but the flight was delayed by 2 hours. This, as said by the airline, was because the plane was late arriving the night before. Due to the 2 hour delay, I missed my connector flight in Dallas. The only other flight to Nashville from Dallas was at 4:30 in the afternoon (original flight was scheduled to leave at 12:30). So I spent 4 hours sitting around in Colorado Springs waiting on the "delayed flight", I spent 3 hours waiting around in Dallas because of my "delayed" flight. To top it off, when we DID finally land in Nashville, the ground crew wasn't at the gate so we had to wait on the tarmac until they got to the gate to offload the plane!! What a wreck this airline is!
route: Colorado Springs to Nashville via DFW

Name: Ali Walker
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Milwaukee to Charlotte. I will never fly American again! They wouldn’t change my partners and my seats so we could sit together, even though when we initially booked we picked seats together. Our seats had changed without our knowledge. Also, they had me place my tiny wallet purse inside my backpack because you can only have one carryon item that can be placed under the seat, However both items would have fit under the seat. Lastly, do not get seats in the very back of the air craft. They do not recline and they actually lean you uncomfortably forward. Worst flight experience ever.

Name: S Dolan
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Paris. What a disaster of an airline - one mistake after another, one 'no' after another and bad hard product to boot. This was the second flight en-route back to Paris. That flight was late a ran to make this flight. Sat down, asked for a cold towel - no, asked for a glass of champagne - no, asked to wash in the bathroom - no. Through out the flight the service was terrible and rude with the exception of one cabin crew who tried to help. The flat bed seat rocked like a baby's cradle and when asked for assistance told, "I'm not an engineer, you need to deal with it". Throughout the flight every time the person next me moved my seat would shudder and move. As you can guess - no sleep into Paris. The crew was just mean and harsh, there was no improvement in the airline since I last flew them 5 years ago. Will not be flying them again - ever.

Name: K Willis
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Pittsburgh to Chicago O’Hare. I fly weekly for work as a business traveler between Buffalo, Cleveland, and Pittsburgh. I live in Chicago. As you can imagine, this leaves little flexibility in my schedule. When I do have a change in my schedule that allows me to get home faster, I try to fly standby or change my flight. Every time I am told there is a $200 or $75 change fee that cannot be waived. Considering I have been traveling every single week for 6 months now, it is extremely frustrating that I am not able to switch flights without paying an unreasonable fee when there are open seats on a flight. I have already paid for my original ticket. United has been able to make this change for me with no problem. If you are a business traveler, do not fly American. When there is a flight delay there is nothing we can do as travelers about it. No compensation, just told to wait 2+ hours. But when we can change flights and open a seat for someone else, time to pay up.

Name: K Irving
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Los Angeles to Atlanta. This American flight had tons of issues. Most concerning was that the aircraft came out of maintenance following service with problems remaining. The plane came out of LAX maintenance with non-functional entertainment systems, about which the crew were never notified. Oddly, even though the plane was sitting at LAX, the plane was nearly 2 hours late to the gate. This was a serious problem, because the pilots were set to time out 1 hour and 18 minutes after the original departure time. A series of blunders followed, including a broken fuel pump, which slowed refueling. We ultimately left with under a minute remaining before the pilots would have timed out. I don't like an airline flying by the seat of their pants. The only positive were the flight crew, who may have been the most pleasant crew I have encountered with an airline. However, they weren't able to cover for American's failings here.

Name: Qunic Pillows
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Atlanta to Miami. My flight was suppose to leave March 27 at 6:50am we got on the plane only to sit there for a hour we made it to the runway only to be told from the captain there was a maintenance problem so we had go get off. They kept sending us updates every hour our flight didn't leave until 1pm.

Name: R Sanyal
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New York to Myrtle Beach via Charlotte. 4 flights and 5 airports - JFK, CLT, MYR, DCA, LGA. Superb experience. All flights were on time and on couple of times early. Flight attendants were attentive. A good selection of snacks served and soft and hard drinks offered. Cockpit crew were communicative. Planes were clean and bright. The seats were spa copy's with ample leg space. Boarding was well organized. The only improvement would be to install electric charging sockets on the seats of the Embraer aircraft.
route: New York to Myrtle Beach via Charlotte

Name: Kelly Cornog
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | We flew to Hawaii for our daughters spring break this year and our 20th wedding anniversary. We had 2 flights to Hawaii both 6 hours long. From Philly to the Big Island there were no TV’s on either flight. One little screen in the aisle that dropped down and played one stupid movie. Two passes of the beverage cart with a handful of pretzels. American Airlines need to put planes into service that have individual TV’s for flights that are longer than 3 hours. Our red eye home from LA also had no TV’s. Thanks American Airlines from all the people who cannot sleep on a night time flight! I couldn’t even get a pillow and a blanket on my red eye! Last year I flew coach on Lufthansa to Germany and was in row 38. I felt like I was in first class! Free booze the duration of the flight, full dinner served with real plates and silverware that was complimentary, and pillows and blankets, and wait for it! TV’s for every single passenger! American Airlines needs to see how to keep their passengers happy buy making their flight more comfortable and not dumping all their money into Philadelphia Terminal B. Every single seat at every bar, lounge, waiting are had a tablet and a charging station next to it. The place looked like a night club! So much for keeping your passengers on your flights comfortable!
route: Hawaii to Philadelphia via Los Angeles

Name: Asa Whitewing
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Lafayette to Roswell via Dallas Ft Worth. My Mother and I had our flight cancelled which was fine. So we rebooked. While rebooking we didn't realize that we booked different flights. One on Tueday and one on Wednesday. They are for the same time, different days. We immediately noticed the error and contacted AA. They wouldn't even let us correct the error without paying 200 dollars. This is easily the worst service that I've received from an airline. We are so upset because now my Mom will have to drive 1.5 hours to the airport to pick me up. We will never fly American Airlines again.
route: Lafayette to Roswell via Dallas Ft Worth

Name: Pavlina Dragieva
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Paris to Atlanta via Charlotte. Never again I will fly my family with American Airlines, after my mom, wife and daughter, missed their connecting flight in Paris because the first one, from Sofia was late they did not put them on another flight till the next day, they spend 8 hrs stuck at the airport. After all they put them in a hotel with no transport to the hotel so they got a taxi, paid for the taxi themselves and the worst is they put them in a room with a complete stranger who also missed his flight, my mom daughter and wife! So they had to get a different room. Also we paid $160 extra to have the first row sits to have more room - didnt get the seats or the money back, customer service is horrible.

Name: B Akers
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Fayetteville to St Louis via Charlotte. Arriving connection aircraft grounded for maintenance then after 1.5 hour delay & crew change, AA team raced to board already irate customers onto aircraft with a maintenance problem just to make it like they were "concerned". Approx 100 fliers strapped in for half hour so pilot could announce can't fix maintenance & the crew will be out of crew rest & need to change too. Approx. Total 5 hours of jerking customers around. Retired pilot here. Totally unacceptable. Never AA again!

Name: B Horton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to Boston. If you choose to fly American, expect delays and cancellations. Expect to hear excuses like overbooking, maintenance, or insufficient staff availability. Expect to be greeted by rude customer service agents when you try to make other arrangements. Expect a hard fight to receive any form of compensation for the inconveniences that they inflict on you. Expect to talk to numerous agents on the phone and at the airport, wasting hours of your time, until you eventually (if you have the patience to see it through) find that one person who will take five seconds of their time to help you. Expect some staff members to simply ignore you when you ask them questions. Expect that you will not make it to your destination at the time printed on your ticket. Even if you do make it onto a plane eventually (likely not the one you originally booked) expect it to be very cramped and uncomfortable. I have flown American Airlines numerous times over the past few years. Every time is a struggle. At  Boston Logan Airport and Philadelphia Airport especially, the staff simply refuse to help when something goes wrong. They will instead resort to silence or walk away when you try to ask a question. At American Airlines, your problems are not their concern. Getting you to your destination on time is not their concern. Your comfort is not their concern. Their only concern is your money, which they will hold onto even when they fail to provide the services you paid them for.

Name: Leigh Crounse
Review: ❌ Not Verified |  Hawaii to Dallas Fort Worth. If you’re flying first class they shouldn’t run out of meals for you. They told me they only had one meal left and it was vegetarian. I was starving and the food was horrible, and I’m not a vegetarian. I paid good money to fly comfortably, and the aircraft should be fully stocked and prepared for the amount of passengers on board!

Name: L Fox
Review: ❌ Not Verified |  Miami to Toronto. I will never fly American Airlines again. Our flight was cancelled on Sunday April 15 to Toronto due to bad weather. I understand why the flight needed to be cancelled, however we were told by American Airlines staff that our luggage had been sent too Toronto on another flight. Which made absolutely no sense to me. We did not have a return flight until Wednesday which meant we had 3 days without any clothing/personal products. I requested some sort of financial compensation because of this and was told that baggage does not handle compensation and to go upstairs and put in a request. When we were upstairs we were told to get into 3 different line ups once we were finally able to speak to someone we were told that they did not provide compensation (I understand about the flight cancellation but believed they should not have sent our suitcases ahead without us). I asked to speak to the supervisor and she told me that they have nothing to do with baggage and if I wanted financial compensation I needed to go back to baggage. She then checked our baggage tags and said our luggage was still in the airport. We then went back downstairs and spoke to someone who was in the luggage area, he was extremely rude so I asked to speak to his supervisor and he refused to call one. His coworker could tell I was becoming visibly upset so called a supervisor. She then left. We waited for approximately 10 minutes and ask the employee who had refused to call a supervisor if they were coming and he said "no, if you want to speak to a supervisor you need to stand in that line over there". So we went and stood in line again . Once through the line I asked to speak to the supervisor and told her that we were told upstairs that our suitcases were still in the airport. She said they maybe here but we could not have them and they were going to be forwarded to Toronto. I then asked for financial compensation for toiletries, clothing etc and she told me I had to go back upstairs to Customer Assistance that they do not handle compensation. I then lost my temper because this was the third time I was told to go to a different spot. Every single staff I dealt with at American Airlines that day was extremely rude and continuously told us we were in the wrong line up, department or it wasn't something they handled. We did eventually get our luggage back the next day but I believe it was largely do to the fact that I was persistent and lost my temper. I would like to mention that there was one staff member in customer assistance who was pleasant to deal with when my mother and I went to confirm our seat on Tuesday April 17th - he needs need to find another airline to work for, and is far too nice of a person to be working with such rude, awful, unhelpful people.

Name: Rachel Bailey
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Phoenix to Dallas. First the ticket is overpriced. In order to have a seat they want to charge you even more money. I get to the gate shown on my boarding pass, find they've changed it with no notification. Have to walk miles to get to the next gate. Then I have a small case to put under my seat and told they will charge me. This is the worst airline.

Name: S Neile
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Tampa. Your fare has restrictions. Be sure to read up on the rules before you go to the airport. And once on board, enjoy the same great service and free snacks, soft drinks and inflight entertainment. You can bring 1 item that fits under the seat - No access to overhead bin. Pay for and check bags before security or pay bag fee + $25 (per bag) at the gate. Also keep in mind you can pay to choose a seat 48 hours before departure or we'll assign one to you when you check in. Your fare is not eligible for upgrades, flight changes or refunds. Even though you board last, make sure you give yourself time to check bags and get to the gate. All Basic Economy rules Yes, and after all of the above, there are more rules! $100 to check bags (both ways). Money grubbing airline! I have always flown southwest, and never felt like I was being nickle and dimed by them. I will never fly American again. I think this ended up costing at least $100 more than Southwest, and they make sure you don't get to sit with your traveling partner. It seemed that almost everyone who was traveling together was sitting apart from each other. And seats are assigned!

Review_Heading: "I work hard now to avoid it"
Name: David Kassel
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Los Angeles to Charlotte. American Airlines is now in the class of Allegiant and United. Aside from overcrowded gates, remote less costly terminals, burned out flight attendants, and a la carte fares, the latest grab is the fare that allows no access to overhead bins! I fly domestically and internationally 20 or more times a year, and I can honestly state that nearly every experience where i am forced to use American Airlines is negative and I work hard now to avoid it.

Name: Reta Green
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Minneapolis. I will never fly this airline again. The airline does not value its customers or have any understanding of good customer service. After making a 5 hour drive to Dallas to catch this flight, I arrived at the airport around 10ish and we made it through security around 10:30ish. The flight was scheduled to start boarding at 11:45 at C29. I checked the board around 11 to confirm and still had this gate. Around 12 after the flight had not been called I wondered if I was at the right gate. I pulled up flight on my phone which said flight had been changed to C28 which was in hearing range of where I was sitting. The flight was never announced and I had missed it. When I went to counter, the agent proceeded to tell me that it was my responsibility to find out which gate and they did not have to announce it. I informed the agent I had checked the board within the hour and the gate was listed as C29. He stated everyone was already there and so he didn’t have to announce. However me and my 4 kids were less than 15 yards away and we were not on board. Even the “customer care” department who I spoke with on the phone had this not my problem attitude. If I had not been so close to the terminal from which my flight departed I would not have a problem. But I am sitting in the airport now hearing flights being announced and last call for passengers and I’m still not sure why my flight was so different?

Name: Simon Ouellette
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Maui to Regina via Phoenix/Calgary. What should’ve been a 12 hour trip home turned into almost 3 days because of inconsistency with this company. First flight got delayed because a piece fell of the airplane, so missed all of our flights and had to get reconnected. Then, got to the airport on 2 hours of sleep, only to be told after waiting in line for 2 more hours that our 8 am flight wasn’t available. Fast forward to our last flight from Toronto to Regina, and they didn’t even put us on our last flight, and didn’t confirm the rescheduled flight, so we were stranded, yet again. We barely managed to get someone to get us a hotel and food vouchers for the night, after another hour of searching through the airport. After we got home, we emailed customer support to only get compensated a couple hundred Americans airline dollars for our trouble. Our flight home got quintupled and all we got was a dinky little couple hundred dollars for stressed out flights, missed events back home, and lack of communication. Definitely not pleased with the service, and am highly not recommending this airline to anyone.

Name: M Sallis
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadephia to Miami. We were supposed to leave at 8:10 am - after delay after delay we boarded the plane around 2:30pm after sitting in the airport for 8 hours. We got in the sky and about 2 hours into our travel. There was an announcement from the captain explaining that we have to fasten our seatbelts immediately because we would have to make an emergency landing in Fort Myers because they were low on fuel. Im not quite sure why the airplane would be low on fuel about 2 hours into the short trip! That is absolutely absurd! Shortly after that there was another announcement from one of the flight attendants stating that she knows we all have questions and she does not have the answers to in a very frantic voice putting us all In a very scared state. Im not quite sure what she meant by that because the answer was to get more fuel which seemed like an absolute lie or cover up of some sort. Once we finally landed in Fort Myers me and the 4 other people that I was with the 3 that were on the reservation with me, and a friend from another reservation demanded to get off of the plane because we felt  unsafe along with some other people that wanted off of the plane. We were told that we were not allowed off of the plane. Not only were we afraid for our lives because of the low fuel incident, we felt as though we were being held hostage. The captain and other workers were extremely rude to us and made us feel very uneasy! They even told us we are on our own when we got off of the plane after ripping up our tickets. After telling us that we were not allowed off of the plane and to take our seats we all demanded to get off. Finally, they let us off of the plane snatched our tickets and ripped them up. We had to pay for a rental car to get to the final destination Miami and drive for about 3 hours due to thunderstorms. We did not reach our destination until after 10:30pm. This has been a disaster! This was my first flight and not sure that I will be getting on another plane again. Our 2-3 hr flight turned into a 16.5 hour trip, more money spent on a rental, afraid for our lives, and an entire day lost! Our way home was on a Frontier airline and took us 2 hours and 5 minutes.! They gave us A $100 credit which will never be used! And no one was willing to take any responsibility! Customer service was terrible and customer relations was not trying to do a thing. They have taken no responsibility.

Name: T Brasher
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Detroit to Dallas. Horrible customer service, even by management. The kiosk lines were long due to 2 or 3 kiosks being out of order. When I finally got to a kiosk and proceeded to check in, I had a quick question regarding my seat assignment. There were two agents standing near me at one of the broken kiosks, talking to each other, one of whom was a manager. He said “Just one minute”. After waiting 5 minutes, I just finished without assistance. He then came over to me and said “I’m here now”. I told him “that’s ok”. He proceeded to stand next to me while I waited for my boarding pass. I was clearly aggravated, but I didn’t say anything more to him. As I proceeded to leave, he loudly and arrogantly said “ have a nice day!” On my previous flight, I was assigned to an exit row seat. I’m tall, so I asked the agent at the gate for my seat to be changed to an exit row seat, if possible (same question that I had earlier when I was checking in). She wasn’t nice either. She said “yeah, if you want to pay more”. I said that I didn’t realize that because I didn’t pay anything extra for the exit row on my departure flight. The agent asked me if I minded taking it. She said, “well, it cost more money because people want those seats”. I am happy with the seat assigned to me. But, I expected much more from American Airlines.

Name: Ajit Kuruvilla
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Port of Spain. The in flight service was barely acceptable; the cabin attendant did what she had to do as if it were a chore. It seemed that she would have rather not come to work on that day. She wasn't impolite but her service was an attempt to demote American Airlines to a 2* carrier. The food was forgettable but that isn't so important to me. Cabin staff should be given the opportunity to fly on Middle Eastern and Asian carriers to experience high quality service.

Name: Brooke Gosselin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Albuquerque to Detroit.I will never fly American again. The attendants when you check your bag or board the plane are either rude or incompetent. I had a lady tell me I didn’t have to pay for my carry on because I was confused my ticket said group 9 and only one carry one. She told me they wouldn’t even notice and that I did not have to check it. When I got to the gate they made me pay $50 for a bag the size of my head! I told them the lady downstairs said I didn’t need too and they still made me pay a ridiculous fee. I’ve never had good customer service, they screw you on charges, and the planes are always delayed.

Name: Joseph Goodrich
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to San Diego. American is still the Wal-Mart of airlines. Aircraft was a bit dirty. Seating was tight. Aircraft appeared dated with no outlets and no TV/Entertainment system. WiFi was spotty at best. Boy, I am sure they can do much better than this. In short, American is still the Wal-Mart of Airlines, On the plus side, the flight was punctual, and the staff was pleasant. Food for purchase was decent.

Name: Matthew Surprenant
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Cali to Montreal via Miami. Has to be one of the worst airlines ever! They always have issue either mechanical or maintenance related, they made us wait 2hrs on the plane before being asked to Deboard! After re-boarding getting near taxiing, the issues hasn’t even been resolved, flight attendance are rude saying” if you guys leave this plane, we’ll leave without you”.

Name: Jack Griffin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to St Louis. It’s hard to believe this stuff still happens, but you can’t make this up. Into Chicago from Toronto early enough to catch a flight to St Louis 2 hours before my regularly scheduled flight. I look online and there are 16 empty seats on a 737.I have no checked bags. I get to gate before they start boarding. Desk attendant tells me to wait until all regularly ticketed passengers are through gate. After waiting, she calls me up and tells my my ticket class doesn’t allow me to take earlier flight. Ok, fine. I ask how much it costs and I’ll pay the difference. She’s says she can’t, go to American customer service where they can. Flight door still not closed. Service desk says they can’t, they won’t take my money, they won’t move me to an empty plane and free up space on my original flight that is fairly full. Anyone see why reviews on American are terrible and profits lag?

Name: R Sanyal
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New York JFK to Los Angeles. An amazingly satisfying flight experience on an early morning flight from JFK terminal 8 to LAX. The take off of the flight was delayed because of rain and low cloud cover. The pilot kept us informed of the flight status throughout the wait on an active runway. The aircraft was clean, bright and spacious. The lie flat seats were angled towards the Windows. A duvet and pillow were provided as was an amenity bag. The entertainment system carried a large repertoire of current fils and TV serials. It came with Bose headphones. The seat was comfortable with several adjustment options. We were provided with hot towels on boarding and before landing. Breakfast of three choices were offered. The two flight attendants in the cabin were very attentive. Snacks served throughout the flight. A true first class experience.
route: New York JFK to Los Angeles

Name: H Gorten
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Rhode Island to St Louis via Chicago. Avoid American Airlines at all costs. Unfortunately, I seem to need to re-learn this lesson every year or two. Having been Concierge Key and Executive Platinum for years, I gave up on AA in 2014 because the service was Always Awful. Having been told flights would go then being cancelled. AA giving away reserved seats. Refusing to refund fare differences after being moved involuntarily from 1st to coach. Concluding AA does not know why we fly, I shifted to Delta and SW and have been Diamond and A-List for a few years. It’s amazing how much better the service is on Delta and even SW. Unfortunately, tonight I decided to give AA another chance so I could accommodate a business dinner in Chicago during a layover. I arrived at the gate 20 minutes before flight time to find that my 1st class seat had been given away as an upgrade to someone else and I’d been re-booked on the first morning flight. Eventually, after persistence with rude gate agents who told me to go find a hotel, I was put in coach and told to forget about a refund of the $1000+ fare difference. In the next bankruptcy, which cannot come soon enough, this airline should be liquidated.
route: Rhode Island to St Louis via Chicago

Name: J Masatanil
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Seattle to Myrtle beach. Worst ever experience. I usually fly Alaska or United, but had to use American to travel to a conference. Flight from Seattle to Charlotte  is a 5 hr flight. No USB port or outlets for laptops, and no in flight entertainment. There was no food available to purchase. The flight was late and I had to run and catch my connection at Charlotte in the last minute. No help from flight attendants on getting off the plane quickly to catch the connecting flight which was leaving in few minutes. Return to Seattle (April 25th). 1.06 pm flight was delayed to 1.40pm. Then delayed to 2.10 pm (too late to get the connecting flight) at which point I am moved to a 4 pm flight to Charlotte to connect to Seattle through another flight (almost an hour standing in line - two separate times - to get the problem corrected). Sitting at the airport for last 3.5 hrs (total waiting - 5hrs) and hoping that rest of the flights will be ok. Will never fly American again.

Name: Tony Spitale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I chose American Airlines for my recent trips along the East Coast. I was doing the following routing: JFK-BOS-JFK-BWI-JFK. I must say that AA has become my favourite carrier for domestic trips. All these flights were on time, staff were friendly, I was checked-in within seconds, there was no hassle at security and without exception all flights were punctual. My best flight however was the one from Boston to New York on a transcontinental A321. I got a comfortable seat in the business-class section for this short 40-minutes-hop into JFK. But it was the captain who made this flight so special. As it was a clear and beautiful day he encouraged the passengers to look out of the window. And they actually did so. The Captain went as far as pointing out some sights en route and commenting on them. It was like flying in the 1980s when inflight entertainment on shorthaul flights was non-existent. After landing the entire crew - including the two pilots - stood in front of the cockpit and wished everybody a nice weekend. American Airlines provided a very personal and kind of nostalgic experience on this flight. I will not hesitate to choose them again.

Name: N Thann
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Houston to Dallas. Totally disappointed when flying with American Airlines from departure to arrival. They have too much trouble. The agent was rude. How do you feel when someone responded they did not need to tell you about your ticket so that they charged extra $25 in addition bag checked at gate because the ticket allowed bag under seat while you was checking another bag. And then 2 bags arrived at 2 different gate, 1 at B, 1 at C. I paid $85 for 2 bags.

Name: F Carter
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Montego Bay to Manchester (NH) via Philadelphia. Where do I begin? One disaster after another. 2 hr delay leaving Jamaica, not weather related. Plane had a "mechanical" issue coming in. When I questioned a flight attendant about the safety of the plane going back out was given a snotty sarcastic answer.
