I settled in to wait, but after only half an hour or so, it was announced that the flight had been delayed by two more hours. And because I was forced to check my bag, I had no way of changing to an earlier flight. The staff were nice enough to put out some drinks and snacks, but I'm unsure of whether that was organized by American or by the airport. The second flight had no in-flight entertainment or even an outlet, though the staff were pleasant. Overall not a great flight experience. I don't think I will be flying with American again without having done some thorough research first.
route: Santa Ana to Philadelphia via Dallas

Review_Heading: "went through the motions but didn’t care"
Name: Colin Lovemason
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew London Heathrow to New York JFK with American Airlines. Check-in was fine and thanks to status I could use the good Cathay Lounge. Boarding was slow because everyone was being asked if they wanted to check in their carry-on as they scanned in. We had two seats in Main Cabin Extra, bulkhead. The big problem was that AA did not have any bassinets so the aisle passenger, not in our party, had to hold the baby. She was fuming because she asked at check in to make sure it was there. It’s hard traveling with babies I know but she really did encroach on my space the whole way. My fault gambling on the bulkhead. Flight attendants went through the motions but didn’t care much. Barely visible. School holidays so not cheap for an unpleasant 7 hours.
route: London Heathrow to New York JFK

Name: Kristi Edwards
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew American Airlines from Denver to Dallas. I have been a loyal American flyer for over 10 years. I only book American flights. Somehow this time not only do my husband and I get charged for a carry on, we also had separated seats on a full flight. Now I put American on the same low level as all the others. Very disappointing. I was a very loyal customer but no more.

Name: S Mawsin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to St Croix. If I can rate a negative number. I would. Flight was at 5.45pm. We were checked in at 10am. Sat for 7 hours with no notification on a gate change. Rudest gate reps we have ever dealt with to the point that they were bold to comment go ahead when i said i will be calling corporate for their negligence as we are left stranded till the following morning. Customers will seek alternate airlines when employees portray such mediocre and nonchalant behavior.

Name: B Moore
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew American Airlines from Kansas City to New Orleans. This trip is the worst experience on a flight I have ever had. Due to an error with the fuel our flight was three hours behind and I then missed my connecting flight. Some staff were apologetic but others were rude. I am spending more time flying that if I had driven.

Name: Stephanie Amoroso
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I arrived at the airport in Tucson at 4.45 am in time for a 6.15 am flight. AA302. Too bad the flight crew decided not to get out of bed. Took off 1.5 hours late and landed in DFW just as my connecting to IAD was leaving. I was rebooked on a flight 4 hours later, in economy, despite having a first class ticket. Then, that flight (AA1544) was delayed due to a "mechanical issue". I landed at 7.15 pm eastern, despite getting up at 3.30 am Arizona time. A 14 hour day just to get from Arizona to Washington. American Airlines has no business being in business.
route: Tucson to Washington via Dallas Fort Worth

Name: David Bergstrom
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Austin to Los Angeles on a Boeing 737-800. Arrived 90 minutes early, with TSA Pre-Check, cleared security in a 2 minutes. Austin Admiral Club staff is still the best. Always nice, accommodating. Small enough lounge, they remember frequent visitors. Flight boarded on time, group 4, for main Cabin Extra. Extra legroom makes economy travel much more comfortable, especially with an empty seat next to me. 3 hrs in the air, 1 round of drinks and snacks. I always order a coke zero and a tomato juice, yes weird combination, but never an issue for the flight attendants. Personal device for entertainment which was fine. Landed early and as usual at LAX you wait till your gate opens up. So arrived at the gate on schedule. Satisfactory economy trip.

Review_Heading: "makes me want to try another airline"
Name: Joe Hoskins
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Charlotte to Miami. Agent made me check my bag. He told me my bag was too big. (Although it was smaller than the average carry on) He also told me their was no room on the plane. (Although he hadn't been on the plane) The guy that did it acted rude and spiteful. When I told the flight attendant she was confused how he could've even known. I've always flown American, however, this individual makes me want to try another airline.

Name: Steve Miller
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Arrived 1 hour prior to flight from Tampa to Chicago. Waited in line to check in for 15 minutes when I was told I could not check my bag because it was too late. I told the lady I would have my wife pick up my bag and ship it to me over night. In the 15 minutes it took my wife to come back we then tried to check in and were told we missed out flight due to a 30 minute check in requirement. Then we were told the next flight they would put us on was 8 hours later even though I offered to pay more to get on one of the many flights leaving much sooner. Had she told us about the 30 minute cut off to check in I could have checked in while waiting for my wife to return and been on my flight. Overall this is the worst experience I have ever had traveling by air and caution anyone booking a flight with American Airlines. Remember, you get what you pay for. I have learned. Next time I will pay more and fly Jetblue or Southwest.

Name: M James
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew Dallas to Chicago. American Airlines continues to be the most inefficient airline I have flown. More frequently delayed than other airlines and often say the overhead bins are full amd make you check your luggage, yet when you get on the flight, there is tons of room. They also seem afraid to acknowledge customers concerns. I will avoid them at all costs in the future.

Review_Heading: "I have rarely been so pleasantly surprised"
Name: D Dawes
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew London Heathrow to Chicago O'Hare, on new B787-800, and based on previous reviewers of American Airlines, dreading the trip. I have rarely been so pleasantly surprised. First flight out of Heathrow, and biz class, due to no First Class on this airplane I had a seat on my own, which was great. The AA biz seat isn't anything special per se, in a global context, but is certainly vastly superior to British Airways Club Class, and even better than British Airways First Class. Food was acceptable, slightly better than mediocre. The purser handling Business Class was excellent, and had the correct balance of professionalism, and personality to serve a Premium Cabin. The aircraft itself is still quite noisy, compared to an A-380, but it seemed to deal with mild turbulence well. So, compared to British Airways, I have to commend American Airlines internationally, (although their USA domestic product is still woeful). I will endeavour to fly American Airlines B-787 business and first class internationally over British Airways, given the choice.

Name: Y Shavani
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Minneapolis. Delayed because of technical/mechanical problem. In the last 6 months, I have traveled 5 times with American Airlines and every time flight got delayed because of so called technical/mechanical problem, One time i had to miss my international connecting flight because of this same American Airline flight got delayed. I will try to avoid travel with American Airline in future, they are the worst airline. I am very disappointed and very unhappy with American Airline, will try to never travel again with them.

Name: Lori Young
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Due to fly American Airlines from Fort Lauderdale to Houston. Poorest customer service I've ever received from an airline. Flight delayed which caused me to miss connecting flight. Stood in line for hours to try and reschedule due to urgent need to get back home but ended up stuck in airport for 14 hours and all agents dismissive and even rude about questions or concerns I had. Will never fly with this airline again as long as there are any other options. Very disappointed!

Name: Mike Literus
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Phoenix to Portland. Horrible customer service, a poor website that wouldn’t let me check in! I show up early and the put me at the end of plane. Then they sit us on the plane for 45 minutes before sending us a text message saying we’re delayed another half hour. I mean can’t you come over the loud speaker and tell us the truth?  After waiting over a hour in the plane they finally decided to tell us that the landing gear is damaged and we would have to roll back and wait while they check for leaks. I’m glad I’m safe but they should’ve taken us off this plane instead of torturing all of us and never disclosing the information when they knew damn right it was gonna take all night. I’m still on board waiting now. It’s been hours.

Name: Frank Melloni
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew American Airlines from New York JFK to Charlotte. They charged me for a carry-on and then tried to charge me for an extra piece because I had a tripod strap to my carry-on. I will never fly them or anybody else who charges for carry-on luggage again. They were rude and I will be sure to let all my friends, family and colleagues know about this.

Review_Heading: "Comfort of the seat was very good"
Name: Thomas Mele
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew Miami to New York City. First time in economy in the new 737MAX. Seat pitch was fine, couldn't tell it was reduced from 31" to 30" as the seat is thinner. Comfort of the seat was very good for the 2hr and 30min flight. Power outlets at every seat, separate USB also at eye level which can be used for charging. FA's were really nice and pleasant, full can of soda and cookies or pretzels. I really appreciated the female FA who politely ensured that everyone's seat back was upright before takeoff and landing. Left on time, arrived early. Luggage was already out when we got to the belt. Competitive pricing. Honestly I think American Airlines is doing a great job. If you are a member of the Admirals Club, the lounges in Miami are great.

Name: C Saunders
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew American Airlines from London Heathrow to New York JFK. Greeted by friendly and helpful staff at Heathrow. Plane was practically empty so myself and my mother had a row each. Cabin crew were polite, helpful and respectful. Food was tasty and filling, even the dairy free meal was appetising. Seats were comfortable and reclined well, legroom was more than enough for 6’1”. Would definitely fly again.
route: London Heathrow to New York JFK

Name: R Sanyal
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew Las Vegas to New York JFK. A very comfortable day time flight on a beautiful day. The pilot/copilot described the flight path while we were on the ground and alerted us to what we should look out for. I was thus lucky to be in a window seat. The tour guide role the cockpit crew played was excellent. A breakfast meal was served. Later on, snacks, soft drinks, hot drinks, and liquor were offered. Although the business class cabin was full, it was spacious and quiet. Flight attendants were attentive. The cabin had drop down TV monitors, no movie selection was available though you could choose from a range of music channels. Seats were wide and leg space ample. It might have been more relaxing if there were foot rests. We were kept informed of the progress of our flight including any holding delays near JFK. I found all this information very useful. Another well run flight by American Airlines - on time departure/arrival, helpful and informative staff, a decent meal and snacks, and clean cabin and lavatory. Given the many negative comments about the airline, it appears that there is a great deal of inconsistency in their service, in the training of their airline, and by aircraft and route. On this trip at least, I had no issues at all.
route: Las Vegas to New York JFK

Name: Jeffrey Atkins
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew San Diego to Philadelphia. I've avoided American airlines at all costs and only fly with them when my company books my travel. They are the worst in customer service. The plane is clean but my flight had no entertainment available. No big deal for me, but a 6 hour flight should have a plane with something. Forced to check my roller at the gate due to space availability, get on the plane and there's tons of space. That annoys me to no end, and they just don't care about your personal belongings (whether you receive them and the baggage claim). I hate American Airlines, from the first time they lost my bag with my most important belongings, then gave me the run around to avoid helping me retrieve my bag or reimburse me. I see nothing has changed.

Name: E Weiss
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Due to fly Des Moines to Charlotte. Over 5 months I have flown American Airlines 9 times. Every flight was delayed due to "mechanical issues". 4 of those flights had no working restroom. I own several older vehicles that run better than AA planes! My confidence in this airline is so low I am seeking other airlines and paying more to get on planes that work. This cannot be coincidence that only the planes I am flying are like this. As I write this, my flight is delayed. Mechanical issues. Cannot wait to get in the air so we can test AA's equipment with several dozen lives on board.

Name: M Nelson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | American airline employees are liars and rude. They took off 45 minutes late as Phoenix was telling them to since the airport has only one operable runway. They said it impacts all flights, so in theory our connecting flight would be delayed as well. After running the entire length of the Phoenix airport and getting to the gate while the plane was still sitting there and the door to the plane was still open, they would not let us board the plane. Rip off airline! Use another airline!! They make you miss your connection and act like they didn’t do anything wrong. Save yourself and your vacation from dealing with them. They have no idea about customer service.

Review_Heading: "will rather pay more to fly with someone else"
Name: Robert Riley
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Due to fly Atlanta to Dallas Forth Worth. I will never fly American Airlines again. Terrible customer service on the phone and in person. I completely understand them being a billion dollar company and not caring about my little money but to be rude and not helpful is another thing. Rep told me I don’t care if you want to fly with another company. Why would you push a customer away? I will rather pay more to fly with someone else.

Name: Karl Martin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I warned my travel party before we left that we should not fly with American Airlines since I had so much trouble in the past. I have never been so right. Our first flight was delayed and my daughter and I ran to catch our connecting flight. We made it in time and I told the ticket attendee that my mother who is 66 years old was right behind us with my sister. The reply I got made me see red. The attendee informed me they had one minute and forty five seconds to get there. Then she informed me we were all "degated" and she had a volunteer she was going to seat. 1 minute 45 seconds has not expired yet and she says the door is closed and shuts the door. Right as my mother and sister arrive. Next flight is 6 hours later putting us at our destination at 1030 pm. So having all this time at the airport, I decided to write a review.

Review_Heading: "should get a polite a courteous reception"
Name: Vernon Peeler
Review:
✅ Trip Verified | 
I just had the worst customer service I’ve ever had with an airline. American Airlines customer service at Philadelphia International Airport has totally gone to pot. Now you not only have to tag your own bag and put it on the conveyor, but you have to put up with some of the rudest counter staff in the airline industry. After I tagged my bag, I went to weigh it and the woman asked for my boarding pass and ID. I held it out for her and she asked again for my boarding pass and ID. I said here it is, and she said again boarding pass and ID. She would not take it or ask me to display it, she just asked for boarding pass and ID. So, I separated them and she said OK. She didn’t get a look at the ID, just saw that I had it in my hand. I could have shown her a library card as far as she knew. Then at the TSA, when I walked up to the Kiosk and held out my boarding pass and ID for the woman there she didn’t take it, she pointed to the front of the kiosk where she wanted me to stand without saying a word. I fly into PHL often and this was the worst customer service I have ever had at any airport. When you are paying a thousand dollars for service on American, you should get a polite a courteous reception. I remember when flying meant great customer service, but now it seems like you really don't want us here.

Name: C Peare
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Midland to Lafayette via Dallas. This was the worst flight I have had. An older female stewardess berated me in front of everyone twice, once for not knowing it was not free seating like my pleasant flights on large Southwest aircraft, and again when I asked what type of cookie, she rolled her eyes and tried to shove it at me, very rude. The next flight the male steward called me out on overhead mic cause I had to use restroom.

Name: Earl C Higgins Jr
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas to Memphis. I was having a hard time booking my flight on my laptop and the employee at DFW ticket counter went out of his way to help me get my flight booked. I tried to give $20.00 for all his help I insisted he take the money. He told me he was happy to help me. I was able to make it home with his help. It is great to have people who care about the customers and go the extra mile for them. Thank You!

Name: Christopher Charley
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  San Diego to Kingston via Miami. Terribly disappointed as American Airlines continues to give a downward spiral in service delivery - after taking them to San Diego and return it is now clear that they see the Caribbean as not a key customer base. These first class tickets were a complete waste of Money no lounge access and very aloof agents in Miami international who were quite proud to say that the Caribbean Market is not where their focus is. I will be spending my money with other carriers - bye bye American.
route: San Diego to Kingston via Miami

Name: R Teale
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dayton to Jacksonville via Charlotte. I had found trip tickets for 2/5/18 and this had to be the worst experience flying I could have imagined. My first flight was fine but when I reached Charlotte I was informed that my connecting flight was delayed so much so that it was going to ruin my plans to see my husband who is active duty military. I was able to switch flights to land in New Bern NC rather than OAJ, but then I had to rent a vehicle to drive an additional hour to get to my destination. In the midst of all this my flight back to Charlotte was delayed 4 times and my time with my husband was spent trying to figure out how I was to get home now since my connecting flight (last flight of the evening) was now going to be missed leaving me stranded in Charlotte. I only ended up getting to spend 1 hour with him and I do not know when I will see him again...i drove to the airport in hopes that I could get a connecting flight home but there was none...so I took the flight I had from OAJ to Charlotte and had to get yet another rental to drive 7.5 hours through the night to get home in time to head right back out to work. It was the worst day and it's almost impossible to get anyone to assist with any kind of refund. What was a $500 trip ended up costing well over $900. Will never fly this airline again.

Name: R Sanyal
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew New York JFK to LAS Vegas with American Airlines. Was upgraded to first class on this domestic non-stop flight. Plans pushed back on time but had to be deiced because of incoming snowstorm thus delaying take off. For the most part the flight was smooth and we landed only a few minutes late. A breakfast was served - there were two choices. Drinks and snacks were regularly offered. Our coats were taken and hung up. The flight attendant serving the cabin was efficient. The wi-fi did not work. There were no personal entertainment screens. One needed to stare at a wall mounted screen, cheap head phones were provided. Ample leg space but the seat did not recline. Bathrooms became untidy towards the end of the flight. In sum, it was a reasonably comfortable flight but would not pay first class fare for the experience.
route: New York JFK to Las Vegas

Name: Carlos Arenas
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew from Charlotte to San Francisco. Although I wasn´t expecting too much from American Airlines, I have to say that this time everything was fair enough. Nothing outstanding, but everything worked well. Perhaps service was somehow rough. Food and beverages were ok. The aircraft was old and worn. Ground service was bad and impersonal.

Name: H Simpson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Where do I even begin with this airline? I could start by saying I will never be flying with them again. American has not once, but twice lost my infant car seat, stroller, and base when flying with a 5 month old baby. My most recent flight I had checked my stroller, car seat and base at my gate, when I arrived in Dallas for my layover it was nowhere to be found. When I asked for assistance it seemed that no one working for American had any idea what they were doing. One gentleman unloading baggage was trying his best to help us by calling his supervisor who took 30-40 minutes to even answer the phone. We got sent back and forth between employees who didn't feel like dealing with us and told us things like "I honestly have no idea how to do this". "Baggage claim isn't answering my calls" and things like "You are going to have to go back to the gate you came from I don't have time to deal with this". The most frustrating moment was when the supervisor finally showed up 40 minutes later, meanwhile I am holding my sick, hysterical child on my hip in the airport trying not to miss my next flight that leaves in 30 minutes. The supervisor drives past us in a baggage car, not even stopping saying "you are going to have to call baggage claim and see where it is, I don't know what to tell you, it must be lost somewhere". It was the worst customer service I have ever experienced. I was then told to go to my next gate and wait there so I didn't miss my next flight. So I carried my child to the opposite end of the airport with no stroller and no extra hands to carry my personal items. When I arrived at my next gate and told the new American employee what was going on she responded by saying. "Oh, you're going to have to go back to the gate you came from. That isn't in my department since you came from a different gate". So extremely frustrating! I then proceeded to ask the employee how she expected me and my child to get home from the airport with no car seat or base when I arrive at my final destination. She then stated that I can file a claim with American and "maybe" they will supply me with a used one to get home from the airport. $250 later my husband had to meet me at the airport, 2 hours from our home with a brand new car seat and base we had to purchase so that we could safely leave the airport with our child. When we arrived at our final destination we were then told our baggage had never even left the first airport we left from. American Airlines stated if they could find our items they would send them to our address. Two days later an American airline employee shows up at our house at 1am with our items! One o clock in the morning! This is one of the most ridiculous and stressful experiences I have dealt with. American not only has terrible customer service but not one of their employees was knowledgeable or accommodating to our situation. This was a nightmare and totally unacceptable! I would advise anyone to steer clear of flying American Airlines. Thank goodness for family that was able to meet me at the airport with new items to get home, otherwise I may have been stuck at the airport with my child all night! So extremely pathetic American Airlines.

Name: W Jackson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Poor customer service after delayed flights with American Airlines. Arrived at Columbia early to try and get another flight because I knew weather was bad today and it was going to be bad across the country. Even though the plane had 8+ seats on both legs to Cleveland I was refused standby and was not allowed to purchase a ticket. You lost an additional sale - someone needs some more training. So, as I guessed original flight from CAE is delayed. When the aircraft arrives, absolutely no hustle by anyone to get the plane boarded. I will give props to the pilot - was ready to push off immediately and made up some time in the air. Land in Washington and have to wait for the ground crew to move equipment out of the way. Really? How does this happen when we were due in 30 minutes ago? We have to wait for all luggage to be pulled and the wait for the bus driver to take us to the terminal. No attempts made to speed anything up. Finally make it to the terminal about 2 minutes late, and no effort is made to route another bus to the plane even though there were 15+ minutes until scheduled take off. I asked to check on other flights and he said he couldn't help me as he stares at his computer in front of him. I eventually make it onto another delayed flight after finding someone with some empathy. When you know all of you're flights are late, make an effort to care and try to be prepared and efficient. And it would be nice to hold flights for a few minutes when you know connecting flights are on the ground, but that's understandable not to hold them. 2 points for the pilot. Everyone else was a disappointment.

Name: Nicole Barr
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | They cancelled our flight from Michigan to Hawaii due to weather that hasn't even arrived. Now we have to wait 2 extra days, have lost 2 days of our vacation, where by the way we have to pay for the hotel that we won't even be at for 2 days. I'm extremely upset and have been sitting on hold for 53 min due to their rude phone agent! Also hidden fees, you will be paying for your seats after tickets are purchased if you want to sit next to your significant other, that was a fun extra $371 dollars, and still haven't paid for baggage! Thanks for absolutely nothing except for an unexpected extra $1,000 that we are paying for! This is not how to conduct a business!

Name: D Kemp
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew Nashville to Charlotte. Worst airline ever. Always delayed, guess what? One hour delay again and not surprised. Never on time. It’s getting ridiculous day after day. After redeeming my miles, I’ll switching to Delta. Don’t waste your money. I’ve tried Delta several times and was impressed every time. I strongly don’t recommend American Airlines.

Name: R Cooper
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Our flight from Sarasota to our layover in DC (Reagan) was fine, and then our flight into Manchester was delayed countless times until it was finally canceled. A fantastic gate employee made it possible within minutes for us to get on a flight to Burlington, and managed to get our checked bag on it as well within a matter of minutes. Incredibly impressed with the effort of the American Airlines staff today, would recommend and absolutely fly again.

Name: Justin Clemons
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Wilmington to Charlotte. Worst traveling experience in my life. Rude customer service. I paid for a first class ticket and was treated like i didn't matter as a customer. On top of that they would not give me a hotel and now I'm sleeping on the floor in an airport. I would not recommend this airline to anyone.

Name: R Andrews
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I arrived 4hrs early for my flight because I finished my work early. When I walked up to ask if there was any way for me to switch to a sooner flight I was instantly yelled at and told "this is not your flight and you need to step away". I waited and walked back up because the girl said "there are two seats left and we boarded very fast". I asked if there was any way to get on the flight. Instead of the girl politely saying I'm sorry we can not talk anymore, I received "No you are way too late and its $75 anyway". I would have been happy to pay the $75 if I could get on the earlier flight. This was so unprofessional and such bad customer service. I will not be flying American Airlines again. American fix your customer service. A manager was standing next to the girl at the counter and he said nothing.

Name: Eva Gonzalez
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Boston to Los Angeles. Absolutely the worst airline. I purchased a ticket towards the front of the plan to be able to exit the plane quickly and have space for my carry on. I received news that my father was in the hospital so this was all done intentionally. For some reason I was placed in the last boarding group and with no surprise they ran out of room for carry on’s. I asked for some sort of help to grab my bag upon exit as other airlines do but they couldn’t even look me in the eye with a response. Only instruments and baby seats can they do that for. They were rude and lacked all empathy. If they would of set proper expectations that their planes cannot accommodate over half of their passengers carry on’s I would of purchased priority boarding or anything to avoid this. Their staff is rude with the worst attitudes. Avoid this airline at all cost.

Name: Alison Waldroff
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I'll keep this short and simple as to why I'm a "one and done" with American Airlines. Firstly, we sat in our plane on the runway way for 2 hours before taking off (being told mixed stories as to why we were delayed). We missed our connecting flight (and our upgraded seats we paid for and had to basically argue about upon arriving). When we finally got to our destination (3 hours late and missing our transportation we had paid for) our luggage was missing. The employees had zero empathy for us for our travel day from hell and handed us a form for our lost luggage (the form had a contact number which we couldn't get through to the following day after multiple attempts of calling). We were told to buy what we needed and we would be reimbursed (we had literally nothing until we got our luggage the following evening). A month after I began the reimbursement process I received a response from American Airlines stating that they don't reimburse for personal belongings due to lost luggage although it's clearly stated that they do on their website. Moral of the story when it comes to flying with American, don't do it.

Name: Tanveer Ahmed
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I would like to share the horrible experience that I had flying with American Airlines. I bought tickets from them to travel from Toronto to Houston and return. Toronto to Chicago to Houston (01/24/2018) Houston to Dallas to Toronto (01/29/18) The flight from Toronto to Houston was ok except for an hour delay. Everything turned into a nightmare when we were travelling back from Houston. Our flight from Houston was at 4:20PM (45 mins flight to Dallas) and our connecting flight from Dallas to Toronto was at 6:25PM (2hr 25 mins to Toronto). We got on the flight at 4:20 and we were stuck there for almost 1.5 hrs. According to the captain the air control did not give clearance and the plane had to refuel since it did not plan for the delay. After 1.5 hours they informed that we will not be able to catch our connecting flight from Dallas so it’s better to get off and re-book from Houston. We got off and asked to get our checked-in luggage. They said they cannot take that out and it will be going to Dallas. So we asked them what our options were since do not want to lose our luggage. During this time we got the notification that our flight was re-booked from Dallas at 7AM the next day (01/30/18), which meant we had to stay the night at Dallas. After discussing at the gate and with the flight crew they confirmed us that since we have a check-in baggage it will be better for us to go to Dallas and as it was an airline issue, accommodation will be provided for the night. We were convinced and agreed to get in the flight again and go for Dallas where we reached at 6:57PM (instead of 5:37PM) This is where everything started. After getting off the plane we went to talk to gate staff (as instructed) for our accommodation voucher and that is when they said "Since it is not our fault, we will not be able to provide accommodation. In our system we see that it is coded for Tarmac delay due to clearance from Air Control which led to refueling". We told them repeatedly that we were took off that plane and put back in and assured that there will be accommodation provided. We just had to talk to the gate. After that they said, "Well sir, I do not see anything documented/coded in your account, therefore I cannot do anything. The best we can do is provide you hotels at distress rate" The minimum amount of distress rate they offered was USD 65 without shuttle and if we wanted shuttle it would USD 75. Why would we pay anything? Was it our fault? We did not take their offer and the funny thing is the hotel we ended up staying “Days Inn hotel” was available on Booking.com for USD 65 with shuttle service. I do not know what kind of distress rate were they offering. You can find a copy of my hotel receipt below. We spent almost 2.5 hours travelling from Houston to Dallas and hearing them say that just made us frustrated and speechless. We were supposed to be at work the next day on 01/30/2018, so which meant 1 extra day leave from work.

Name: R Sanyal
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Four segments on American Airlines - all departures and arrival on time. Smooth flights, attentive flight attendants, clean aircraft, sufficient baggage stowage. Lunch on return was excellent with frequent servings of wine. Other snacks and complimentary non-alcoholic drinks served. Wi-fi was available but did not use. Boarding area had ample seating and the actual boarding was completed smoothly. The entire flying experience was stress-free - all very professional. While coming into land into La Guardia, was afforded a breathtaking view on a very clear wintry day of lower Manhattan with its skyscrapers and the waters around them. Will fly again with AA!
route: LaGuardia to Green Bay via Chicago

Name: J Reames
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Mexico City. Plane delayed and no food or compensation given other than apologies. First the plane had a mechanical issue that had to be fixed (good that it was) but approx 30 minutes delay. Second, the plane somehow was without a first officer or backup pilot. So we waited another 45 minutes while that person drove in from home. Third, long wait on tarmac to actually take off, I think they lost their slot in the queue as a result of the delays. No food on offer, ie included in the ticket. You could buy a box of processed meat and biscuits for $9. Great food service -  not. The staff themselves were trying. Wifi availability, you could buy it but the fine print said it would only work over USA, and this was a flight to Mexico, so no point there.
route: Dallas Ft Worth to Mexico City

Name: S  Ramir
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I found an unbelievable low fare from NYC to Chicago for under $100 round trip and decided to take advantage of this deal. I was able to select available seats in advance at no extra charge. I didn’t expect much from this relatively short flight. The cabin was clean, and it looked full to me. It took on time, no delays on the return flight either. Each seat had IFE. Complimentary non alcoholic beverages were served and they had snacks for purchase but I don’t think anyone bothered to buy anything on board of this 2 hour flight. Overall I’m satisfied with the service.

Name: Neil Jeram
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Los Angeles to Sydney. I really want to like and love AA! This was the return leg from LA booked on a Qantas code. Now originally I had been coming back on QF74 via SFO. However due to ATC issues in SFO three out of four flights leaving LAX were cancelled. Too their credit AA sorted the problem out and found a space on AA73 back to Sydney. That meant a bus ride back to T4 at LAX from one of the outlying terminals that AA uses. In addition a delay of 3 hours over the departure time of QF74. A separate review of the lounge at T4 but suffice to say I had a lot of time to kill. Books and phones help! Now the flight itself was on AA73 which is a B787 -9. Was keen to try this as it is the plane around which Qantas are building their future. Most if not all of my long haul is on the Airbus A380 with QF or EK. So the Boeing felt and was smaller.Ceilings were high and windows bit bigger but not as quiet as the Airbus. Being new everything had that new car feel to it! So the hard product is fine albeit I had better get used to it. It is the soft product where AA fails. On entering the craft the FA said: do I have to tell you where to go?  The food service was hurried and without any real warmth. I appreciate that FA's are working in cramped conditions and so will always ask an FA how his or her day is going and smile. US crews just seem not too care, its a job for them and they just do it on auto pilot. The famed US levels of service with a smile have long since gone. The seat, 24B was a nightmare. Exit row but so narrow and uncomfortable. The Boeing 787 is probably OK for flights up to 9/10 hours but beyond that I would not take it. The AA Flagship Lounge is superb and but besides that AA's soft product is just lacking.

Name: A Murphy
Review:
✅ Trip Verified |  
Cancun to Omaha via Charlotte. My experience with American Airlines as a whole is abysmal, however, there was an instance that occurred last night that is ridiculous. My husband and I were flying from Cancun to Charlotte and then Omaha. Our flight to Charlotte landed about ten minutes late, we then had to go through immigration, customs, and security again and make it to our next flight that was in one hour. We got through everything as quickly as we could and then ran to the gate our flight was leaving out of and had missed it by 3 minutes. The workers at that gate directed us to a service desk to help with rerouting our flight. We explained the situation to the service desk and they put us on standby on a flight in the morning and reported that they could not confirm this flight for us because missing the flight was our fault. We asked for a hotel voucher for the night and this was refused for the same reason - that missing our flight was our fault. They refused to do anything else. The plane was late, we had to wait in three lines to get to a gate on the opposite end of the terminal, and these three lines took their sweet ass time. I'm not sure how blaming your customers gets you anywhere. Notorious for delayed flights and improper service.

Review_Heading: "we will not fly with this airline again"
Name: R Morrell
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | We flew with American Airlines a couple of years ago and it was just awful, my husband reassured me that things had got better and this time it would be okay - he was wrong and we will not fly with this airline again. We took four flights with them from Heathrow to Cancun via Miami and it was consistently bad. I hated that there was a surcharge for sitting together, something you expect when you are flying with a budget airline but not transatlantic flight. The food was dreadful, I am one of those rare people who quite like airplane food, but this was not good. “Chicken or pasta” was the mantra all the way down the aisle and when I asked for more information I just got chicken or pasta repeated. How about giving a full description over the tannoy and then no need to repeat it 300 times? I genuinely did not know what I was eating, it was unrecognisable. I left almost everything apart from the water. Finally the crew, really not nice people and only one flight attendant out of all we interacted with was pleasant. Their culture is one of (almost) intimidation, very unfriendly even for a Brit. I know they are probably tired but there was a real feeling that we were a nuisance and they don’t want to offer a service - not that we used the bell once during any of their flights. My husband went up to ask for another glass of wine and was told to ‘slow down’ - not something you expect. Really couldn’t wait to get off and will not return.

Name: Charlie Trussell
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew Chicago to Hartford. We were delayed for about an hour with very little communication with the front desk, this is my second flight in two weeks with American Airlines, they are notorious for delayed flights with little or no explanation why the flight is delayed or canceled. I don’t recommend this airline for anyone, I am a gold member and due to the area I have to travel they unfortunately the one who has the majority of flights! I truly wished I didn’t have to use them!

Name: M Bowie
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew Palm Beach to Baltimore via Charlotte. I will never fly American again. We checked two big bags in the terminal. We carried two very small kids suitcases to the gate, when I was informed that a “new product” American has no longer allows you to bring carry on bags that take overhead space. Sure enough, in my ticket to said “under seat bag only”. They then tried to charge me $50 per kids bag vs the $25 regular fee. I will never book a flight on your airline again. For $50 you just lost a customer for a lifetime.
route: Palm Beach to Baltimore via Charlotte

Name: N Kynard
Review:
❎ Not Verified |  
Bradley to Raleigh Durham. The customer service I received to describe - terrible isn't a strong enough word! I had to check my bag and with no prior notification given. I was told they do not accept cash. So I had to purchase a card the would convert my cash to be applicable. The catch to it is they charge $5 just to purchase the card. The manager on duty at the time was of no help. For the information I had to physically call the customer service phone number while at airport. I do not believe I will do business with American Airlines. I am a frequent flyer and I've never been subject to these type of regulations. In the end I paid 30 for a checked bag that should have cost 25.

Review_Heading: "bumped me off from the connecting flight"
Name: Jaakko Meriläinen
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I recently traveled from Stockholm to San Juan via London and Miami. The flight from London to Miami was delayed by 40 minutes, due to which American Airlines decided to bump me off from the connecting flight - as confirmed by the customer service. Despite the delay, I would have been able to make it to the flight well before it departed. People who arrived to the gate after me were allowed to board. Later, I was told by the customer service that I was bumped off to make sure that the plane would leave on time. This seems to be in conflict with what I experienced. Instead of sending me a message about me being bumped off the flight, American Airlines sent me emails about the flight being delayed. Had I been informed on time that I was not on the flight anymore, I could have gone to the re-booking counter right away. Now I ended up going to the gate and waiting there. I tried to ask the airline why they do not inform their customers about this kind of changes and if they believe it would be appropriate to do so, but received no answer at all. I ended up spending 24 hours in Miami on standby before getting on a flight to San Juan. I was constantly told by the airline staff at the airport that people would be let to board flights in the order they appear on the standby list. Yet, many people who were behind me on the list were allowed to board before me. I was in contact with the American Airlines customer service about the depressing experience with the airline. They struggled to give me a proper explanation on why I was bumped off the flight and the overall treatment I got at the airport. I exchanged three emails with the customer service but they failed to provide any coherent responses, which - I believe - is the least the airline could have done.

Name: H Darson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Chicago to Oklahoma city. I’m really tired of airlines not taking responsibility for anything or taking care of their customers. I missed a flight by 5 minutes, because of my incoming flight from Europe was late due to security issues. And even though it was the last flight of the night they would not hold the plane, for 5 minutes, and they wouldn’t put me up in a hotel because it wasn’t their fault. Well it wasn’t my fault either. But I am the one who has to stay up all night in an airport. Lesson learned, from now on I’m only flying Southwest in the U.S. because they have consistently held planes when it was only a few minutes.

Review_Heading: "could not care less about bad reviews"
Name: M Andrews
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I can see by the reviews here that American Airlines could not care less about bad reviews. I wouldn’t even give them one star if I had a choice. For an international flight, we purchased additional miles for $1300 so that we would have enough miles to fly “main cabin extra”. (This is an extra cost over regular coach because you get extra leg room and other benefits). Being claustrophobic, I needed the seats that we originally chose. AA changed the plane that they were going to fly to Australia (a 15.5 hour flight from LA) and took it upon themselves to move us to much worse seats in the regular coach section. My husband is a Platinum flier for life with 3 million miles flown on AA. After speaking to several supervisors at the platinum desk and writing to customer service, AA refused to do anything about it. At the very least, they should have refunded the $1300 that we had to pay to purchase extra miles in order to get the upgraded section! Shame on you American Airlines. It’s no wonder that you no longer carry an elite status in the airline industry if this is how you treat your customers who have been loyal to you for many years! Southwest Airlines and Delta Air Lines could teach you a thing or two about how to treat your customers right!
route: Austin, TX to Sydney Australia via Los Angeles

Name: Hennessy Goicochea
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to New York. This has been the worst experience ever, when it comes to boarding they should have an estimate on how many people have a carry on and there is no reason there is never space for everyone’s carry on. Also, the staff becomes rude when they start to tell you that you have to check in your bag, the problem I have with this is that they let certain people go and it becomes a personal judgement call rather than actually determining if someone has a larger carry on. Up entering I saw plenty of space still available even right above me there was a completely empty over bin. I try my best not to check in my bag because I always have to be out of the airport and I think they have just made it inconvenient for me to travel.

Name: Remi Whyte
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew American Airlines from New York to Boston. This has been the worst experience I have ever had with an airline. I am from Australia and am a frequent flyer internationally and internally in AUS. First of all, we were informed we have one checked bag (that we would somehow have to fit under our seat)? Meaning if you had two bags the cost of adding another checked bag (my duffle bag) that should fit in overhead. You would pay $35 on top of what you had to pay for any checked in bags to begin with. Seems like anything they can do for extra money, has already been put in place with this airline. Uncomfortable seats, rude staff at security and a poorly organised airline. Me, along with the 5 other members I was travelling with will never fly with this airline again.

Name: H Davidson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew American Airlines from Baltimore to Albuquerque via Dallas Fort Worth. 2 flights, two broken planes. Had to spend a night in Baltimore because plane was leaking oil. Was given a food voucher of $24.00 for two of us. Now we were just were unloaded from plane to Albuquerque because what the pilot referred to as a “reacuring problem”.
route: Baltimore to Albuquerque via Dallas Fort Worth

Name: Remi Whyte
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Washington to Boston. This has been the worst experience I have had with an airline. we were informed we have one checked bag (that we would somehow have to fit under our seat)? Meaning if you had two bags, the cost of adding another checked bag (my duffle bag) that should fit in overhead. you would pay $35 on top of what you had to pay for any checked in bags to begin with. Seems like anything they can do for extra money, has already been put in place with this airline. As we boarded the plane, it was a shock to notice an almost empty flight, meaning the extra we had to pay because we didn’t have the correct booking to access the overhead, was an excuse for us, as customers to pay more. Even though when I asked if the check in lady could help us out because we had just spent $200US on all our check in bags. There was clearly enough room for our carry on bags. But the customer service we received was not problem solving or useful to us. The flight had Uncomfortable seats, rude staff at security, overall it was a very poorly organised airline. Due to this, me, along with the 5 other members I was travelling with will never fly with this airline again.

Name: M Dalton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  We had four itineraries on AA during our recent holiday to the US and Mexico with the final and worst being from Cancun to Miami. Some slight improvements since they "lost" our luggage years ago (and almost had to be sued for compensation) but still a 2 star airline. Boarding usually a shambles exacerbated by people flying with pets (dog fights at gates comical). Also people travelling with too much carry on causing huge delays. It isn't such an issue in other countries I'm not sure why such a problem with US airlines after having so many years to address the problem,. The real entertainment is usually the cabin crew, who I am sure are mostly nice people, it is just that their standard of training and presentation takes the joy out of the entire experience. Whilst all flights were pleasant enough, just walking onto a plane to see two poorly dressed flight attendants standing with their backs to you eating, instead of greeting customers is so bad it's hilarious. And it was the same for each of the seven legs we took over these three tickets. Apart from that the flights offered a variety of mediocre experiences from airplane condition to not being offered headphones in first class, but that didn't bother us as much as the dreadful presentation and complete lack of pride and professionalism. We only fly AA for the status credits to keep our Qantas Platinum (Oneworld Emerald), I hope that AA's recent image overhaul is still underway and better training standards on the horizon. Note - there isn't a Oneworld lounge at CUN and AA will not check your bags beyond USA, even though we were connecting to another Oneworld airline in biz class - Qatar (talk about chalk and cheese). This is appalling. We wasted 2hrs going through immigration to collect and re check our bags. What a waste of resources.

Name: F Norton
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | American Airlines flights are popping up on search engines as cheaper flights, however their new policy makes you pay more once arriving to airport. Apparently as boarding group 9, you are no longer even allotted a once normal sized carry on bag. It must be checked and if you do self check in, and miss this, they will charge you 50$ at the gate to check a carry on bag. I fly once a month every month to and from San Francisco-Cleveland. I will no longer even consider any flight under American Airlines. Next thing the basic economy is going to start charging for is breathable air. The price gouging is absolutely ridiculous.

Name: Shivi Bhatnagar
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Monroe to New York via Dallas / Atlanta. The most horrible and irresponsible airline, with unfriendly and rude staff. On top of my baggage is delayed, after one day it has been delivered at the airport, and thereafter no one knows where it is. It is transferred to some delivery company, and the company has no contact, and is waiting for driver to be assigned. No one has any clue, and the customer service representative only says one thing - Apologize - with no information. They are asking us to google and get information. Seriously cheap airlines, with zero responsibility.  Never witnessed such poor customer service and irresponsible airline behavior. Definitely the worst so far.
route: Monroe to New York via Dallas / Atlanta

Name: S Malcher
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Orlando to Manchester via Chicago. The flight to Orlando was fine. On the way back the flight was cancelled and rebooked three days later. We were told no compensation and not even a glass of water is possible as the flight cancellation is due to bad weather and an act of god. The longer flight from Chicago to Manchester had less space than the internal connecting flight from Orlando to Charlotte or Charlotte to Chicago. My son wears a splint and usually on Europe and domestic flights he is able to remove the splint and put it back on in his seat. But this flight from Chicago to Manchester was so cramped he was unable to do this. No hydration was offered, no space to stand up, and the vegetarian meals we ordered were not available. Absolutely awful treatment. I would not recommend flying with American unless there is no other choice. To top it all the plane was so old there was no inflight entertainment from Chicago to Manchester. Awful experience.

Name: S Jackson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew American Airlines from Houston to Barcelona via Miami. Disappointed in seat selection. A customer shouldn’t have to pay to pick an open seat. No options were available to choose from and my seat was randomly assigned. Flight attendants from other flights had better options than me. I will continue to try and avoid this airline.

Name: noam simckes
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to St Louis. I used to be a die hard fan of American Airlines until the last flight, they broke my laptop. Now they're refusing to take responsibility, for 3 months they are just buying time, telling me to wait for an email, and that only the bag department with no way of contacting them.

Name: Antonis Asprakis
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Philadelphia to San Jose return via Charlotte on a mileage redemption. There were weather delays on both outbound and inbound dates, and AA made changes to my flights on both travel dates to ensure that I reached my destinations on time - outbound they put me on an earlier flight to CLT from PHL to ensure I made my connection in CLT to SJO, and on the return trip, completely re-routed me through MIA so I could arrive in PHL at almost the same time as my originally scheduled itinerary, all done with a smile and no additional charges. Need to give credit where credit is due - well done AA! That being said, the ex-US Airways A320s with absolutely no in-flight entertainment are really starting to grind my gears - they need to be put out of their misery. Flight crews on all segments were friendly and professional, but I did not appreciate having to pay for checked baggage and alcoholic drinks on international segments.
route: Philadelphia to San Jose via Charlotte

Name: Jasmine Thomas
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I am writing this letter in utter disgust and frustration. I was travelling on A2657 from Orlando to Miami on 14/1/18 with what was to be a connecting flight to Antigua on A2405. Much to my surprise, we landed at MIA 5 minutes early, only to be held on the tarmac for an hour, all because there was an aircraft still at the gate, so much for being early. So AA had a plane for an hour, on the tarmac just waiting with passengers who had connecting flights. To make matters worst being the concerned passenger I asked the head flight attendant a question, to which she had the audacity to rudely state that I should have flew in the night before. The nerve of her. After finally being able to deplane & having to scramble to G21, much to my demise the flight had already closed off, and instead of aiding assistance to an already frustrated me, the female agent rudely said we are not getting on. Seems like some of these females employed by AA need training. The male agent made it his priority to calm an already angered me. Good Job to him. He advised me that the airline would accept fault. You would think that my anger would have ended there. After being told that I would be placed in a hotel at the expense of the airline, I was given a $12 food voucher. Really American. I had to pay an additional $15 for proper food. Another Issue was the shuttle that was to take me to the hotel had me waiting 2 hours, by this time I had given up. Fast forward to Monday 15th shall we, I got to the airport thinking it would be a better day but no, here I was thinking that my first class seat 4C would still be available so I could at least have one thing to smile about. I was told that I would be occupying 12A. I am awaiting a reward for that First class ticket that I purchased.

Review_Heading: "AA did a god job in tough conditions"
Name: D Saunders
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I am a FF with American Airlines and have been satisfied with the overall performance of the airline during this time of inclement weather. We arrived in CLT on the evening of Jan 7th and found our flight to PHL was delayed. The delay became longer as the planes for the 20.00 and 22.15 from CLT to PHL were both delayed or grounded elsewhere. This was an issue for all flights with some customers being delayed more than two flights. AA solved the problem by using a larger plane that held the passengers from both flights to PHL. We arrived later than we wanted but our bags arrived with us. AA did a god job in tough conditions.

Name: Frank Stewart
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew American Airlines from Charlotte to Los Angeles. We have sat at the departing gate for over an hour without any explanation. The captain just announced by first saying we must not have heard his last announcement (which he didn’t make). He said the “paperwork is almost done”. The flight attendant told me there was a maintenance issue. Why would the captain not have made an announcement earlier and then just sat hr paperwork was now ready? That is poor leadership and customer service.

Name: Linda Caplan
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Miami to Tampa. My husband and I were extremely disappointed flying on American Airlines with two small children. We had a stroller, a few carry on hand bags, a seat for my toddler for the plane, and two kids that were asleep and during the four trips (we all had four round trip connecting flights from Tampa to Dominican Republic),we were the last to get on and the last to get off. It was by far the most stressful plane ride for us because we had to carry both kids, all the bags, the install the chair into the seat with everyone on the flight looking at us. There were several flight attendants looking at us with faces that screamed, hurry up and get to your seats because we have to fly. In fact, one flight attendant was more focused on gathering her suitcases to get off the plane then: “hey, let me help you guys?!” From this experience if you’re not going to board parents with small children first or help them get settled and off the plane safely, then I’m never going to fly with my family on this plane because it wasn’t kid-friendly. I honestly felt like I was inconveniencing everyone - never again!

Name: T Hass
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  I had an international flight scheduled from Auckland to Los Angeles on American. As we approached our gate we were informed our flight was cancelled because the crew was sick. We were then made to stand in lines for 4 hours to get our luggage back from off the plane. We were sent away from the airport to a hotel, still with no information on a rescheduled flight. We were then contacted for the next two days with constantly changing information about our rebooking. American Airlines also miscommunicated to the hotel the value of our food vouchers; we were told a particular value in the airport, and the hotel was only told half the amount. two days after our scheduled departure, we were rebooked, loaded back in a bus to the airport, and upon parking and unloading, informed that our flight had been cancelled again; we were sent back to the hotel. Finally, three days later we were put into a flight with a different airline and were able to get back to the US. I missed two days of work and had to buy a completely new ticket for a connecting flight in the US because of the delay, and they offered a measly voucher worth less than half the cost of the original flight. I wrote a complaint email, detailed with pictures and information, and American Airlines headquarters refused to budge. I'm extremely displeased. I also flew American Airlines in September and my plane had to make an emergency landing due to engine failure. We had to pack into a van and be driven the remaining 2-3 hours to our destination, and they offer of compensation was subpar, to say the least. Don't fly American. Fly a reliable airline.

Name: Melissa Johns
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew American Airlines from Reno to Dallas Fort Worth. Horrible, inconsiderate experience. First flight of the day and they had us wait 39 mins to de-ice plane which made us late to our connection. 16 of us ran and got to the gate only for them to close and lock the door and deny us on. Sold all of our seats to standby passengers. Travel often and my first disgusted review.

Name: M Kemp
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Customer service is terrible! No one is accommodating. I was booked to go from Baltimore to Philadelphia then Philadelphia to Charlotte then Charlotte to Ft Walton Beach at Gate C2 at BWI. Literally across from me at C3 was a flight to Charlotte leaving slightly before me. I arrived and had plenty of time to possibly fly standby but was told I could not. 1 rep on the phone said I had to have a “same route change” despite the fact it was literally going to my one hub destination-Charlotte and there was a winter travel advisory for yesterday in Philadelphia. The personnel at gate told me I couldn’t because I would have had to change it downstairs. I’m getting mixed messages. AA could have had an extra seat in Philadelphia if it needed it, especially with the travel advisory yesterday I can imagine there were a lot of delays and cancellations. I asked where the change of ticket policy was easily accessible to he customer and was told “you have to search for it in the search box”. It’s not clearly expressed when you buy your ticket. This is my first and last time flying American Airlines. I would rather pay more for a ticket than deal with their poor routes and terrible service.

Name: LaKisha Bell
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to Birmingham. The absolute worst flight experience I've encountered. There were numerous delays in flight times and currently one gate change at this time but that's subject to change. My plans with family are no more and have missed a family event very important to me thanks to American Airlines.

Name: M Gordon
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew San Diego to New York JFK. I will never fly with AA again! I flew American Airlines twice in the last two years. My checked in bags were lost both times. I made international calls and was told by American Airlines that they could not locate my bags, they did not offer any other assistance as well, which was the most frustrating part as a passenger. AA has been reckless and irresponsible.
route: San Diego to New York JFK

Name: S Malkar
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Domestic flight from Phoenix to Miami. Check-in a bit chaotic and don't think the machine took our payment for hold luggage, but produced the luggage labels. PHX a murky airport. Boarding efficient for a full flight and we left on time. Seats as you expect on a A320 - comfortable and good leg room for a 3 hour flight. FAs friendly and served what they had with a smile which is nice. We purchased some drinks and enjoyed the flight. To be fair, good value for money, efficient (second time I've used that word) and on time. We and our luggage well taken care of - what more do you want?

Name: L Barrat
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew from Seattle to Boston via Philadelphia. Navigating American’s area in Seattle was easy enough. We checked in at the self-serve kiosks. Boarded on time and got into the air in good time. The first leg was aboard their newly-configured Airbus A321. I was in seat 26F. The seat was pretty old on the 5-hour flight. Width felt very tight, and the legroom was made difficult by a low-hanging seat and my underseat storage occupied. Also, the streaming IFE did not work for the entire flight. Things quickly got very boring. Cabin service was on par, however the flight attendants did seem very unenthusiastic. Connection in Philadelphia was pretty simple, however we had a long walk between gates that would have been difficult with a short connection time. The flying time up to Boston was very quick. I was occupying seat 20F on the Airbus A320, and it was significantly more comfortable. The seat width was the same, but I was able to get my bag further under the seat, which allowed for greater legroom. Cabin service was better on this leg, however it was a short flight. IFE streaming was again not working properly, but it was a short hop so I didn’t mind. Overall, my experience on American got me back across the country, but the “cattle class” narrative certainly being applied. Thankfully, it wasn’t too expensive, but I expected a little more from a legacy carrier. Every LCC experience I’ve had recently has been better. But it’ll definitely get you where you need to go.

Name: Nathanael Griggs
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I’ve never wrote an review for anything in my life. But from my last experience from American Airlines, I made it my obligation to review this poor flight. I had a flight from Norfolk to San Diego via Dallas. I arrive at my flight on time just for them to delay my flight for an hour. Finally take off and when I arrive at Dallas my flight was just now taking off. I was extremely annoyed. Had to wait in a line for up to an hour and a half since there was an absurd amount of people that missed their flight as well. Was told that my next guaranteed flight will be that next following day, but I have the option to wait for the last available flights of that night, I will just be on stand by. Waited for 3 long hours to see if me and my girlfriend can squeeze in but we got denied. I was told I was number 14 on the list but another administrator told me I was number 12 on the stand by list. Very unorganized. The only positive thing that came from this was that they gave us an hotel voucher for the night. However, I was told that my bags had already took off without me and I will have to go get them at the baggage claim when I arrive at SD. Not only that, but when I was in a line for my hotel voucher, you can even hear the customer assistance saying “I’m leaving in 2 minutes, Im going home.” Mind you there are groups of people waiting to find a place to stay that have been traveling all day long. What type of service is that? Glad to know that American Airlines care about their passengers. That next following morning I wait by the gate to board my flight that was around 06:20. Came to find out that they switched the flight to another gate number when I went to the help desk to see if I was at the right location. Thank god I asked or I would of missed out on another flight. Nobody even notified us that the gate number even had changed. What type of service is that? I will never in my life fly this company again. The apocalypse can occur and they can have the last flight to safety and I still wouldn’t take it. This company doesn’t care about anything but their wallets.
route: Norfolk to San Diego via Dallas

Name: J L Miles
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | American Airlines is bar none the worst airline to fly. My wife and I were flying from Nashville to Newport News. We had a layover in Charlotte. The flight was delayed on the track so we made it to Charlotte and ran to the next gate, they were still boarding with over a third still in line. When we got to the ticket counter the (rude) woman told us they had given our seats away. My 5 month pregnant wife and I sprinted to make this flight so we could make it to our party in time. This woman could not have cared less. They gave our seats away and we were there. The customer service rep informed us that a refund would not be given because they put us on a different flight. That is completely besides the point and with any honor American would have done the right thing and given us a refund since they were the sole reason we missed our party. They were the rudest people to deal with and I will never deal with them again. There is no doubt that the rating they have is well deserved as being lowly incompetent people. Fly Delta/Southwest/whatever else you can but stay away from American.

Name: J Harrison
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | The flight from New York to Charlotte was delayed more than 2 and a half hours. I also had my pet with me. Due to the flight being delayed so much I missed my connecting flights. Then I talked to the lady of American Airlines who was extremely rude and gave me the next flight at 7.25 pm which is ridiculous. I was supposed to be at my final destination which was Peoria (PIA Airport) at 12.00 pm but I sat at Charlotte airport for around 10 hours with a pet. This was a very ridiculous service. I'm very unsatisfied with their poor service.

Name: C Lamerty
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Glasgow to Providenciales via Miami. The worst Airline we have ever flown. Completely ruined a £19,000 holiday. American Airlines lost our luggage containing baby milk. Long story short baby became ill from having to use different milk. We had to leave Turks and Caicos after 4 days losing 6 days at £1,100 a night. Contacted a woman on American Airlines who changed our flights to go home via New York so the baby could get better and we arrived at Providenciales to find that our flights had been changed to economy from business class and also that we would have to pay baggage fees. Now in New York trying to get home and we are being charged again for flight to Glasgow! I am utterly disgusted with this airline.  Avoid this airline at all costs.

Name: Marc L Coleman
Review:
✅ Trip Verified | 
Mexico City to Miami return. AA1031 and AA2416. Both flights on 319, although going out was a better seat (row 12 both ways), return had no legroom whatsoever. To the flights, not charged for bags which was good, no beverage service apart from soft drinks and coffee/tea. Flight was early into Miami but waited 45 mins to get to gate, probably not Americans fault. So late. Return on time but seat room bad, I measured 27 inches, almost impossible for a 6 foot person to sit. Broken bag on return, sorting out now.

Name: M Richards
Review: Flew American Airlines from St Louis to Chicago. Aside from a rather temperamental APU the flight was wonderful. The seats were perfectly adequate for this short journey. The cabin staff were friendly and responsive to passenger needs and requirements. Drinks were served shortly after takeoff along with snacks, nothing else could be expected for a flight of one hour. Wi-Fi was available but I didn't use it.

Name: N Ivers
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Santo Domingo to New York. January 1st, 2018. We’ve been stuck at the airport in Santo Domingo since 1:30 only to find out our flight is pushed to 10 am next day. American Airline knew way before 1:30pm that they did not have enough crew to fly but didn’t bother telling customers until 7pm. They knew that crew that was flying in will not fly back because they had to take mandatory break. Do they have any regard for their customers?‬ Nothing stopping them from charging $1,200 for economy tickets and $25 for the first checked bag on a top of that. But they feel that it's perfectly fine not to inform their passengers about the flight that won't be flying any time soon. Were they too afraid to lose some money from that ridiculas fare? This is a complete ignorance or incompetence. The way they put it "a mistake the company made". A mistake they said they’ve fixed already. There was a news article by major news outlet 2-3 weeks ago that American Airline granted too much PTO time to their pilots and crews for the holiday season and major service outages are expected. AA responded that issue is resolved and no delays or cancellations are expected. I guess it was just a PR spin.

Name: G Samson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Cleveland to Punta Cana via Charlotte. We travelled as a family of 8 for Christmas to Punta Cana. Thanks to AA we missed a whole day in Punta Cana because we missed our flight to Charlotte. We missed the flight because we were waiting for staff to bring a wheelchair for my grandmother who cannot walk through an airport. When we got to the gate, staff said the plane was gone and we were 2 min late. Staff even acknowledged that the time stamp on our luggage was an hour before boarding time. We waited an hour for a wheelchair. We told them we could push the chair but they did not allow it. There was only one lady working the wheelchair area. Of course it being the holidays they could not get us to our destination that day. We flew to Charlotte that day but had to stay the night. They gave us 1 room for my grandmother since she needed the wheelchair, but we had to pay for additional rooms. I guess AA thought we could have left an old lady and got on a flight without her. We are a family! We come together and leave together! The luggage was a whole other situation. We had the AA agent check all of our luggage tickets. She ensured us that once we missed the flight our luggage did not go either. Well, my luggage was in Punta Cana without me. Once we made it to Punta Cana only 1 family member's luggage came on the belt! Total disaster and staff had no idea where it was. Everyone elses luggage eventually came and all was good. I am very disappointed in AA, we even tried to get refunds and just cancel the trip. They would not give refunds because they said it was our fault that we missed the original flight. We had travel insurance. This is the short version of what happened. The misinformation from AA agents in Cleveland, Charlotte, and Punta Cana is another story. Never again. Oh no wifi on the plane, but the flight attendants were nice. On the way home, I did have to listen to the flight attendants entire personal conversations because I was sitting in the very last row. That was annoying because I wanted to sleep.
route: Cleveland to Punta Cana via Charlotte

Name: W Johnson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew American Airlines from Los Angeles to Amsterdam via Philadelphia. Staff at the airport were really friendly and helpful but as soon we got on the first flight the staff were rude. We could here them swearing and shouting to each other at the back of the plane. We had a long flight (6hrs) to Philadelphia and were only offered one drink and a cookie because no one had checked the catering before take off so there was no food on board. There was also no entertainment on board. Before taking our second flight we asked and checked if there was entertainment so we could prepare ourselves and buy magazine/books etc. The lady told us that each seat had a tablet style screen. When got on board there were only small central screens in the aisles and the headphone jacks gave so much feedback it was unbearable to listen to. We unfortunately had bad snow and wind, combined with a technical fault we were delayed by 3 hours. Communication was terrible during this time and during bad turbulence.
route: Los Angeles to Amsterdam via Philadelphia

Review_Heading: "They are a monstrosity of an airline"
Name: L Martin
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | Absolutely terrible. The airline chose to cancel my flight so they could reroute numerous people and squeeze in their 18 stand by passengers. By doing this they missed my connection flight (even with a 3 hr layover). Upon arrival they scheduled me for a 6pm flight. At 5.45 American Airlines over-rode the airports authority and cancelled our flight, because they wanted more passengers from yet another rerouted plane catching my connection, except after making us wait an extra hour for them to make yet more money, the impending airport had a slight emergency. Had American thought of their passenger who booked months in advance, instead of stand-bys I would have made my trip in the scheduled 4hrs, instead of 18. They refused to re-fund any money. They are a monstrosity of an airline. Every other company made their flights to the same airports on schedule without delay. They claimed inflight wifi, none. It connected but didn't work. They are utterly useless.

Name: Shawn B Burns
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  New Orleans to Philadelphia. I fly American Airlines as much as possible due to convenience. I recently purchased a ticket the night before for $500 and the next day the ticket was $57. This was a family emergency but they refused to refund or help with this ridiculous cost. It suppose to be $200 to change your flight. Not sticking to their own policy apparently.  I'll be avoiding them at all costs moving forward.

Name: R King
Review: ✅ Trip Verified | I bought my daughter and grandson a ticket to come and see me in Chattanooga. Their flight back (today) was supposed to leave at 5.45pm, it's 7.15pm right now and they are still sitting on the plane because it won't start! She has a 5 month old with her, and no information is being given to the passengers. I've flown this airline myself in December. I can honestly say that I would never book with American Airlines again. I will start flying with Delta again. They are telling my daughter that she probably has to rebook her connecting flight, this airline continues to disappoint.

Name: Travis Carlson
Review: ✅ Trip Verified |  Buffalo to Jacksonville via Charlotte. An hour of gate delays after boarding made for a very tight connecting flight with no assistance, which isn't required but would be appreciated. The real gripe is the ticket takers were notified that carry on space was reached and despite major concerns that $75,000 worth of camera equipment was not something to risk lightly. I was given no choice in the matter - and getting on the flight to find five bins and room for a dozen bags remained.
